Full Name: Crunchy Mexican Tilapia with Miniature Roasties and Slow-Roasted Tomatoes
Ingredients: Tilapia Fillet, Mexican Spice, Panko Breadcrumbs, Potato, Lime, Cherry Tomatoes, Crème Fraîche, Coriander
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl
Description: The wonderfully crazy molecular gastronomists of the world like Ferran Adria and Heston Blumenthal believe that food shouldn’t just be experienced through the sense of taste. For them it’s an all immersive experience. At Heston’s restaurant you even plug earphones into a shell to listen to the sound of the sea whilst you eat! It might not be for everyone but the easiest way to add another sensory dimension to dinnertime is to add some texture. And nothing does it quite as well as a bit of crunchiness. Hence tonight’s little number ;-)

Full Name: Seared Black Pepper Steak Salad with Chimichurri Dressing
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Parsley, Oregano, Black Peppercorns, Red Wine Vinegar, Red Chilli Flakes, Baby Spinach, Garlic Clove, New Potatoes
Description: Luke has a new hero in his life. The poster on his wall of Taylor Swift has been taken down and replaced with a picture of none other than Nick ‘The Knife’ Mellin. He’s one of the guys behind the family-run butchers, Roaming Roosters. Located in Lancashire, the gorgeous meat from their farm is what’s hitting your plate. Check out how great these guys are at www.roamingroosters.co.uk.

Full Name: A Creative Minestrone Soup with Conchigliette, Bacon and Fresh Pesto (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Courgette, Bay Leaf, Smoked Bacon, Organic Cannellini Beans, Cavolo Nero, Chicken Stock, Chopped Tomatoes, Conchiglie Pasta, Thyme, Celery Stick, Pesto
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Pan
Description: If you were firing a space rocket to the moon then chances are you’d want to get your sums right. Fortunately, the art of making a smashing soup is not quite so precise. For this fantastic minestrone recipe we’ve given you all the steps and ingredients you need to make the perfect soup. If there happens to be a little of this and that left over though, feel free to add it into the pan so you’ve got some lunch the next day. Perfect for an impromptu spacewalk!

Full Name: Wandering Forager’s Wild Mushroom Risotto
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Celery Stick, Thyme, Vegetable Stock Pot, Wild Mushrooms, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Fresh Peas, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Spoon, Bowl
Description: Sometimes we like to think of ourselves in another life. A life where we live in an old hut in the Tuscan countryside and we eat a dish like this after a hard day’s foraging. Combining the depth of our gorgeous garlic with thyme and specially selected wild mushrooms this is an unctuous, satisfying risotto that simply cannot fail to impress. For the ultimate decadence look out for our Fresh Tip* overleaf…

Full Name: HelloFresh Five Spiced Chicken with Bok Choi
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Caster Sugar, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Brown Basmati Rice, Bok Choy, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Chinese 5 Spice
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Knife, Grater, Bowl
Description: What are these mysterious 5 spices that so often sneak their way into Chinese cooking? The exact formula can vary from place to place but usually it’s a concoction of star anise, cloves, Chinese cinnamon, fennel seeds and a bit of Sichuan pepper. This dish was actually inspired by a trip to Australia where they tend to use all sorts of Asian flavours in their cooking. We teamed it up super fresh bok choi, ginger and garlic for a quick burst of flavours!

Full Name: Strolling Rigatoni with Cherry Tomatoes and Goat’s Cheese
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Chorizo, Black Olives, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description: The key to this dish is gently roasting the cherry tomatoes and pepper to bring out their natural sweetness and then balancing this against tangy olives and mild, creamy goat’s cheese. We’ve made it super quick and easy, to leave more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Creamy Leek and Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Thyme, Chicken Breast, Organic Lentils, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: When asked what his favourite food is, Patrick, our Head Chef, will say “French” with very little hesitation. French food is to Patrick, what lentils are to the French. Known as the poor man’s caviar, the humble lentil is an exalted ingredient in French cooking with a texture superior to that of any other lentil variety.  It has a delicious nutty flavour with a moreish smooth interior and nutritional credentials to knock your socks off.  It’s also a cousin to the the British pea.  Enjoy!

Full Name: Fresh Start Aubergine Korma with Homemade Wholemeal Chapatis
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Garlic Clove, Wholemeal Flour, Baby Spinach, Potato, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mild Chili Powder, Ground Coriander, Ground Cumin, Tumeric, Greek Yoghurt, Flaked Almonds, Coriander
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: Once you’ve had a taste of the good stuff it’s very difficult to go back. Nowhere is this more true than when it comes to bread. This year we want to give you a go at making your own to see just how amazing (and satisfying) it can be. Rather than go in at the deep end though we’re kicking off with the most simple bread of them all: the humble chapati. Prized in India for the easiness to prepare (and the fact that they’re awesome for mopping up sauce) we’re offering a prize for best chapati pic on Facebook!

Full Name: Courgette Parmigiana with Insalata Caprese
Ingredients: Courgette, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Tomato Passata, Hard Italian Cheese, Pine Nuts, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia, Cherry Tomatoes, Dried Oregano, Garlic Clove, Red Onion
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Large Pan, Baking Tray
Description: When we started Hello Fresh from Patrick’s living room a few short years ago we wanted to make dinner time easy. Whilst the emphasis has always been on quick and tasty, there are certain recipes that deserve a bit more time and this parmigiana is one of those. We recommend enlisting a sous chef to help you with the prep. They’ll be more than happy to help once the smell what’s on the menu!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Creamy Leek and Porcini Lentils (F)
Ingredients: Organic Lentils, Chicken Breast, Thyme, Crème Fraîche, Celery Stick, Carrot, Dried Porcini Mushrooms, Leek
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: Shannon, our nutritional guru, recently did a blog on our site about the wonders of leeks, so today the canteen will be serving this delicious, nutrition-packed dinner in her honour. Shannon is all about demystifying the world of nutritional jargon and she has some awesome ideas for getting your new year off to a kickstart - check out her site at www.shannonflavell.com

Full Name: A Creative Minestrone Soup with Conchigliette, Bacon and Fresh Pesto (F)
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Courgette, Bay Leaf, Smoked Bacon, Organic Cannellini Beans, Cavolo Nero, Chicken Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Conchiglie Pasta, Pesto, Thyme, Celery Stick
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: If you were firing a space rocket to the moon then chances are you’d want to get your sums right. Fortunately, the art of making a smashing soup is not quite so precise. For this fantastic minestrone recipe we’ve given you all the steps and ingredients you need to make the perfect soup. If there happens to be a little of this and that left over though, feel free to add it into the pan so you’ve got some lunch the next day. Perfect for an impromptu spacewalk!

Full Name: Thick Cut Pork Chops with Sage Butter and New Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Broccoli, Pork Chops, Crème Fraîche, Sage, Lemon, Garlic Clove, Butter
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Baking Tray, Fork, Frying Pan
Description: Far too often have we suffered pork chops so overcooked that they have the texture of a Bedouin’s flip-flop. But no more! For this recipe we asked our butcher for juicy door-stoppers and recommend erring on the side of undercooked rather than over. As with all things your chops are exponentially better once you’ve given them a bit of a rest. Once they’re cooked take them out of the oven and keep them under some foil for a few minutes to let the juices redistribute. Choptastic!

Full Name: A ‘Professional’ Fisherman’s Pie
Ingredients: JKM Seafood Mix, Leek, Potato, Parsley, Double Cream, Fish Stock Cube, Panko Breadcrumbs, Netherend Butter Salted, Plain Flour, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Bowl, Large Bowl
Description: Got your own flock of sheep? Shepherd’s Pie. Own a thatched house in the countryside? Cottage Pie. It seems that everyone is getting in on the act these days (watch this space for our leek filled ‘plumber’s pie’) so it’s only right that the fishermen have their place in the pie-related sun. We concocted this little number in close consultation with our fantastic fishmonger James Knight of Mayfair, who gave us the inside track from the dockside. Guaranteed to quell even the feistiest of dinnertime mutinies.

Full Name: Wahaca Beef & Corn Tortillas with Pepper & Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Minced Beef, Tomato Puree 30g, Wahaca Smokey Chipotle Sauce, Wholemeal Tortilla, Organic Black Beans, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Organic sweet corn, Crème Fraîche, Lime
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: You might have thought the gang here at the Fresh Farm would go to a country pub for their Christmas party, but instead we headed down to Wahaca for a Mexican feast (we're certain Head Chef Patrick rigged the vote!). We love the place so much that we're sharing the Mexican love tonight and ("drum roll") the best/most Mexican photo on our Facebook wall wins dinner for 4 at Wahaca!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Chicken with Hearty Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Courgette, Red Pepper, Sweet Potato, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon, Ground Cumin, Ground Coriander, Mustard Seeds, Tumeric, Ginger, Flour
Utensils: Peeler, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: We fell in love with this recipe the moment it passed our lips. There’s nothing complicated or fancy about it - just a perfect combination of great produce, premium chicken and a warming blend of Middle Eastern spice. In keeping with our ongoing mission to stoke you up against winter colds there’s also a triple hit of vitamin C from the red pepper, sweet potato and courgette. In the (unlikely) event that you don’t eat it all on one go, this is absolutely awesome for lunch the next day too!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Pork Medallions with Tarragon & Potatoes
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, New Potatoes, Leek, Tarragon, Sour Cream, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: Another tough week of taste testing is over and this time we’ve been putting our Smithfield butcher Tom Hixson to the test. He’s sourced us the most succulent pork fillets going and we’ve combined them with a divine tarragon sauce that’ll blow the socks off the people round your dinner table. The trick here is to make sure your pork isn’t overcooked - we like to leave it just ever so slightly pink in the middle to enjoy all the juicy deliciousness!

Full Name: Honey-Smoked Chicken Skewers with Sweet Potato Wedges (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Sweet Potato, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Grain Mustard, Honey, Crème Fraîche, Wooden Skewers, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray
Description: It’s that point in the year when the nights are so cold you need to know there is a light (and a summer!) at the end of the tunnel. That’s why we’re giving you a hearty warming dinner with a little reminder of BBQ season. As ever, the longer you leave the chicken to marinade the better the flavour. Roll on summer!

Full Name: Gnocchi Allo Genovese with Toasted Pine Nuts & Tenderstem Broccoli (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Del Verde Fresh Gnocchi, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Tenderstem Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer
Description: ‘Allo Genovese’ simply means ‘in the style of Genoa’, which is the northern Italian city famous for the pesto that you’ll be making tonight. ‘Pesto’ actually comes from the word ‘pestare’, which means to pound or crush, referring to the old fashioned method of making it in a pestle & mortar. If you happen to have a food processor, you can whizz the pesto together in that, or alternatively just chop, chop, chop everything until it is tiny. Andiamo!

Full Name: Lebanese Sweet Potato Wraps with Minted Tzatziki & Toasted Almonds
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Garlic Clove, Ground Cumin, Sumac, Lemon, Red Onion, Greek Yoghurt, Mint Leaves, Cucumber, Baby Gem Lettuce, Carrot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Salt, Pepper, Almonds
Utensils: Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: It wasn’t so very long ago that Chef Patrick found himself wandering around the marketplaces of Beirut in search of culinary inspiration. And boy did he find some! The people of Lebanon have a sense of hospitality to rival the best of them and fortunately for Patrick their greatest expression of this is in their food. 15 minutes in one market and his hands were chock full of food given to him by the locals. This little number just happened to be one of them, so he felt inspired to re-create it for you. Yalla!

Full Name: Roasted Butternut Squash and Halloumi Jumble
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Pepper, Rocket, Halloumi, Pine Nuts, Red Wine Vinegar, Bulgur Wheat, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: After much consideration (and a broken vegetable peeler), we’ve decided to change our butternut squash peeling technique. Our recommendation is to chop the squash in half widthways to separate the top from the bulb at the bottom. Next use your knife to level off the edges (which will also take off the skin). Much easier!

Full Name: Honey-Smoked Chicken Skewers with Sweet Potato Wedges (F)
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Sweet Potato, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Grain Mustard, Honey, Honey, Crème Fraîche, Wooden Skewers, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray
Description: It’s that point in the year when the nights are so cold you need to know there is a light (and a summer!) at the end of the tunnel. That’s why we’re giving you a hearty warming dinner with a little reminder of BBQ season. As ever, the longer you leave the chicken to marinade the better the flavour. Roll on summer!

Full Name: Gnocchi Allo Genovese with Toasted Pine Nuts & Tenderstem Broccoli (F)
Ingredients: Del Verde Fresh Gnocchi, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Tenderstem Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Pancetta, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer
Description: ‘Allo Genovese’ simply means ‘in the style of Genoa’, which is the northern Italian city famous for the pesto that you’ll be making tonight. ‘Pesto’ actually comes from the word ‘pestare’, which means to pound or crush, referring to the old fashioned method of making it in a pestle & mortar. If you happen to have a food processor, you can whizz the pesto together in that, or alternatively just chop, chop, chop everything until it is tiny. Andiamo!

Full Name: Chicken Milanese with Roasted New Potatoes and Chives
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Sour Cream, Panko Breadcrumbs, Chives, Lemon, Steve's Leaves, New Potatoes, Garlic Salt
Utensils: Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Grater, Zester, Bowl, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We tried sending out eggs once and it caused our operations guru Luke a whole world of scrambled trouble! When Luke saw Milanese on the menu his little face dropped at the thought of an egg wash for the breadcrumbs, but Patrick turned his frown upside down by using sour cream! If you’ve got ideas for future egg padding let us know!

Full Name: Body-Boosting Hoisin Pork with Wholemeal Rice, Yellow Pepper & Sugar Snap Peas (F)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Pork Medallion, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Yellow Pepper, Sugar Snap Peas, Celery Stick, Hoisin Sauce, Lime, Coriander, Cornflour, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Pan
Description: With Jack Frost still thumping at the door we’re giving you a seasonal boost! Brown rice is packed full of much needed fibre whilst chilli is the perfect way to preventing a cold. Combine that with immune boosting ginger and garlic and a whole array of vegetables and you’ve made the first bold step towards a ‘Sniffle’ free winter!

Full Name: Hearty Roasted Chicken with Dijon Mushroom Sauce
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Brown Basmati Rice, Crème Fraîche, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chicken Stock, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Dijon Mustard
Utensils: Pot, Kitchen Paper, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description: A trip down memory lane this evening for one of our head chef’s favourite childhood recipes. Nutritious, chewy brown rice is the perfect bed for this flavour packed sauce. Our big tip here is to make sure you take the stock off the boil and let it cool for a minute before you add the crème fraîche to make sure you don’t split your sauce.

Full Name: Pan-Fried Salmon in a Dill and Butter Sauce with Rocket New Potatoes
Ingredients: Salmon fillet, New Potatoes, Dill, Rocket, Lemon, Capers, Butter, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Plate, Zester
Description: For your Quick Dish of the week we didn’t need to make things complicated - the ingredients spoke for themselves. If you’ve never much liked eating the skin on salmon give it a second chance as this cooking method makes it crispy and delicious!

Full Name: Smokey Burritos with Chipotle Sour Cream Dressing
Ingredients: Wholemeal Tortilla, Chorizo, Potato, Green Pepper, Cheddar Cheese, Sour Cream, Coriander, Luchito Chipotle, Baby Gem Lettuce, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Red Onion, Lime, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil, Vine Tomatoes
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: The New Year may be a time of change, but some things will always remain. Our Head Chef’s love of all things Mexican shows no sign of stopping and this cheeky little burrito is his latest love. One of the star ingredients in tonight’s recipe is some wonderfully smokey chipotle from our friends at Luchito. Stir it through the sour cream and add a healthy dollop at the end. Check out www.gran.luchito.co.uk for some more fab recipes. Arriba!

Full Name: Orecchiette with Herbed Pork Tenderstem Broccoli, Chilli and Pesto (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Pork & Oregano Sausage, Orecchiette pasta, Chilli Flakes, Tenderstem Broccoli, Basil Pesto, Pine Nuts, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: If you were spending a weekend in Rome then you might come across this dish under it’s traditional name, ‘Orecchiette ai Broccoletti’. It’s a classic Italian dish combining a few simple, yet incredibly high quality ingredients for a quick, nutritious, delicious dinner. A plateful of nutritious deliciousness in the time it takes to boil your pasta!

Full Name: Sweet Potato Bake with Jalapeño Chilli and Feta
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Feta Cheese, Jalapeño Chilli, Organic Black Beans, Spring Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Red Onion, Smoked Paprika, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description: Every week at the Fresh Farm we sit down and read every single one of the feedback questionnaires you send to us. Most temperamental chefs wouldn’t be so keen if you wandered through the restaurant into the kitchen to give an opinion, but Patrick really gets into it. This is a perfect example: flavours you previously loved but with a method that’s been totally simplified. He’s got his fingers crossed for a high score!

Full Name: Bedouin Spiced Winter Veg with Tzatziki and Couscous
Ingredients: Couscous, Red Onion, Carrot, Parsnip, Swede, Chopped Tomatoes, Dried Apricots, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Greek Yoghurt, Cucumber, Flaked Almonds, Ground Cinnamon, Tumeric, Allspice, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: When he’s cooking your Hello Fresh recipes Patrick always has his mind on keeping them simple, so you have more time for putting your feet up. This one requires a bit of prep up front but once it’s bubbling away you’ll have plenty of time to catch up on your latest box set / re-arrange your sock drawer. And remember: slow gentle bubbling = maximum flavour!

Full Name: Inspired Courgette Fettuccine with Peas and Pesto
Ingredients: Courgette strands, Pecorino Cheese, Pesto, Fettuccine, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Fresh Peas
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: A couple of week’s ago Patrick sent everyone at The Fresh Farm what he described as the most beautiful cooking video he’d ever seen. In fact he got so excited about it that he flew over to Stockholm last week to hang out with the guys who made it. When he arrived they were in the middle of filming 24 hours of live cooking for a new campaign and that’s where he got the idea for this tasty little number. To check out the video that inspired him just search for “Now You’re Cooking” on Youtube.

Full Name: Fried Salmon in Dill Sauce with Rocket New Potatoes
Ingredients: Salmon fillet, New Potatoes, Dill, Rocket, Lemon, Butter, Capers
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Seafood First
Description: For your Quick Dish of the week we didn’t need to make things complicated - the ingredients spoke for themselves. If you’ve never much liked eating the salmon skin, give it a second chance as this cooking method makes it crispy and delicious!

Full Name: Orecchiette with Herbed Pork Tenderstem Broccoli, Chilli and Pesto (F)
Ingredients: Italian Pork Sausage, Orecchiette pasta, Chilli Flakes, Tenderstem Broccoli, Basil Pesto, Pine Nuts, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: If you were spending a weekend in Rome then you might come across this dish under it’s traditional name, ‘Orecchiette ai Broccoletti’. It’s a classic Italian dish combining a few simple, yet incredibly high quality ingredients for a quick, nutritious, delicious dinner. Tenderstem has a mild, distinctive flavour and a texture akin to asparagus. With a small handful containing all the vitamin C you need for a whole day, you’ve got a plate full of traditional healthiness in the time it takes to boil your pasta!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coco-Nutty Rice and Bok Choi (F)
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Bok Choy, Cashew Nuts, Coconut Powder, Garlic Clove, Soy Sauce, Honey, Ginger, Salt, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master.

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Chicken (F)
Ingredients: Vine Tomatoes, Yellow tomato, Chicken Breast, Coriander, Lime, Sweet Potato, Mexican Spice, Feta Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan
Description: Spring seems quite far away so Patrick decided to create something zingy to kickstart proceedings. Our wonderful greengrocer has sourced these sweet tasting red and yellow tomatoes, which we’ve combined with nutritious roasted sweet potatoes and the tanginess of lime to transport you all the way to the Mexican Riviera!

Full Name: Mythical Herbed Pork and Tomato Risotto (SWAP)
Ingredients: Fennel Seeds, Chicken Stock, Tomato Passata, Garlic Clove, Onion, Parsley, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Arborio Rice, Parmesan Cheese, Butter, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: We’re big believers in spicing up dinner time conversation. Enter: The HelloFresh Dinner Time Trivia Team. Rumour has it that in Greek mythology, Prometheus used the stalk of a fennel plant to steal fire from the demigods, whilst the ancient Romans called fennel seeds “the herb of sight”. Patrick just figured it would taste fab in this risotto, but we’re pretty sure the reference to Prometheus will impress your guests more!

Full Name: Silver Lining Carrot and Spiced Lentil Soup with Herb Focaccia (SWAP)
Ingredients: Onion, Celery Stick, Maris Pipes Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Chilli Flakes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Herb Focaccia, Olive Oil, Carrot, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pan
Description: They say that every cloud has a silver lining and though summer still seems a long way off it does mean you can slurp big bowls of hearty, nutrition-packed, homemade soup! This is one of Patrick’s absolute favourites since it’s super quick to make but beats the pants off any of the store bought alternatives. We’ve added a kick of chilli to raise your temperature that little bit more and fight off any winter colds. Enjoy!

Full Name: The Birthday boys Chicken Paella
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Chicken Thighs, Chorizo, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Cherry Tomatoes, Chicken Stock Pot, Rosemary, Flat Leaf Parsley, Basmati Rice, Yellow Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Why cheeky? Well, this chicken Paella has managed to sneak in some spicy chorizo for double meaty goodness. Bold, even by our own standards! This is a great dish for sharing with friends and family – just put the pot in the middle of the table and watch the spoons, forks and… even hands fling themselves towards it. It’s a real crowd-pleaser that you will love to cook again and again.

Full Name: Lamb Koftas with Homemade Tzatziki and Healthy Wholemeal Rice (F)
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Greek Yoghurt, Shawarma Spice Mix, Dill, Cucumber, Brown Basmati Rice, Lemon, Garlic Clove, Skewers, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Zester
Description: The last time we sent out a dish with this shawarma spice in it we spent a good part of the next day responding to people asking where we got it from. This fab little blend comes from our friends at Seasoned Pioneers, a speciality spice merchant who have a whole Aladdin’s cave of culinary wonderment - check them out online! Oh, and save a tablespoon of Greek yoghurt for this week’s fish n’ chips!

Full Name: (Slightly Fancy) Fish n’ Chips n’ Mushy Peas (F)
Ingredients: Sea Bream Fillet, New Potatoes, Fresh Peas, Malt vinegar, Lemon, Greek Yoghurt, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper, Butter
Utensils: Baking Tray, Fork, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: For tonight’s Quick Dish we’re taking a trip down memory lane, with a little twist. The ‘slightly fancy’ part of this fish n’ chips is that the fish comes from the Queen’s fishmonger, James Knight of Mayfair...and the fact that it’s not wrapped in newspaper! Splash some malt vinegar onto your potatoes at the end for a nostalgia-inducing touch.

Full Name: Aphrodite’s Bucatini Amatriciana with Pancetta and Plump Olives
Ingredients: Pancetta, Onion, Chili Flakes, Garlic Clove, Parmesan Cheese, Bucatini pasta, Black Olives, Chopped Tomatoes, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper, Sugar
Utensils: Grater, Pot, Pan
Description: Bucatini Amatriciana is an Italian classic! Historically, the pope has chosen his best chefs from the Amatrice region - so you’re in for a treat! The sauce is made with sweet ripe tomatoes and a hint of chilli to make a sumptuous sauce. What could be more italian than a hint of olive and Pancetta to liven up the party? Enjoy!

Full Name: Lentil and Charred Vegetable Halloumi Salad (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Halloumi, Rocket, Organic Lentils, Courgette, Red Pepper, Lemon, Thyme, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan
Description: We laugh in the face of Jack Frost! The temperature may not be balmy but that hasn’t stopped us dreaming of the summer to come, down here at the Fresh Farm. Patrick got us in the mood last week when this little number appeared from the Fresh Kitchen for a quick taste testing session. Bring on the flip-flops!

Full Name: Danny’s Courgette Quinoa Patties with Minted Yoghurt Sauce
Ingredients: Quinoa, Courgette, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cherry Tomatoes, Salad, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Tumeric, Hard Italian Cheese, Greek Yoghurt, Mint Leaves, Plain Flour, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Grater, Kitchen Paper, Pot, Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife
Description: Danny (our accountant/bean counter) has been hitting the gym recently, so he loves to sneak in a bit of extra protein into his diet wherever he can. Recently he’s been spicing things up in the kitchen by mixing high protein pseudo-cereal quinoa with all the freshness of grated courgette and the vibrant colour of turmeric. The end result is a little plate of freshness to brighten up the winter!

Full Name: Perfect Mushroom Stroganoff with Tagliatelle and Broccoli
Ingredients: Tenderstem Broccoli, Chestnut Mushrooms, Tagliatelle, Onion, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sour Cream, Ketchup, Paprika., Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Zester
Description: Long before fast food restaurants spanned the globe another culinary trailblazer was making its way around the world. Yup, you guessed it: Stroganoff. Created in Russia in the 1800’s for Count Pavel Stroganov, the dish quickly spread to China where it was adopted by U.S. servicemen, before being shipped back to America. Much of the world has since followed suit and you can even have a plate with your caipirinha in Brazil!

Full Name: Lamb Koftas with Homemade Tzatziki and Healthy Wholemeal Rice
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Greek Yoghurt, Shawarma Spice Mix, Dill, Cucumber, Brown Basmati Rice, Lemon, Garlic Clove, Skewers, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Zester
Description: The last time we sent out a dish with this shawarma spice in it we spent a good part of the next day responding to people asking where we got it from. This fab little blend comes from our friends at Seasoned Pioneers, a speciality spice merchant who have a whole Aladdin’s cave of culinary wonderment - check them out online! Oh, and save a couple of tablespoons of Greek yoghurt for this week’s fish recipe!

Full Name: (Slightly Fancy) Fish n’ Chips n’ Mushy Peas
Ingredients: Sea Bream Fillet, New Potatoes, Peas, Malt vinegar, Lemon, Greek Yoghurt, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper, Butter
Utensils: Baking Tray, Fork, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For tonight’s Quick Dish we’re taking a trip down memory lane, with a little twist. The ‘slightly fancy’ part of this fish n’ chips is that the fish comes from the Queen’s fishmonger, James Knight of Mayfair...and the fact that it’s not wrapped in newspaper! Splash some malt vinegar onto your potatoes at the end for a nostalgia-inducing touch.

Full Name: Matador’s Chicken and Chorizo Casserole with Crushed New Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, New Potatoes, Carrot, Chopped Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chorizo, Rosemary, Bay Leaf, Garlic Clove, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil, Sugar
Utensils: Knife, Kitchen Paper, Pan, Pot
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: When faced with the prospect of possible death in the bullring we’re not entirely sure a matador would choose to eat falafel as his final meal.  With this as inspiration we created a hearty, robust recipe that uses chorizo to give a distinctive, smoky character. Whether you’re up against a raging bull, or maybe just a traffic warden, this is the one for you...

Full Name: Smokin’ Cowboy Style Sausage, Homemade Baked Beans and Mash
Ingredients: Mixed Beans, Chopped Tomatoes, Pancetta, Smoked Paprika, Onion, Garlic Clove, Muscovado Sugar, Thyme, Parsley, Sausage, Potato
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: Patrick is a pretty open-minded guy. Except when it comes to baked beans. When Sous Chef Rachel said she could beat his favourite Heinz beans (it’s a bit of a guilty pleasure with granary toast and salty butter) he just wasn’t convinced. Then the impossible happened! We recommend you co-ordinate the beans, mash and sausages at the same time, as far as your juggling skills allow and the cooking time will be halved.

Full Name: Pork Chops with Leek and Potato Mash and Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Pork Chops, Potato, Leek, Milk, Red Onion, Chicken Stock Pot, Rosemary, Cornflour, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper, Sugar, Butter
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: A little recipe dedication this evening to one of our favourite chefs Jane Wilson. She wrote to tell us how much she’d been enjoying her boxes and she’d love to see some more pork chops on the menu. Apparently her secret to perfect chops is an inexpensive meat thermometer to take the guesswork out of proceedings - we couldn’t agree more!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, New Potatoes, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans, Tarragon, Dijon Mustard, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in awhile we see a sharp spike in the scores and until recently we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Sizzling Sesame Korean Beef with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Roaming Roosters Steak, Chinese Soy Sauce, Sugar, Spring Onion, Bok Choy, Sesame Oil, Sesame Seeds, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Salt
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Bowl, Pot, Pan, Fork
Description: In his tireless quest for new recipe inspiration Patrick has been eating at a few Korean restaurants of late and was inspired to knock up this sizzling beef number. The trick is to put your steak in the freezer for 40 minutes before you start and then it’s easier to slice wafer thin ribbons for a deliciously tender finish!

Full Name: A Slightly Surreal Singapore Chicken Laksa
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Red Curry Paste, Peanut Butter, Spring Onion, Chicken Stock Pot, Coconut Milk, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Ginger, Lime, Egg Noodle Nest, Coriander, Garlic Clove
Description: Patrick had a fairly surreal moment in a Singapore airport food hall not so long ago when he spotted himself on the telly! Seems his show has made it over to the Far East and rumour has it he now speaks the local lingo (though we suspect it’s dubbed!). He happened to be eating a delicious laksa at the time so it seemed only right it should make a guest appearance on the Hello Fresh menu!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Sweet Potato and Green Bean Curry (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Onion, Garlic Clove, Coconut Milk, Brown Basmati Rice, Green Beans, Cashew Nuts, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Desiccated Coconut, Chili Flakes, Coriander, Lime, Ginger, Salt, Vegetable Oil, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Tap, tap, tap! Class! Today we are having a culinary geography lesson and the subject is: Sri Lanka. An island of just over 20 million people, Sri Lanka sits off the southern coast of India and is known as “The Pearl of the Indian Ocean”. We had a word with our friends down at Seasoned Pioneers when we decided to create his recipe and they sent us this incredible fruity blend to transport you to sunnier climes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Rosemary Roasted Butternut Squash and Butter Bean Cassoulet
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Garlic Clove, Butterbeans, Rosemary, Cherry Tomatoes, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Vegetable Stock Pot, Italian Herbs, Almonds, Broccoli, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Description: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Batman and Robin, Bert and Ernie. Some things were born to go better together. There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of foodie fashion and this dish is a testament to one such union. We’ve combined the silky texture of butternut squash, with the heady taste of rosemary and cut through the richness with an unctuous tomato sauce for a dinner that’ll warm you from the inside out.

Full Name: Roasted Vegetable and Feta Medley with Walnuts
Ingredients: Feta Cheese, Sweet Potato, Yellow Pepper, Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Organic Lentils, Red Onion, Walnuts, Red Wine Vinegar, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: OK we admit, ‘medley’ is a bit of an old-fashioned word, but we weren’t quite sure how else to describe this little marriage of deliciousness. The idea was to create something that you could knock up with minimum effort that combined both sweet and earthy flavours. The result was such a corker we’ve seen it in at least 5 lunch boxes at the Fresh Farm since!

Full Name: Chicken Yakitori with Crispy Red Onions and Sweet and Sour Noodles
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Lime, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Fish Sauce, Plain Flour, Egg Noodle Nest, Skewers
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: Patrick has been working on a theory that the fewer utensils you use to eat a meal, the tastier it’s likely to be. Think about it - everything you eat with only a fork is usually delicious. Dispense with cutlery entirely to use your fingers and suddenly you’re in taste bud paradise. That was the thinking behind this Japanese favourite. The first person to finish has to shout “Banzaaaiiii”!

Full Name: Cross-Over Chickpea and Spinach Curry with Cooling Coriander
Ingredients: Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Curry Powder, Vine Tomatoes, Chickpeas, Vegetable Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Ground Cinnamon, Bay Leaf, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Baby Spinach, Vegetable Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: The male members of the HelloFresh Farm are reliably informed that there is a certain category of clothing called “cross-over” clothing. Arnie thought this might have something to do with his occasional penchant for high heels, but Caroline tells us they are clothes which can be worn from day to night. That got us to thinking about cross-over dishes - warm enough for the chilly nights we’re still having, but with a hint of impending Spring. This nutritious little number is the perfect addition to your nutritional closet.

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, New Potatoes, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans, Tarragon, Dijon Mustard, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Pan, Tall-Sided Pan, Plate
Description: Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in awhile we see a sharp spike in the scores and until recently we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Sizzling Sesame Korean Beef with Bok Choi (F)
Ingredients: Roaming Roosters Steak, Chinese Soy Sauce, Sugar, Spring Onion, Bok Choy, Sesame Oil, Sesame Seeds, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In his tireless quest for new recipe inspiration Patrick has been eating at a few Korean restaurants of late and was inspired to knock up this sizzling beef number. The trick is to put your steak in the freezer for 40 minutes before you start and then it’s easier to slice wafer thin ribbons for a deliciously tender finish!

Full Name: Gnocchi with Homemade Creme Fraiche Pesto and Tomato Bruschetta (F)
Ingredients: Pancetta, Courgette, Basil 20g, Crème Fraîche, Pine Nuts, Parmesan Cheese, Gnocchi, Ciabatta, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Plate
Description: We want your family to eat only the best, which is why we know that food is about so much more than taste alone. Texture, colour and smell all play a part in the wonderful ensemble that is the perfect dinner. For this dish, we combined the crunch of crispy bruschetta, the chewy deliciousness of gnocchi and the colours and smells of fresh basil and cherry tomatoes to create a symphony that would even make Mozart proud.

Full Name: Tuscan Meatballs with Spaghetti, Fresh Basil and Tomato Sauce (F)
Ingredients: Spaghetti, Beef Mince, Pecorino Cheese, Crackers, Chopped Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Dried Oregano, Porcini Mushrooms, Echalion Shallot, Basil 20g, Couscous, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description: We’re not too proud nor too grown up to admit that this recipe may have been inspired by a certain canine cartoon. Unfortunately Lady and the Tramp didn’t provide recipe details so instead we took our inspiration from Tuscany to create a rustic, hearty dish that can be whipped up in no time at all. See our Fresh Tip* below to use couscous for a great, crunchy finish.

Full Name: Roasted Pork Loin with Sweet Potato Mash and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Pork Medallion, Crème Fraîche, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: We’ve taken the best pork loin we could lay our hands on from our Butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ and teamed it up with super nutritious sweet potato mash. If you’ve got peppercorns in the cupboard then given them a whack and add them to your sauce - or otherwise you can leave them out - it’ll still taste crazy good!

Full Name: Fearless Pan-Fried Tilapia with Chorizo Roasted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chorizo, Onion, Thyme, Tilapia Fillet, Rocket, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Seafood First
Description: We all have irrational fears. Recently we’ve had a few messages saying that we’re helping some people get over their fear of cooking fish. For tonight’s tilapia arm yourself with a non-stick pan, step boldly up to your stove and make it happen - it’s so easy you’ll wonder what all the fuss was about!

Full Name: Mozzarella Stuffed Beefburgers with Caprese Salad
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Beef Mince, Ciabatta, Garlic Clove, Dried Oregano, Mustard, Baby Gem Lettuce, Basil 20g, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray
Description: There’s something about a BBQ that brings out the caveman in even the mildest of men. That mixture of smoke, charcoal and heat seems to stir an inner beast, who craves slabs of grilled meat and copious bottles of cold beer. Gripped by one such urge last weekend, our chef created this cheeky little recipe to feed his fellow cave dwellers. Stuffed with our notoriously good mozzarella, these burgers are oozingly good and equally suited to the kitchen grill if the weather isn’t behaving. Ugg, ugg.

Full Name: Street Food Chicken Satay with Brown Rice and Garlic Beans
Ingredients: Skewers, Green Beans, Chicken Thighs, Garlic Clove, Brown Basmati Rice, Lime, Peanut Butter, Sweet Chilli Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Back in his days of youthful exuberance Head Chef Patrick took a trip to Beijing. Tiananmen Square and the Great Wall were pretty interesting but it was the street food that really blew his mind. The ‘Beijing-ers’ love eating grasshoppers, but we thought they’d be a bit racey for tonight’s dinner, so we opted for this satay instead!

Full Name: Tarragon Infused Wild Mushroom Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Red Onion, Parsley, Tarragon, Wild Mushrooms, Vegetable Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Tagliatelle, Flour, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan, Grater, Bowl
Description: Drum roll maestro if you please...! This week we wanted to get you cooking with tarragon. Tarragon is one of what the French call the ‘fines herbes’ and you might be used to tasting it in Béarnaise sauce. Trivia alert: it’s slightly aniseed flavour and popular in Azerbaijan where you can even drink it in a bright green carbonated drink called Tarhun.

Full Name: Bedouin Sweet Potato Tagine with Apricot, Flaked Almonds & Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Sweet Potato, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Ras-el-Hanout, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Couscous, Mint, Parsley, Flaked Almonds, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: We don’t know too many Bedouins but we’d like to think that this little number would suit them down to a tee. Taking the warming Arabic flavour of Ras-el Hanout and mixing it with lemon and apricot, this dish is as healthy as it is tasty. With sweet potatoes and carrots you’ll also be getting two of your five a day, so it’s a perfect nutritional boost for a day in the desert, or a night with your feet up.

Full Name: Thai Sweet Potato and Baby Corn Panang Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Water Chestnuts, Fresh Thai Basil, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Spicy, Veggie, Lactose Free
Description: Though Panang is a mild curry, nutritionally it packs one hell of a punch! Sweet potatoes are full of beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai Basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as Holy Basil!

Full Name: Mozzarella Stuffed Beefburgers with Caprese Salad (F)
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Beef Mince, Ciabatta, Garlic Clove, Dried Oregano, Mustard, Baby Gem Lettuce, Basil 20g, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description: There’s something about a BBQ that brings out the caveman in even the mildest of men. That mixture of smoke, charcoal and heat seems to stir an inner beast, who craves slabs of grilled meat and copious bottles of cold beer. Gripped by one such urge last weekend, our chef created this cheeky little recipe to feed his fellow cave dwellers. Stuffed with our notoriously good mozzarella, these burgers are oozingly good and equally suited to the kitchen grill if the weather isn’t behaving. Ugg, ugg.

Full Name: Street Food Chicken Satay with Brown Rice and Garlic Beans (F)
Ingredients: Green Beans, Crunchy Peanut Butter, Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Garlic Clove, Lime, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Skewers, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Back in his days of youthful exuberance Head Chef Patrick took a trip to Beijing. Tiananmen Square and the Great Wall were pretty interesting but it was the street food that really blew his mind. The ‘Beijing-ers’ love eating grasshoppers, but we thought they’d be a bit racey for tonight’s dinner, so we opted for this satay instead!

Full Name: Thai Pork Panang Curry with Sweet Potato and Baby Corn (F)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Fresh Thai Basil, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn, Vegetable Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: Though Panang is a mild curry, nutritionally it packs one hell of a punch! Sweet potatoes are full of anti-oxidants, beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai Basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as Holy Basil!

Full Name: Roasted Cherry Tomato Spaghetti with Rocket and Citrus Chicken (F)
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Balsamic Vinegar, Pine Nuts, Chicken Breast, Spaghetti, Garlic Clove, Rocket, Parmesan Cheese, Lemon, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot
Description: Having created almost 600 recipes since we started Patrick is always happy to get a bit of culinary inspiration! The latest shot of creativity came from a picture he saw on Twitter by Joe Munns, who is certainly no stranger to good nosh. Joe is one of the team who founded BakedIn - check out his cakes at www.bakedin.co.uk if you fancy a bit of pud afterwards!

Full Name: Chicken Milanese with Roasted New Potatoes and Chives
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Sour Cream, Garlic Salt, Lemon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Chives, Steve’s Leaves: Peashoots & Spinach, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Rolling Pin, Bowl, Frying Pan, Small Bowl
Description: We tried sending out eggs once and it caused our operations guru Luke a whole world of scrambled trouble! When Luke saw Milanese on the menu his little face dropped at the thought of an egg wash for the breadcrumbs, but Patrick turned his frown upside down by using sour cream! If you’ve got ideas for future egg padding let us know!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Capers, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta, Olive Oil, Salt, Sugar, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: Sicily, ‘The Old Country’, the birthplace of Vito Corleone and home to one of our favourite Italian dishes: Caponata. Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: HelloFresh Prawn and Serrano Linguine
Ingredients: Green Chilli, Chives, Garlic Clove, Serrano Ham, Lemon, Linguine, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We’ve come a long way since Patrick stuck up his first week of recipes on the Fresh Farm notice board. From those 5 recipes we’re rapidly approaching our 1000th recipe and we’ve even created a HelloFresh Wall of Fame! At the top of the pops is this crazy good linguine. So good in fact that Patrick taught people all over the UK how to cook it on a Google Hangout. Check it out at hellofresh.co.uk/hangout

Full Name: Mexican Chicken and Chorizo ‘Dirty Rice’
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Organic Black Beans, Smoked Paprika, Lime, Chicken Thighs, Chorizo, Green Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: ‘Dirty Rice’ is usually associated with Cajun cooking and takes its name from the colour of the rice once it’s mixed with meat and spices. We’ve given the dish a Mexican spin by using chorizo, paprika and black beans and balancing them with lime, tomatoes and coriander to create something really zingy and fresh. It seems you can’t always judge a book by its cover!

Full Name: Roasted Butternut Squash with Giant Couscous, Rocket and Lemon-Tahini Sauce (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Lemon Thyme, Vegetable Stock Pot, Giant Couscous, Lemon, Tahini Paste, Pine Nuts, Rocket, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Spoon, Baking Tray, Pot, Small Bowl, Fork, Bowl
Description: We’ve had enough of winter weather down at the Fresh Farm. The wind is howling at the barn doors and people’s muddy wellies are causing havoc with the shag pile. That’s why we’re eating for the weather we want. It’s a bit like the food version of a Native American sun dance. Combining the creamy, nuttiness of roasted butternut squash with the chewy deliciousness of giant couscous, this recipe will brighten up dinnertime if nothing else!

Full Name: Golden Halloumi with Zingy Capers, Lentils and Fresh Dill
Ingredients: Pearl Barley, Dill, Courgette, Organic Lentils, Capers, Lemon, Sour Cream, Rocket, Halloumi, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Description: There are few events as seismic as halloumi coming onto the menu down at the Fresh Farm. Hardcore meat-eaters suddenly forget their allegiance and most of the team seem to take a veggie box for the week. This recipe was no exception and the double whammy of adding fresh dill (another ingredient on the top ten list) has secured this as one of our favourite dishes!

Full Name: Super Quick Walnut, Olive and Lemon Fettuccine
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Lemon Thyme, Walnuts, Fettuccine, Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Lemon, Red Chilli, Hard Italian Cheese, Capers
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate, Bowl
Description: For tonight’s Quick Dish we’re whisking you away to the coast of Amalfi in the south of Italy, for something zingy and refreshing. The trick to this recipe is to keep back half a cup of your pasta water just before you drain the pasta and this’ll help you create a silky sauce to go with your fettuccine.

Full Name: Roasted Pork Belly with Honey Mustard Glaze, Mash and Beans
Ingredients: Pork Belly, Potato, Milk, Honey, Green Beans, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Pan, Pot, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: The last time we sent out pork belly from our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ the feedback was so positive that we couldn’t resist trying it again. Nick has specially trimmed the meat so that you’ll have none of the faff but all of the flavour. Pork belly deserves to be slow cooked so we’ve given different techniques below depending on how long you can wait!

Full Name: HelloFresh Five Spiced Chicken with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Bok Choy, Spring Onion, Ginger, Soy Sauce, Garlic Clove, Sugar, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Red Chilli, Chinese 5 Spice
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Lactose Free, Spicy, Healthy
Description: What are these mysterious 5 spices that so often sneak their way into Chinese cooking? The exact formula can vary from place to place but usually it’s a concoction of star anise, cloves, Chinese cinnamon, fennel seeds and a bit of Sichuan pepper. This dish was actually inspired by a trip to Australia where they tend to use all sorts of Asian flavours in their cooking. We teamed it up with super fresh bok choy, ginger and garlic for a quick burst of flavours!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta (F)
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Capers, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Sicily, ‘The Old Country’, the birthplace of Vito Corleone and home to one of our favourite Italian dishes: Caponata. Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: HelloFresh Prawn and Serrano Linguine (F)
Ingredients: Green Chilli, Chives, Garlic Clove, Serrano Ham, Lemon, Linguine, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil, Côtes de Provence Rosé
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We’ve come a long way since Patrick stuck up his first week of recipes on the Fresh Farm notice board. From those 5 recipes we’re rapidly approaching our 1000th recipe and we’ve even created a HelloFresh Wall of Fame! At the top of the pops is this crazy good linguine. So good in fact that Patrick taught people all over the UK how to cook it on a Google Hangout

Full Name: Virtuous Vegetarian Curry with Toasted Cashews & Brown Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Baby Corn, Baby Button Mushrooms, Green Beans, Cashew Nuts, Yellow Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Vegan, Spicy
Description: Anthropomorphisation. It’s not a word you hear all that much. It’s used to describe a situation in which we describe an object as if it had human character traits*. Though virtue is more usually associated with someone like Mother Theresa than a humble curry, bear with us here. This recipe combines all the delicious flavours of a Thai yellow curry but with all the goodness of brown rice, vegetables and even low fat coconut milk. Devilishly good has never been so saintly ;-)

Full Name: Tuscan Meatballs with Spaghetti, Fresh Basil and Tomato Sauce (SWAP)
Ingredients: Dried Porcini Mushrooms, Crackers, Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, Basil 20g, Minced Beef, Dried Oregano, Pecorino Cheese, Chopped Tomatoes, Couscous, Spaghetti, Milk, Salt, Pepper, Sugar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Bowl, Pan, Pot
Description: We’re not too proud nor too grown up to admit that this recipe may have been inspired by a certain canine cartoon. Unfortunately Lady and the Tramp didn’t provide recipe details so instead we took our inspiration from Tuscany to create a rustic, hearty dish that can be whipped up in no time at all. See our Fresh Tip* below to use couscous for a great, crunchy finish.

Full Name: Chicken Shawarma
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Natural Yoghurt, Shawarma Spice Mix, Lemon, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Mayonnaise, Flatbread
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In our bid to re-invent the nation’s favourites with a healthy spin, we’ve decided to take on the ultimate challenge: Shawarma. Usually eaten at around 3am after a night of over-indulgence they’re a guilty pleasure that few can resist. Sous chef Rachel stepped up to the plate with gusto last Monday and the results blew our socks off. This recipe has all the delicious Lebanese flavours you’d expect but without the need for a trip to Barry’s Bootcamp the next day. Yalla! Tip: The longer you marinade the chicken the better so consider doing this step far in advance

Full Name: Chicken, Leek and Tarragon Stew with Mashed Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Garlic Clove, Leek, Carrot, Tarragon, Flour, Chicken Thighs, Chicken Stock Pot, Milk
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: When chef Rachel decided to make this dish she wanted to create something that matched the season. A little bit wintery but with the promise of impending spring. She hit the nail on the head with this light, vibrant broth and a nice helping of smooth warming mash. The rolling forward of the clocks moves closer with every mouthful!

Full Name: Thai Pork Panang Curry with Sweet Potato and Baby Corn
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Fresh Thai Basil, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: Though Panang is a mild curry, nutritionally it packs one hell of a punch! Sweet potatoes are full of anti-oxidants, beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai Basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as Holy Basil!

Full Name: Crunchy Nachos Grande with Healthy Homemade Guacamole (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Chorizo, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Kidney Beans, Mexican Spice, Chopped Tomatoes, Avocado, Sour Cream, Manomasa Tortilla Chips, Cheddar Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: We recommend cooking this recipe once your avocado is ripe (you’ll know it’s ready when it’s a little bit soft when squeezed). To speed up the ripening place it inside a brown paper bag, seal it up and leave it at room temperature for a couple of days. If you want to speed things up even more put a ripe banana in the bag too. Mexican magic!

Full Name: Grilled Artichoke Risotto with Toasted Pine Nuts (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Onion, Garlic Clove, Grilled Artichoke, Flat Leaf Parsley, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Pine Nuts, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Plate
Description: If an artichoke were a person they would be that hard-to-get, good-looking boy/girl at the bar who always seems to resist your advances. But much like the misunderstood artichoke, once you penetrate that tough exterior you’ll inevitably spend a wonderful evening together. For tonight’s dinner we’ve strolled over and broken the ice for you already. No need for any groundwork - just throw them in the mix and let the fun begin!

Full Name: Coconut Dal with Homemade Chapati
Ingredients: Wholemeal Flour, Red Lentils, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Chilli, Curry Powder, Vegetable Stock Pot, Desiccated Coconut, Coriander, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Pan
Description: Many, many (many) years ago Head Chef Patrick was rushing to school when he remembered it was ‘Home Economics’ day. In his haste he grabbed the only things he could find: a tin of baked beans and a bag of wholemeal flour. His speciality that day was baked beans on homemade chapatis. We’re glad to say he’s increased his repertoire since then and tonight’s coconut dal is an absolute stonker!

Full Name: Thai Mussaman Rice with Roasted Aubergine and Chestnut Mushrooms
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Peanut Butter, Lime, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Vegan
Description: In the world of curry, as in the world of cowboys, there are the good, the bad and the ugly. Amongst the bad ones are those that sit there innocuously on your plate, not saying boo to a goose, but loaded with enough chilli to take down a rhino. As for the ugly, you need only go to the local take-away. For this Thai Mussaman rice we combined the creaminess of peanut butter (our secret ingredient!) and organic coconut milk against the fresh tanginess of coriander and lime. It’s so good is should be made a Saint!

Full Name: An Alternative Mother's Day Chicken Shawarma (with a side portion of love)(F)
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Natural Yoghurt, Shawarma Spice Mix, Lemon, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cocktail Tomato, Garlic Clove, Mayonnaise, Flatbread, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Mother's Day needs a shake up! The mums of yesteryear may have been happy with a roast chicken dinner but the mum of today is a sophisticated lady with global taste! That's why we decided to spice up the usual mealtime offering with this healthy spin on a Lebanese classic. Maximum taste, maximum love, minimum hassle. Best served with a warm hug.

Full Name: Crunchy Nachos Grande with Healthy Homemade Guacamole (F)
Ingredients: Chorizo, Onion, Garlic Clove, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Chopped Tomatoes, Avocado, Sour Cream, Manomasa Tortilla Chips, Cheddar Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description: We recommend cooking this recipe once your avocado is ripe (you’ll know it’s ready when it’s a little bit soft when squeezed). To speed up the ripening place it inside a brown paper bag, seal it up and leave it at room temperature for a couple of days. If you want to speed things up even more put a ripe banana in the bag too. Mexican magic!

Full Name: Super Quick Pork, Walnut and Lemon Fettuccine (F)
Ingredients: Flat Leaf Parsley, Pork Sausage, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Walnuts, Fettuccine, Green Olives, Lemon, Parmesan Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For tonight’s Quick Dish we’re whisking you away to the coast of Amalfi in the south of Italy for something zingy and refreshing. The trick to this recipe is to keep back half a cup of your pasta water just before you drain the pasta and this’ll help you create a silky sauce to go with your fettuccine. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Smokey Chicken Skewers with Corn and Potato Salad (F)
Ingredients: Skewers, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Chicken Thighs, Smoked Paprika, Lime, New Potatoes, Organic Sweetcorn, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description: Our ingredient of the week this week is most definitely smoked paprika. Regular paprika is often made by drying out peppers in the sun and then grinding them to a spicy powder. As you can imagine, the smoked variety are dried in smoke sheds to give them their delicious, distinctive flavour. All the better for tickling your family’s taste buds!

Full Name: Black Sesame Teriyaki Beef with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Bok Choy, Black Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: Generally when we think of sesame seeds we think of white seeds but in this recipe we’re using black ones! Black sesame seeds aren’t a toasted version of the ones you normally see - they’re actually just sesame seeds with their jackets still on! Black sesame seeds have a lot more calcium in them than white seeds. And lastly, we’re told that the famous phrase ‘Open Sesame’ from Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves is a reference to ripe sesame seeds popping out of their shells. Dinner and useful trivia…#winning.

Full Name: Sea Bream Oreganata with New Potatoes and Carrots with New Potatoes and Carrots
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Carrot, Parmesan Cheese, Dried Oregano, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lemon, New Potatoes, Sea Bream Fillet, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: When we started HelloFresh we promised we’d never use unnecessarily complicated culinary words to dress up our recipes. Why do you need to use words like julienne and brunoise? It’s just carrot sticks and carrot cubes! Oreganata may sound a bit fussy but it’s just a really simple, crunchy topping to take your James Knight Bream to the next level. Bon apétit Enjoy!

Full Name: Easy Eating Lamb Kofta with Almond Couscous and Cucumber Salad (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Red Onion, Mint, Almonds, Wooden Skewers, Lamb Mince, Spices: Cumin, Smoked	Paprika and Cinnamon, Cucumber, Lime, Plain Yoghurt, Couscous, Vegetable Stock Pot, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Peeler, Pot, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: We’ve been working on a theory down here at The Fresh Farm. We’re convinced that if you can eat a meal with only a fork, or even better simply off a stick then it’s bound to be tasty. Think about it: spaghetti bolognese, shepherds pie and every single one of those delicious ‘sticky’ street food morsels you’ve had whilst on holiday. This evening we’re putting the theory to the test!

Full Name: Strolling Rigatoni with Cherry Tomatoes and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Rigatoni Pasta, Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Black Olives, Mozzarella
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Pan, Large Pan, Plate
Description: The key to this dish is gently roasting the cherry tomatoes and pepper to bring out their natural sweetness and then balance this against tangy olives and mild, creamy goat’s cheese. We’ve made it super quick and easy, to leave more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: A Slightly Surreal Singapore Tofu Laksa
Ingredients: Tofu, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Veggie Thai Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Crunchy Peanut Butter, Lime, Sugar Snap Peas, Egg Noodle Nest, Coriander, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Large Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Sometimes life throws bizarre situations at us. Patrick experienced this in Singapore airport recently when he was sitting in the food hall and suddenly saw himself on the television. Turns out his Italian cooking show has made it over to the Far East and it wasn’t long before the staff in the restaurant were piling his plate high with all sorts of local deliciousness. This one’s for the team at Singapore airport!

Full Name: A Lentil and Aubergine Stack
Ingredients: Aubergine, Cherry Tomatoes, Cheddar Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Netherend Butter Salted, Flour, Milk, Boursin, Organic Lentils, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Did you know that the word lentil comes from the ancient French word for freckle? Those little red lentils do look as cute as a freckle, I must say. For this dish, we are however using their big brother – the Puy lentil. These guys have a rich sophisticated flavour and there is nothing cute about it! Excellent when combined with the soft, sweet taste of our cheesy roux sauce and our sumptuously soft baked aubergine. This is a pile of pure pleasure! Enjoy.

Full Name: Black Sesame Teriyaki Beef with Bok Choy with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Bok Choy, Black Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: Generally when we think of sesame seeds we think of white seeds but in this recipe we’re using black ones! Black sesame seeds aren’t a toasted version of the ones you normally see - they’re actually just sesame seeds with their jackets still on! Black sesame seeds have a lot more calcium in them than white seeds. And lastly, we’re told that the famous phrase ‘Open Sesame’ from Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves is a reference to ripe sesame seeds popping out of their shells. Dinner and useful trivia…#winning.

Full Name: Sea-Bream Oreganata with New Potatoes and Carrots (F)
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Parsley, Carrot, Parmesan Cheese, Dried Oregano, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lemon, New Potatoes, Sea Bream Fillet, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Grater, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: When we started HelloFresh we promised we’d never use unnecessarily complicated culinary words to dress up our recipes. Why do you need to use words like julienne and brunoise? It’s just carrot sticks and carrot cubes! Oreganata may sound a bit fussy but it’s just a really simple, crunchy topping to take your James Knight Bream to the next level. Bon apétit Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican ‘Dirty Rice’ with Chicken and Chorizo (F)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Organic Black Beans, Lime, Smoked Paprika, Chicken Thighs, Chorizo, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: ‘Dirty Rice’ is usually associated with Cajun cooking and takes its name from the colour of the rice once it’s mixed with meat and spices. We’ve given the dish a Mexican spin by using chorizo, paprika and black beans and balanced them with lime, tomatoes and coriander to create something really zingy and fresh. It’s seems you can’t always judge a book by it’s cover!

Full Name: Honey Mustard Artisan Sausages with Sweet Potato Mash and Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Honey Mustard Sausages, Red Onion, Thyme, Beef Stock Pot, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Fork, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Healthy
Description: Our butcher Nick “The Knife” (less scary than he sounds) is a bit of a master when it comes to sausage making. We went up to his farm in Lancashire recently and came away with a whole box of sausages to road test back at the kitchen. What’s your favourite sausage flavour? Tell us on Facebook and we’ll put the best flavour on our menu!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with (Your Favourite) Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Kitchen Paper, Large Pan
Description: As you know we send out a questionnaire every week to see how you enjoyed your recipes. Renee (our menu planning guru) sits down with Patrick every Tuesday to give him the low-down and from there we plan the weeks to come. Recently we noticed a huge spike in popularity for fresh tarragon, hence the inspiration for tonight’s delicious dinner!

Full Name: Your Favourite Tabasco Jambalaya with Orange and Honey Chicken
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chicken Stock Pot, Green Pepper, Chicken Thighs, Orange, Honey, Chorizo, Basmati Rice, Chopped Tomatoes, Tabasco
Utensils: Pan
Description: Every week our little kitchen brigade (AKA Patrick and Rachel) are concocting new recipes to tickle your tastebuds and whilst they hope every recipe is great, occasionally they strike total gold. Tonight’s recipe was one such discovery. We’ve had so many requests to bring it back that we thought its re-appearance was the only way to prevent civil unrest. To see Patrick cooking it check out out little video at www.hellofresh.co.uk/jambalaya

Full Name: Raiders of the Lost Beef and Mushroom Burger
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Button Mushrooms, Potato, Minced Beef, Brioche Bun, Cheese, Steve's Leaves, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Peeler, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: Indiana Jones was a pretty intrepid guy, but even though he found the lost Ark and visited the Temples of Doom, he never completed a quest for the perfect cheeseburger. It’s a quest that Patrick and Sous Chef Rachel have taken very seriously, and this week they’ve come one step closer. Something tells us this isn’t their Last Crusade.

Full Name: Courgette, Jalapeño and Black Bean Quesadillas (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Onion, Courgette, Organic Black Beans, Jalapeño Chilli, Lime, Ground Cumin, Tomato Passata, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce, Wholemeal Tortilla, Feta Cheese, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Zester, Pan, Bowl
Description: Introducing tonight’s star ingredient: (*drum roll*) Jalapeños! Jalapeños are named after the Mexican town of Jalapa and have a rating of 2,500 - 10,000 units on the Scoville Scale. The Scoville Scale is used to measure the heat in a chilli with the hottest being a Trinidad Moruga Scorpion chilli (the name says it all!) at 2 million units. Thankfully tonight’s dinner is a little more tame!

Full Name: Cajun Halloumi Burgers with Chunky Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Sweet Potato, Cajun Spice, Halloumi, Sour Cream, Brioche Bun, Baby Gem Lettuce, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan
Description: For this recipe the secret’s in the sauce. The garlic sauce to be precise. Rather than simply chop the garlic into little bits (which doesn’t spread the flavour evenly), you’ll be using the flat of your knife to make a paste instead. It’s a bit cheffy, but when you taste the end result you’ll never go back!

Full Name: Lentil and Mushroom Soup with Parmesan Toasts
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Organic Lentils, Carrot, Potato, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Dried Porcini Mushrooms, Thyme, Hard Italian Cheese, Double Cream, Salt, Pepper, Wholemeal Baguette
Utensils: Peeler, Pot
Description: We’re optimistically looking ahead to warmer weather but we’re not out of the woods yet. With that in mind you’ll be knocking up this chunky, nutrition packed soup tonight to keep the chills at bay. Ironically the toasts will be even better if your bread is a bit stale when you make them so if this is the last meal of the week then all the better!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with (Your Favourite) Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Seafood First
Description: As you know we send out a questionnaire every week to see how you enjoyed your recipes. Renee (our menu planning guru) sits down with Patrick every Tuesday to give him the low-down and from there we plan the weeks to come. Recently we noticed a huge spike in popularity for fresh tarragon, hence the inspiration for tonight’s delicious dinner!

Full Name: Raiders of the Lost Beef and Mushroom Burger
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Button Mushrooms, Potato, Beef Mince, Brioche Bun, Cheese, Steve's Leaves, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Peeler, Baking Tray
Description: Indiana Jones was a pretty intrepid guy, but even though he found the lost Ark and visited the Temples of Doom, he never completed a quest for the perfect cheeseburger. It’s a quest that Patrick and Sous Chef Rachel have taken very seriously, and this week they’ve come one step closer. Something tells us this isn’t their Last Crusade.

Full Name: Chicken and Mushroom Stroganoff with Tagliatelle and Provencal Courgettes (F)
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Chicken Breast, Chestnut Mushrooms, Onion, Tagliatelle, Courgette, Ketchup, Paprika., Lemon, Worcestershire Sauce, Sour Cream, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer
Description: Advanced prep is the name of the game for tonight’s recipe. Whenever Patrick makes this one at home he cooks the poached chicken when he has a bit of spare time (e.g. the night before / during the morning) and leaves it in the fridge until he cooks that night. Then all you need to do is shred the chicken and make up your sauce. Essential time saving for hungry tums

Full Name: Perfect Pork Chops with Cinnamon & Apple Chutney and Rosemary New Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: Apple, Tenderstem Broccoli, Netherend Butter Salted, Ground Cinnamon, New Potatoes, Pork Chops, Rosemary, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer, Fork
Description: Admittedly ‘perfect’ is a pretty subjective word but we really made Patrick work hard on this recipe. Every week lots of us down at the Fresh Farm grab an upcoming recipe and give it a proper road test at home. If we don’t like it we’ll tell our head chef what we think and he’ll adjust until it’s just right. We think he hit the nail on the head with this one and we hope you think so too!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coco-Nutty Rice and Bok Choy (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Bok Choy, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Coconut Powder, Cashew Nuts, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master.

Full Name: Gnocchi with Homemade Crème Fraîche Pesto
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Parmesan Cheese, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Crème Fraîche, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description: We want your family to eat only the best, which is why we know that food is about so much more than taste alone. Texture, colour and smell all play a part in the wonderful ensemble that is the perfect dinner. For this dish, we combined the chewy deliciousness of gnocchi and the colours and smells of fresh basil and cherry tomatoes, to create a symphony that would even make Mozart proud.

Full Name: Tandoori Chicken Pockets with Cooling Yoghurt
Ingredients: Natural Yoghurt, Tandoori Masala Spice, Chicken Breast, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Carrot, Cucumber, Pita Bread
Utensils: Baking Tray
Description: The name tandoori originates from the ‘tandoor’ cylindrical clay oven in which the dish is traditionally roasted. But don’t worry! Our Head Chef has created this easy recipe and any oven will do! With inspiration from South Asia, the colourful dish tingles the taste-buds by marinating the chicken in yoghurt and seasoning with a special blend of spices. Alongside the cooling yoghurt, it’s the perfect level of spicy tucked into tasty wholemeal pittas! Delish!
