Full Name: The Maharaja’s King Prawn Pilau with Cardamom and Cashews
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Sugar Snap Peas, Ginger, Cashew Nuts, Ground Coriander, Tumeric, Basmati Rice, Cardamom Pod, King Prawns, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Spoon, Pan, Pot, Fork
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Seafood First, Spicy
Description: One of the key flavours in tonight’s little taste of India is cardamom. It might look like a raisin with a suit of armour, but getting into it is pretty easy. Put the pod on a chopping board and either crush it using the back of a spoon or the base of the handle of your chopping knife, but be careful it doesn’t ping away ;-)

Full Name: Sizzling Mexican Pork with Homemade Salsa and Coriander Rice (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Pork Belly, Garlic Clove, Smoked Paprika, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Jalapeño Chilli, Avocado, Lime, Sour Cream, Coriander, Spring Onion
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Fork
Description: We’re not even sure it makes any sense how good this dish tastes. It’s not always easy to get hold of great pork belly but we dropped a line to our brilliant butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ and as ever he delivered the goods. Post a great picture of your finished creation on our Facebook page and you could be in the running for our coveted photo of the week!

Full Name: Rachel’s Roast Celeriac and Beetroot Springtime Salad
Ingredients: Celeriac, Beetroot, Thyme, Quinoa, Vegetable Stock Pot, Honey, Red Wine Vinegar, Hazelnuts, Rocket, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot
Description: Some people have a thing about not tempting fate. We reckon life should be the exact opposite - tempt fate to do what you want at every opportunity! That’s why Chef Rachel put together this Springtime salad. Warming enough to ward off the chills but with a distinct hint of sunnier times thrown in. Hello fate. Hello springtime.

Full Name: Courgette and Sun-Dried Tomato Tart with Rocket Salad
Ingredients: Courgette, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Vine Tomatoes, Cream Cheese, Parmesan Cheese, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Dried Oregano, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Large Pan, Baking Tray
Description:
Pastry might seem like it’s the preserve of people who have way too much time on their hands but tonight we’re making it easy*! And here’s some HelloFresh trivia for you … during the drying process sun-dried tomatoes can loose up to 93% of their weight! At the same time the flavours become concentrated to give you that delicious hit of sweetness.
*Step aside Mary Berry!

Full Name: Spinach and Ricotta Lasagne with Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Shallot, Pine Nuts, Chopped Tomatoes, Dried Italian Herbs, Baby Spinach, Ricotta Cheese, Lasagne Sheets, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Today we’re taking you into the underground world of ‘reverse engineering’. A clandestine art practised by industrial spies, it usually involves somebody taking a new gadget apart and working out how it was made, so they can copy it. Head Chef Patrick likes to see himself as an upstanding member of society, but when he went to a dinner party recently and the chef refused to give up the secret of her spinach and ricotta lasagne, I think we all know what happened next. He’s still finding pine nuts in his jacket pocket to this day.

Full Name: Tandoori Chicken Pockets (F)
Ingredients: Natural Yoghurt, Tandoori Masala Spice, Chicken Breast, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Carrot, Cucumber, Wholemeal Pita
Utensils: Knife, Spoon, Peeler, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: The name tandoori originates from the ‘tandoor’ cylindrical clay oven in which the dish is traditionally roasted. But don’t worry! Our Head Chef has created this easy recipe and any oven will do! With inspiration from South Asia, the colourful dish tingles the taste-buds by marinating the chicken in yoghurt and seasoning with a special blend of spices. Alongside the cooling yoghurt, it’s the perfect level of spicy tucked into tasty wholemeal pittas! Delish!

Full Name: The Maharaja’s King Prawn Pilau with Cardamom and Cashews (F)
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Sugar Snap Peas, Ginger, Cashew Nuts, Ground Coriander, Basmati Rice, Cardamom Pod, King Prawns, Coriander, Lime, Ground Turmeric
Utensils: Spoon, Pan, Pot, Fork
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Seafood First, Spicy
Description: One of the key flavours in tonight’s little taste of India is cardamom. It might look like a raisin with a suit of armour, but getting into it is pretty easy. Put the pod on a chopping board and either crush it using the back of a spoon or the base of the handle of your chopping knife, but be careful it doesn’t ping away ;-)

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Knife, Spoon, Oven dish, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up your kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces...arriba!

Full Name: Spiced Tomato Penne with Chorizo and Smoked Garlic (F)
Ingredients: Long Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Chorizo, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: There’s nothing like the sound of a favourite song or the smell of certain scent to transport you to another place and time. For this dish we’ve specially sourced smoked garlic and chorizo with a heady aroma that cannot help but carry you away. And how to recognise the smoked garlic amongst your ingredients? Just follow your nose...

Full Name: Thai ‘Moo Pad Krapow’
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, Red Chilli, Green Beans, Pork Mince, Sweet Soy Sauce, Fish Sauce, Fresh Thai Basil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Spoon, Plate
Description: In a former life (well, about 10 years ago) our Head Chef used to be a lawyer. When his firm asked him where he’d like to go on secondment, they were probably expecting him to choose Berlin or possibly Munich. His answer? Thailand. Living there for three months he used to eat in the food halls with all the locals every lunchtime and this became his go-to dish. Stick a fried egg on for extra authenticity!

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Coriander, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cherry Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up most of the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces. Keep a few whole ones back for texture too...arriba!

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Herbed Bulgar Wheat
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Rice Vinegar, Sweet Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Plate, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Bulgur wheat isn’t the most frequent guest at the dinner table, so we’ve invited it to join the party for this recipe! High in fibre and protein and low on the glycemic index, it’s a great source of nutrition and, more importantly, it tastes great. Bulgur wheat is eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia where people have been enjoying it for thousands of years. We’ve teamed it up with a fantastic sweet and sour pork for a recipe which is as delicious as it is easy.

Full Name: Mozzarella and Pesto Roulades with Roasted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Onion, Chicken Breast, Basil Pesto, Mozzarella, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: Roast chicken is possibly one of the most comforting meals of all time and down at the fresh farm, these roulades are a firm favourite. All the ingredients and deliciousness of a roast but with a few unexpected twists. We can’t get enough of this recipe and we hope you enjoy our HelloFresh version of a Sunday classic as much as us!

Full Name: HelloFresh Singapore Noodles with a Kick of Chilli and Chives (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Onion, Egg Noodle Nest, Chicken Thighs, Curry Powder, Beansprouts, Soy Sauce, Chives, Lime, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Tackling foreign cuisine can be a bit daunting but Patrick has simplified this dish to within an inch of its life so that you can say ‘zai jian’ (that’s ‘goodbye’ in Mandarin Chinese) to your local Asian eatery. Your repertoire is getting greater by the day!

Full Name: Fennel and Olive Fettuccini with Fresh Parsley (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Pitted Black Olives, Parsley, Red Pepper, Fennel, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Fettuccine, Hard Italian Cheese, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: It is said that Italy produces 85% of the world's fennel (“finocchio” in Italian). It also happens to be the place where our delicious Del Verde pasta comes from. The best pasta is squeezed through bronze dies (little pasta shaped holes) rather than teflon to give the pasta a rougher edge that sticks to the sauce. It’s trickier to manufacture but it’s worth the effort!

Full Name: Double Peanut Satay Stir-Fry with Thai Holy Basil & Bok Choy
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Peanut Butter, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Ginger, Red Pepper, Bok Choy, Spring Onion, Sugar Snap Peas, Thai Holy Basil, Dry Roasted Peanuts
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Knife, Spoon, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: We seem to be reading a lot about the importance of ‘mindfulness’ these days. Taking a few deep breaths and clearing the mind of all the noise.  Apparently in Thailand the monks eat a special type of basil to create the same calming effect, hence the name Holy Basil. Hopefully tonight’s recipe will bring you a bit of dinner time nirvana!

Full Name: Greek Ragu with Almond, Aubergine & Basil Couscous
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Aubergine, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Green Olives, Ground Almond, Basil 20g, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pan, Fork, Plate
Description: The Ancient Greeks are famed for their spectacular mythology, their Gods and Goddesses and their epic storytelling. But we think their ragu is one of their lesser known treasures. The gentle, warm tang of our tomatoes blends like a charm with flaked almonds and aubergines. And when you add the herby basil couscous into the mix...  Well - take our word for it, the whole family will love it!

Full Name: Easter Time Roulades with Roasted Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Onion, Chicken Breast, Basil Pesto, Mozzarella, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: Easter time down at the Fresh Farm is a chance for all of us to get a bit creative in the kitchen. There’s a big family style dinner around our new 14 foot table (that we made from some old planks!) and everyone gets to bring a dish. These roulades are a firm favourite. All the deliciousness of a roast but with a couple of twists (and so easy to make). Happy Easter!

Full Name: Classic Singapore Noodles with a Kick of Chilli and Chives (F)
Ingredients: Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Onion, Egg Noodle Nest, Chicken Thighs, Curry Powder, Beansprouts, Soy Sauce, Chives, Lime, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl
Description: One of the things we love doing down at the Hello Fresh Farm is taking the restaurant classics and showing you the secrets behind them. Singapore noodles is a perfect contender, as without a bit of insider knowledge things can get a little tricky. Fear not! Patrick has simplified this dish to within an inch of its life so that you can say ‘zai jian’ (that’s ‘goodbye’ in Mandarin Chinese) to your local Asian eatery. Your repertoire is getting greater by the day!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Tomato Puree 30g, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Haricot Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this family recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Smokey Team-Effort Meatballs with Creamy Mash (F)
Ingredients: Red Onion, Minced Beef, Mustard, Dried Oregano, Cumin, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, Potato, Carrot, Yellow Pepper, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Muscovado Sugar, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Lid, Pan, Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Plate
Description: Wisdom is everywhere, if you know where to look. Just the other day Patrick was wandering down to the Fresh Farm when he saw a big billboard exclaiming ‘Dreams don’t work, unless you do’. He took it as a sign to whip up these meatballs. They take a little bit of work but he wanted you to try something a little different and the end result is an absolute corker!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Salmon with Lemon and Onion Couscous
Ingredients: Ras-el-Hanout, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Lid, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Ever wonder who that chirpy person is who replies to your tweets and Facebook messages? It’s none other than Nia! Nia joined the Fresh Farm a while ago and wins over the hearts of the team by getting all sorts of tasty samples delivered to us every week for our tasting sessions. Our Seasoned Pioneers Ras-el-Hanout is Nia’s favourite sample which is what inspired this weeks delicious salmon. Nia is also one of the judges for our weekly Recipe Photo of the Week competition, so it pays to be on her good side!

Full Name: Crispy Chicken Parmigiana Salad
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Baby Spinach, Panko Breadcrumbs, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic Salt, Chicken Breast, Sour Cream, Lemon
Utensils: Pot, Rolling Pin, Baking Tray, Bowl, Small Bowl, Plate
Description: Once upon a time our Head Chef was doing a spot of babysitting and decided to teach the toddlers how to recognise the various stages of cooked pasta. One experiment involved throwing spaghetti at the wall to see it stick. The toddlers loved it, but he wasn’t asked to babysit anymore. Another fun cooking tip is a homemade salad spinner (see below). Just make sure the grown-ups aren’t home.

Full Name: A Trendy Cauliflower and Lentil Panang Curry (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Green Lentils, Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cauliflower, Coriander, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Spoon, Frying Pan, Lid
Description: Patrick likes to think he’s pretty ‘down with the kids’ (though the fact that he even uses that phrase speaks volumes about how cool he really is!). Recently he’s been noticing a big trend for eating cauliflower, beyond the usual cheese-covered stuff you might eat with your Sunday lunch. Tonight you’ll be giving it a Malaysian spin with our delicious Panang paste. At this rate we may even see Kale on the menu in the near future!*

Full Name: Garlic Day Ciabatta Pizzas with Smokey Homemade Salsa and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Ciabatta, Mozzarella, Rocket, Basil 20g, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description: Not so long ago Renee, Luke and Patrick headed down to the Isle of Wight for a ‘research trip’. They spent a weekend with one of our favourite suppliers The Garlic Farm and though it sounded suspiciously like a holiday, they learnt (and ate) endless amounts (not least about the difference in taste between Isle of Wight garlic and the skinny supermarket stuff). To celebrate Garlic Day we put together this Italian classic. Happy Garlic Day!

Full Name: An Inventive Springtime Pea and Mint Salad
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Sugar Snap Peas, Wholegrain Mustard, Lemon, Pine Nuts, Mint, Pea Shoots & Baby Leaves, Goat's Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Frying Pan, Knife
Description: The long saga of the pea continues… Many of you will know about the constant struggle between Patrick’s love of peas and Luke’s reluctance to pop them out of their pods (to be fair he has to pop peas by the tonne which wreaks havoc with his delicate hands). To that end Patrick has been getting inventive and asked the team down at Steve’s leaves to send over their most spanking fresh pea shoots for a new recipe. This divine little recipe was the result!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Salmon with Lemon and Onion Couscous
Ingredients: Ras-el-Hanout, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Lid, Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Ever wonder who that chirpy person is who replies to your tweets and Facebook messages? It’s none other than Nia! Nia joined the Fresh Farm a while ago and wins over the hearts of the team by getting all sorts of tasty samples delivered to us every week for our tasting sessions. Our Seasoned Pioneers Ras-el-Hanout is Nia’s favourite sample, which is what inspired this week’s delicious salmon. Nia is also one of the judges for our weekly Recipe Photo of the Week competition, so it pays to be on her good side!

Full Name: Greek Style Nachos Grande with Lamb and Minted Tzatziki (F)
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Olives, Mint, Tomato Puree 30g, Lamb Mince, Dried Oregano, Wholemeal Pita Bread, Cucumber, Greek Yoghurt, Lemon, Pine Nuts, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Spoon, Baking Tray
Description: Our Head Chef is basically obsessed with Mexican food and will find any excuse to cook it. In the interests of diversity Sous Chef Rachel has been trying to wean him off, but thought it best not to go cold turkey. That’s when she hit upon this Greek twist on nachos grande and it became an instant winner down at the Farm!

Full Name: It’s About Time Chicken Tikka Massala (F)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Ginger, Cornflour, Tandoori Masala Spice, Chopped Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Coriander, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper, Sugar
Utensils: Lid, Pan, Pot, Knife, Spoon
Description: It’s about time indeed! Since we started HelloFresh 3 quick years ago Patrick has been slaving over a hot stove to create more than 800 new recipes, but this classic seems to have slipped through the net! As ever we’re revamping the classic to be healthier AND tastier. Here’s to the next 800 recipes - hurrah!

Full Name: Southern Thai Mussaman and Sweet Potato Soup with Crispy Chicken
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Sweet Potato, Peanut Butter, Lime, Coriander, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Kitchen Paper, Pan, Knife, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Food can be an amazing leveller. This zingy little number is inspired by a street food stall in Bangkok, where people from all walks of life queue down the street to get their dinner. Whether it’s the bus driver or the suited businesswoman, the child or the grandparent everyone gets in line for a bowl and chows down on fold up chairs. We wouldn’t necessarily recommend you set up for dinner on your doorstep, but if you did, you might make some interesting new friends...

Full Name: Minted Lamb and Feta Burgers with a Crunchy Summer Salad
Ingredients: Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Radish, Lamb Mince, Mint, Spring Onion, Feta Cheese, Brioche Bun, Olive Oil, Salt, Sugar, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Lid, Pan, Bowl
Description: For Da Vinci, it was Mona Lisa. For Banksy, Kate Moss. Down the centuries great artists have been moved to great feats of creativity by a beautiful muse. For Head Chef Patrick, that mythical muse is the burger. A thing of such delicious, dribble-down-your-chin simplicity, it can be re-invented time and time again to create the most divine dinnertime results. For this little incarnation, he’s taken lamb mince and thrown in a Greek twist with a kick of minty freshness. Last week he tried to frame one, but Luke ate it before he had the chance.

Full Name: Sizzling Steak Stir Fry with Egg Noodles and Bok Choy
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Cornflour, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Cashew Nuts, Bok Choy, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Chinese 5 Spice, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Those who would criticise your chopstick skills must remember that something is only easy if you’ve been shown how. Only a gifted few manage to ride a bicycle without first using stabilisers, and Chinese cutlery is equally tricky. That’s why we’ve developed the (almost) patented, Hello Fresh Chopstick System. All you need is a couple of sticks, a piece of paper and a rubber band - within hours you’ll have more skills than Mr Miyagi himself. Good luck, young grasshopper!

Full Name: Positano Pasta with Courgettes, Mozzarella and Smoked Pancetta (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Courgette, Fusilli, Pancetta, Garlic Clove, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Pecorino Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Head Chef Patrick just got back from (what he is calling) a ‘cooking reconnaissance mission’. This time we were told it was ‘absolutely necessary’ that he carry out some research in Positano on the Amalfi coast and we’ve gotta’ say the results are looking promising so far. This dish is a simple, yet utterly delicious local favourite made with mozzarella cheese from the region. We sourced the best mozzarella we could find so that you could faithfully recreate it in the comfort of your kitchen. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Mexican Tortillas with Feta and Black Beans
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Green Pepper, Baby Gem Lettuce, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Chopped Tomatoes, Organic Black Beans, Feta Cheese, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl, Zester, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This weather is so beautiful on the island at the moment, it’s almost like we’re somewhere like Mexico! Sadly, we can’t buy you a one way ticket there, but we can make your tastebuds feel like you’re there. So get ready for a flavour bonanza with our Mexican tortillas, packed with creamy black beans and salty feta. And don’t worry, Patrick has added in few pinches of Mexican spices to the mix and a spritz of lime juice so your mouth will be saying “ay ay AY” with every bite. ¡Buen provecho!

Full Name: Petrifying Vegetarian Paella
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Vegetable Stock Pot, Rosemary, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Veggie, Healthy
Description: Halloween is a bit like April Fools, everyone’s playing practical jokes and leaping out behind doors to make others scream. “Saltimbocca” literally means to “jump in the mouth”, so instead of jumping out of our skin with fear, we are jumping with joy at bringing you this classic Spanish recipe! The ghoulish green herbs combined with the crusty bottom makes for a fantastic mix of textures and a surefire dinnertime winner!

Full Name: Provencal Farmhouse Vegetable Gratin with Mozzarella and Mixed Beans
Ingredients: Aubergine, Courgette, Red Pepper, Onion, Garlic Clove, Mixed Beans, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Provencale Herbs, Mozzarella, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: What’s in a name? When it comes to naming our recipes it’s a pretty simple case of imagining where you might eat this dish if you weren’t in your kitchen. We quite fancied that we’d eat this in a cosy little cottage on a hilltop in the south of France. Mozzarella and Italian cheese add a little touch from across the border and give you a great hit of protein too. Bon appétit!

Full Name: Minted Lamb and Feta Burgers with a Crunchy Summer Salad
Ingredients: Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Radish, Spring Onion, Mint, Lamb Mince, Feta Cheese, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Knife, Lid, Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: For Da Vinci, it was Mona Lisa. For Banksy, Kate Moss. Down the centuries great artists have been moved to great feats of creativity by a beautiful muse. For Head Chef Patrick, that mythical muse is the burger. A thing of such delicious, dribble-down-your-chin simplicity, it can be re-invented time and time again to create the most divine dinnertime results. For this little incarnation, he’s taken lamb mince and thrown in a Greek twist with a kick of minty freshness. Last week he tried to frame one, but Luke ate it before he had the chance.

Full Name: Positano Pasta with Courgettes, Mozzarella and Smoked Pancetta
Ingredients: Courgette, Fusilli, Pancetta, Garlic Clove, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Pecorino Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan
Description: Head Chef Patrick just got back from (what he is calling) a ‘cooking reconnaissance mission’. This time we were told it was ‘absolutely necessary’ that he carry out some research in Positano on the Amalfi coast and we’ve gotta’ say the results are looking promising so far. This dish is a simple, yet utterly delicious local favourite made with mozzarella cheese from the region. We sourced the best mozzarella we could find so that you could faithfully recreate it in the comfort of your kitchen. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Description: Less time in the kitchen, more time in the garden. That’s the theme behind tonight’s recipe. Like the best Italian dishes, we’ve pared down this recipe to a few ultra-high quality ingredients which really speak for themselves. You’ll also be butterflying your chicken to cut the cooking time down even further. Dust off your frisbee, it’s time to play.

Full Name: Chicken Yakitori with Crispy Red Onions and Sweet and Sour Noodles (F)
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Lime, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Fish Sauce, Plain Flour, Egg Noodle Nest, Skewers, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: Patrick has been working on a theory that the fewer utensils you use to eat a meal, the tastier it’s likely to be. Think about it - everything you eat with only a fork is usually delicious. Dispense with cutlery entirely to use your fingers and suddenly you’re in taste bud paradise. That was the thinking behind this Japanese favourite. A surefire winner in the eateries of Tokyo, pick it up with your fingers and get stuck in! The first person to finish has to shout ‘Banzaaaiiii’!

Full Name: Rigatoni Caprese with Olives and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Black Olives, Chopped Tomatoes, Rigatoni Pasta, Basil 20g, Mozzarella
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Since our first heady days packing up recipes in Patrick’s living room, our enthusiastic Head Chef has whipped up well over 500 recipes. The other day we did a bit of research and it turns out there’s a big trend towards all things Italian. It’s no wonder though - he spent six months travelling from Sicily to Milan filming a show about their food and discovered the delicious simplicity of their cooking. The mozzarella in tonight’s recipe is one of our star ingredients - sourced from the heart of the Campania region in Italy, you’re going to love it too!

Full Name: Pan Seared Sea Bass with New Potatoes and Cucumber and Dill Salad
Ingredients: Cucumber, Red Onion, New Potatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets, Dill, Baby Gem Lettuce, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Peeler, Pot, Bowl, Pan
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Seafood First
Description: When asked what she wanted to talk about in this little blurb Chef Rachel suggested we create a pickle related tongue twister to go with the deliciously fresh cucumber relish for tonight’s seabass. Since we couldn’t think of one we’re having a competition for you to do it instead! The best tongue twister, said 5 times in a row on video and posted to our Facebook page wins a prize!

Full Name: Korean Beef Bulgogi with Ginger Stir-Fried Tenderstem
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Sesame Oil, Beef Mince, Tenderstem Broccoli, Basmati Rice, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Peeler, Knife, Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: Chinese food has been a regular part of the UK diet since we first started eating ‘After Eight’ mints (admit it, you ate them too!). Korean food on the other hand isn’t so well known. We’re absolutely in love with their flavours and aside from kimchi (super trendy right now!) Bulgogi is practically a national dish. We’ve simplified it to within an inch of its life so you can whip it up in minutes at home.

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Homemade Refried Beans
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Tabasco, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Chicken Breast, Smoked Paprika, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Strainer, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: Following the success of National Bring Your Lunch to Work Day (there’s a day for everything!) organised by our lovely Elise, we’ve been doing a lot more cooking for each other. With the new kitchen now in full swing, every couple of weeks we all bring in a dish and sit round for a big family style dinner. Last week this little number was the star of the show!

Full Name: Moroccan Chicken with Citrus Couscous and Green Beans (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Green Beans, Chicken Thighs, Dried Apricots, Lemon, Couscous, Chicken Stock, Honey, Ground Cinnamon, Cumin, Organic Tomatoes, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Grater, Zester, Bowl, Pan, Fork, Plate
Description: Taking the warming Arabic flavours of cinnamon and cumin and mixing them with lemon zest and apricot, this dish is as healthy as it is tasty. With tomatoes and beans you’ll also be getting 2 of your 5 a day, so it’s a perfect nutritional boost for a day in the desert, or a night with your feet up.

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Halloumi
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Halloumi, Mexican Spice, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Even though it is now well and truly winter (Luke has got his thermal long johns out), we’ve decided to create something zingy to remind us of warmer times! The Tomato Stall sent us these sweet tasting red and yellow tomatoes, which we’ve combined with nutritious roasted sweet potatoes and the tanginess of lime to transport you all the way to the Mexican Riviera!

Full Name: Freekeh-ishly Healthy Salad
Ingredients: Freekeh, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Pomegranate Seeds, Lemon, Zahtar Spice, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl
Description: Freekeh is a grain that’s very popular in Italy - you’ll usually find it in soups and salads. It’s got a good kick of fibre, iron and even some zinc but most importantly, it has the perfect taste and texture for this healthy January dinner.

Full Name: Power Pasta of the Gods with Peas and Parsley
Ingredients: Spaghetti, Pine Nuts, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Flat Leaf Parsley, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Strainer
Description: An impressive title for an equally impressive recipe! Legend has it that before battle Hercules would stride into his kitchen and whip up a plate of this pasta to fuel his heroics. Since it was practically ready in the time it takes to cook the pasta, it meant he never missed the start of battle and firmly secured his place in the history books. Admittedly it’s difficult to imagine the son of Zeus in a pinny, but you wouldn’t catch us making fun of him.

Full Name: Pan Seared Sea Bass with New Potatoes and Cucumber and Dill Salad
Ingredients: Cucumber, Red Onion, New Potatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets, Dill, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Peeler, Pot, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Family Box, Healthy
Description: When asked what she wanted to talk about in this little blurb, Chef Rachel suggested we create a pickle related tongue twister to go with the deliciously fresh cucumber relish for tonight’s sea bass. Since the last one we held was so successful  we’re having another  tongue twister competition! The best tongue twister, said five times in a row on video and posted to our Facebook page wins a prize!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Homemade Refried Beans (F)
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Tabasco, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Chicken Breast, Smoked Paprika, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Strainer, Baking Tray
Description: Following the success of National Bring Your Lunch to Work Day (there’s a day for everything!) organised by our lovely Elise, we’ve been doing a lot more cooking for each other. With the new kitchen now in full swing, every couple of weeks we all bring in a dish and sit round for a big family style dinner. Last week this little number was the star of the show!

Full Name: Chicken, Leek and Tarragon Stew with Mashed Potatoes (F)
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Leek, Carrot, Tarragon, Flour, Chicken Thighs, Potato, Chicken Stock, Milk, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Large Pan, Pot, Strainer
Description: When chef Rachel decided to make this dish she wanted to create something that matched the season. A little bit wintery but with the promise of impending spring. She hit the nail on the head with this light, vibrant broth and a nice helping of smooth warming mash.

Full Name: Ultimate HelloFresh Chilli Con Carne (The Sequel!)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Coriander, Beef Mince, Smoked Paprika, Organic Kidney Beans in Chilli, Beef Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Sour Cream, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Small Bowl, Bowl
Description: Not so very long ago Patrick decided to get all experimental with this classic Mexican favourite. He added chocolate (a big flavour in South American savoury cooking) and star anise. Much like Marmite (which he also included in the recipe!) it divided opinion, so we felt it justified giving it another try. This time sous chef Rachel stepped up to the plate and created something a little more traditional. Patrick had to (begrudgingly) admit that it was one of the best he’d ever tasted. Arriba!

Full Name: Super Cosy Herby Pork and Lentil Casserole (SWAP)
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Vine Tomatoes, Pork Sausage, Organic Lentils, Wholegrain Mustard, Chicken Stock, Thyme, Spring Greens, Flat Leaf Parsley, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Spoon, Large Pan, Strainer, Pot
Description: Every week you send us thousands of replies to the recipe survey and we read every. single. one. of. them. That means every week you get to help shape the future menus we send out. That said, Head Chef Patrick isn’t a big fan of kale so this trendy little superfood hasn’t had many outings. Chef Rachel snuck this one through on the sly and even he had to admit it was awesome!

Full Name: Protein-Packed Chorizo, Quinoa and Almond Jumble
Ingredients: Quinoa, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Red Onion, Almonds, Organic Lentils, Chorizo, Coriander, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description: Rumour has it that Superman’s powers don’t actually come from the Planet Krypton. They’re from this dinner. Quinoa is a complete protein (which means it contains all essential nine amino acids we need to be at our best), whilst almonds and feta give you another protein hit together with a dose of magnesium, vitamin B and vitamin E. Who needs supplements when you’re eating this well?!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Mustard Potato Salad
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Red Onion, Celery Stick, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Sour Cream
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Cuisines: American, European, Italian, Russian, American, European, Italian, Russian
Description: Tonight’s recipe comes with a little history lesson in mustard. We first hear mention of this fiery little condiment from the Romans back in the 4th century, but it really hit the headlines when it reached Dijon around 800 years later. In fact, people went so potty for the stuff that when the Duke of Burgundy threw a party in 1336 his guests ate 70 gallons of mustard in one sitting! We’ve sent you slightly less tonight, but we hope you’ll go potty too.

Full Name: Ginger Beef Stir Fry with Asparagus and Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Asparagus, Flank Steak, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, Oyster Style Sauce, Lime, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Pan
Description: Today we’re talking about tenderisers. If you’ve ever wondered how those clever chefs down at your local Chinese eatery get their meat to be so juicy and soft, we’re going to let you in on a little trade secret: Cornflour. When you coat your meat in this fantastic natural ingredient before cooking, it helps to keep all the juices inside the meat, leaving it succulently soft every time.

Full Name: Pork and Apple Roulades with Herbed Cannellini (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Green Apple, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Netherend Butter Salted, Sage, Organic Cannellini Beans, Pork Tenderloin, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Baking Tray
Description: We’re all about new experiences at the Fresh Farm. Last week Ed swapped his regulation Chinos for a pair of jeans and we’re pretty sure Luke has bought the new One Direction single. In that spirit of adventure we’ve got a new cooking technique for you to master this evening. You’ll be working on your knife skills to whip up an apple-stuffed pork fillet with some deliciously sage-y cannellini. Boy band playlist optional (though preferable)!

Full Name: Rigatoni with Red Pesto and Roasted Vegetables
Ingredients: Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Broccoli, Rigatoni Pasta, Chilli Flakes, Red Pesto, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray
Description: Tonight’s dinner really epitomises everything we love about Italian food. Simple, high quality ingredients, quickly cooked with maximum results. Broccoli has a mild, distinctive flavour. With a small handful containing all the vitamin C you need for a whole day, you’ve got a plate full of traditional healthiness in the time it takes to boil your pasta!

Full Name: Pesto and Asparagus Tarts with Rocket and Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Asparagus, Crème Fraîche, Basil Pesto, Hard Italian Cheese, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Pine Nuts, Rocket, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray
Description: It’s not nice on the other dishes to choose a favourite, but we have to say that this one currently gets to sit in the front seat of the car. Made with the freshest, most seasonal asparagus we could lay our mitts on, together with light puff pastry and peppery rocket, it tastes every bit as impressive as it looks on the dinner table. Don’t get too complimentary though, or the other recipes might get a complex.

Full Name: Spiced Lentils with Grilled Halloumi and Red Onion Textures
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Lentils, Red Onion, Halloumi, Pistachios, Flour, Ras-el-Hanout, Basmati Rice, Baby Spinach, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Bowl, Frying Pan, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: Great food is all about dimensions. For some people, food has only one dimension: they eat it for fuel. For others it has two dimensions: it not only keeps them going, but it tastes good too. But as with Oscar winning blockbusters about blue people from Pandora, the full experience can really only be enjoyed in 3D. For this dish, we added texture in the form of crispy onions and the hearty mouth filling indulgence that is grilled halloumi. Blue and red disposable glasses optional.

Full Name: Summery Grain Mustard Potato Salad with Pan-Fried Chicken (F)
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Red Onion, Celery Stick, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Sour Cream, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Tonight’s recipe comes with a little history lesson in mustard. We first hear mention of this fiery little condiment from the Romans back in the 4th century, but it really hit the headlines when it reached Dijon around 800 years later. In fact, people went so potty for the stuff that when the Duke of Burgundy threw a party in 1336 his guests ate 70 gallons of mustard in one sitting! We’ve sent you slightly less tonight, but we hope you’ll go potty too.

Full Name: Ginger Beef Stir Fry with Asparagus and Basmati Rice (F)
Ingredients: Asparagus, Flank Steak, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, Oyster Style Sauce, Lime, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Pan
Description: Today we’re talking about tenderisers. If you’ve ever wondered how those clever chefs down at your local Chinese eatery get their meat to be so juicy and soft, we’re going to let you in on a little trade secret: Corn flour. When you coat your meat in this fantastic natural ingredient before cooking, it helps to keep all the juices inside the meat, leaving it succulently soft every time. Combined with the fact that we source our beef from one of the best butchers in London’s famous Smithfield market, it won’t be long until your guests want to be in on the secret too.

Full Name: Herbed Pork and Pesto Penne with Pecorino (F)
Ingredients: Herbed Pork Sausage, Tenderstem Broccoli, Penne Pasta, Basil Pesto, Pecorino Cheese, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan
Description: For this week’s Quick Dish we’ve gathered a handful of the most delicious ingredients we could find for a dinner that’s as speedy as it is delicious. Our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ is fast gaining a reputation for the tastiest sausages in the country whilst the good folk over at Del Verde have supplied your bronze extruded penne. Less time cooking, more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: Mexican Tortilla Stack with Guacamole and Black Bean Salsa
Ingredients: Red Onion, Coriander, Organic Black Beans, Yellow Pepper, Chorizo, Chopped Tomatoes, Mexican Spice, Avocado, Lime, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Fork, Bowl, Plate
Description: Head chef Patrick doesn’t like fuss. He’s always telling us that the best kind of food is simple, soulful grub that makes you feel loved. That said, every dinner is a chance to practise your presentation skills. Bigger plates are a great way of framing your food and a sprinkle of herbs or a drizzle of olive oil at the end gives everything a bit more pizazz. For this recipe, we took classic Mexican ingredients and played with the presentation to create something that’s as tasty to the eye as it is to the tongue. Arriba!

Full Name: Herby Pork Stuffed Chicken Breast with an Easy Pan Sauce
Ingredients: Potato, Chicken Breast, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Flour, Chicken Stock, Broccoli, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Clingfilm, Pan, Rolling Pin, Bowl
Description: If you’re wondering about that lonely sausage in your box this week it’s destined for this awesome recipe! We asked our butcher Nick to put together some sage and onion infused pork to create a really easy stuffing for tonight’s chicken. With a quick pan sauce this recipe is easy to make and bound to impress!

Full Name: Bang Bang Bangladeshi Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Bang Curry Spice, Lamb Mince, Peas, Mint, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: There are certain people who have been with us since the beginning and the adorable Shelly at Bang Curry is one of those people. Shelly is a total ray of sunshine and every so often we call each other to catch up on the goss’ and talk recipes. This latest pice from her kitchen is a total banger and you can see the whole range, as well as meeting the lady herself, at bangcurry.co.uk

Full Name: Tagliatelle with Smoked Salmon and Lemon
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Dill, Lemon, Tagliatelle, Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Hot Smoked Salmon, Crème Fraîche, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Large Pan
Description: Certain recipes are like a really good Madonna hit. No matter how many times you bring them back they always put a smile on your face and a spring in your step. Patrick’s prawn and prosciutto linguine was one of those dishes. Not to be outdone Chef Rachel has stepped up to the plate with this beautiful smoked salmon tagliatelle. It’s Borderline Like a Prayer.

Full Name: Souk-ulent Chicken Tagine with Apricot, Flaked Almonds and Cooling Yoghurt (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Onion, Sweet Potato, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Chicken Thighs, Ras-el-Hanout, Red Chilli, Chicken Stock, Couscous, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Flaked Almonds, Natural Yoghurt, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Head Chef Patrick recently went off on another of his ‘research’ (AKA holiday) trips. This time it was to the exotic souks of Marrakech. A lot of people seemed interested in the rugs and teapots but our trusty chef took one for the team and spent his whole trip testing food to inspire our future menus. This little number was one of those dishes. Where shall we send him next? Answers on Facebook please!

Full Name: Black Bean Chilli with Brown Rice & Citrus Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Kidney Beans, Organic Black Beans, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Crème Fraîche, Tomato Puree 30g
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Grater, Bowl
Description: We’re a traditional bunch here at the Fresh Farm. Luke has often been known to throw his jacket into a puddle to save a lady’s slippers, whilst in spite of his tender years Ed insists on dressing like a man 30 years his senior. That’s why we decided to use chipotle, a smoky chilli paste produced by local farmers in the Oaxaca region of Mexico, who use age-old methods to work the land and produce this rich, sweet, spicy concoction. Add bit by bit, it’s hot!

Full Name: Leek and Pea Risotto with Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Pine Nuts, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Peas, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This evening we’re covering risotto technique. A source of lively dinner time debate. Italians broadly fall into two camps: the flippers and the stirrers (our terminology not theirs). Some argue that a risotto must be constantly massaged to develop its creaminess, whilst others (the head chef at the Bulgari hotel in Milan for one) advocate flipping the rice in the pan whilst cooking. We’ve gone for stirring as there is less chance of covering the walls, but flip it if you dare!

Full Name: The Ultimate HelloFresh Springtime Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Red Pepper, Carrot, Sugar Snap Peas, Pesto, Radish, Pine Nuts, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Why ‘the ultimate’ we hear you cry?! Well it’s just packed so full of freshness, colour, texture, flavour and goodness. In fact we were half tempted to call it a superlative springtime salad since lesser adjectives wouldn’t fit. As ever, make sure you watch your nuts like a Jack Russell waiting for the postman, or else they can burn at a moment’s notice!

Full Name: Tagliatelle with Smoked Salmon and Lemon (F)
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Dill, Lemon, Tagliatelle, Hot Smoked Salmon, Crème Fraîche, Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Vegetable Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Knife, Pot, Large Pan
Description: Certain recipes are like a really good Madonna hit. No matter how many times you bring them back they always put a smile on your face and a spring in your step. Patrick’s prawn and prosciutto linguine was one of those dishes. Not to be outdone Chef Rachel has stepped up to the plate with this beautiful smoked salmon tagliatelle. It’s Borderline Like a Prayer.

Full Name: Souk-ulent Chicken Tagine with Apricot, Almonds & Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Sweet Potato, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Chicken Thighs, Ras-el-Hanout, Red Chilli, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Flaked Almonds, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Head chef Patrick recently went off on another of his ‘research’ (AKA holiday) trips. This time it was to the exotic souks of Marrakech. A lot of people seemed interested in the rugs and teapots but our trusty chef took one for the team and spent his whole trip testing food to inspire our future menus. This little number was one of those dishes. Where shall we send him next? Answers on Facebook please!

Full Name: Homemade Pork Schnitzel with New Potatoes and Zingy Salad (F)
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Panko Breadcrumbs, Sour Cream, New Potatoes, Lemon, Dijon Mustard, Balsamic Vinegar, Rocket, Lilliput Capers, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
Utensils: Pot, Clingfilm, Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Fork
Description: Food can be a great opportunity for increasing your vocabulary and nowhere is this more apparent than with the word ‘schnitzel’. We conjured up a thousand ideas on what this word could mean, though it turns out it simply means ‘cut’ (as in a ‘cut’ of meat). The schnitzel also happens to be a close cousin of the escalope, the milanese and the milanesa in case you need to order it abroad!

Full Name: Garlicky Courgette Chicken Gratin with Roasted New Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Courgette, Boursin, Chicken Breast, Steve’s Leaves: Peashoots & Spinach
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Kitchen Paper, Spoon, Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: Life’s most precious commodity is time and tonight we want to make sure you’ve got more of it to do stuff that counts. That’s why tonight’s Quick Dish is big on flavour and nutrition but small on prep time. Get the oven pre-heating pronto, get a helper to grate the courgette and before you know it you’ll be relaxing and reflecting on another homemade dinner well done.

Full Name: Tagliata with Roasted Garlic and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Chilli Flakes, Dried Oregano, Flank Steak, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Like fish, perfectly cooking a piece of steak can be a little intimidating if you haven’t had much practice. Our top tips are: 1) take your steak out of the fridge an hour before you plan to cook it so that it comes nearer to room temperature 2) get your pan really hot before cooking and 3) once you’ve cooked it leave it to rest for a few minutes before slicing. Easy!

Full Name: Grilled Aubergine Linguine with Chilli, Chorizo and Sun-Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chorizo, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Linguine
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: Somedays you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Thor’s Thunder Chicken with Bok Choy and Basmati (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Ginger, Bok Choi, Carrot, Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Muscovado Sugar, Fish Sauce, Lemon, Coriander
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Lid, Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Strainer
Description: We inherited this tasty little number from an Australian friend of ours. He explained the whole recipe in fantastic detail so that we’d be able to recreate it in our own kitchen. The only thing he didn’t explain was why he decided to call it Thor’s Thunder Chicken. If you’ve got any imaginative ideas let us know on our Facebook page!

Full Name: Spiced Moroccan Lentil and Chickpea Soup
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chickpeas, Coriander, Ground Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Split Lentils, Pita Bread, Natural Yoghurt, Ground Cloves, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Strainer, Pan, Spoon, Bowl
Description: They say you can lead a camel to water but you can’t make him drink. We’re pretty sure if you led him to this steaming bowl of Moroccan soup, you wouldn’t have a problem! This recipe is inspired by Head Chef Patrick’s recent trip to the Atlas Mountains where he spent time with the nomadic Berbers. Check out the video of his adventure on our blog!

Full Name: Quickfire Quesadillas with Homemade Citrus Guacamole
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Coriander, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up most of the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces. Keep a few whole ones back for texture too...arriba!

Full Name: Aubergine Tagliatelle with Chilli and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Wholewheat Tagliatelle, Flat Leaf Parsley, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: Somedays you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Tagliata with Roasted Garlic and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Chilli Flakes, Dried Oregano, Flank Steak, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Healthy
Description:
Like fish, perfectly cooking a piece of steak can be a little intimidating if you haven’t had much practice. Our top tips are: 1) take your steak out of the fridge an hour before you plan to cook it, so that it comes nearer to room temperature 2) get your pan really hot before cooking and 3)
once you’ve cooked it, leave it to rest for a few minutes before slicing. Easy!

Full Name: Thor’s Thunder Chicken with Bok Choy and Basmati (F)
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Ginger, Bok Choi, Carrot, Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Muscovado Sugar, Fish Sauce, Lemon, Coriander
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Lid, Pan, Bowl, Spoon, Frying Pan, Strainer
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: We inherited this tasty little number from an Australian friend of ours. He explained the whole recipe in fantastic detail so that we’d be able to recreate it in our own kitchen. The only thing he didn’t explain was why he decided to call it Thor’s Thunder Chicken. If you’ve got any imaginative ideas let us know on our Facebook page!

Full Name: Pork and Apple Burger with Rosemary Chips (F)
Ingredients: Rosemary, Potato, Cox's Apple, Pork Mince, Brioche Bun, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan
Description: Nothing makes us happier than respinning a fast food favourite into an equally fast, but healthy dinner! This week we’ve turned our attention to the trusty hamburger. No crazy additives and preservatives. Instead we’ve got the best pork we can lay our hands on from our Butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ and added some homemade chunky chips. If you happen to have a slice of cheese in the fridge we won’t tell!

Full Name: Charred Mediterranean Vegetables with Butterflied Chicken and Dill Crème Fraîche (F)
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Dried Oregano, Aubergine, Red Pepper, Courgette, Dill, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate, Spoon
Description: Dill is the black sheep of the HelloFresh Family. Unlike the other herbs, who always dutifully turn up to dinner, dill has other ideas. We’ve only seen him around these parts on a few occasions, but whenever he turns up to the dinner table you’re guaranteed to be in for a good time. Tonight he’ll be making an appearance alongside a beautiful slab of grilled citrus chicken and a stack of mouthwatering charred vegetables. What a rockstar.

Full Name: Piled-High Moroccan Pita Breads with Fresh Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Vine Tomatoes, Cucumber, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Minced Beef, Pita Bread, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Spoon, Knife, Frying Pan
Description: Another dish inspired by our Head Chef’s recent recce in Morocco! Our spice merchants at Seasoned Pioneers have created the most wonderful blend (check out the lavender and rose petals!) to transport you to the souks of a faraway land. And you don’t even need to leave your kitchen! Besseha! (Moroccan for ‘to your good health!)

Full Name: Prawn and Asparagus Risotto
Ingredients: Fish Stock Pot, Asparagus, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Onion, Celery Stick, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Tiger Prawns, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: If vegetables could talk, you’d have a job keeping asparagus quiet. With an illustrious culinary history dating back to 20,000 BC (Yup, that’s four zeros), it’s the grandaddy of the local allotment. Perhaps most curious though, is why it was so popular amongst French monks, given its reputation as an aphrodisiac*. Never ones to pry, we’re just happy to include it in this fantastic springtime risotto alongside our fresh tiger prawns from James Knight of Mayfair.

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: For tonight’s dinner we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your ’taters come from!

Full Name: Fresh, Homemade Carrot, Pancetta and Lentil Soup with Herb Foccacia (5 MEAL)
Ingredients: Onion, Celery Stick, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Chilli Flakes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Pancetta, Herb Focaccia, Potato
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Strainer, Pan, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper
Description: The weather is warming up but we thought there should be one last hurrah for this homemade bowl of love! In Italy when you come to the bottom of your bowl it’s common to “fare la scarpetta” which (randomly) means “do the shoe”. It’s the action of wiping your plate, though fortunately we’ve provided you with some fresh foccacia rather than an old shoe!

Full Name: Seasonal Asparagus Stir Fry with Protein Packed Cashews
Ingredients: Asparagus, Tenderstem Broccoli, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Cashew Nuts, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Yellow Bean Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Sesame Oil
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Spoon
Description: Ahhhh asparagus season, thou art too short! One of our favourite seasons has rolled around again and we plan to make the most of it. This tasty little Chinese number invokes memories of our first ever Chinese restaurant experience, but we’ve reworked the recipe for maximum nutrition and freshness. Sihk faahn! (that’s Cantonese for bon appetit!)

Full Name: Superfood Mexican Jumble with Feta and Jalapeño
Ingredients: Hazelnuts, Vegetable Stock Pot, Quinoa, Couscous, Coriander, Jalapeño Chilli, Red Pepper, Pumpkin Seeds, Feta Cheese, Sweetcorn, Cumin, Lime
Utensils: Frying Pan, Lid, Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Knife, Fork, Spoon
Description: So Patrick’s parents tell us, the biggest mistake they ever made was to buy him a chemistry set as a child. In the weeks that followed, his bedroom became his laboratory and the house was under the constant cloud of impending experimental explosion. Little has changed these days - the lab has been swapped for the HelloFresh Kitchen and instead of the chemistry set, he now gets to play with ingredients like the jalapeño chilli in tonight’s recipe. We still hear the occasional explosion but the results are worth it!

Full Name: Piled-High Moroccan Flatbreads with Fresh Tabbouleh (F)
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Minced Beef, Pita Bread, Cucumber, Yellow Pepper, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Spoon, Knife, Frying Pan
Description: Another dish inspired by our Head Chef’s recent recce in Morocco! Our spice merchants at Seasoned Pioneers have created the most wonderful blend (check out the lavender and rose petals!) to transport you to the souks of a faraway land. And you don’t even need to leave your kitchen! Besseha! (Moroccan for ‘to your good health!)

Full Name: Kylie’s Italian ‘Doona’ Chicken with Fluffy Maris Piper Mash (F)
Ingredients: Potato, Courgette, Chicken Breast, Pecorino Cheese, Chilli Flakes, Lemon, Green Beans
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Grater, Kitchen Paper, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Bowl, Spoon, Baking Tray, Fork
Description: One of our aspiring chefs (AKA a Hello Fresh customer) got in touch the other day to tell us about a delicious dish she’s eaten in a very elegant restaurant in Rome. She was so excited about the dish that we couldn’t resist developing it in the Hello Fresh Kitchen. We assumed that it would have a suitably Roman name but Kylie, being Australian, had other ideas. We’re reliably informed that “doona” means duvet in the Queen’s English, which makes this one of our cosiest recipes yet!

Full Name: King Prawn Linguine with Chilli and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Chopped Tomatoes, Linguine, Tiger Prawns
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Family Box, Lactose Free, Healthy, Spicy
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunch on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this dish we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing recipe that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: The Big Belazu Coriander & Cumin Chicken Burger (SWAP)
Ingredients: Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Lemon, Ciabatta, Belazu Coriander & Cumin Paste
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Zester, Bowl, Spoon
Description: We love a challenge and turning badly made fast food style dishes into something healthy, delicious and (dare we say it) a bit gourmet is our speciality. This week’s Quick Dinner is this juicy chicken burger topped off with a beautiful Coriander and Cumin Paste from our friends at Belazu. Take that Colonel Sanders!

Full Name: Fresh, Homemade Carrot, Pancetta and Lentil Soup with Herb Foccacia
Ingredients: Onion, Celery Stick, Carrot, Potato, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Chilli Flakes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Pancetta, Herb Focaccia
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Strainer, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper
Description: The weather is warming up but we thought there should be one last hurrah for this homemade bowl of love! In Italy when you come to the bottom of your bowl it’s common to “fare la scarpetta” which (randomly) means “do the shoe”. It’s the action of wiping your plate, though fortunately we’ve provided you with some fresh foccacia rather than an old shoe!

Full Name: Deliciously Ella's Coconut Thai Curry with Chickpeas
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Chopped Tomatoes, Ginger, Chilli Flakes, Butternut Squash, Aubergine, Chickpeas, Brown Miso Paste, Coriander
Utensils: Knife, Spoon, Grater, Large Pan, Pot, Lid
Description: If you haven’t heard of Ella Woodward yet then there’s a good chance you haven’t left your house / read a newspaper / gone online in the last 12 months. Ella is the fresh face of healthy eating and her blog deliciouslyella.com is a goldmine of tasty, nutritious alternatives to some of the naughtier things we eat. If you like this recipe check out her book “Deliciously Ella” on Amazon - it’s a corker!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coco-Nutty Rice and Bok Choy
Ingredients: Bok Choi, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: HelloFresh Trivia Alert: According to the World Health Organisation, Japan has the longest life expectancy in the world. Whilst we’d like to think this is directly attributable to the joy of karaoke (a favourite pastime at the Fresh Farm) it may also have a lot to do with a diet which relies far less on red meat, dairy and processed foods. We’re working hard to give you a perfectly balanced diet to give Japan a run for their money!

Full Name: Nourishing Cauliflower and Lentil Dal with Cooling Yoghurt (SWAP)
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cauliflower, Coriander, Green Beans, Curry Spice, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Lid
Description: Every week we sit down and go through all your recipe scores and comments and they make a huge difference in the way Head Chef Patrick plans your future dinners. The humble dal is a great example. Of all the Indian recipes we’ve created, this one stands out from the crowd both for taste and pure, body-nourishing warmth.

Full Name: Sumptuous Sea Bass with Tomato Concasse & Crispy Potatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, New Potatoes, Coriander, Ginger, Vine Tomatoes, Sea Bass Fillets, Lime, Fish Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Spoon, Baking Tray, Strainer, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: World-renowned people generally all have one thing in common: a legacy. For Henry Ford it was the motor car, for Thomas Edison it was the light bulb. For our intern Simon, it was this lip-smackingly awesome sea bass. Taking the warm crunchiness of potatoes against the fresh southern asian flavours of fish with coriander, ginger and lime, it’s the perfect dish for transporting your taste buds. Add your fish sauce gradually for an authentic asian spin!

Full Name: Chopped Summertime Salad with Shredded Chicken and Homemade Croutons
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Wholemeal Bap, Garlic Clove, Mayonnaise, Lemon, Organic Black Beans, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Spoon, Slotted Spoon, Fork
Description: Less is usually more, but when it comes to a chopped salad we think more is definitely more. More ingredients, more flavours and more textures. That’s why we’ve given you a little bit of a lot of things. Instead of going heavy on chicken, or overloading you with croutons we’ve given you just the right amount of everything, so that every mouthful takes you tastebuds on a trip. To make things extra tangy you can always very finely chop some garlic into your dressing too.

Full Name: Smokey Homemade Hamburgers with Rustic Chips and a Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Pork Sausage, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Monterey Jack Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Peeler, Spoon, Frying Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: In 2012, Black Bear Casino Resort in the USA, set the world record for the biggest burger. It weighed 913 kg and was 3 metres wide! Pretty impressive! This burger, while not being quite that big is pretty impressive in the taste department. We’re sure this hamburger will blow your socks off!

Full Name: HelloFresh Five Spiced Chicken with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Muscovado Sugar, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Brown Basmati Rice, Bok Choi, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Chinese 5 Spice
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Spoon, Pan
Description: What are these mysterious 5 spices that so often sneak their way into Chinese cooking? The exact formula can vary from place to place but usually it’s a concoction of star anise, cloves, Chinese cinnamon, fennel seeds and a bit of Sichuan pepper. This dish was actually inspired by a trip to Australia where they tend to use all sorts of Asian flavours in their cooking. We teamed it up with super fresh bok choy, ginger and garlic for a quick burst of flavours!

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean & Buckwheat Bake with Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Vegetable Stock Pot, Buckwheat, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Jalapeño Chilli, Spices: Cumin, Smoked	Paprika and Cinnamon, Organic Black Beans, Crème Fraîche, Cheddar Cheese, Chives
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Pan, Spoon, Fork, Plate
Description: *Drum rolllllll* Making a rare appearance, the star of tonight’s dish is ultra nutritious, super tasty buckwheat! Buckwheat is actually a seed related to rhubarb and quite apart from its delicious, nutty flavour it is absolutely chock full of nutrition. Slow-burning to keep your energy levels constant, it also contains magnesium which can help lower blood pressure and aid delivery of nutrients around the body. If you like to spice things up then use all of the jalapeños!

Full Name: Bang Bang Veggie Bangladeshi Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Bang Curry Spice, Sweet Potato, Fresh Peas, Flaked Almonds, Lime, Feta Cheese, Coriander, Mint
Utensils: Lid, Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Peeler, Slotted Spoon, Pan, Spoon
Description: There are certain people who have been with us since the beginning and the adorable Shelly at Bang Curry is one of those people. Shelly is a total ray of sunshine and every so often we call each other to catch up on the goss’ and talk recipes  This latest spice from her kitchen is a total banger and you can see the whole range, as well as meeting the lady herself, at bangcurry.co.uk

Full Name: Curried Lentil Burgers
Ingredients: Potato, Cucumber, Carrot, Onion, Coriander, Organic Lentils, Red Curry Paste, Panko Breadcrumbs, Natural Yoghurt, Brioche Bun, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Peeler, Strainer, Fork, Knife, Large Bowl, Frying Pan, Spoon, Kitchen Paper
Description: Every week literally thousands of you wonderful cooks give us feedback on our recipes via the little questionnaire we email to you. And every week our Renee reads through every single answer (we’ve given her a comfortable chair and as much tea as she likes to ease the process). A lot of mentions have been coming through about creating a hearty veggie burger so Patrick headed into the kitchen and this tasty number was the result. Let us know what you think!

Full Name: Simply Simon’s Sumptuous Sea Bream with Tomato Concasse and Crispy Potatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, New Potatoes, Coriander, Ginger, Vine Tomatoes, Sea Bream Fillet, Lime, Fish Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Spoon, Baking Tray, Slotted Spoon, Strainer, Pan, Frying Pan
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Seafood First
Description: World-renowned people generally all have one thing in common: a legacy. For Henry Ford it was the motorcar, for Thomas Edison it was the lightbulb. For our intern Simon, it was this lip-smackingly awesome Sea Bream. Taking the warm crunchiness of potatoes against the fresh southern asian flavours of fish with coriander, ginger and lime, it’s the perfect dish for transporting your tastebuds. Don’t let the smell of the fish sauce throw you - add it gradually to your sauce for a really authentic asian spin!

Full Name: Chopped Summertime Salad with Shredded Chicken and Homemade Croutons
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Wholemeal Bap, Garlic Clove, Mayonnaise, Lemon, Organic Black Beans, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Spoon, Slotted Spoon, Fork
Description: Less is usually more, but when it comes to a chopped salad we think more is definitely more. More ingredients, more flavours and more textures. That’s why we’ve given you a little bit of a lot of things. Instead of going heavy on chicken, or overloading you with croutons we’ve given you just the right amount of everything, so that every mouthful takes you tastebuds on a trip. To make things extra tangy you can always very finely chop some garlic into your dressing too.

Full Name: Thai ‘Moo Pad Krapow’
Ingredients: Pork Mince, Basmati Rice, Thai Holy Basil, Banana Shallot, Green Beans, Garlic Clove, Fish Sauce, Red Chilli, Kecap Manis
Utensils: Lid, Pan, Food Processor, Knife, Plate
Description: In a former life (well, about 10 years ago) our head chef used to be a lawyer. When his firm asked him where he’d like to go on secondment they were probably expecting him to choose Berlin or possibly Munich. His answer? Thailand. Living there for 3 months he used to eat in the food halls with all the locals every lunchtime and this (along with Mango and sticky rice) became his go-to dish. We couldn’t more highly recommend sticking a fried egg on at the end. Decadent but oh so good!

Full Name: Spooky Super Quick Creamy Pasta with Peas and Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Fresh Peas, Flat Leaf Parsley, Bacon, Fusilli, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Kitchen Paper, Pan, Slotted Spoon, Spoon, Bowl
Description: Halloween is a bit like April Fools, everyone’s playing practical jokes and leaping out behind doors to make others scream. “Saltimbocca” literally means to “jump in the mouth”, so instead of jumping out of our skin with fear, we are jumping with joy at bringing you this classic Italian recipe! The ghostly skin of the smooth crème friache and ghoulish green peas along with the crispy bacon is a fantastic mix of textures and a surefire dinnertime winner!

Full Name: Tagliatelle with Fennel and Lamb Ragu
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Rosemary, Fennel, Lamb Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Tagliatelle, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Spoon
Description: We had a nice surprise visit down at the Fresh Farm from the guys at Del Verde pasta last week. They came all the way over from Italy to say hello and as you can imagine they’re pretty feisty when it comes to talking pasta. All of their pasta is made using bronze dies (i.e. it’s squeezed through a bronze pasta shaper) rather than Teflon. It’s a much longer process than cheaper producers use, but it means the sauce sticks to the pasta properly when you mix it. Our tip: Don’t even get them started on the subject of adding olive oil to your boiling water - touchy subject!

Full Name: Chorizo Crusted Chicken with New Potatoes and Green Beans
Ingredients: Chorizo, Panko Breadcrumbs, New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Baking Tray, Spoon
Description: HelloFresh’s super sous chef Rachel took texture to a whole new level when she cooked this up last week. Not only are you getting a double hit of protein but the crunch of the topping adds a whole extra dimension to the dish. The trick is to chop the chorizo nice and fine at the start. We recommend placing your fingers on the top of your knife towards the tip and using this as a pivot while you chop up and down. We’re expecting Photo of the Week on Facebook to come from this recipe as it’s so photogenic!

Full Name: Chorizo Crusted Chicken with New Potatoes and Green Beans
Ingredients: Chorizo, Panko Breadcrumbs, New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Baking Tray, Spoon, Pot, Bowl
Description: HelloFresh’s super sous chef Rachel took texture to a whole new level when she cooked this up last week. Not only are you getting a double hit of protein but the crunch of the topping adds a whole extra dimension to the dish. The trick is to chop the chorizo nice and fine at the start. We recommend placing your fingers on the top of your knife towards the tip and using this as a pivot while you chop up and down. We’re expecting Photo of the Week on Facebook to come from this recipe as it’s so photogenic!

Full Name: Duck à l’Orange with an Asian Twist
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Duck Breast, Orange, Bok Choi, Red Chilli, Lemongrass, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Star Anise
Utensils: Pot, Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Every week at the Fresh Farm we sit down and go over all of your feedback to decide what we’ll cook the following week. Lots of you love the classic dishes of your childhood, whilst the thrill seekers amongst you like to try out things you’ve never tasted before. This week we thought we’d try to tick both culinary boxes by creating an old favourite with a little Oriental twist. Use more or less of the lemongrass according to taste and make sure you chop it up micro-fine for the best result.

Full Name: Chillibeany Fajitas with Citrus Soured Cream
Ingredients: Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Coriander, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Tabasco, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Baking Tray, Lid, Pan, Bowl, Grater, Spoon, Fork
Description: Since Patrick met Thomasina Miers from Wahaca last year, he’s gone Mexico mad! Mexican food has been up and coming for awhile now with its combinations of citrus flavours, spices and the complimentary textures of soft beans with crunchy peppers. For this simple recipe you’ll be knocking up your own refried beans, spicing things up with some Tabasco and topping it off with a cooling dollop of sour cream. It’s so good we might end up coming over for dinner ourselves!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Dukkah Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Super Dukkah Mix, Chicken Breast, Sugar Snap Peas, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Grater, Pot, Slotted Spoon, Bowl, Spoon
Description:
Sparks may have flown when Harry met Sally, but they don’t even come close to the love affair the residents of the HelloFresh Farm currently have with Dukkah*! This little wonder-mixture appeared on our radar a few weeks ago when we chatted to the awesome folks down at The Dukkah Company. Just like us, they started off from their own home and their mixtures of spices, seeds, nuts and general deliciousness are putting them on the map all over the country.
