Description: We’re really excited to get you making the first ever HelloFresh calzone! Our good friends at The Northern Dough Company have made this beautiful pizza dough in advance, so that all you need to do is roll it out, top it with tastiness, fold it in half and bake it in your (pizza) oven. Make sure to cook this meal first this week so you get the dough at its absolute freshest!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Sea Bass with Cherry Tomato Caponata
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, New Potatoes, Cherry Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lilliput Capers, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Seafood First
Description: We love the instant gratification of food. The best things in life often take a long time to create, but a great recipe is the perfect antidote to long term graft. One minute it’s a picture and a few lines of text on a recipe card, 30 minutes later it’s sitting on a plate in front of you and 35 minutes later it’s gone! This one is definitely best enjoyed with a glass of something cold out in the fresh air.

Full Name: Indian Nachos with Chickpeas, Veggies & Yoghurt Dip
Ingredients: Chickpeas, Cornflour, Garam Masala, Cumin, Red Onion, Lemon, Flatbread, Red Pepper, Avocado, Garlic Clove, Greek Yoghurt, Red Chilli, Mint, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Knife, Plate
Description: This take on nachos is inspired by the flavours of India and turns a super-unhealthy treat into a nutritious dinner. Protein-rich, spiced chickpeas are layered with fresh, raw vegetables and herbs, all held together with a little melted cheddar. Although not Indian in any way, the deep savoury flavour of cheddar goes surprisingly well with Indian food! The red onions are quick-pickled in fresh lemon juice, resulting in gorgeously coloured, super-easy and speedy pickled onions. So you can have lovely pickled onions ready whenever you need them. Any leftovers can be tossed together and served the next day as Indian ‘panzanella’.

Full Name: Homemade ‘Marmalade’ Sticky Chicken with Rice and Vichy Veg
Ingredients: Chicken Leg, Honey, Orange, Soy Sauce, Black Garlic Teriyaki Sauce, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Carrot, Courgette, Coriander, Sweet Chilli Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description: Paddington Bear would certainly approve of this easy to make, even easier to eat dinner time treat. Your hungry bears will be gobbling up this dish and sucking their sticky paws clean. This one is a family favourite at our house and is requested frequently, which is good because it has maximum approval with minimum effort. (It is also one for your back pocket on picnic days as it is equally delicious cold! Wrap each chicken leg in tinfoil and distribute to everyone on your very own teddy bears picnic.) The Vichy veg can remain at the dinner table however, and is a fancy name for a simple preparation method from the French region of the same name.  An all-round winner – no grizzlies here!

Full Name: Oven Baked Chicken with an Orange and Sesame Quinoa Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Quinoa, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Coriander, Orange, Tahini Paste, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Kale
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Description: This lovely late summer salad is bursting with great flavours and nutrients! For this Quick Dinner we combined simple, citrusy and tangy flavours with fresh herbs to create a dressing with an oriental flare; who knew that making a healthy dressing could be this easy and delicious?! It works perfectly with the chicken and the lovely Peruvian ‘pseudo-grain’- Quinoa; which if you didn’t already know is naturally gluten free and contains nine essential amino acids. So, unload your food box, get your dinner forks ready and go for it!

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Chicken and Chestnut Mushrooms
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Chicken Thighs, Basmati Rice, Cornflour, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Powder, Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: When our head chef decided to get some work experience in a law firm after university, the usual choices (London, Belgium, Frankfurt) didn’t really appeal. So he decided to go to Bangkok. A month in an office meant three months of pocket money on the islands, so the maths made sense. During his office time instead of eating with the lawyers at lunchtime he’d nip over to a nearby food hall and feast with all the locals. Massaman Rice was his go-to dish, so this week he decided to take a trip down memory lane.

Full Name: Soy & Honey Baked Salmon with Green Bean Bulgur Wheat & Stir Fried Kale
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Soy Sauce, Honey, Salmon fillet, Green Beans, Kale, Garlic Clove, Lemon
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Kale has experienced a bit of a revival in recent years, and no wonder, it is SO good for you and also absolutely delicious! A serving of kale has more calcium than a carton of milk! You may think kale has only become popular recently but people have been growing it for more than 2,000 years, the Romans especially were rather huge fans!

Full Name: Roly-Poly Chicken with Herby Couscous
Ingredients: Smoky Sausage, Chicken Thighs, Hoisin Sauce, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Cucumber, Vine Tomatoes, Celery Stick, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Lemon, Chives
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Cluck, cluck, cluck chicken! Not laying eggs today but wrapping itself around a yummy sausage. Lots of opportunities to get sticky hands and for kids to get stuck in to the prep for the whole meal.

Full Name: Pork Chops with Roasted Fennel Medley and Mashed Potato
Ingredients: Braeburn Apple, Red Onion, Fennel, Potato, Pork Chops, Apple and Sage Jelly
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Spoon, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: When you think of fennel you normally think of the tiny seeds used in rich Indian dishes to give it that surprising aniseed flavour. Here we’re using the plant, rather than its seeds, so you’re getting some fabulous textures along with that delicious flavour. Fennel can play some cheeky tricks on your taste buds though. Certain wineries used to offer it to people before wine tastings so people wouldn’t taste how bad the wine was!

Full Name: Gnocchi with Homemade Crème Fraîche Pesto
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Parmesan Cheese, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Crème Fraîche, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We want your family to eat only the best, which is why we know that food is about so much more than taste alone. Texture, colour and smell all play a part in the wonderful ensemble that is the perfect dinner. For this dish, we combined the chewy deliciousness of gnocchi and the colours and smells of fresh basil and cherry tomatoes, to create a symphony that would make even Mozart proud.

Full Name: Mimi’s Coastal Fish Curry with Green Beans
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Tilapia Fillet, Lime, Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Mustard Seeds, Bang Curry Spice, Coconut Milk
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: This dish is inspired by Mimi’s time on the Indian coast. It’s a delicate, fresh tasting little number that will transport your taste buds to the village of Varkala in southern India! Traditional Indian fish dishes often involve marinating for several hours but we’ve used some HelloFresh magic to whip this one up in just half an hour, using a Bang Curry Spice - enjoy!

Full Name: Grilled Lamb Pittas with Cucumber Salsa and Salad
Ingredients: Vine Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce, Red Onion, Wholemeal Pita Bread, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Cucumber, Natural Yoghurt, Lamb Mince, Ground Cinnamon
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Benjamin Franklin once said there is nothing certain in this life, except for death and taxes. That sentiment was echoed down at the Fresh Farm recently, as we gazed out of the window at the rain. We decided to set up camp in the kitchen for lunch and these little pitas were the result. Combining fresh, herby flavours and a delicious cucumber salsa, they’re the perfect antidote to the uncertainty of a British weather.

Full Name: Pork Chops with Roasted Fennel Medley and Mashed Potato
Ingredients: Braeburn Apple, Red Onion, Fennel, Potato, Apple and Sage Jelly, Pork Chops
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Spoon, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: When you think of fennel you normally think of the tiny seeds used in rich Indian dishes to give it that surprising aniseed flavour. Here we’re using the plant, rather than its seeds, so you’re getting some fabulous textures along with that delicious flavour. Fennel can play some cheeky tricks on your taste buds though. Certain wineries used to offer it to people before wine tastings so people wouldn’t taste how bad the wine was!

Full Name: Penne all’Arrabbiata with Smoked Pancetta and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Pancetta, Chopped Tomatoes, Chilli Powder, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Food is described with an infinite number of adjectives but ‘angry’ is not one that immediately springs to mind. That’s unless we’re talking in Italian. This little dish is ‘Arrabbiata’ because of its chilli kick, but we’ll leave it to you to decide how much of a temper you want it to have. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time it takes to boil your pasta, there’s really nothing angry about it. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Spiced Lentil and Feta Tart
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Ground Cumin, Ground Cinnamon, Chilli Flakes, Organic Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Lemon, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: This spiced lentil tart is a great combination of earthy, sour, salty and sweet, with an extra zing from the lemon and chilli. It’s a great vegetarian way to explore the flavours of the Middle East and the earthy colours are perfect for tonight’s autumn meal!

Full Name: Sausage Puff with Homemade Red Onion Marmalade and Tomato and Watercress Salad
Ingredients: Onion, Red Onion, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Balsamic Vinegar, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Cherry Tomatoes, Cucumber, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress, White Wine Vinegar, Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Sausages come in all flavours now, with added tasty ingredients; which makes this filling more interesting than using a bland sausage meat. All plates of food should be colourful, hence the addition of various bright salad veggies to add interest and freshness. Lots of jobs for younger members of the family to assist with as well!

Full Name: Scrummy Salmon and Prawn Fish Cakes with Corn on the Cob and Tenderstem Broccoli
Ingredients: Potato, Salmon fillet, King Prawns, Chives, Corn on the Cob, Tenderstem Broccoli, Sweet Chilli Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Fork, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: These fish cakes are not ideal for birthday cake candles, but perfectly splendid for dinner. Any meal that involves the kids getting yucky, sticky hands is bound to be a big hit, and they can make ‘their’ fishcake as big or as small as they like. You can enjoy a glass of chilled white wine with yours as a relaxing reward after all the fun and games! And just before you tackle the washing up….

Full Name: Pan-Fried Gnocchi with Chestnut Mushrooms and Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Mozzarella and Pesto Roulades with Roasted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Onion, Chicken Breast, Basil Pesto, Mozzarella, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Roast chicken is possibly one of the most comforting meals of all time and down at the Fresh Farm, these roulades are a firm favourite. All the ingredients and deliciousness of a roast but with a few unexpected twists. We can’t get enough of this recipe and we hope you enjoy our HelloFresh version of a Sunday classic as much as us!

Full Name: Cheesy Cheddar Bake with Grilled Chicken Skewers
Ingredients: Wooden Skewers, Broccoli, Chicken Breast, Bacon, Smoked Cheese, Crème Fraîche, Milk, Rigatoni Pasta, Tomato Puree 30g, Honey, Vine Tomatoes, Onion, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: A comforting, tasty and easy bake that makes a good lunch as well as a supper. Mixing pasta and veggies with cheese add extra punch and flavour, and is sure to be a hit with the whole family. Set everyone else on the job of making the kebabs while you prep the rest. Many hands make light work!

Full Name: Greek Feta Stuffed Peppers with Bulgur and Avocado Salad
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Feta Cheese, Dried Oregano, Pine Nuts, Rocket, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Spring Onion
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Fork, Plate
Description: These home roasted peppers are stuffed with tangy feta, served with bulgur and a super-nutritious avocado salad. Celebrating the wonderful cuisine of Greece, this meal features flavours typical to the Mediterranean - oregano, chilli, garlic and lemon. This easy to prepare bulgur is accompanied by a zingy avocado salad which is full of healthy fats. Tasty hot, warm and cold – even makes a great packed lunch the next day!

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean and Chicken Stew with Rice and Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Cumin, Chicken Thighs, Basmati Rice, Chipotle Paste, Oregano, Organic Black Beans, Chicken Stock Pot, Coriander, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: According to reseach blackbeans contain as many antioxidants as blueberries and brussel sprouts! Blackbeans also slow down the ageing process, as does red wine! So a delicous portion of black bean and chicken stew with a glass of red wine will get you looking ten years younger ;-)

Full Name: Nick ‘The Knife’s’ Zesty Orange Beef Stir-Fry
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Orange, Ginger, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Egg Noodle Nest, Vegetable Stock Pot, Soy Sauce, Muscovado Sugar, Mangetout, Lime, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Spoon, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Last week Patrick, Luke and Ed headed out to the sticks to visit our esteemed butcher Nick ‘The Knife’. He’s actually a lot less scary than he sounds and he’s been in the butchery business since he was knee-high to a grasshopper. Nick’s big tip for this recipe is to put the steak in the freezer for 30 mins before you slice it and you’ll be able to get paper thin slices really easily!

Full Name: No Fuss Vegetable Mac ‘n Cheese
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Green Beans, Cheddar Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese, Milk, Netherend Butter Salted, Flour, Macaroni, Paprika., English Mustard, Chives, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan
Description: Macaroni and cheese has previously had a bad rep! It can be quite calorific, and we wanted to change your view! Patrick and the gang feel that fresh ingredients and a little TLC goes a long way. We’ve transformed our ‘mac and cheese’ into a meal that’s not only healthy, but one that is cooked in just one pot. No stress and less mess - just go for it!

Full Name: Sweet Potato and Carrot Veggie Curry
Ingredients: Carrot, Sweet Potato, Green Beans, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Vegetable Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Onion, Green Chilli, Curry Powder, Desiccated Coconut, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl
Description: Why we we love sweet potatoes so much? Simple: they are among the most nutritious vegetables around! They are full of both vitamin A and C and deliver a whole host of other health benefits...they are also one of the tastiest veggies around! Winner!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Tomato Puree 30g, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this family recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Stir-Fried Chinese Chilli Beef with Smithfield Steak
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Ginger, Egg Noodle Nest, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Well, you could knock us down with a feather! When Patrick whipped up this little number, we were instantly transported to a bustling backstreet eatery in Hong Kong. It blew our socks off! The trick with this dish is to slice your beef into ribbons as thinly as you can. Next, you need to cook it in a super hot frying pan in batches. By leaving space between each ribbon in the pan, they’ll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Figgy Chorizo and Ricotta Tart with Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Courgette, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Ricotta Cheese, Chorizo, Tracklements Fig Relish, Basil 20g
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray
Description: This is the easiest and quickest recipe but produces some quite delicious results...you won’t believe how little effort you will need to put in. We’ve teamed creamy ricotta with chorizo as well as the fig relish from our friends at Trackelments. This figgy deliciousness has won so many awards we felt we just had to incorporate it into something delicious. We hope you enjoy it.

Full Name: Nostalgia-Inducing Duck à l’Orange with Chicory and New Potatoes
Ingredients: Duck Breast, Orange, New Potatoes, Spring Onion, Chicory, Chicken Stock Pot, Star Anise, Cornflour
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For those old enough to remember the 80s  it was a wonderful decade of shoulder pads and Filofaxes, that didn’t seem to care too much for style. A decade where the height of sophistication was a prawn cocktail starter eaten from a martini glass and dessert was a Viennetta. To relive those glory days, we’ve put a modern spin on the most classic recipe of them all: Duck à l’Orange. 80s themed clothes are optional, but recommended.

Full Name: Hearty Vegetable Shepherd’s Pie
Ingredients: Carrot, Onion, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Potato, Rosemary, Milk, Tomato Puree 30g, Organic Cannellini Beans, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Broccoli, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: When you think about it, ‘Shepherd’s Pie’ is a bit of a misnomer. shepherd’s don’t spend all day looking after their flock only to go home and tuck into a plate of Shepherd’s pie at all. If that were the case, they wouldn’t have much wool to take to market at the end of the month. We spoke to a couple of shepherds to get their take on the situation and it turns out a lot of them are eating something far more sheep friendly...Veggie Shepherd’s Pie!

Full Name: Nutrition-Packed Nachos with Sour Cream and Guacamole
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Cheddar Cheese, Coriander, Chopped Tomatoes, Organic Sweetcorn, Tomato Puree 30g, Mexican Spice, Nachos, Avocado, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Like Robert Downey Jr and Charlie Sheen, there are certain dishes which court more controversy than others. But just as those two have dusted themselves down to reach new career heights, we’ve been hard at work making over some previously misbehaved recipes. Nachos have been getting a bad wrap for years thanks to American style diners, but we’ve revamped the dish into a nutrition powerhouse. It’s time to roll out the red carpet!

Full Name: A Really Special Chicken Fried Rice with Pistachio and Sesame
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Soy Sauce, Chicken Thighs, Pistachios, Yellow Pepper, Carrot, Green Beans, Spring Onion, Sesame Oil, Organic Sweetcorn, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: What’s so special about ‘special’ fried rice? From what we can tell, not much. That’s why Patrick decided to put the ‘spesh’ back in with this nutritious plate of deliciousness. Pistachios, cashews and sesame all combine to give you a hit of heart-healthy crunch, whilst brown rice provides that wonderful chewiness to leave you feeling utterly satisfied. Mix this with the freshness of beans and pepper, it’s probably the most special rice we’ve ever tasted.

Full Name: Beef Roly Polys, Mexican Style
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Beef Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Smoked Paprika, Flour Tortillas, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans, Onion, Garlic Clove, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Pot
Description: Get your sombreros out, wrap yourself in a stripy blanket and get ready for a Mexican style meal. Flour tortillas stuffed with tasty mince and smothered in a cheesy sauce… making your mouth water? Get the kids to help with prep, whether it’s grating cheese or rolling up tortillas, they will be sure to enjoy their roly polys if they’ve had a hand in making them. Don’t forget the cold beers and slice of lime!

Full Name: Winter Pork Schnitzel with Creamy Mash and Broccoli
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Onion, Balsamic Vinegar, Pork Medallion, Panko Breadcrumbs, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: Yep, it’s schnitzel time. The turning of the seasons is an exciting time down at the Fresh Farm. We’re taking on the responsibility of keeping you stoked up over the colder months and warding off any coughs and colds and it starts right here. What could be more ‘winter warming’ than a delicious pork schnitzel?!

Full Name: Cajun Lemon Cod with Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Cod Fillet, Lemon, Cajun Spice, Netherend Butter Salted, Thyme
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: At the Fresh Farm, we’ve noticed that the word Cajun is thrown around a lot! It’s always “Cajun this” and “Cajun that”. But Cajun isn’t just another spice like Paprika or Cumin, it’s a whole cooking tradition created by the French when they moved to Southern Louisiana. It was born out of fusion! So we’re taking our beloved friend fusion a bit further, by adding the sweet, hot flavours of Cajun spices to some delicious lemony British cod. Enjoy!

Full Name: Spooky Shredded Chicken and Baby Spinach Maille Caesar Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Wholemeal Bap, Garlic Clove, Sour Cream, Lemon, Dijon Mustard, Baby Spinach, Sunflower Seeds, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Patrick often wants his food to leap out of your plate, give you a massive bear hug and tell you how fantastic your costume is. However, since it’s Halloween, he’s tried to make this shredded chicken recipe as spooky as possible. Whilst there’s nothing scary about nutritious feel-good food, you can eat this dish whilst dressed in your scariest costume, so whilst you’ll be smiling, you’ll scare off anyone who wants you to share!

Full Name: Mustardy Gammon Steaks with Roasties and Lentils
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Red Onion, Leek, Organic Lentils, Gammon Steak, Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: It seems a strange concept that gammon could win an award. Images of an X-Factor style panel of judges’ glaring at a nervous steak spring to mind. But these gammon steaks from our fantastic butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ went all the way to the judges house (their kitchen to be precise) recently. We’ve teamed them up with a spoonful of our favourite wholegrain mustard for a duet that’s bound to go to number 1!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes & Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be having a team ski trip to Gstaad this Christmas. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result: 1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it 2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in and 3) Make sure you rest the steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it. Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Date and Pistachio Stuffed Pork Fillet with Mashed Parsnips & Green Beans
Ingredients: Pistachios, Dates, Parsnip, Potato, Green Beans, Pork Medallion, Pork Sausage
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot, Plate
Description: Pistachios have had some pretty famous fans throughout history. The Queen of Sheba loved pistachios so much that she demanded that the entire region’s pistachio harvest be set aside for her! In China pistachios are known as the ‘happy nut’ and we hope the lovely combination of pistachios, dates and pork makes you smile :)

Full Name: Speedy Smoked Mackerel Pasta
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Smoked Mackerel, Crème Fraîche, Wholegrain Mustard, Wholewheat Tagliatelle, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: We love getting suggestions in about what ingredients you would like us to use and what recipes you would like us to make! Recently our lovely customer Henrietta requested more wholegrain ingredients… so we whipped this up! A combination of delicious smoked mackerel from James Knight with our amazing Delverde pasta, and some other bits and bobs to make it extra special! Here’s to all the wholegrain fans!

Full Name: One-Pot Vegetarian Chilli with Quinoa
Ingredients: Quinoa, Garlic Clove, Onion, Green Pepper, Carrot, Coriander, Red Kidney Beans, Cumin, Chilli Powder, Ground Cinnamon, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Lime, Sour Cream, Cornflour
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Veggie
Description: Presenting to you another versatile HelloFresh ‘one-pot wonder’! This delicious dish has a bit of a twist - quinoa (yes, cooked in the same pot as the chilli)! It still contains all of the beloved flavours you know and love but with some new earthy cinnamon tones, add to this some hearty kidney beans, and you have one very satisfying and nutritious meal. Go for it!

Full Name: Spicy Peanut & Courgette Balls with Egg Noodles in a Yoghurt Satay Sauce
Ingredients: Courgette, Dry Roasted Peanuts, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Red Chilli, Coriander, Panko Breadcrumbs, Wholemeal Flour, Tahini Paste, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Peanut Butter, Honey, Natural Yoghurt, Lime
Utensils: Plate, Frying Pan, Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This one goes out to all the peanut butter lovers. Here at the Fresh Farm we love to make things interesting and these deliciously spicy plant-based and nutty ‘meatballs’, are certainly that! A combo of rustic and crunchy ‘(non)meatballs’ on top of a bed of hearty egg noodles that have been tossed in a creamy yoghurt-peanut satay. The ‘meatballs’ might make it a slightly longer dish to cook, but we promise it’s worth it!

Full Name: Undercover Southern Style Chicken and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Crème Fraîche, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Salt, Tumeric, Chicken Breast, Panko Breadcrumbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Why undercover? Because sometimes you need to get inventive to get the nippers to try something new. Kids these days are wising up to the old ‘hide-the-veg-in-the-pasta-sauce’ trick so we’ve been trying out a few sneaky ways to re-spin some decadent favourites. Tonight we’re taking the ‘colonel’s’ recipe and giving it a total nutritional make-over. Who knew that healthy could be so deceptively delish?!

Full Name: Mushroom and Pancetta Risotto
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Vine Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Arborio Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Pancetta, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: Rice is a very versatile ingredient, filling and healthy but it also is excellent at taking up the flavours added to it. So, lovely mushrooms and crispy pancetta (that’s posh bacon to you, kids) make for a popular and tasty dinner, or lunch, for all the family. Adding super food watercress and brilliant red tomatoes also add to your important five-a-day.

Full Name: Pork and Apple Sauce with Chantenay Carrots and Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Pork Medallion, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Cox's Apple, Honey, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: There’s nothing more comforting than food with a twist of nostalgia and this recipe is one of those classics, that so many of us grew up with. Pork, with a tangy apple sauce is the perfect autumn comfort food. So, gather the family around the dinner table and dig in! Why Chantenay carrots? These stocky looking little fellows are known for being the sweetest of all the carrot family. If you ask us, they’re the perfect complement to our creamy, crunchy roast potatoes.

Full Name: Veggie-tastic Italian Soup with Crispy Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Leek, Carrot, Smoked Bacon, Cherry Tomatoes, Green Beans, Red Split Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Cavolo Nero, Lemon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: As we move deeper into winter, we’re big fans of snuggling indoors with a hearty bowl of veggie-tastic soup.  Whilst everyone else is sniffling their way through the cold, we like to ward off any nasties with wholesome veggies. Did you know that every different coloured vegetable represents a different phytonutrient? This hearty bowl of soup contains green beans, red tomatoes, orange carrots, brown onions and white leeks. BOOM!

Full Name: Seared Sausage with Warm Orzo and Veggies
Ingredients: Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Red Pepper, Lemon, Pork Sausage, Orzo
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: In all honesty, orzo isn’t the traditional kind of pasta that most British households carry. Unlike our dear friends spaghetti and penne, orzo makes us feel a bit fancy. It makes us feel like saying: “Oooh! Don’t mind if I do!”. It’s pasta that they’ve shaped like a bit of rice. Good try! We know a good pasta dish when we taste it and this is one of those!

Full Name: DIY Vegetarian Fajitas with Homemade Guacamole
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Red Chilli, Aubergine, Lime, Ground Cumin, Cherry Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce, Coriander, Avocado, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description: Not so long ago dinner time used to be a very solitary occasion. Everybody had their own plate of food and woe betide anyone who should try to steal a potato from someone else’s plate. Slowly but surely our experiences of foreign cuisine warmed us up to the idea of ‘sharing food’ and nowadays it’s all the rage. With that in mind we put together this healthy fajita dish with a DIY element added for a bit more fun. Remember: sharing is caring :-)

Full Name: Pan-Fried Gnocchi with Green Beans, Mushrooms & Yoghurt-Pesto Sauce
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Green Beans, Basil 20g, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Basil Pesto, Gnocchi, Hard Italian Cheese, Walnuts
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with a yoghurt and basil pesto sauce is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty green beans, cheese and basil. Tossed in a pesto sauce and garnished with sun-dried tomatoes and crunchy walnut pieces. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Paprika Pork with Crushed New Potatoes and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Bay Leaf, New Potatoes, Red Pepper, Pork Medallion, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: A combination of Spanish delights. A very simple Spanish butter bean stew using fresh, seasonal tomatoes, rich in flavour and colour. A great little dish on its own! It’s difficult to go into a tapas bar and not find this on the menu. And of course, a traditional combination of paprika and pork that will send wonderful, zingy notes to your taste buds. It will be as if your holiday to Spain came early this year!

Full Name: Fishy Thyme Goujons with Sweet Potato Wedges and Minty Peas
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Mint, Thyme, Tilapia Fillet, Panko Breadcrumbs, Peas, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: This is a bit of a twist on the classic fish and chips you get at the beach, but  the healthy version! There is nothing more comforting than eating some crispy battered fish and slightly soggy chips sitting on a bench at the seaside – this dinner will take you back to sunny days by the sea.

Full Name: Oven-Baked Vegetable Risotto with a Crispy Panko & Cheese Topping
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Yellow Pepper, Portobello Mushroom, Vine Tomatoes, Lemon, Thyme, Chives, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Granary Roll
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Typically, this tasty, classic Italian dish involves a lot of stirring and waiting around the stove top. But our oven-baked vegetable risotto requires minimal stirring and practically cooks itself (it’s all in the name).  Enjoy a delicious mix of vegetables, fresh herbs, a lemony freshness, a crunchy panko and cheese topping and some granary bread to finish it off. Instead of stirring a pot, sit back with a glass of wine and wait for this delicious dish to cook.

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean and Chicken Stew with Rice and Sour Cream
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Oregano, Cumin, Chicken Thighs, Chipotle Paste, Organic Black Beans, Chicken Stock Pot, Coriander, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: According to research black beans contain as many antioxidants as blueberries and brussel sprouts! Black beans also slow down the ageing process, as does red wine! So a delicious portion of black bean and chicken stew with a glass of red wine will get you looking ten years younger ;-)

Full Name: Aubergine, Chilli, Chorizo & Sun-Dried Tomato Linguine
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Linguine, Chopped Tomatoes
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Somedays you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: A ‘Professional’ Fisherman’s Pie
Ingredients: Potato, Leek, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, Fish Stock Pot, JKM Seafood Mix, Netherend Butter Salted, Flour, Double Cream, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Oven dish
Description: Got your own flock of sheep? Shepherd’s Pie. Own a thatched house in the countryside? Cottage Pie. It seems that everyone is getting in on the act these days, so it’s only right that the fishermen have their place in the pie-related sun. We concocted this little number in close consultation with our fantastic fishmonger James Knight of Mayfair. Guaranteed to quell even the feistiest of dinner time mutinies.

Full Name: Jerk Pork with Coconut Tomato Rice and Beans
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Jerk Sauce, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Chilli Flakes, Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Organic Black Beans
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: There is nothing better than an incredible street food stall and London is full of them. Everywhere you go there are amazing foods from all over the world and Caribbean food is one of our chef Mimi’s firm favourites (along with every other cuisine!).  She sampled some pretty incredible jerk pork the other day which inspired her to create this delicious recipe. The jerk sauce adds a bit of a kick to the pork and the coconut milk adds a creaminess to the rice… Yum!

Full Name: Cheesy Tomato, Chorizo and Mozzarella Orzo Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes.  Combined with creamy mozzarella and succulent cherry tomatoes from our friends at the Tomato Stall… what more could you want? Our orzo is made by Delverde who use mineral water from the mountains in their pasta which in our opinion creates something really quite special.

Full Name: Creamy-Chivey Smoked Haddock with Crushed Potatoes & Buttery Greens
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Haddock Fillet, Milk, Chives, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Our new chef Victoria comes from Scotland, so she’s using her favourite Scottish staple: smoked haddock.  Locals from the fishing town of Finnan tuck into a bowl of warm poached milk and Finnan Haddie (haddock cold-smoked over peat in Finnan) for brekkie! This dish is a gentler more fragrant version of this famous Scottish breakfast, served with some trusty crushed potato and some delicious healthy greens.

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Pine Nuts and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Green Olives, Dried Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Pine Nuts, Lilliput Capers, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sicily, ‘The Old Country’, the birthplace of Vito Corleone and home to one of our favourite Italian dishes: Caponata. Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats. Buon Appetito!

Full Name: Super Food Stir-Fried Rice with Pistachios and Sweet Soy Sauce
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Green Pepper, Carrot, Green Beans, Spring Onion, Red Chilli, Pistachios, Almonds, Sesame Oil, Organic Sweetcorn, Sweet Soy Sauce, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Sir Isaac Newton, Vincent Van Gogh and Charles Darwin. All ridiculed during their lifetime, yet revered as geniuses in the years that followed. We think brown rice is similarly misunderstood. Often associated with the hardcore health fraternity, brown rice is certainly packed full of slow-burning wholegrain goodness, but moreover it’s got a fantastic chewy nuttiness, that just makes every mouthful feel like you are nourishing your body from the inside out.

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Wholegrain Mustard, Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Pan-Fried Salmon with Dill Crème Fraîche and New Potatoes
Ingredients: Dill, Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, New Potatoes, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Salmon fillet, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: World meet Ollie! Ollie is the lovely chap who finds us all our potatoes and given that his surname is Chipp we can’t help but think he is perfect for the job! Ollie treats all of his potatoes like his newborns and tells us that since it is the start of the season they have particularly delicate skins. His tip? Just be sure to keep them in the bottom of the fridge until you want to eat them and they’ll be right as rain. Enjoy!

Full Name: Caribbean Spicy Sausages with Roasted Veggies and Mashed Potato
Ingredients: Green Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Courgette, Jerk Sauce, Mango Chutney 40g, Spicy Sausage, Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Plate
Description: This spicy dish is sure to get your taste-buds talking. Caribbean food is renowned for being full of flavour and spice so get yourself prepared! The peppers and onion will caramelise so everything will be slightly sticky, which just adds to the flavour. We’ve also asked our butchers at Roaming Roosters to add a bit of chilli to the sausages to give them a bit of a kick!

Full Name: Minty Lamb and Apricot Meatballs with Tomato Pearl Barley Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Leek, Mint, Pearl Barley, Chopped Tomatoes, Chicken Stock Pot, Lamb Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: When most people watch the meatball scene in Lady and the Tramp, they see romance. They coo and giggle. Now, while that’s all very nice, all I saw was a very relatable, very terrifying struggle to get the last meatball! Did anyone else feel that way? Now, take those meatballs and multiply their deliciousness by 100 or so and you have our minty lamb and apricot meatballs. Cook these up and make sure you get one extra for all your hard work!

Full Name: Baked Five Spice Tofu Kebabs with Ginger and Tahini Noodles
Ingredients: Wooden Skewers, Tofu, Red Onion, Green Pepper, Button Mushrooms, Chinese 5 Spice, Apricot and Ginger Chutney, Soy Sauce, Ginger, Lime, Spring Onion, Red Chilli, Rice Vinegar, Honey, Tahini Paste, Egg Noodle Nest
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot
Description: Our ‘veggie-fied’ kebabs are not only the perfect pick-me-up during the week, but really help to make this ‘healthy eating’ thing a doddle. This dish may take a little more time to prepare, but it’s certainly worth it! Our tasty kebabs are made with lots of lovely ingredients all marinated in a blend of Chinese 5 spice, soy sauce and a delicious Tracklements apricot and ginger chutney.  A great combination of flavours and textures! Enjoy!

Full Name: Spinach, Mushroom and Bacon Puff with Grilled Tomatoes
Ingredients: Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Vine Tomatoes, Chives, Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Bacon, Baby Spinach, Philadelphia Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A sneaky twist on a flan, so no flan tin required! Hooray! It’s easy to do and your cooking skills will impress your fellow diners. Juicy grilled tomatoes add colour and sauciness. It might sound like summer food, but is just as warming and tasty when those darker evenings are drawing in.

Full Name: Fresh Minestrone Soup with Bacon and Conchiglioni
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Celery Stick, Courgette, Thyme, Bacon, Cavolo Nero, Bay Leaf, Chopped Tomatoes, Conchiglioni, Organic Cannellini Beans
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Healthy, Lactose Free, One Pot Wonder
Description: If you were firing a space rocket to the moon then chances are you’d want to get your sums right. Luckily, the art of making a smashing soup is not quite so precise. For this fantastic minestrone recipe, we’ve given you all the steps and ingredients you need to make the perfect soup. If there happens to be a little of this and that leftover though, feel free to add it into the pan, so you’ve got some lunch the next day. Perfect for an impromptu spacewalk!

Full Name: Fearless Sesame Crusted Salmon with Couscous and Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Red Onion, Coriander, Lime, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Salmon fillet, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: Call us pushy but here at HelloFresh we want to get you cooking with ingredients that aren’t necessarily part of your usual repertoire (trust us!). A lot of people tell us they’re scared of fish, but the only time you should be afraid is when they have big teeth and a Steven Spielberg soundtrack. This salmon recipe is incredibly forgiving and for a delicious Moroccan inspired touch we’ve teamed it up with couscous. Watch out Jaws.

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Stir-Fried Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Beef Kofta Tandoori with Sag Aloo and Flat Bread
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, New Potatoes, Coriander, Ground Turmeric, Ground Cumin, Baby Spinach, Beef Mince, Tandoori Paste, Coconut Milk, Flatbread, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: One thing we love about curry, is that it doesn’t always come with the same side. Rice is irresistible, but so is a good flatbread, dosa, or chapatti. The possibilities with flatbreads seem to be endless! So, dig into this beef kofta curry and don’t forget to mop up all that sauce with your flatbread!

Full Name: A Closely Guarded Mushroom, Thyme and Ricotta Linguine
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Linguine, Pine Nuts, Peas, Ricotta Cheese, Lemon, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Have you ever discovered a restaurant so good you didn’t want to tell anyone about it for fear it would be overrun? That’s exactly the way Patrick felt about a certain trattoria in Rome when he was filming there. They have a house speciality called Tonnarelli alla Ciociara which, in his words, “would make a grown man weep with pleasure”. This recreation did get our stomachs rumbling, and the name of the restaurant? You’ll have to twist his arm to find out!

Full Name: Pork and Fennel Meatballs
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Linguine, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Nick ‘the Knife’ our butcher has been getting quite the reputation for his sausages up in Lancashire. When Patrick, Ed and Luke made a visit up to the Roaming Roosters farm recently, you’d think there was about to be a sausage shortage, as people were queuing right out the door! Fortunately we’ve got a few connections so we managed to snag a few Tuscan fennel sausages for tonight’s dinner!

Full Name: Chermoula Chicken with Pancetta Lentils and Roasted Peppers
Ingredients: Carrot, Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Ras-el-Hanout, Lemon, Chicken Thighs, Pancetta, Organic Lentils, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Spicy
Description: Chermoula is one of the most delicious ways to cook just about anything; meat, fish or vegetables. It is a traditional North African marinade and you just can’t beat it. Here we’ve used it on some juicy chicken thighs and you won’t believe how little time it will take you to create such an explosion of flavours...HelloFresh magic!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Muscovado Sugar, Redcurrant Jelly
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t even really know how to cook a steak well-done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Mexican Jalapeño Jumble with Black Beans and Chorizo
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Black Beans, Organic Sweetcorn, Jalapeño Chilli, Coriander, Chorizo, Lime, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: The subject of this lesson is ‘The Scoville Scale’. In 1912, Wilbur Scoville created this scale to measure the heat in different chillies. The scale measures the amount of ‘capsaicin’ in the chilli, (the bit that makes it spicy). At the top of the scale, you’ve got the Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Chilli (!) at 2,000,000 Scoville Units, whilst the Jalapeño (star of this recipe) is only 3,500 Units. However, if you’re sensitive to heat we still recommend you go easy on the spice!

Full Name: Cranberry and Cream Cheese Roulades with Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Chicken Breast, Philadelphia Cheese, Dried Cranberries, Broccoli, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: With the Big Day so close we wanted to give you a bit of pre-match training. Tonight you’re going to be practising your perfect roast potatoes and we’re throwing in another Crimbo themed touch with some cranberry stuffed chicken. It’s dead simple and the flavours are the perfect warm up to the 25th. The key secret is to get some nice rough edges on your potatoes before they go into the oven. Prizes for the crunchiest looking ‘taters!

Full Name: Cranberry and Cream Cheese Roulades with Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Chicken Breast, Philadelphia Cheese, Dried Cranberries, Broccoli, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: With the Big Day so close we wanted to give you a bit of pre-match training. Tonight you’re going to be practising your perfect roast potatoes and we’re throwing in another Crimbo themed touch with some cranberry stuffed chicken. It’s dead simple and the flavours are the perfect warm up to the 25th. The key secret is to get some nice rough edges on your potatoes before they go into the oven. Prizes for the crunchiest looking ‘taters!

Full Name: Luke’s Elephant Garlic, Pancetta and Mushroom Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Red Onion, Elephant Garlic, Chestnut Mushrooms, Lemon, Thyme, Pancetta, Tagliatelle, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: Sometimes, when a flavour is so alluring and so satisfying, you don’t want anything stealing its thunder! Luke’s simple tagliatelle is an ode to elephant garlic. Why? Because it tastes SO good and the cloves are bigger – so less peeling off garlic skin. Hurrah!

Full Name: Beef and Corn Tortillas with Crunchy Pepper and Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Organic Black Beans, Organic Sweetcorn, Beef Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Chipotle Paste, Wholemeal Tortilla, Lime, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The sauce for this recipe is flavoured with Mexican chipotle, made by taking ripe jalapeño chillies and smoking them for several days until they’re dry. It takes around 5kg of chillies to produce just 1/2kilo of chipotle, so it’s potent stuff! As tasty as it is quick, this recipe is a sure-fire body booster!

Full Name: Roasted Red Pepper and Goat’s Cheese Risotto
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Onion, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Arborio Rice, Grilled Peppers, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: Passing your driving test. Your first shave. Your first kiss. There are certain rights of passage that we all undergo on our journey through life, but none so pivotal as cooking the perfect risotto. Our top tips for the perfect risotto are to add a little butter at step 3, and to make sure you loosen up the risotto at the end with the red pepper sauce and a little more stock if necessary. With any luck this recipe could lead to your second kiss too…

Full Name: Vegetable & Butter Bean Chilli with Guacamole & Rice
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Cumin, Ground Coriander, Smoked Paprika, Chilli Flakes, Basmati Rice, Chopped Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Courgette, Avocado, Lime, Spring Onion
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Veggie
Description: This chilli is a firm favourite of our chef Mimi. It is inspired by Mimi’s veggie friend Emily who whipped this up one night and having originally turned her nose up at butter beans, Mimi proceeded to devour three portions. It is packed with a whole array of delicious ingredients and we hope you enjoy this taste sensation as much as we do!

Full Name: Fishy Thyme Goujons with Sweet Potato Wedges and Minty Peas
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Mint, Thyme, Tilapia Fillet, Panko Breadcrumbs, Crème Fraîche, Fresh Peas
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: This is a bit of a twist on the classic fish and chips you get at the beach, but  the healthy version! There is nothing more comforting than eating some crispy battered fish and slightly soggy chips sitting on a bench at the seaside – this dinner will take you back to sunny days by the sea.

Full Name: Sicilian Penne Caponata
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Lilliput Capers, White Wine Vinegar, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: This recipe was born out of Patrick’s love for all things Italian. Sicily is famous for their arancini and cannoli but this caponata is also one of Sicily’s best kept secrets. So, mum’s the word. We don’t want to get in trouble with the locals! The sweet tang of those tomatoes work so well with the capers, peppers and Tuscan sausage. You’ll enjoy this one!

Full Name: Zesty Citrus Chicken and Ginger Stir Fry
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Green Beans, Orange, Garlic Clove, Egg Noodle Nest, Ginger, Soy Sauce, Cornflour, Muscovado Sugar, Beansprouts, Sesame Seeds, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Spoon, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: This stir-fry balances a range of flavours, to create a dish that would feel at home in any Asian eatery. One of those flavours is muscovado sugar, (AKA Barbados Sugar). This tasty little ingredient owes its distinctive dark colour to a high content of molasses; a thick, honey-like liquid that we know more commonly as treacle. Combined with ginger, sesame and soy sauce, a connoisseur might call this a perfect little symphony. We just say it tastes awesome.

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Muscovado Sugar, Redcurrant Jelly
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t even really know how to cook a steak well-done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Your Favourite Orange and Honey Chicken Jambalaya
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chicken Stock Pot, Green Pepper, Chicken Thighs, Orange, Honey, Chorizo, Habernero Sauce, Basmati Rice, Chopped Tomatoes
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: Every week our little kitchen brigade are concocting new recipes to tickle your taste buds and whilst they hope every recipe is great, occasionally they strike total gold. Tonight’s recipe was one such discovery. We’ve had so many requests to bring it back, that we thought its reappearance was the only way to prevent civil unrest.

Full Name: Leek and Pea Risotto with Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Pine Nuts, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Peas, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: This evening we’re covering risotto technique. A source of lively dinner time debate. Italians broadly fall into two camps: the flippers and the stirrers (our terminology not theirs). Some argue that a risotto must be constantly massaged to develop its creaminess, whilst others (the head chef at the Bulgari hotel in Milan for one) advocate flipping the rice in the pan whilst cooking. We’ve gone for stirring as there is less chance of covering the walls, but flip it if you dare!

Full Name: Butternut Squash & Coconut Dal with Warm Flatbreads and Onion Textures
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Red Chilli, Vine Tomatoes, Curry Powder, Vegetable Stock Pot, Creamed Coconut, Red Split Lentils, Flour, Coriander, Flatbread, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: This recipe is a total stonker. With a good kick of chilli it’s just the ticket for a windy weeknight. ‘Onion textures’ sound a little more posh than they need to - it essentially means some nice crunchy onions to add a bit of textural contrast to your dal. To get them good and crispy, get the oil nice and hot and don’t overcrowd the pan. If they have a bit of space to cook then you’ll fry them (instead of stew them), which will give you a perfect finish. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Jalapeño Jumble with Black Beans and Smoked Paprika
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Black Beans, Chickpeas, Organic Sweetcorn, Jalapeño Chilli, Coriander, Smoked Paprika, Lime, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: The subject of this lesson is ‘The Scoville Scale’. In 1912, Wilbur Scoville created this scale to measure the heat in different chillies. The scale measures the amount of ‘capsaicin’ in the chilli, (the bit that makes it spicy). At the top of the scale, you’ve got the Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Chilli (!) at 2,000,000 Scoville Units, whilst the jalapeño (star of this recipe) is only 3,500 Units. However, if you’re sensitive to heat we still recommend you go easy on the spice!

Full Name: Sticky Cranberry Pork with Mustard Mash and Broccoli
Ingredients: Potato, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Pork Medallion, Flour, Red Onion, Dried Cranberries, Honey, Chicken Stock Pot, Broccoli
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: “And we won’t leave until we get some…” although traditionally this song celebrates figgy pudding, we’d like to think it fits extremely well to our intensely flavourful, sticky cranberry pork with mustard mash. When the scent of this aromatic dish wafts your way, you will have one option only – keep cooking and don’t leave your kitchen until you’ve got some on the end of your fork!

Full Name: Meatballs with Roasted Root Vegetables
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Potato, Parsnip, Onion, Garlic Clove, Beef Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Mixed Beans, Kale
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: Meatballs are a speciality in so many different countries across the world, from Germany to Egypt and so many people have that special recipe from their grandpa or mum, which is the BEST. Well, it seems we have some stiff competition, but don’t worry, we take our dinner time responsibilities very seriously; you won’t be disappointed with these beefy meatballs.

Full Name: Vegetable Loaded Gnocchi with Chorizo, Red Pesto and Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Parmesan Cheese, Pine Nuts, Chorizo, Gnocchi, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Red Pesto
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Since she arrived at The Fresh Farm from The Netherlands, our menu planning guru Renee has made a huge difference to our lives… and yours! Not only does she keep head chef Patrick organised, but she reads through every piece of the feedback you send us, in the weekly questionnaire, to make your meals better. And our gnocchi cooking technique is hers too… thanks Renee!

Full Name: Pete’s Suggestive Coconut Red Curry with Toasted Cashews
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Coriander, Cashew Nuts, Chicken Breast, Red Curry Paste, Peanut Butter, Coconut Milk, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: One of HelloFresh’s most dedicated recipe testers is Pete. He happens to the the brother of our awesome sous chef Rachel. Pete isn’t without his own culinary aspirations though, so when he suggested we knock up one of his signature dishes, we were keen to see if he had the cooking gene too. Turns out he does!

Full Name: Smoky Team-Effort Meatballs with Creamy Mash
Ingredients: Red Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, English Mustard, Dried Oregano, Cumin, Potato, Carrot, Red Chilli, Yellow Pepper, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot
Description: Wisdom is everywhere, if you know where to look. Just the other day, Patrick was wandering down to the Fresh Farm, when he saw a big billboard exclaiming ‘Dreams don’t work, unless you do’. He took it as a sign to whip up these meatballs. They take a little bit of work but he wanted you to try something a little different and the end result is an absolute corker. We recommend enlisting the help of your dinner guest(s) to make the meatballs!

Full Name: Wild Mushroom and Chicken Tagliatelle with Fresh Parsley
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Wild Mushrooms, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chicken Thighs, Tagliatelle, Flour, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Patrick was off on another research trip to Italy recently and felt inspired to combine these autumnal Italian flavours. He started off in Capri then ate his way slowly up to Florence, Parma and then Venice. However, his culinary heart is in the north, where the food is comforting, nutritious and full of deep flavours. This one is especially perfect for a chilly night after a long day. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Caribbean Spicy Sausages with Roasted Veggies and Mashed Potato
Ingredients: Green Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Courgette, Jerk Sauce, Mango Chutney 40g, Spicy Sausage, Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: This spicy dish is sure to get your taste buds talking. Caribbean food is renowned for being full of flavour and spice so get yourself prepared! The peppers and onion will caramelise so everything will be slightly sticky, which just adds to the flavour. We’ve also asked our butchers at Roaming Roosters to add a bit of chilli to the sausages to give them a bit of a kick!

Full Name: The King’s Massaman Curry with Toasted Cashews and Sweet Potato
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Cornflour, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: In days of old, the ancient Thai King Rama II loved Massaman curry. So much so, that when composing a poem about a young lady who tickled his fancy he wrote “any man who has tasted (your) Massaman pines for you”. Such romance! All we can say is that it’s no wonder Thailand is known as the ‘land of the smile’ if this dish is available at every street corner! If you’ve got a spoonful of peanut butter in the cupboard then add it in as your secret ingredient!

Full Name: Honey Mustard Gammon Steaks with Parsley Sauce
Ingredients: Carrot, Courgette, Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley, Honey, Gammon Steak, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, English Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There are quite a few versions of how curing meat to make ham and gammon came about. Some say it was the Chinese and others say it was the Gauls. Either way, we’re mighty happy that they did, because gammon is so good. The saltiness of a gammon steak is absolutely divine when you add a bit of honey. So, get that honey and gammon and get cooking!

Full Name: One Pot Vegetarian Chilli with Quinoa
Ingredients: Quinoa, Garlic Clove, Onion, Green Pepper, Carrot, Coriander, Red Kidney Beans, Cumin, Spicy Cinnamon, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Lime, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Sieve, Knife, Saucepan, Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Veggie
Description: Presenting to you another versatile HelloFresh ‘one-pot wonder’! This delicious dish has a bit of a twist - quinoa (yes, cooked in the same pot as the chilli)! It still contains all of the beloved flavours you know and love but with some new earthy cinnamon tones, add to this some hearty kidney beans and you have one very satisfying and nutritious meal. Go for it!

Full Name: Winter Warming Mushroom Rosti Pie with Hearty Greens
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Oyster mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Red Onion, Carrot, Turnip, Parsnip, Potato, Vegetable Stock Pot, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Flat Leaf Parsley, Crème Fraîche, Cavolo Nero
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mushrooms are widely used in vegetarian cuisine for several reasons. Firstly, they are seriously D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S. Secondly, they impart an umami flavour - that infamous fifth taste. They are also ridiculously good for you, especially the Asian varieties which are otherwise known as medicinal mushrooms. There’s also a stonking eight portions of vegetables in this powerhouse of a mushroom pie.  Just in case you needed another reason to tuck in…

Full Name: Shirley’s Lamb Koftas with Tzatziki
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Sweetheart Cabbage, Lamb Mince, Spice Mix: Fennel Seeds, Chilli Powder & Cinnamon, Brown Basmati Rice, Spice Mix: Curry Powder & Turmeric, Tomato Passata, Cucumber, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: Every week you send us lots and lots of feedback on recipes and every week we all sit down to talk about how we can use it to make your dinners even tastier. A while ago, one of you decided to send your own kofta recipe, claiming that it would beat Patrick’s hands down. Not one to shy away from a challenge he got cooking and even he had to admit it was pretty darn delicious. Shirley this one’s for you.

Full Name: Fried Chicken with Dukkah Sweet Potatoes & Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Super Dukkah Mix, Chicken Breast, Lime, Sugar Snap Peas, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Sparks may have flown when Harry met Sally, but they don’t even come close to the love affair the residents of the Fresh Farm currently have with Dukkah*! This little wonder-mixture appeared on our radar a few weeks ago, when we chatted to the awesome folks down at The Dukkah Company. Just like us, they started off from their own home and their mixtures of spices, seeds, nuts and general deliciousness are putting them on the map all over the country.
*It’s pronounced ‘Doo-kah’ - as in ‘Super Doo-kah!’

Full Name: Protein-Packed Chorizo, Quinoa and Almond Jumble
Ingredients: Quinoa, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Red Onion, Almonds, Organic Lentils, Chorizo, Coriander, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: Rumour has it that Superman’s powers don’t actually come from the Planet Krypton. They’re from this dinner. Quinoa is a complete protein (which means it contains all essential nine amino acids we need to be at our best), whilst almonds and feta give you another protein hit, together with a dose of magnesium, vitamin B and vitamin E. Who needs supplements when you’re eating this well?!

Full Name: Cheeky Chicken Chow Mein with Oyster Sauce and Water Chestnuts
Ingredients: Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Carrot, Spring Onion, Water Chestnuts, Chicken Thighs, Ginger, Soy Sauce, Tomato Passata, Noodles, Oyster Style Sauce, Beansprouts
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan
Tags: Family Box, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Chicken Chow Mein is a classic dish that has been adopted around the world. Chow Mein simply means ‘fried noodles’ and the dish can be interpreted according to your taste. The trick with this dish is to reserve half a cup of the salted water in which you cooked the noodles and broccoli. Right at the end you’ll add it into the pan to loosen up your noodles and create a delicious sauce. Yum!

Full Name: Roasted Salmon with Garlicky Tomatoes and Crushed Potatoes
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Beans, New Potatoes, Salmon fillet
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Did you know that oily fish is absolutely perfect for boosting your brain and memory power? Luckily for you, salmon is an oily fish! After you’ve cooked this roasted salmon with our sweet tomatoes and crushed potatoes, your brain will be very happy with you. Enjoy your dinner!

Full Name: Spanish Chicken with Spinach, Brown Rice and Sugar Snap Peas
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Ground Cumin & Mild Paprika, Chicken Thighs, Sugar Snap Peas, Honey, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What makes Spanish Chicken, Spanish? What an exceedingly good question! Well, it’s the paprika! Paprika is famously called Pimentón de la Vera because it’s traditionally grown in Spain’s beautiful Andalusian region of Vera. Just add some lemon, cumin and a few other ingredients and Bob’s your uncle! You’ll feel like you’re sunning yourself in Spain!

Full Name: Italian Polpetti Soup with Conchiglioni and Fresh Marjoram
Ingredients: Marjoram, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Carrot, Parmesan Cheese, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Mince, Chili Flakes, Conchiglioni, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: As far back as 1897, Pellegrino Artusi, author of La Scienza in Cucina e L’Arte di Mangiar Bene, (The Science of Cooking and the Art of Eating Well), included three recipes for ‘polpetti’. In Tuscany they were a favourite of housewives who frugally made them using scraps of meat and bread to feed their hungry families. We are of course referring to the (not so humble) meatball. Here we’ve jazzed up the recipe with Parmesan and a kick of chilli to tickle your taste buds.

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Sweet Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Bulgur wheat isn’t the most frequent guest at the dinner table, so we’ve invited it to join the party for this recipe! High in fibre and protein and low on the glycemic index, it’s a great source of nutrition and, more importantly, it tastes great. Bulgur wheat is eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia where people have been enjoying it for thousands of years. We’ve teamed it up with a fantastic sweet and sour pork for a recipe which is as delicious as it is easy.

Full Name: Sweet Potato & Aubergine Malaysian Laksa Curry with Brown Rice
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Aubergine, Sweet Potato, Brown Basmati Rice, Malay Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Split Lentils, Lime, Coriander, Kale and Rainbow Chard Mix
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Veggie
Description: At the Fresh Farm our chefs love a good adventure. This aubergine laksa is an absolute flavour rollercoaster with the sweetness of coconut milk matched with the tang of lime and coriander. Fancy a ride? Get cooking!

Full Name: Silver Lining Carrot & Spiced Lentil Soup with Herb Focaccia
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Potato, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Chili Flakes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Herb Focaccia
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Tags: Healthy, Lactose Free, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Veggie
Description: They say that every cloud has a silver lining and though summer still seems a long way off, it does mean you can slurp big bowls of hearty, nutrition-packed, homemade soup! This is one of Patrick’s absolute favourites since it’s super quick to make but beats the pants off any of the store bought alternatives. We’ve added a kick of chilli to raise your temperature that little bit more and fight off any winter colds. Enjoy!

Full Name: Turkey Milanese with Pesto Greens Beans and Creamy Potatoes
Ingredients: Parmesan Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Garlic Salt, Dried Basil, Dried Oregano, Potato, Turkey Steak, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans, Basil Pesto
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Did you know that in Milan, unlike the more southern parts of Italy, tomatoes are rarely used! When we heard this our worlds were turned upside down somewhat. So, here’s our Turkey Milanese. It’s creamy and it’s herby – so it’s perfect for those winter evenings. Dig in!

Full Name: Smoked Fish en Croute with Citrus Broccoli
Ingredients: Flat Leaf Parsley, Smoked Fish Mix, Crème Fraîche, Flour, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Lemon, Garlic Clove, Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Spring Greens
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Mothers and fathers across the land have been telling their kids: “Don’t play with your FOOD!”. And rightly so. But you know us, we’re a little bit cheeky sometimes! Victoria’s grandma used to make a similar dish. When grandma wasn’t looking, she would make a little island out of the food and the broccoli would ALWAYS be the trees. Always. So, enjoy your Fish en Croute and don’t forget to make the broccoli into trees, when mum’s not watching!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coco-Nutty Rice & January King Cabbage
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, January King Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Cashew Nuts, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Spoon, Bowl
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master.

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Balsamic Vinegar, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot, Plate
Description: For tonight’s dinner, we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your ’taters come from!

Full Name: Sausages with Parmesan Swede Wedges, Tenderstem & Red Onion Relish
Ingredients: Swede, Parmesan Cheese, Rosemary, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Tenderstem Broccoli, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage and mash is an absolute classic. But you know how we treat classics at HelloFresh, right? We like to give them a bit of a twist and sprinkle some healthy magic dust on top. So, here’s our sausage with parmesan swede wedges. What a treat! And don’t forget your red onion relish. It’s more bangin’ than bangers and mash, trust us!

Full Name: The Governor’s Kung Bao with Brown Rice and Cashews
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Ginger, Spring Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Cashew Nuts
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description:
Legend has it that in the late nineteenth century, the governor of Sichuan province, Ding Baozhen, was missing quite a few of his teeth. One day he ducked out of his palace to eat in a local restaurant, where the chef served him a dish of beautifully chopped up, quickly stir-fried ingredients. The governor was so impressed with the dish (not least because it was easy for him to eat), that he hired the chef full time and christened the recipe with his official name, Kung Bao. Though some people doubt the story, we’re convinced it’s the tooth*.
*Sorry, we couldn’t resist that one!

Full Name: Sloppy Joes with Crunchy Salad
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Green Chilli, Baby Gem Lettuce, Carrot, Spring Onion, Beef Mince, Sloppy Joe Spice Mix, Flour, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Kidney Beans, Lime, Coriander, Pita Bread
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Plate
Description: According to the history books, the Sloppy Joe was created by a chef called Joe (what a shock!) in America in the 1920s. Originally the Sloppy Joe was a mixture of beef mince and spices encased in a hamburger bun, but our version is slightly healthier and uses pita instead. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Chicken
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Chicken Breast, Mexican Spice, Lime, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Cutting board, Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Spring seems quite far away, so Patrick decided to create something zingy to kick-start proceedings. Our wonderful greengrocer has sourced these sweet tasting red and yellow tomatoes, which we’ve combined with nutritious roasted sweet potatoes and the tanginess of lime to transport you all the way to the Mexican Riviera!

Full Name: Ultimate HelloFresh Chilli Con Carne (The Sequel!)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Coriander, Red Chilli, Beef Mince, Smoked Paprika, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Sour Cream, Lime
