Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Not so very long ago Patrick decided to get all experimental with this classic Mexican favourite. He added chocolate (a big flavour in South American savoury cooking) and star anise. It divided opinion, so we felt it justified giving it another try. This time sous chef Rachel stepped up to the plate and created something a little more traditional. Patrick had to (begrudgingly) admit that it was one of the best he’d ever tasted. Arriba!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed Smokey Chorizo Baking Tray Pizza
Ingredients: Yeast, Flour, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Pizza is one of those things that everyone loves but not many people make at home. Well that is a thing of the past! Victoria has created this foolproof pizza recipe where you even make your own dough! The key to this recipe is all in the kneading which in our opinion kneading can be very therapuetic... Enjoy!

Full Name: Tabbouleh with Grilled Halloumi and Pomegranate
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Mint, Red Onion, Halloumi, Rocket, Cashew Nuts, Pumpkin Seeds, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: May we present: the pomegranate. A symbol of birth and eternal life, as well as brimming with anti-oxidants and vitamins. A fruit of Persian origin, the pomegranate has a sweet, zingy flavour that perfectly accompanies our twist on a Middle Eastern tabbouleh. Ancient wisdom would have us believe, that it was actually this cheeky little fruit that tempted Eve in the Garden of Eden and once you’ve tasted this recipe, you might just see why...

Full Name: South Indian Chana Masala with Brown Rice and Raita
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Chilli, South Indian Spice Mix, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Chickpeas, Cucumber, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Pot, Sieve, Tea Towel, Knife, Spoon, Saucepan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Chana Masala is a dish which is eaten in most parts of India from Delhi in the North to Chennai and Cochin in the South. Chana means chickpea and masala just means spice mix, so as you can imagine in every part of India, the Chana Masala has its very own personality and quirks. When Mimi was travelling through India, this was her favourite of them all. It’s very fragrant and 100% delicious.

Full Name: Grilled Artichoke, Chestnut Mushroom and Zesty Thyme Risotto
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Thyme, Lemon, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Grilled Artichoke, Flat Leaf Parsley, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Ladle, Bowl
Description: A steamy dish of rich mushrooms, succulent artichokes and citrusy thyme risotto is exactly what the doctor ordered. There are rumours flying around that risotto is difficult to get right. Well, Victoria’s made it super easy for you to become the risotto master you’ve always dreamed of. No time to delay – get cooking!

Full Name: Patrick’s Tandoori Take-Down with Brown Rice
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Breast, Cornflour, Red Onion, Jalfrezi Spice, Chopped Tomatoes, Lemon, Coriander, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Tea Towel, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Why should tandoori restaurants have the monopoly on melt-in-your-mouth tender chicken?! We sent our Curry Research Unit on a mission to discover the secrets behind your tandoori favourites and they came back with a bellyful of inspiration. One of the magic ingredients is a little bit of cornflour. In ‘the trade’ they call this magical ingredient a tenderiser, but the science is really quite simple: by coating the chicken you seal in more of the moisture for a totally succulent result.

Full Name: Honey Mustard Sausages, Sweet Potato Mash & Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Honey Mustard Sausages, Savoy Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Sweet Potato, Potato, Red Onion, Beef Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: Our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ (less scary than he sounds), is a bit of a master when it comes to sausage making. We went up to his farm in Lancashire recently and came away with a whole box of sausages to road test back at the kitchen. What’s your favourite sausage flavour? Tell us on Facebook and we’ll put the best flavour on our menu!

Full Name: Mushroom and Spinach Cannelloni with Roasted Tenderstem Broccoli
Ingredients: Lasagne Sheets, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Baby Spinach, Chopped Tomatoes, Ricotta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: The word cannelloni literally means “a big pipe”. Cannelloni is a traditional Sunday lunch or special occasion dish in Italy. It can be filled with anything, from salmon to cured meats. We’ve filled our cannelloni with deliciously creamy ricotta, chestnut mushrooms and spinach. Who says you can’t celebrate a special occasion on a school night?!

Full Name: Spiced Buttery Sea Bass with Curried Potatoes, Tomatoes and Leeks
Ingredients: Potato, Curry Powder, Leek, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Netherend Butter Salted, Tandoori Masala Spice, Sea Bass Fillets
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Flavoured butters are something which many people buy from the supermarket for extortionate amounts but really all you need is regular butter, some herbs or spices and some elbow grease! Here we’ve flavoured our butter with some delicious spices to go with yummy sea bass. Our chef Mimi loves butter more than anything, so her fridge is packed with various flavoured butters! Our tip is to get the butter out of the fridge an hour or 2 before cooking so it softens.

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Capers, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Caponata. Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats. Buon Appetito!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coco-Nutty Rice & January King Cabbage
Ingredients: January King Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master.

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Creamy Leek and Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Red Chilli, Thyme, Sage, Chicken Breast, Organic Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Clingfilm, Saucepan, Plate, Sieve
Description: When asked what his favourite food is, Patrick, our Head Chef, will say “French” with very little hesitation. French food is to Patrick, what lentils are to the French. Known as the poor man’s caviar, the humble green lentil is an exalted ingredient in French cooking with a texture superior to that of any other lentil variety. It has a delicious nutty flavour with a moreish smooth interior and nutritional credentials to knock your socks off. It’s also a cousin to the the British pea. Enjoy!

Full Name: Winter Warming Pork, Sage and Apple Casserole
Ingredients: Onion, Leek, Celery Stick, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Sage, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Cider Vinegar, Potato, Pork Medallion, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Pot, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There are few British flavour combinations as celebrated as apple and pork. Whether it’s in the form of a tasty little Cumberland sausage or some chunky apple sauce on some roast pork, we love it. But how about a new twist? Our pork, sage and apple casserole brings tangy apple and sumptuous pork together in an eye-opening, taste bud tingling way! Enjoy.

Full Name: Greek Chicken with Feta and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Lemon, Dried Oregano, Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Olives, Smoky Cinnamon, Butterbeans, Chopped Tomatoes, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: The butter bean is so often forgotten; feeling as lonely as a cloud. But no more shall this brilliant bean be cast aside. It’s its turn to shine and believe us, in this chicken stew it’s definitely stealing the limelight. With parsley and oregano as its trusty companions… it’ll never be lonely again!

Full Name: Speedy Vietnamese Roaming Roosters Steak and Lemongrass Stir Fry
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemongrass, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Just like a rooster, these steaks are super quick! Known for being super tender, these flank steaks are served with steamy basmati rice and chilli with white wine vinegar, to give it that authentic hot and sour flavour combination. To make sure you are getting at least some of your five-a-day, we have added some fresh green beans, spring onions and red pepper!

Full Name: Cheesy Tomato, Chorizo and Mozzarella Orzo Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella and succulent cherry tomatoes from our friends at the Tomato Stall… what more could you want? Our orzo is made by Delverde who use mineral water from the mountains in their pasta, which in our opinion creates something really quite special.

Full Name: Aphrodisiac Spiced Tilapia with a Pomegranate and Mint Pilaf
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Curry Powder, Vegetable Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Garam Masala, Tilapia Fillet, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: Since we like to keep things pretty PG13 around these parts, we won’t get into the specifics of why pomegranate is considered to be an aphrodisiac. Suffice to say that once you’ve popped a few of these passion pills in your pilaff, things could take a seriously fun turn on the 14th. Turn up that Marvin Gaye album and let’s get it on.

Full Name: Asian Chicken Skewers with Egg Noodles and Carrot Ribbons
Ingredients: Wooden Skewers, Red Pepper, Chicken Thighs, Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Muscovado Sugar, Chilli Ketchup, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Spring Onion, Egg Noodle Nest, Carrot, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Strainer, Peeler, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Happy Chinese New Year everyone! We had to make this dish to honour the occasion. Chinese New Year is all about sweeping away the bad luck of the year before and making way for a whole lot of new luck. So, as the Cantonese would say “Gong Hey Fat Choy” – we’re wishing you lots of luck (and delicious food)!

Full Name: Trisha’s Apple and Pork Tortillas with Winter Slaw
Ingredients: Apple, Garlic Clove, Mexican Spice, Pork Medallion, Red Cabbage, Coriander, White Wine Vinegar, Wholemeal Tortilla, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Plate, Frying Pan
Description: Our Trisha (aka Head Storyteller) has a great column on our blog called ‘That’s Weird!’. It’s all about flavour combinations that you would never think to put together, but which bizarrely taste absolutely incredible. We wouldn’t say apple and pork tortillas are the wildest combo she’s covered, but we’re pretty sure your taste buds will do a little jig once you try them! Check out the blog at blog.hellofresh.co.uk!

Full Name: Herby Pork Stuffed Chicken Breast with an Easy Pan Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Broccoli
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If you’re wondering about that lonely sausage in your box this week it’s destined for this awesome recipe! We asked our butcher Nick to put together some delicious sausages, to create a really easy stuffing for tonight’s chicken. With a quick pan sauce, this recipe is easy to make and bound to impress!

Full Name: Our Valentine’s Wildly Passionate Mushroom Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Whilst researching all things aphrodisiac in the run up to Valentine’s week, our Mimi discovered that most ingredients have at least some reason for making us feel frisky. Since this is a family show we won’t go into the ins and outs of the mushroom’s sexy reputation, suffice to say that tonight’s dinner, combined with a bit of Marvin Gaye could hit all the right notes. Let’s get it on.

Full Name: Greek Feta Stuffed Peppers with Bulgur and Avocado Salad
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Feta Cheese, Dried Oregano, Panko Breadcrumbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Spring Onion, Rocket
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Spoon, Plate
Description: These home roasted peppers are stuffed with tangy feta, served with bulgur and a super-nutritious avocado salad. Celebrating the wonderful cuisine of Greece, this meal features flavours typical to the Mediterranean - oregano, chilli, garlic and lemon. This easy to prepare bulgur is accompanied by a zingy avocado salad which is full of healthy fats. Tasty hot, warm and cold – even makes a great packed lunch the next day!

Full Name: Body-Boosting Hoisin Stir Fry with Rice,Yellow Pepper and Sugar Snap Peas
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Coriander, Celery Stick, Yellow Pepper, Ginger, Aubergine, Cornflour, Sugar Snap Peas, Lime, Hoisin Sauce, Salted Peanuts
Utensils: Pot, Sieve, Tea Towel, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Happy Chinese New Year everyone! We had to make this dish to honour the occasion. Chinese New Year is all about sweeping away the bad luck of the year before and making way for a whole lot of new luck. So, as the Cantonese would say “Gong Hey Fat Choy” – we’re wishing you lots of luck (and delicious food)!

Full Name: Chicken, Leek and Tarragon Stew with Mashed Potatoes
Ingredients: Maris Piper Potatoes, Onion, Garlic Clove, Leek, Carrot, Tarragon, Flour, Chicken Thighs, Chicken Stock Pot, Cider Vinegar
Utensils: Peeler, Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Potato Masher, Strainer, Bowl
Description: There is something so comforting about this recipe. Sometimes the most simple ingredients come together to create something absolutely wonderful, which is what happened here when chef Rachel decided to make this dish. She hit the comfort food nail on the head with this light, vibrant broth and a nice helping of smooth warming mash. We hope you enjoy it as much as all of us!

Full Name: Valentine’s Turkey Saltimbocca with Chestnut Mushrooms and Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Flour, Turkey Steak, Serrano Ham, Chestnut Mushrooms, Sage, Netherend Butter Salted, White Wine Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Tagliatelle, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Whilst researching all things aphrodisiac in the run up to Valentine’s week, our Victoria discovered that most ingredients have at least some reason for making us feel frisky. Since this is a family show we won’t go into the ins and outs of the mushroom’s sexy reputation, suffice to say that tonight’s dinner, combined with a bit of Elton John could have you really feeling the love tonight.

Full Name: Apricot Ginger Salmon with Asian Style Yellow Rice
Ingredients: Onion, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Coriander, Cinnamon & Turmeric Spice Mix, Panang Curry Paste, Basmati Rice, Raisins, Vegetable Stock Pot, Apricot and Ginger Chutney, Salmon fillet, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Happy Chinese New Year everyone! We had to make this dish to honour the occasion. Chinese New Year is all about sweeping away the bad luck of the year before and making way for a whole lot of new luck. So, as the Cantonese would say “Gong Hey Fat Choy” – we’re wishing you lots of luck (and delicious food)!

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Bowl, Strainer, Baking Tray, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces...arriba!

Full Name: Freddy’s Roasted Duck with Spiced Lentils and Caramelised Apples
Ingredients: Duck Breast, Red Chilli, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Echalion Shallot, Spring Greens, Organic Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Pan with Lid, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: When we first started HelloFresh, we used to get all sorts of emails from people saying that they were ‘scared’ of fish. Whether Steven Spielberg related, or something to do with it welding to their frying pan, we soon knocked their phobia into touch with a few easy recipes. Next on our scary-food-hitlist is duck - far more simple than you might believe! Our tip here is to leave the duck out of the fridge for 30 mins before you cook it, so it cooks evenly.

Full Name: Chorizo Crusted Chicken with New Potatoes and Green Beans
Ingredients: Chorizo, Panko Breadcrumbs, New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Pot, Rolling Pin, Baking Tray, Strainer, Plate
Description: This delicious dinner takes texture to a whole new level. Not only are you getting a double hit of protein but the crunch of the topping adds a whole extra dimension to the dish. The trick is to chop the chorizo nice and fine at the start. We recommend placing your fingers on the top of your knife towards the tip and using this as a pivot while you chop up and down. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Herbed Pork Orecchiette with Purple Sprouting, Chilli & Pesto
Ingredients: Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Orecchiette pasta, Pine Nuts, Pork and Oregano Sausage, Chilli Flakes, Basil Pesto
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: If you were spending a weekend in Rome then you might come across this dish under its traditional name, ‘Orecchiette ai Broccoletti’. It’s a classic Italian dish combining a few simple, yet incredibly high quality ingredients for a quick, nutritious, delicious dinner. A plateful of nutritious deliciousness in the time it takes to boil your pasta!

Full Name: Quick Cheat Lamb Moussaka
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Lamb Mince, Ground Cinnamon, Chopped Tomatoes, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese, Rocket, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Grater, Oven dish, Bowl
Description: Moussaka is one of our chef Mimi’s favourite dishes… if there’s one winter warmer that wins in her book it’s this one. Normally moussaka takes hours to make, but with a bit of HelloFresh magic you’ll be whipping this up in no time at all!

Full Name: Tonterita Quesadillas with Homemade Pistachio Refried Beans
Ingredients: Red Onion, Pistachios, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cherry Tomatoes, Cheddar Cheese, Mixed Beans, Habanero Sauce, Tomato Puree 30g, Cumin, Wholemeal Tortilla, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Sieve, Pan with Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Patrick has been taking a walk around the ‘trendier’ parts of this nation’s capital this week in search of the next big thing and he has made two discoveries: if you want to look cool, wear skinny jeans*, if you want to eat cool, go Mexican. All over the place trendy little Mexican eateries are popping up with an array of zesty, quick bites to sate the greatest of appetites. This little number was inspired by famous tequila bar ‘Tonteria’ on Sloane Square where quesadillas are delivered to your table on a tiny steam train!
*Sadly a brief foray into a vintage store revealed that Patrick may be 10 years too old for this trend. And his thighs don’t really fit.

Full Name: Rustic Butter Bean Cassoulet with Herb Dumplings
Ingredients: Red Split Lentils, Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Pearl Barley, Rosemary, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Butterbeans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Self Raising Flour, Vegetarian Suet
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Sieve, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: There’s a time and a place for fine dining. Tablecloths ironed to within an inch of their life and place settings for 17 courses, are all well and good, but you can’t beat a bit of rustic cooking. French food is known the world over for its lofty pretensions, but it’s the rural side of their cooking that we love the most. This dish is inspired by the cassoulets of the South of France. Hearty, wholesome and perfect for a chilly night.

Full Name: Pasta ‘al Forno’ with Roasted Aubergine and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Garlic Clove, Cheddar Cheese, Black Olives, Chopped Tomatoes, Dried Oregano, Penne Pasta, Basil 20g, Mozzarella, Balsamic Vinegar, Rocket, Pine Nuts
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Oven dish, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description: There are few things as warmth-inducing as a big, Italian woodfired oven, or the dishes that they produce. ‘Al forno’ describes dishes which have been oven baked and for this hearty recipe, we’ve combined the creaminess of our incredible mozzarella with the delicious saltiness of black olives. The trick here is to pack your pasta nice and tightly into the oven dish and cook it long enough for the mozzarella to melt and hold the pasta together.

Full Name: Sausages with a Broccoli and Potato Gratin served with Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Thyme, Carrot, Red Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Pancetta, Double Cream, Dijon Mustard, Panko Breadcrumbs, Sausage, Honey, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Strainer, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Oven dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Potato dauphinoise is possibly the most luxurious and delicious invention on the planet (according to our chef Mimi). But this gratin is the slightly healthier version. Potatoes and broccoli combined with pancetta and cream, go hand in hand with some delicious sausages from our friends at Roaming Roosters, and with a side of honey glazed carrots, you can’t go wrong!

Full Name: Roasted Cherry Tomato Spaghetti with Rocket & Citrus Chicken
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Balsamic Vinegar, Pine Nuts, Chicken Thighs, Lemon, Spaghetti, Rocket, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Pot, Strainer
Description: The world record for the largest bowl of pasta is an enormous 7,900 kg and was achieved in Poland in 2015. It took forty chefs a whopping nineteen hours to cook and prepare the pasta. Incredible!

Full Name: Stir Fried Chinese Chilli Beef with Smithfield Steak
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Ginger, Egg Noodle Nest, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Strainer, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Plate
Description: Well, you could knock us down with a feather! When Patrick whipped up this little number, we were instantly transported to a bustling backstreet eatery in Hong Kong. It blew our socks off! The trick with this dish is to slice your steak into ribbons as thinly as you can. Next, you need to cook it in a super hot frying pan in batches. By leaving space between each ribbon in the pan, they’ll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Pan Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Crème Fraîche, Dijon Mustard, Tarragon
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Strainer, Plate
Description: Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in a while we see a sharp spike in the scores and until recently we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: Tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Paprika Pork with Crushed New Potatoes and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Bay Leaf, New Potatoes, Red Pepper, Pork Medallion, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: A combination of Spanish delights. A very simple Spanish butter bean stew using fresh, seasonal tomatoes, rich in flavour and colour. A great little dish on its own! It’s difficult to go into a tapas bar and not find this on the menu. And, of course, a traditional combination of paprika and pork that will send wonderful, zingy notes to your taste buds. It will be as if your holiday to Spain came early this year!

Full Name: Moroccan Steak with Quick Lemon Couscous
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Ras-el-Hanout, Vegetable Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Spring Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Couscous, Coriander, Baby Spinach, Lemon
Utensils: Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Knife, Grater, Plate
Description: Close your eyes, open up your Ras el Hanout and inhale deeply. You are no longer standing in your kitchen. Around you are the sounds of a bustling market. Men sell ornate carpets and a camel nibbles affectionately at your ear. OK, we’re pretty sure Paul McKenna’s job is safe for now, but get cooking this recipe and take dinner time on a magic carpet ride to Casablanca! Our tip is to take your meat out of the fridge at least 30 mins before dinner.

Full Name: It’s About Time Chicken Tikka Masala
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Green Beans, Ginger, Cornflour, Tandoori Paste, Chopped Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Spoon, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: It’s about time indeed! Since we started HelloFresh four quick years ago, Patrick has been slaving over a hot stove to create more than 800 new recipes, but this classic seems to have slipped through the net! As ever we’re revamping the classic to be healthier AND tastier. Here’s to the next 800 recipes - hurrah!

Full Name: Homemade Carrot, Pancetta & Lentil Soup with Herb Focaccia
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Potato, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Chilli Flakes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Pancetta, Herb Focaccia
Description: The weather is warming up but we thought there should be one last hurrah for this homemade bowl of love! In Italy when you come to the bottom of your bowl it’s common to “fare la scarpetta” which (randomly) means “do the shoe”. It’s the action of wiping your plate, though fortunately we’ve provided you with some fresh focaccia rather than an old shoe!

Full Name: Baked Tofu with Peanut Satay Sauce and Steamed Bok Choy
Ingredients: Tofu, Baby Bok Choy, Brown Basmati Rice, Peanut Butter, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Cashew Nuts
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: We feel a bit sorry for tofu. Countless incidents of under-seasoning and bad cooking have meant that this Asian favourite has earned a pretty bad ‘rep’. Everyone deserves a second chance though, and for this recipe, we’ve baked the tofu for extra, chewy deliciousness and teamed it up with a rich peanut satay sauce to wake up your taste buds. Check out step 6 overleaf before you start and learn how to make your own DIY steamer for the bok choy.

Full Name: Sumac Halloumi with Quinoa and Cherry Tomato Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Quinoa, Sumac, Lemon, Halloumi, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Cucumber, Spring Onion
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: The star of this evening’s dish is a little known middle eastern delicacy called sumac. Made from the ground berries of the sumac plant it has a great citrusy, tangy flavour that perfectly balances against the creaminess of our halloumi. For this recipe, we combined the halloumi with couscous and fresh herbs to give you a palate-cleansing taste, whilst making sure you’re still lip smackingly satisfied. Go for it!

Full Name: Greek Ragu with Almond, Aubergine and Basil Couscous
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Couscous, Aubergine, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Green Olives, Ground Almond, Basil 20g, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The ancient Greeks are famed for their spectacular mythology, their gods and goddesses and their epic storytelling. But we think their ragu is one of their lesser known treasures. The gentle, warm tang of our tomatoes blends like a charm with ground almonds and aubergines. And when you add the herby basil couscous into the mix...well - take our word for it, the whole family will love it!

Full Name: Puff Pastry Pizza with a Crunchy Mixed Leaf Salad
Ingredients: Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Vine Tomatoes, Serrano Ham, Mozzarella, Premium Baby Leaf Mix, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing, Basil 20g
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Pizza is the ultimate comfort food and puff pastry is also up there on the deliciousness scale. WELL ... here we’ve combined these two luxuries to bring you (drum roll, please) the puff pastry pizza! Serrano ham, our juicy Tomato Stall tomatoes and some creamy mozzarella combine on a sheet of puff pastry… delicious and fun to make too!

Full Name: Hearty Roasted Chicken with Dijon Mushroom Sauce
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Thyme, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chicken Stock Pot, Dijon Mustard, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife, Plate
Description: A trip down memory lane this evening in one of our head chef’s favourite childhood recipes. Nutritious, chewy brown rice is the perfect bed for this flavour-packed sauce. Our big tip here is to make sure you take the stock off the boil and let it cool for a minute, before you add the crème fraîche to make sure you don’t split your sauce.

Full Name: Beef Roly Polys, Mexican Style
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, Beef Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Smoked Paprika, Flour Tortillas, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Pot, Bowl, Strainer, Plate
Description: Get your sombreros out, wrap yourself in a stripy blanket and get ready for a Mexican-style meal. Flour tortillas stuffed with tasty mince and smothered in a cheesy sauce… making your mouth water? Get the kids to help with prep, whether it’s grating cheese or rolling up tortillas, they will be sure to enjoy their roly polys if they’ve had a hand in making them. Don’t forget the cold beers and a slice of lime!

Full Name: HelloFresh Turkey Katsu Curry
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Curry Powder, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Honey, Soy Sauce, Basmati Rice, Turkey Steak, Crème Fraîche, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Pot, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: As you can imagine, down at the Fresh Farm, lunch is a pretty big deal. We all sit around our long table and discuss our lunch decisions; the hands-down HelloFresh favourite lunch is undeniably the Katsu Curry (Elliot once managed to eat two and a half in one sitting!). In light of this HelloFresh obsession, Mimi decided to recreate a version for our lovely customers. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with Zesty Lime Mash and Chilli Broccoli
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Chilli Flakes, Lime, Honey, Ground Coriander, Tilapia Fillet
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Strainer, Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Spatula, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Our chef Victoria is obsessed with vegetables and knows a ridiculous amount about them, from their nutritional value to interesting ways to cook them. Cooking broccoli ‘Victoria’s way’ has transformed the way we cook this humble veggie, to create something really quite special. Who would’ve thought simply slicing the florets and roasting them with chilli and garlic would be so revolutionary!

Full Name: ‘Ksar Char-Bargh’ Moroccan Beef Burgers with Red Onion Marmalade
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Rose Harissa Paste, Wholemeal Pita, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What’s this ‘Ksar Char-Bargh’, we hear you say?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bargh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Harissa Chicken with Pomegranate Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Lemon, Bulgur Wheat, Chicken Thighs, Rose Harissa Paste, Red Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vine Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The pomegranate, has been celebrated as a symbol of ambition and prosperity since Ancient Egyptian times. In fact, it seems that pretty much every ancient culture all over the world has drawn, praised and written about it throughout the ages. For tonight’s dinner you’ll be taking the bold step of cooking with it and we’re sure you’ll be making your own little piece of dinner time history.

Full Name: Rustic Leek and Goat’s Cheese Tart with Roasted Walnuts
Ingredients: Leek, Onion, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Walnuts, Rosemary, Goat's Cheese, Green Beans
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Strainer, Plate
Description: Luke always looks forward to Patrick’s tarts. Quite aside from being pretty tasty, it means he has the chance to call our beloved Moira from the Dorset Pastry Company. Moira makes arguably the best organic pastry in the country (maybe the world) and rumour has it a lot of top restaurants actually pretend it’s their own. We’re certain you wouldn’t do the same, but we recommend hiding the wrapping in your neighbour’s dustbin to make sure you don’t get busted!

Full Name: Thai Sweet Potato and Baby Corn Panang Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Broccoli, Fresh Thai Basil, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy, Veggie
Description: Though Panang is a mild curry, nutritionally it packs one hell of a punch! Sweet potatoes are full of beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as Holy basil!

Full Name: Ultimate HelloFresh Chilli Con Carne (The Sequel!)
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Coriander, Red Chilli, Beef Mince, Smoked Paprika, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Sour Cream, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate, Bowl, Grater
Description: Not so very long ago Patrick decided to get all experimental with this classic Mexican favourite. He added chocolate (a big flavour in South American savoury cooking) and star anise. It divided opinion, so we felt it justified another try. This time sous chef Rachel stepped up to the plate and created something a little more traditional. Patrick had to (begrudgingly) admit that it was one of the best he’d ever tasted. Arriba!

Full Name: Cheesy Courgette Chicken Gratin with Roasted New Potatoes
Ingredients: Courgette, Boursin, New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Baby Spinach, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Knife, Tea Towel, Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: Life’s most precious commodity is time, and tonight we want to make sure you’ve got more of it to do stuff that counts. That’s why tonight’s Quick Dish is big on flavour and nutrition but small on prep time. Get the oven pre-heating pronto, get a helper to grate the courgette and before you know it you’ll be relaxing and reflecting on another homemade dinner well done.

Full Name: HelloFresh Prawn and Serrano Linguine
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Chives, Serrano Ham, Tiger Prawns, Linguine, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: We’ve come a long way since Patrick stuck up his first week of recipes on the Fresh Farm notice board. From those five recipes we’re rapidly approaching our 1000th recipe and we’ve even created a HelloFresh Wall of Fame! At the top of the pops is this crazy good linguine. So good in fact that Patrick taught people all over the UK how to cook it on a Google Hangout. Check it out at hellofresh.co.uk/hangout

Full Name: Sausages with Parmesan Swede Wedges Tenderstem & Red Onion Relish
Ingredients: Swede, Parmesan Cheese, Rosemary, Pork and Oregano Sausage, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Tenderstem Broccoli, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Fork, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage and mash is an absolute classic. But you know how we treat classics at HelloFresh, right? We like to give them a bit of a twist and sprinkle some healthy magic dust on top. So, here’s our sausage with parmesan swede wedges. What a treat! And don’t forget your red onion relish. It’s more bangin’ than bangers and mash, trust us!

Full Name: Chermoula Spiced Lamb with Baba Ganoush and Minted Courgette Salad
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Carrot, Lamb Mince, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chermoula Spice, Cheddar Cheese, Courgette, Mint, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Spoon, Grater, Bowl, Peeler, Plate
Description: Not so long ago Head Chef Patrick headed off to Morocco for a bit of recipe reconnaissance. Winding through the back streets of a local market with the scent of wood shavings, spices and charcoal grills in the air, he discovered a hole-in-the-wall eatery that specialised in chermoula spiced lamb. See the adventure that inspired this recipe atblog.hellofresh.co.uk/our-stories/morocco/

Full Name: White Sesame Teriyaki Beef with Chinese Leaf
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Chinese Leaf, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: The pearly white seeds you see here don’t come straight out of the fruit that way. They must be hulled from their darker shells first. We’re told that the famous phrase ‘Open Sesame’ from Ali Baba and the Forty Thievesis a reference to ripe sesame seeds popping out of their shells. Dinner and useful trivia…#winning.

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Knife, Large Pot, Frying Pan, Pot, Strainer, Plate
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunchtime on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this dish we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing recipe that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: Italian Sausage Stew with Cheesy Polenta
Ingredients: Porcini Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Onion, Sausage, Rosemary, Chopped Tomatoes, Baby Spinach, Parmesan Cheese, Gouda Cheese, Polenta, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Strainer, Grater, Pot
Description: Polenta was once considered ‘food of the peasants’. It’s so popular nowadays that there has even been an Italian folk song written about it: ‘La Bella Polenta’! We recommend you put on some folk music and have a little dance around the kitchen to get you in the mood for this Italian feast!

Full Name: Power Pasta of the Gods
Ingredients: Spaghetti, Pine Nuts, Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Flat Leaf Parsley, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Knife, Grater, Bowl, Strainer
Description: An impressive title for an equally impressive recipe! Legend has it that before battle Hercules would stride into his kitchen and whip up a plate of this pasta to fuel his heroics. Since it was practically ready in the time it takes to cook the pasta, it meant he never missed the start of battle and firmly secured his place in the history books. Admittedly it’s difficult to imagine the son of Zeus in a pinny, but you wouldn’t catch us making fun of him.

Full Name: Soul-Warming Indian Spiced Lentil Soup with Garlic Naan
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Sweet Potato, Courgette, Curry Powder, Red Split Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chickpeas, Coriander, Garlic Naan, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Peeler, Strainer, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: If you’re anything like our Head Chef Patrick, then you’ll appreciate that feeling you have when you find a dish you love. And then eat it 5 out of 7 nights a week. That’s what happened when he whipped up this little number recently. Creature of habit that he is, he made 3 litres and ate it with renewed delight every day thereafter. Once you taste its soul-warming deliciousness you’ll see why.

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean and Buckwheat Bake with Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Jalapeño Chilli, Cumin, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Ground Cinnamon, Organic Black Beans, Crème Fraîche, Cheddar Cheese, Chives, Buckwheat
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Oven dish, Bowl
Description: *Drum rolllllll* Making a rare appearance, the star of tonight’s dish is ultra nutritious, super tasty buckwheat! Buckwheat is actually a seed related to rhubarb and quite apart from its delicious, nutty flavour it is absolutely chock full of nutrition. Slow-burning to keep your energy levels constant, it also contains magnesium which can help lower blood pressure and aid delivery of nutrients around the body. If you like to spice things up then use all of the jalapeños!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Salmon with Lemon and Onion Couscous
Ingredients: Ras-el-Hanout, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Grater
Description: Ever wonder who that chirpy person is who replies to your tweets and Facebook messages? It’s none other than Nia! Nia joined the Fresh Farm a while ago and wins over the hearts of the team, by getting all sorts of tasty samples delivered to us every week, for our tasting sessions. Our Seasoned Pioneers’ ras-el-hanout is Nia’s favourite sample, which is what inspired this week’s delicious salmon. Nia is also one of the judges for our weekly Recipe Photo of the Week competition, so it pays to be on her good side!

Full Name: Black Bean Salad with Barbecue Chicken
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, BBQ Sauce, New Potatoes, Coriander, Spring Onion, Red Pepper, Organic Black Beans, Organic Sweetcorn, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Knife, Strainer, Bowl, Grater, Plate
Description: It may not be that warm outside just yet, but that doesn’t stop us from dreaming of summer BBQs. This recipe is just the ticket for digging up memories of past BBQs. But why should a BBQ only be eaten in the summer? Tuck into this delicious dinner and you’ll realise it doesn’t!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable-Packed Smoky Chorizo Baking Tray Pizza
Ingredients: Yeast, Flour, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Italian Herbs
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: Pizza is one of those things that everyone loves but not many people make at home. Well that is a thing of the past! Victoria has created this foolproof pizza recipe where you even make your own dough! The key to this recipe is all in the kneading, which in our opinion can be very therapeutic... Enjoy!

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Potato Masher, Strainer, Baking Tray, Grater, Bowl, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up most of the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces. Keep a few whole ones back for texture too... arriba!

Full Name: Creamy Paprika Chicken AKA Paprikás Csirke
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Courgette, Chicken Thighs, Basmati Rice, Flour, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Chicken Stock Pot, Butterbeans, Sour Cream, Soy Sauce, Honey
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer
Description: We get a lot of helpful feedback from all our lovely customers and one thing we’ve noticed recently is a lot of requests for hungarian dishes! Your wish is our command… We present to you the HelloFresh version of ‘Paprikás Csirke’ - the classic hungarian dish made with delicious sweet paprika. Keep the suggestions coming!

Full Name: Pan Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Crème Fraîche, Dijon Mustard, Tarragon
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Pot, Strainer, Plate
Description: Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in a while we see a sharp spike in the scores and until recently we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Spanish Butternut Squash Stew with Chorizo and Lentils
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Chorizo, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Chicken Stock Pot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Organic Lentils
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Strainer, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, One Pot Wonder
Description: Our menu planner Renee is the glue that holds us all together. There is literally nothing she is unable to turn her hand to! From mending coffee machines to cooking up a storm in the kitchen. When she brought this stew into the office for everyone to try, it was quite clear it just HAD to make an appearance in a HelloFresh box...so here we are! Enjoy!

Full Name: Cajun Halloumi Burgers with Chunky Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Sweet Potato, Cajun Spice, Halloumi, Sour Cream, Brioche Bun, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Pan, Plate
Description: For this recipe the secret’s in the sauce. The garlic sauce to be precise. Rather than simply chopping the garlic into little bits (which doesn’t spread the flavour evenly), you’ll be using the flat of your knife to make a paste instead. It’s a bit cheffy, but when you taste the end result you’ll never go back!

Full Name: Hearty Vegetable Shepherd’s Pie
Ingredients: Carrot, Onion, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Rosemary, Potato, Tomato Puree 30g, Organic Cannellini Beans, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Broccoli, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Strainer, Grater, Oven dish, Plate
Description: When you think about it, ‘Shepherd’s Pie’ is a bit of a misnomer. Shepherds don’t spend all day looking after their flock, only to go home and tuck into a plate of Shepherd’s Pie at all. If that were the case, they wouldn’t have much wool to take to market at the end of the month. We spoke to a couple of shepherds to get their take on the situation and it turns out a lot of them are eating something far more sheep friendly... Veggie Shepherd’s Pie!

Full Name: Spanish Chicken with Spinach, Brown Rice and Sugar Snap Peas
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Ground Cumin, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Chicken Thighs, Sugar Snap Peas, Honey, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: What makes Spanish Chicken, Spanish? What an exceedingly good question! Well, it’s the paprika! Paprika is famously called Pimentón de la Vera because it’s traditionally grown in Spain’s beautiful Andalusian region of Vera. Just add some lemon, cumin and a few other ingredients and Bob’s your uncle! You’ll feel like you’re sunning yourself in Spain!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes and a Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Mortar, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result: 1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it 2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in and 3) Make sure you rest the steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it. Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Sausage en Croute with Homemade Red Onion Marmalade and a Tomato and Watercress Salad
Ingredients: Onion, Red Onion, Pork and Oregano Sausage, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Balsamic Vinegar, Cherry Tomatoes, Cucumber, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Mix, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Sausages come in all flavours now, with added tasty ingredients; which makes this filling more interesting than using a bland sausage meat. All plates of food should be colourful, hence the addition of various bright salad veggies to add interest and freshness. Lots of jobs for younger members of the family to assist with as well!

Full Name: Super Quick Creamy Pasta with Peas and Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Fusilli, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: After a long day at work, there’s always the temptation to eat something super simple, so you can maximize your time on the couch in your fluffy slippers with a blanket and a cuppa. Well, your wish is our command! Our peas and bacon pasta is unbelievably tasty and quick in equal measure. Its oh-so creamy sauce brings it all together! So, get those slippers ready, it’s going to be an awesome night in!

Full Name: Salmon on a Bed of Walnut-Herby Mushrooms with Celeriac Fries
Ingredients: Celeriac, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Thyme, Lemon, Walnuts, Chestnut Mushrooms, Salmon fillet
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: When you first opened your box, you may have thought a little alien had wandered in or a very old gnome. To the contrary! Meet Clive the Celeriac - don’t be fooled by his rough exterior. He is absolutely beautiful on the inside, which is why he’s our British veggie of the month. And this dish is nothing if not a love song to Clive. Those herby mushrooms and that tender salmon are the perfect match for nutty, creamy celeriac fries. Find out more about Clive the Celeriac in your box!

Full Name: Honey Mustard Sausages with Sweet Potato Mash & Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Honey Mustard Sausages, Pointed Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Sweet Potato, Potato, Red Onion, Beef Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: Our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ (less scary than he sounds), is a bit of a master when it comes to sausage making. We went up to his farm in Lancashire recently and came away with a whole box of sausages to road test back at the kitchen. What’s your favourite sausage flavour? Tell us on Facebook and we’ll put the best flavour on our menu!

Full Name: Penne all’Arrabbiata with Smoked Pancetta and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Pancetta, Chopped Tomatoes, Chilli Powder, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Food is described with an infinite number of adjectives but ‘angry’ is not one that immediately springs to mind. That’s unless we’re talking in Italian. This little dish is ‘Arrabbiata’ because of its chilli kick, but we’ll leave it to you to decide how much of a temper you want it to have. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time it takes to boil your pasta, there’s really nothing angry about it. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Minted Lamb and Feta Burgers with a Crunchy Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Radish, Spring Onion, Mint, Lamb Mince, Feta Cheese, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: For Da Vinci, it was Mona Lisa. For Banksy, Kate Moss. Down the centuries great artists have been moved to great feats of creativity by a beautiful muse. For Head Chef Patrick, that mythical muse is the burger. A thing of such delicious, dribble-down-your-chin simplicity, it can be re-invented time and time again to create the most divine dinner time results. For this little incarnation, he’s taken lamb mince and thrown in a Greek twist with a kick of minty freshness.

Full Name: Nourishing Cauliflower and Lentil Dal with Greek Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cauliflower, Coriander, Green Beans, Curry Powder, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl
Description: Every week we sit down and go through all your recipe scores and comments and they make a huge difference in the way Head Chef Patrick plans your future dinners. The humble dal is a great example. Of all the Indian recipes we’ve created, this one stands out from the crowd both for taste and pure, body-nourishing warmth.

Full Name: Record Breaking Vegetarian Paella
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Lemon, Chestnut Mushrooms, Vegetable Stock Pot, Rosemary, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Vegan, Veggie
Description: Few dishes could be as synonymous with a country, as paella is to Spain. The dish has evolved over hundreds of years, but it’s the good people of Valencia who lay claim to its current incarnation. In fact, one Valencian named Juan Galbis was so keen to immortalise the dish that he cooked one (with the help of a few friends) for 110,000 people back in 2001. We’re tackling a slightly more humble audience tonight, but every Guinness World Record has to start somewhere.

Full Name: Pan Fried Tilapia with (Your Favourite) Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: As you know we send out a questionnaire every week to see how you enjoyed your recipes. Renee (our menu planning guru) sits down with Patrick every Tuesday to give him the low-down and from there we plan the weeks to come. Recently, we noticed a huge spike in popularity for fresh tarragon, hence the inspiration for tonight’s delicious dinner!

Full Name: Curly Sausage, Celeriac Mash and Sticky Onion Gravy with Purple Sprouting Broccoli
Ingredients: Red Onion, Celeriac, Red Potato, Thyme, Netherend Butter Salted, Cumberland Sausage, Bamboo Skewers, Flour, Beef Stock Pot, Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Milk, Nutmeg
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: Sausage and mash with sticky onion gravy is a classic dish and we've all got our favourite takes on it. Our lovely Victoria & Andre worked on this recipe for you guys, because celeriac is our British veggie of the month and we're celebrating our little knobbly buddy! Not only does celeriac make a mash so flavourful and rich, that you'll want to sing "yodelayheee" from the roof top, it's also packed with fibre, vitamins B, C and K. So, what are you waiting for?

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Sweet Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Plate, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Bulgur wheat isn’t the most frequent guest at the dinner table, so we’ve invited it to join the party for this recipe! High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, it’s a great source of nutrition and, more importantly, it tastes great. Bulgur wheat is eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia where people have been enjoying it for thousands of years. We’ve teamed it up with a fantastic sweet and sour, pork for a recipe which is as delicious as it is easy.

Full Name: Celeriac and Leek Wellington with a Sautéed Chard and Red Onion Medley
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Celeriac, Flat Leaf Parsley, Thyme, Roasted and Ground Cumin Mix, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Spring Greens, Red Onion
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Hurrah for our British veggie of the month: it's Clive the Celeriac! If you're not well acquainted with celeriac, it's your lucky day! It's such a rich and delicious alternative to potatoes with its peppery, nutty tones. Our puff pastry wrapped around spring greens, celeriac, leek and onion makes the perfect Wellington... and if you add a bit of cumin from our wonderful suppliers, The Seasoned Pioneers - Kabooooom! (That's the sound of your mouth exploding with flavour!)

Full Name: A Slightly Surreal Singapore Chicken Laksa
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Peanut Butter, Lime, Chicken Thighs, Egg Noodle Nest, Coriander
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Sometimes life throws bizarre situations at us. Patrick experienced this in Singapore airport recently when he was sitting in the food hall and suddenly saw himself on the television. Turns out his Italian cooking show had made it over to the Far East and it wasn’t long before the staff in the restaurant were piling his plate high with all sorts of local deliciousness*. One of the 6 main courses (!) was a mouthwatering Singapore Laksa - practically a national dish. This one’s for the team at Singapore airport! *In hindsight, probably not the wisest decision before enduring a 12 hour flight back to London.

Full Name: Herby Dukkah and Lemon Crusted Pork with Crushed Potatoes and a Green Salad
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Lemon, Potato, Pork Medallion, Super Dukkah Mix, Mixed Salad
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Fork, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description: According to our lovely Dukkah suppliers: ‘The Dukkah Company’, Dukkah can add a bit of magic to any dish and we have to agree! The delicious blend of almonds, hazelnuts, sesame and spices will make your taste buds very happy, you’re onto a winner for dinner!

Full Name: Treat Day Cheesy Tomato, Chorizo and Mozzarella Orzo Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Grater, Bowl
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella and succulent cherry tomatoes from our friends at the Tomato Stall… what more could you want? Our orzo is made by Delverde who use mineral water from the mountains in their pasta, which in our opinion creates something really quite special.

Full Name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Beef
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemongrass, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Just like a rooster, these steaks are super quick! Known for being super tender, these flank steaks are served with steamy basmati rice. We’ve added some chilli and white wine vinegar, to give it that authentic hot and sour flavour combination. To make sure you are getting at least some of your five-a-day, we have added some fresh green beans, spring onions and red pepper!

Full Name: Tah-antilising Butternut Tahini Salad
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Chilli Flakes, Thyme, Cucumber, Tahini Paste, Lemon, Sunflower Seeds, Feta Cheese, Dried Cranberries, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Without tahini there would be no hummus (shock horror!). But tahini has lots of other uses, it is often mixed with honey and spread on toast for a delicious breakfast! But here we are mixing it with lemon juice and a glug of olive oil to make a deliciously creamy dressing. Combined with deliciously sweet butternut squash and a whole host of mouth-watering ingredients, this really is a winning recipe.

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice, Roasted Aubergine and Mushrooms
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Vegan
Description: In the world of curry, as in the world of cowboys, there are the good, the bad and the ugly. Amongst the bad ones are those that sit there innocuously on your plate, not saying boo to a goose, but loaded with enough chilli to take down a rhino.As for the ugly, you need only go to the local take-away. For this Thai Massaman rice we combined the creaminess of peanut butter (our secret ingredient!) and organic coconut milk with the fresh tanginess of coriander and lime. It’s so good it should be made a saint!

Full Name: Smokey Lamb and Sweet Potato Hotpot
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Lamb Mince, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Sweet Potato, Courgette
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: Meet Andre - the creator of this wondrous recipe! He’s just joined Patrick, Victoria & Mimi to make up our chef dream team. Intriguingly, a long, long time ago, before Andre was a chef, he was the man people would call to claim their lottery winnings!!! We’re pretty sure you’ll feel like you’ve won the lottery, when you dig into his smokey lamb and sweet potato hotpot. It’s a personal dish - his kids love this dish and he adores it because it’s colourful and full of the joys of spring.

Full Name: Korean Beef Bulgogi with Ginger Stir Fried Broccoli
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Sesame Oil, Beef Mince, Basmati Rice, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Chinese food has been a regular part of the UK diet since we first started eating ‘After Eight’ mints (admit it, you ate them too!). Korean food on the other hand isn’t so well known. We’re absolutely in love with their flavours and aside from Kimchi (super trendy right now!), Bulgogi is practically a national dish. We’ve simplified it to within an inch of its life, so you can whip it up in minutes at home.

Full Name: Chicken Shawarma Kebabs with Jewelled Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Bamboo Skewers, Shawarma Spice Mix, Red Onion, Bulgur Wheat, Red Pepper, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Coriander, Lemon, Pomegranate Seeds, Natural Yoghurt, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Grater, Plate
Description: Do you know the Edgeware Road in London? It runs North-West through our capital city from Marble Arch to Edgware on the outskirts of London. Since the 19th century, Edgware Road has been famed for its delicious Middle Eastern food, from kebabs to the very chicken shawarma that inspired this HelloFresh recipe.

Full Name: Roasted Pork Belly with Honey Mustard Glaze and Mash and Beans
Ingredients: Pork Belly, Potato, Milk, Honey, Spiced Honey Mustard, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Green Beans
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: The last time we sent out pork belly from our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ the feedback was so positive that we couldn’t resist trying it again. Nick has specially trimmed the meat, so that you’ll have none of the faff but all of the flavour. Pork belly deserves to be slow cooked, so we’ve given different techniques, depending on how long you can wait!

Full Name: Smokey Cod and Roasted New Potatoes with a Chorizo Dressing and Caramelised Courgettes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Red Onion, Cod Fillet, Lemon, Smoked Paprika, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chorizo
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Peeler, Plate
Description: Have you ever been awoken by the smell of pimiento dulce infused cod while taking a siesta on the Spanish coast? Me neither! But it sounds delightful and our chef André had that very experience when he was on holiday last year. Let his smokey cod with roasted new potatoes, chorizo dressing and caramelised courgettes whisk you away to the shores of Spain this dinner time!

Full Name: Surprisingly Filling Mexican Broth with Spicy Beef and Beans
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Green Pepper, Mixed Beans, Potato, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Coriander, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This recipe calls for only one or two tortillas which means you will have quite a few leftover! We hate waste so are always thinking of ways to use leftover ingredients. One suggestion is to make oven baked tortilla chips (healthier than deep fried but still delicious!). You can brush them with oil and then make them savoury with a sprinkling of salt and some paprika, or sweet with cinnamon and sugar. A few minutes in a hot oven and voila!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Tomato Puree 30g, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky, so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Mustardy Gammon Steaks with Roasties and Lentils
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Onion, Leek, Organic Lentils, Gammon Steak, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description: It seems a strange concept that gammon could win an award. Images of an X-Factor style panel of judges glaring at a nervous steak spring to mind. But these gammon steaks from our fantastic butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ went all the way to the judges house (their kitchen to be precise) recently. We’ve teamed them up with a spoonful of our favourite wholegrain mustard, for a duet that’s bound to go to number 1!

Full Name: Garlicky Mushrooms with Provencal Stew
Ingredients: Portobello Mushroom, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Panko Breadcrumbs, Red Onion, Courgette, Basil 20g, Organic Cannellini Beans, Tomato Passata, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Sieve, Saucepan, Plate
Description: This dish is an eensy bit magical because our chef André’s mum taught him how to make it when he was young. In fact her mum had taught her and it’s gone on that way for generations! So, tonight he wanted to invite you to share and enjoy a little bit of his family history, as well some very tasty garlicky provencal bean stew.

Full Name: Homemade Caramelised Red Onion, Goat’s Cheese and Rocket Flatbread Pizza
Ingredients: Red Onion, Honey, Yeast, Flour, Goat's Cheese, Oregano, Tomato Puree 30g, Rocket
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: The city of Paris is associated with an array of different things, from love and romance to Victor Hugo’s ‘The Hunchback of Notre Dame’. But for our Victoria, a trip many years ago to France’s capital, led to her associating the banks of the Seine with goat’s cheese and caramelised onion tarts. Not a bad association if you ask us! She took those flavours and ran with it - in the form of this ever so tasty flatbread pizza.

Full Name: Pad Thai with Tamarind and Roasted Peanuts
Ingredients: Green Beans, Coriander, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Dry Roasted Peanuts, Ginger, Noodles, Tamarind Sauce, Soy Sauce, Beansprouts, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Rolling Pin, Spoon, Bowl, Sieve, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: It took our chef Patrick a while to get around to this little classic because we wanted to get it just right. One of the key flavours is tamarind. Originally from Africa, tamarind has that sweet and sour flavour we most commonly associate with this dish. Sprinkle on some crushed, dry roasted peanuts for added texture and you may as well be strolling through the street markets on the Khao San Road. If you like it hot then add the whole chilli, otherwise just add as much as you dare!

Full Name: Swingball Meatballs with Smoked Tomato Linguine
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Bay Leaf, Linguine, Dried Thyme, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description:
When we were kids a skipping rope and a hula hoop constituted a pretty good evening’s entertainment*. As the years went by a swingball set appeared in the garden and then it wasn’t long before our humble Frisbee became a long range Aerobie. Whatever your summertime pleasure, we put this little number together with speed and ease in mind, so you’ve got more time for the fun stuff.
*OK, maybe we’re not that old. Though Head Chef Patrick might be. Shhhhhhhh.

Full Name: Umami Burger with Rustic Chips and Rocket Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Garlic Salt, Beef Mince, Ketchup, Brioche Bun, Smoked Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl, Plate
Description: In 2012, Black Bear Casino Resort in the USA, set the world record for the biggest burger. It weighed 913 kg and was 3 metres wide! Pretty impressive! This burger, while not being quite that big, is pretty impressive in the taste department. We’re sure this hamburger will blow your socks off!

Full Name: Gremolata Crusted Tilapia with Roasted Mediterranean Veg
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Pepper, Courgette, New Potatoes, Tilapia Fillet, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Fork, Pot, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: As you’ll have gathered by now, we’re not too much into fussy culinary terminology. Drizzles of this and towers of that and julienne and brunoise...who makes this stuff up anyway? That said, this week we are using a ‘gremolata’ but it’s not as complicated as it might sound. An easy to create mixture of fresh parsley, garlic and lemon zest, gremolata is really popular in Italian cooking and this evening we’ve added some breadcrumbs to give it a bit of crunch. Buonissimo!

Full Name: Milly’s Herby Chicken with Couscous and Oven Ratatouille
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Provencale Herbs, Chicken Breast, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: Have you heard of Milly? She used to be our supply chain intern and she was an AMAZING cook. She’d always wanted to do a really authentic French recipe. Every now and then she’d give Mimi lots of ideas on French cooking and recipes. That’s how Milly’s herby chicken was born - and we’re not being biased when we say that it’s délicieux! She’s going to be so happy to have a recipe in your box - she might cry with joy when it goes out. Enjoy this one from our dear Milly!

Full Name: Seared Black Pepper Steak Salad with Chimichurri Dressing
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Oregano, Chilli Flakes, Red Wine Vinegar, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Pot, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Luke has a new hero in his life. The poster on his wall of Taylor Swift has been taken down and replaced with a picture of none other than Nick ‘The Knife’ Mellin. He’s one of the guys behind the familyrun butchers, Roaming Roosters, who support local native British breeds, care about animals and work in collaborations with other local farmers. Located in Lancashire, the gorgeous free-range meat from their farm is what’s hitting your plate. Check out how great these guys are at www.roamingroosters.co.uk.

Full Name: Tiger Prawn and Chorizo Spaghetti with Fresh Vine Tomatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tiger Prawns, Vine Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Favourite date-night restaurants - we’ve all got them. In the more heady days of his youth, Head Chef Patrick was particularly fond of a little Spanish eatery in Borough Market, where the food and the opportunity to try out a bit of foreign lingo always seemed to impress. He ended up going there so often that eventually he became best friends with the head chef and started to work in the kitchen at weekends. His favourite recipes included the beautiful Iberican combination of prawns and chorizo, which he uses here so that you can have date-night at home!

Full Name: Smokey Homemade Hamburgers with Rustic Chips and a Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Smoked Paprika, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Flour, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Cheddar Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In 2012, Black Bear Casino Resort in the USA set the world record for the biggest burger. It weighed 913kg and was 3 metres wide! Pretty impressive! This burger, while not being quite that big, is pretty impressive in the taste department. We’re sure this hamburger will blow your socks off!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Halloumi, Tabbouleh and Mint Raita
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: When Victoria came up with this recipe she was so pleased she wouldn’t stop talking about it. She had made so much, that she ate it every day for a week (and enjoyed every mouthful!).We really hope you enjoy it as much as she did!

Full Name: Warming Lentil, Ricotta and Spinach Moussaka
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Potato, Bay Leaf, Thyme, Baby Spinach, Organic Lentils, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Ricotta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Sieve, Oven dish, Plate
Description: After rigorous taste testing down at the Fresh Farm, we want to introduce you to our spin on a traditional moussaka. Though it’ll take a little longer to make, once it’s in the oven, kick back with a glass of wine and simply relax...

Full Name: A ‘Professional’ Fisherman’s Pie
Ingredients: Fish Stock Pot, Potato, Leek, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, JKM Seafood Mix, Netherend Butter Salted, Flour, Double Cream, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Potato Masher, Oven dish
Description: Got your own flock of sheep? Shepherd’s Pie. Own a thatched house in the countryside? Cottage Pie. It seems that everyone is getting in on the act these days, so it’s only right that the fishermen have their place in the pie-related sun. We concocted this little number in close consultation with our fantastic fishmonger James Knight of Mayfair. Guaranteed to quell even the feistiest of dinner time mutinies.

Full Name: Mushroom and Pancetta Risotto
Ingredients: Leek, Vine Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Arborio Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Pancetta, Garlic Clove, Mangetout, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Frying Pan, Pot, Grater, Mixing Bowl
Description: Rice is a very versatile ingredient, filling and healthy. It is also excellent at taking up any flavours added to it. With lovely mushrooms and crispy pancetta (that’s posh bacon to you, kids) it makes for a popular and tasty dinner, or lunch, for all the family. With superfood watercress and brilliant red tomatoes, it all adds to your important five-a-day.

Full Name: Chicken Yakitori with Crispy Red Onions and Sweet and Sour Noodles
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Skewers, Lime, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Fish Sauce, Flour, Egg Noodle Nest
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Patrick has been working on a theory that the fewer utensils you use to eat a meal, the tastier it’s likely to be. Think about it - everything you eat with only a fork is usually delicious. Dispense with cutlery entirely to use your fingers and suddenly you’re in taste bud paradise.
