That was the thinking behind this Japanese favourite. The first person to finish has to shout “Banzaaaiiii”!

Full Name: Herby Pork Stuffed Chicken Breast with an Easy Pan Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Broccoli
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Rolling Pin, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If you’re wondering about that lonely sausage in your box this week it’s destined for this awesome recipe! We asked our butcher Nick to put together some delicious sausages, to create a really easy stuffing for tonight’s chicken. With a quick pan sauce, this recipe is easy to make and bound to impress!

Full Name: Chillybeany Fajitas with Citrus Soured Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Green Pepper, Coriander, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Habernero Sauce, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Plate
Description: Since Patrick met Thomasina Miers from Wahaca last year, he’s gone Mexico mad! Mexican food has been up and coming for a while now with its combinations of citrus flavours, spices and the complimentary textures of soft beans and crunchy peppers. For this simple recipe you’ll be knocking up your own refried beans, spicing things up with some habanero sauce and topping it off with a cooling dollop of sour cream. It’s so good we might end up coming over for dinner ourselves!

Full Name: Mexican Tortilla Stack with Homemade Guacamole and Black Bean Salsa
Ingredients: Red Onion, Coriander, Organic Black Beans, Yellow Pepper, Chorizo, Chopped Tomatoes, Mexican Spice, Avocado, Lime, Corn Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Frying Pan, Bowl, Fork, Plate
Description: Head Chef Patrick doesn’t like fuss. He’s always telling us that the best kind of food is simple, soulful grub that makes you feel loved. That said, every dinner is a chance to practise your presentation skills. Bigger plates are a great way of framing your food and a sprinkle of herbs or a drizzle of olive oil at the end gives everything a bit more pizazz. For this recipe, we took classic Mexican ingredients and played with the presentation to create something that’s as tasty to the eye as it is on the tongue. Arriba!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken Breast with Sweet Potato Mash and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Chicken Stock Pot, Sour Cream, Black Peppercorns
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Strainer, Mortar, Plate
Description: The term ‘superfood’ is thrown around a lot these days by people who want to sell you the latest health product. Since there isn’t a specific set of criteria needed for someone to call something a superfood, the claims can often be a bit misleading. Except when we’re talking about sweet potatoes. These little nuggets of nutritiousness are stuffed full of vitamin A, vitamin C, antioxidants and anti-inflammatory nutrients. Superfood or not, sweet potatoes are pretty awesome!

Full Name: Wild Mushroom and Pancetta Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Goats Cheese, Walnut and Honey Crostini with a Tangy Poached Rhubarb Salad
Ingredients: Ciabatta, Rhubarb, Walnuts, Goat's Cheese, Dijon Mustard, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: You know us at the Fresh Farm, we’re lovers of good British produce. Cue the rhubarb. It’s so British and it’s in season. Our Victoria is famed for including a fruity element into a dinner salad. She just loves the mix of flavours and we have to say, it works delightfully in her goat’s cheese and walnut salad. Get it while it’s hot!

Full Name: Grilled pork chops, champ potatoes, and glazed rhubarb with a mustard creme fraiche
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Spring Greens, Rhubarb, Spring Onion, Pork Chops, Crème Fraîche, Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: Taking a classic British combo, like pork and apple sauce and making it our own, is something our recipe team love. So, given that it’s rhubarb season, try our grilled pork chops with champ potatoes and rhubarb. Rhubarb has all the tangy sweetness of apple...but it’s so seasonal and fresh right now, that we couldn’t resist. What do you think?

Full Name: Pork Belly and Sausage Cassoulet with a Herb Crumb and Spring Greens
Ingredients: Pork Sausage, Carrot, Onion, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Spring Greens, Pork Belly Rashers, Provencale Herbs, Butterbeans, Chicken Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Peeler, Oven dish, Strainer, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Our Victoria came up with this pork belly and sausage cassoulet when her friends came to visit. You see, they’re French and she met them in the South of France. Luckily for her, she had some spare sausages in her fridge, so rustling up this beauty of a recipe was easy. Apparently, they chatted the night away with memories of summers gone by on the shores of Southern France. Bon Appétit!

Full Name: Aromatic Lamb Koftes with Freekeh and Rhubarb Salsa
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Ground Turmeric, Freekeh, Spring Onion, Coriander, Lamb Mince, Ras-el-Hanout, Rhubarb, Lemon, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Pot, Mixing Bowl, Grater, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Sieve, Plate
Description: It’s ripe, it’s really delicious, it’s rhubarb! Because rhubarb is in season right now, we thought we’d show you how you can use it to bring out the flavours of lamb. André’s aromatic lamb koftas are so rich and meaty, that the sweet and sourness of our rhubarb is the perfect addition for your taste buds.

Full Name: Chermoula and Yoghurt Marinated Chicken with Zesty Courgette Pilaf
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chermoula Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Basmati Rice, Chicken Stock Pot, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Saucepan, Baking Tray, Grater, Plate
Description: When our chef André visited Marrakech, he adored the bustling night markets and the way they come alive when the sun sets. They’re just packed with the freshest most seductively well-spiced food for miles around. That perfect memory of deep, rich, chargrilled chicken is the inspiration for his chermoula and yogurt spiced chicken, with his zesty courgette pilaf.

Full Name: Creamy Mushroom Pappardelle with Rocket and Hard Italian Cheese
Ingredients: Portobello Mushroom, Chestnut Mushrooms, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Pappardelle, Crème Fraîche, Rocket, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer
Description: Oh Spring - how warm you are, and how full of new life. To honour all things new, Andre cooked up this delightfully light pasta dish for you all to enjoy while (hopefully) sunning yourselves in the evening Spring sunshine. How delightful!

Full Name: Herb and Mustard Chicken with Crushed New Potatoes and Garlicky Slaw
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Lemon Thyme, Chicken Thighs, Carrot, Red Cabbage, Garlic Mayonnaise, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Dijon Mustard
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Peeler, Fork, Strainer, Plate
Description: Our chef Andre says: "I love this dish. The warm salsa verde releases its incredibly warm flavours into the chicken". There you have it - straight from the horse's mouth. This dish is zesty, warming and wholesome. So, what are you waiting for? Get cooking!

Full Name: Pan Fried Tilapia with Panzanella
Ingredients: Ciabatta, Red Onion, Vine Tomatoes, Cucumber, Basil 20g, Red Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Flour, Tilapia Fillet
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Panzanella is so popular in Italy, that in the 16th century it even had a poem written about it! We’ve paired it with some delicious tilapia which we’ve coated in flour before cooking, to make it lovely and crispy. Enjoy!

Full Name: Black Bean Chilli with Herbed Pork
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Pork Sausage, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Mixed Beans, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Pot, Sieve, Knife, Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl
Description: Sausage meat in a chilli?! Yes, you read it right! It may be slightly crazy but we assure you the delicious sausage meat from Roaming Roosters is an amazing meaty alternative to beef mince. Enjoy!

Full Name: Nick ‘The Knife’s’ Zesty Orange Beef Stir Fry
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Orange, Ginger, Spring Onion, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Mangetout, Lime, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Spoon, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Strainer, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: Last week Patrick, Luke and Ed headed out to the sticks to visit our esteemed butcher Nick ‘The Knife’. He’s actually a lot less scary than he sounds and he’s been in the butchery business since he was knee-high to a grasshopper. Nick’s big tip for this recipe is to put the steak in the freezer for 30 mins before you slice it and you’ll be able to get paper thin slices really easily!

Full Name: Spiced Cauliflower and Courgettes with Yellow Rice Pistachios and Coriander
Ingredients: Cauliflower, Courgette, Nigella Seeds, Ground Turmeric, Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Mustard Seeds, Basmati Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Lime, Pistachios, Raisins
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Vegan, Veggie
Description: It's hard to describe this dish and it's amazingness. There are just so many amazing ingredients, so André thought - why not just bring them together to make this epic spiced cauliflower and courgettes with yellow rice and pistachios. You've got crunch, spice and tang - what more could you need?

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed HelloFresh Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: We’re really excited to get you making the HelloFresh calzone! Our good friends at The Northern Dough Company have made this beautiful pizza dough in advance, so that all you need to do is roll it out, top it with tastiness, fold it in half and bake it in your (pizza) oven. Make sure to cook this meal first this week so you get the dough at its absolute freshest!

Full Name: Pan Fried Tilapia with Warm Potato Salad and Garlicky Spring Greens
Ingredients: Potato, Chives, Spring Greens, Crème Fraîche, Wholegrain Mustard, Garlic Clove, Flour, Tilapia Fillet
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Fork, Strainer, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There's a man called Rhyan and that man loves potatoes more than anything in the world. He once ate 45 roast potatoes in one sitting - and no we just don't know how! Anyway, he's one lucky guy because he's our chef Mimi's flatmate and she always makes extra potato salad just for him at their barbecues. This dish is from Mimi to her pal Rhyan - because it's his favourite versionof potato salad and can be eaten all year round! Enjoy Mimi's pan-fried tilapia and Rhyan's warm potato salad.

Full Name: Tuscan Pork Linguine with Courgettes, Chilli and Lemon
Ingredients: Italian Style Sausage, Courgette, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Linguine, Pecorino Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Sieve, Bowl, Grater
Description: Cinematic landscapes, beautiful wines and some of the best nosh we’ve ever laid our taste buds on. Tuscany pretty much ticks all of our sensory boxes and with that in mind we created this rustic little number. We combined artisan sausage meat with chilli and Pecorino to give you a hit of Italy, in the time it takes to let a bottle of Chianti breathe. With all the time you’ll have left over we’d recommend nipping online to book a weekend getaway! Buon appetito!

Full Name: Hippocrates's Honey and Chilli Chicken with Rice
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Coriander, Cherry Tomatoes, Honey, Chicken Breast, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Spoon, Baking Tray, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Culled by honeybees and produced from the nectar of flowers, there could be no greater aphrodisiac than honey. Hippocrates was harnessing its power thousands of years ago but the science lies in honey’s high levels of vitamin B and amino acids, which boost energy and stamina. We’ve teamed it up with chilli and ginger in this recipe, so don’t be surprised if you feel an urge to light candles and scatter rose petals around your house after eating...

Full Name: Pan Fried Pork Medallions with Tarragon and Potatoes
Ingredients: Tarragon, Chicken Stock Pot, Leek, Pork Medallion, New Potatoes, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Another tough week of taste testing is over and this time we’ve been putting our butchers at Roaming Roosters to the test. They’ve sourced us some succulent pork fillets and we’ve combined them with a divine tarragon sauce, that’ll blow the socks off the people round your dinner table.

Full Name: Pork Satay Burgers with Paprika Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Coriander, Lime, Salted Peanuts, Pork Mince, Soy Sauce, Baby Gem Lettuce, Carrot, Peanut Butter, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Satay is usually done with chicken, but we’ve gone a bit ‘out there’ and created our very own pork satay burger! When you add in the zinginess of lime and the creamy crunch of peanuts - you’ve got yourself a burger that is beyond scrumptious!

Full Name: Korean Beef Bulgogi with Ginger Stir Fried Broccoli
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Beef Mince, Basmati Rice, Sesame Seeds, Boiling Water
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Chinese food has been a regular part of the UK diet since we first started eating ‘After Eight’ mints (admit it, you ate them too!). Korean food on the other hand isn’t so well known. We’re absolutely in love with their flavours and aside from kimchi (super trendy right now!) Bulgogi is practically a national dish. We’ve simplified it to within an inch of its life, so you can whip it up in minutes at home.

Full Name: Chicken Dosa Pancake with Sticky Mango Chutney and Cooling Raita
Ingredients: Coriander, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Curry Powder, Gram Flour, Nigella Seeds, Mango Chutney 40g, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Whisk, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A lot of people associate pancakes with France because of their incredible crepes, or with America because they’ve got their fluffy breakfast pancake down to a fine art! But the pancake is a delight enjoyed by so many people in so many countries. Our Victoria wanted to show you all the deliciousness that is India’s take on the pancake: it’s the dosa! It’s an adventure for your taste buds!

Full Name: Mimi’s Moroccan Mushroom and Raisin Tagine
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chickpeas, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Raisins, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Sieve, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Last Christmas, Mimi was camel riding with her family in Morocco! And we can tell you that the tan she had when she got back made us all pretty jealous. Now, even though Mimi loves a camel ride, the absolute highlight for her was this very tagine, which they ate in the desert under a blanket of twinkling stars and indigo night skies. Now, she couldn’t bring back the desert or the skies, but she sure brought back the recipe just for you guys! Enjoy!

Full Name: Sweetcorn Fritters with Avocado and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Coriander, Lime, Organic Sweetcorn, Gram Flour, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Feta Cheese, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Sieve, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: At the Fresh Farm, we learn new things about food all the time. We hope our recipes do this for you too! Since Victoria arrived at HelloFresh, she’s been pulling new interesting ingredients out of her sleeve at every turn! Have you heard of gram flour? It’s made from ground chickpeas and it’s very popular in India, Pakistan and Bangladesh. It’s a rich, tasty alternative to normal wheat flour and works well with savoury recipes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Rigatoni Caprese with Olives and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Black Olives, Oregano, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Rigatoni Pasta, Basil 20g, Mozzarella
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Since our first heady days packing up recipes in Patrick’s living room, our enthusiastic Head Chef has whipped up well over 500 recipes. The other day we did a bit of research and it turns out there’s a big trend in his recipes towards all things Italian. It’s no wonder though - he spent six months travelling from Sicily to Milan filming a show about their food and discovered the delicious simplicity of their cooking. The mozzarella in tonight’s recipe is one of our star ingredients - sourced from the heart of the Campania region in Italy, you’re going to love it too!

Full Name: Pork and Apple Sauce with Chantenay Carrots and Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Pork Medallion, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Cox's Apple, Honey, Vegetable Stock Pot, Apple and Sage Jelly
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Strainer, Oven dish, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Peeler, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: There’s nothing more comforting than food with a twist of nostalgia and this recipe is one of those classics, that so many of us grew up with. Pork, with a tangy apple sauce is the perfect comfort food. So, gather the family around the dinner table and dig in! Why Chantenay carrots? These stocky looking little fellows are known for being the sweetest of all the carrot family. If you ask us, they’re the perfect complement to our creamy, crunchy roast potatoes.

Full Name: Provençal Pasta Bake with Juicy Chicken and Basil
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Provencale Herbs, Chicken Stock Pot, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Red Pepper, Rigatoni Pasta, Tomato Passata, Basil 20g, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish
Description: We are so lucky that our chefs grew up in families where recipes are passed down the generations. We’re not sure how happy André’s granny would be if she knew he was sharing her provençal French cooking tricks, but as we can’t bare to disappoint you guys ... we’ll let you in on his granny’s delectable provençal pasta bake.

Full Name: Spinach, Mushroom and Bacon Puff with Grilled Tomatoes
Ingredients: Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Vine Tomatoes, Chives, Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Bacon, Baby Spinach, Philadelphia Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A sneaky twist on a flan, so no flan tin required! Hooray! It’s easy to do and your cooking skills will impress your fellow diners. Juicy grilled tomatoes add colour and sauciness. A delicious spring dish...Enjoy!

Full Name: Ginger Beef Stir Fry with Asparagus and Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Asparagus, Flank Steak, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, Oyster Style Sauce, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Today we’re talking about tenderisers. If you’ve ever wondered how those clever chefs down at your local Chinese eatery get their meat to be so juicy and soft, we’re going to let you in on a little trade secret: cornflour. When you coat your meat in this fantastic natural ingredient before cooking, it helps to keep all the juices inside the meat, leaving it succulently soft every time.

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Salmon with Lemon and Onion Couscous
Ingredients: Ras-el-Hanout, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Lemon
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description: Ever wonder who that chirpy person is who replies to your tweets and Facebook messages? It’s none other than Nia! Nia joined the Fresh Farm a while ago and wins over the hearts of the team by getting all sorts of tasty samples delivered to us every week, for our tasting sessions. Our Seasoned Pioneers Ras-el-Hanout is Nia’s favourite sample, which is what inspired this week’s delicious salmon. Nia is also one of the judges for our weekly Recipe Photo of the Week competition, so it pays to be on her good side!

Full Name: Chicken with Rigatoni, Crème Fraîche and Tarragon
Ingredients: Onion, Leek, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Tarragon, Chicken Breast, Chicken Stock Pot, Rigatoni Pasta, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: When André’s kids dig into this dish, there are always very few words but lots of “mmmm!”s. Now, we’re not saying that André’s kids are the be all and end all of tasty food, but - they’re pretty honest recipe testers.

Full Name: Tandoori Spiced Aubergine with Tomato and Coriander Rice and Nigella Yoghurt
Ingredients: Aubergine, Tandoori Masala Spice, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Spring Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Nigella Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Saucepan, Plate
Description: Our chef André isn’t a vegetarian but his veggie friends absolutely love this dish - he makes it whenever they come over - because they demand it! So get cooking his tandoori spiced aubergine!

Full Name: Too Tasty Beetroot and Lentil Salad
Ingredients: Beetroot, New Potatoes, Red Onion, Organic Lentils, Rocket, Balsamic Cream with Figs, Goat's Cheese, Walnuts
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Sieve, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Not only will beetroot keep your eyes busy with its fuchsia tones, this sweet little root veggie is wonderfully versatile. When mixed with goat’s cheese, for that melt-in-your mouth tang, and walnuts, for a smooth but crunchy sensation, you have yourself a tasty, tasty, summer salad. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pork and Fennel Meatballs
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Linguine, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: Nick ‘the Knife’ our butcher has been getting quite the reputation for his sausages up in Lancashire. When Patrick, Ed and Luke made a visit to the Roaming Roosters farm recently, you’d think there was about to be a sausage shortage, as people were queuing right out the door! Fortunately, we’ve got a few connections, so we managed to snag some Tuscan sausages for tonight’s dinner!

Full Name: Moroccan Steak with Quick Lemon Couscous
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Ras-el-Hanout, Vegetable Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Spring Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Couscous, Coriander, Baby Spinach, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description: Close your eyes, open up the Ras-el-Hanout and inhale deeply. You are no longer standing in your kitchen. Around you are the sounds of a bustling market. Robed men sell ornate carpets and a camel nibbles affectionately at your ear. OK, we’re pretty sure Paul McKenna’s job is safe for now, but get cooking this recipe and take dinner time on a magic carpet ride to Casablanca! Our tip for this recipe is to take your meat out of the fridge at least 30 mins before dinner which will allow you to cook it more evenly.

Full Name: Pan Seared Sea Bass with New Potatoes and Cucumber-Dill Relish
Ingredients: Cucumber, Red Onion, New Potatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets, Dill, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Peeler, Strainer, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: The star of this delicious summery dish is the sea bass from the guys over at J.K. Mayfair (who also supply fish to the Queen!). The trick with getting a crispy skin on your fish is to use a medium-hot pan, and while the skin is cooking, try not to move the fish…it’s that easy!

Full Name: Chicken Fried Rice with Mushrooms and Chilli, Peanuts and Soy
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Cinnamon Stick, Chicken Thighs, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Coriander, Salted Peanuts, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: You know us at the Fresh Farm, we’re not in to fancy things, we just love wonderful home cooking. So, André’s kept it simple with his chicken fried rice. It’s simple to make and simply delicious. Enjoy!

Full Name: Grilled Aubergine Spaghetti with Chilli, Chorizo and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Spaghetti, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Some days you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Pan Seared Sea Bass with New Potatoes and Cucumber-Dill Relish
Ingredients: Cucumber, Red Onion, New Potatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets, Dill, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Mixing Bowl, Strainer, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The star of this delicious summery dish is the sea bass from the guys over at J.K. Mayfair (who also supply fish to the Queen!). The trick with getting a crispy skin on your fish is to use a medium-hot pan, and while the skin is cooking, try not to move the fish…it’s that easy!

Full Name: Honey and Mustard Glazed Pork with Apple Lentils
Ingredients: Pork Fillet, Carrot, Celery Stick, Bramley Apple, Sage, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Organic Lentils, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Strainer, Plate
Description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away – at least that’s what they claim! With carrot, celery, lentils and rocket added to the mix, this dish is absolutely loaded with both flavour and nutrition. Now for the decadent part... we have taken the finest pork in the land and glazed it (generously) with the sweetness that only honey can pull off and the warmth of mustard. You are in for a treat!

Full Name: Roast Chicken with Mini Roast Potatoes Honey Glazed Carrots, Pan Fried Broccoli and Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Broccoli, Thyme, Chicken Breast, Honey, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot, Strainer, Plate
Description: Roast chicken has quite a place in a lot of people’s hearts because many of us grew up with it. For Mimi, the creator of this yummy dish, roast chicken is at its best when made by her mum. "My mum used to make roast chicken for every evening meal - it was a great time in my life!" says Mimi. This Mimi roast chicken is the easy version for a delightful mid-week supper!

Full Name: Mushroom Panzanella Salad with Mozzarella and Caramelised Onion
Ingredients: Ciabatta, Red Onion, Balsamic Vinegar, Portobello Mushroom, Vine Tomatoes, Lemon, Mozzarella, Rocket, Basil 20g
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Mimi admits that salad isn’t her favourite thing - but her mushroom panzanella salad with mozzarella and caramelised onion is ‘something else’. For a salad with bells on - get panzanella-ing!

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Halloumi
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Halloumi, Mexican Spice, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Spring is well and truly underway, with summer on the horizon! So Patrick decided to create something colourful and full of sunshine! Our delicious tomatoes from The Tomato Stall are paired with coriander and lime chicken with a hint of Mexican spice. Enjoy!

Full Name: ‘Ksar Char-Bagh’ Moroccan Beefburgers with Red Onion Marmalade
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Ras-el-Hanout, Wholemeal Pita, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What’s this ‘Ksar Char-Bagh’, we hear you say?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Sesame Soy Glazed Pork With Carrots, Bok Choy And Noodles
Ingredients: Oyster Style Sauce, Honey, Pork Fillet, Black Sesame Seeds, Noodles, Bok Choy, Carrot, Peanut Butter, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We get our delicious peanut butter from the lovely people at Pip and Nut. Not only are they passionate about nut butters but they are also lovely people and occasionally even bring breakfast over to the Fresh Farm, which is usually devoured within minutes! We hope you enjoy their peanut butter in our recipe this week!

Full Name: Your Favourite Orange and Honey Chicken Jambalaya
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Orange, Chicken Thighs, Honey, Chorizo, Basmati Rice, Chopped Tomatoes, Habanero Sauce
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Every week our little kitchen brigade are concocting new recipes to tickle your taste buds and whilst they hope every recipe is great, occasionally they strike total gold. Tonight’s recipe was one such discovery. We’ve had so many requests to bring it back, that we thought its reappearance was the only way to prevent civil unrest.

Full Name: Paella de Verduras de Temporada con Frijoles AKA Seasonal Veggie Paella
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Red Pepper, Button Mushrooms, Red Kidney Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Tomato Puree 30g, Peas, Lemon, Black Olives
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, High-Sided Bowl, Plate
Description: The Spanish are considered to be very passionate, especially when it comes to their food! Traditional paellas come in many forms, but most can be easily recreated in your own kitchen. Our newest Fresh Farm Veggie Paella encompasses delicious spices, seasonal vegetables (including our lovely wild mushrooms) and kidney beans to make this a well rounded meal, packed full of plant proteins! Place this beautiful and comforting dish right in the middle of your dinner table because after all, this communal style of eating is the best and most traditional way to enjoy it!

Full Name: Chicken Salad with Asian Slaw Radishes and Curried Croutons
Ingredients: Ciabatta, Curry Powder, Chicken Breast, Soy Sauce, Coriander, Carrot, Red Onion, Radish, Red Pepper, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description: This summer salad is all about fusion. Those mild curry flavours contrasted with a super fresh, zingy salad will make your fork freak out and your tastebuds jump for joy. And you know what else is so great about this recipe? It's seasonal and radishes are our British Veggie of the Month.

Full Name: Bangladeshi Lamb Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Curry Powder, Lamb Mince, Green Beans, Mint, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Biryani is traditionally made with a leg of goat, but here we’ve made it with our delicious lamb mince from butchers Roaming Roosters. It’s a traditional dish from India and is often served at weddings and big occasions… and is also delicious as a mid-week meal! Enjoy!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Redcurrant Jelly
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t even really know how to cook a steak well-done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Spiced Fennel Sausages with Herbed Couscous Chermoula Sauce and Yoghurt
Ingredients: Couscous, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Orange Pepper, Chermoula Spice, Tomato Passata, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Plate
Description: Of all the delicious meats we get from our British butchers - Roaming Roosters - these spiced fennel sausages are by far André’s favourite. Even though we all love a bit of potato with our sausages, we thought as it’s spring, it’s out with the old and in with the new. So, enjoy the sausages with this herby couscous and North African chermoula sauce.

Full Name: Mimi’s Nutty Tom Yum Noodle Broth with Pickled Radishes
Ingredients: Carrot, Radish, Rice Vinegar, Vermicelli Rice Noodles, Spring Onion, Coriander, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Lemongrass, Red Pepper, Star Anise, Panang Curry Paste, Soy Sauce, Salted Peanuts, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Grater, Rolling Pin, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This noodle broth is absolutely packed with different flavours and textures. Noodles, crushed peanuts and you even get to learn about pickling radishes! And you know what else is so great about this recipe? It’s seasonal and radishes are our British Veggie of the Month.

Full Name: Spiced Lentil Burger with Tomato and Coriander Salad
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Coriander, Butterbeans, Red Curry Paste, Organic Lentils, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lime, Natural Yoghurt, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Ginger, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Potato Masher, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description: Every week literally thousands of you wonderful cooks give us feedback on our recipes via the little questionnaire we email to you. And every week our Renee and Ellie read through every single answer (we’ve given them comfortable chairs and as much tea as they like to ease the process). We’ve had a lot of requests from our veggie customers recently for a delicious veggie burger so Andre headed into the kitchen to create this masterpiece! Let us know what you think!

Full Name: Thyme Roasted Chicken and Potatoes with Spinach and Buttered Radishes
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Thyme, New Potatoes, Red Onion, Radish, Garlic Clove, Baby Spinach, Netherend Butter Salted, Lemon Mayonnaise
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Drum roll please for our British Veggie of the Month - it’s the ravishing radish! André says “This is a really cool way of cooking radish which a lot of people don’t think of.”. Fancy transforming radish from a salad veggie to a deliciously warm, buttery side? André... you absolute GENIUS!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Tomato Puree 30g, Cherry Tomatoes, Organic Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Strainer, Baking Tray, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this family recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Hoisin Duck with Fragrant Basmati Rice Cucumber and Coriander
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Cinnamon Stick, Cucumber, Lime, Coriander, Duck Breast, Hoisin Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mmmm, who doesn’t love hoisin duck in a pancake? Well, what about with some rice, fresh cucumber and coriander? It’s André’s twist on a classic dish which is loved by so many of us!

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Stir Fried Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Butternut Squash, Sage and Pancetta Penne Bake
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Rosemary, Onion, Garlic Clove, Sage, Wholewheat Penne, Pancetta, Ricotta Cheese, Baby Spinach, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Oven dish, Strainer, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl
Description: Our chef Victoria has gone all out here with her delicious pasta recipe! Adding the starchy water from the pasta to loosen up the sauce is a pretty nifty trick, it gives the sauce a lovely creamy feel. In this recipe we’ve included some extra ricotta in case you feel it needs it, OR you can use it to whip up a cheesecake at the weekend. If the adults want to sprinkle some chilli flakes on top,feel free… We have popped some in your box.

Full Name: Smoked Cheese Burger with Sweet Potato Wedges and Rocket Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Beef Mince, Garlic Salt, Ketchup, Dried Oregano, Brioche Bun, Smoked Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl, Plate
Description: Oregano is one of the nation’s most loved herbs. But while we sprinkle it into pasta sauces and lasagnes with ease, our burgers are often lacking the stuff. Well, no more! This beef burger is as happy as can be with its new Italian buddy oregano. And don’t forget to add this amazing Stokes ketchup. It’s DELICIOUS!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate, Strainer
Description: For tonight’s dinner, we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your ’taters come from!

Full Name: Fearless Sesame Crusted Salmon with Couscous and Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Red Onion, Coriander, Lime, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Salmon fillet, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Plate
Description: Call us pushy but here at HelloFresh we want to get you cooking with ingredients that aren’t necessarily part of your usual repertoire (trust us!). A lot of people tell us they’re scared of fish, but the only time you should be afraid is when they have big teeth and a Steven Spielberg soundtrack. This salmon recipe is incredibly forgiving and for a delicious Moroccan inspired touch we’ve teamed it up with couscous. Watch out Jaws.

Full Name: Mushroom and Pancetta Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese, Crème Fraîche, Chestnut Mushrooms, Water
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Chickpea and Runner Bean Salad with Feta and Zahtar
Ingredients: Ciabatta, Zahtar Spice, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Runner Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Oregano, Lemon, Red Wine Vinegar, Chickpeas, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Grater, Pot, Strainer, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: We love a bit of fusion! So this Middle Eastern inspired chickpea salad with British runner beans is just a dream for us - good job André! Now, what’s that extra magical sprinkle of flavour? It’s Zahtar! It can be traced all the way back to biblical times - so it must be good if it’s been popular for this long!

Full Name: Warm Freekeh Salad with Chermoula Spiced Carrots Herbs, Sumac and Pistachios
Ingredients: Carrot, Chermoula Spice, Cinnamon Stick, Vegetable Stock Pot, Freekeh, Cucumber, White Wine Vinegar, Flat Leaf Parsley, Coriander, Mint, Pistachios, Garlic Clove, Natural Yoghurt, Sumac, Lemon
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Peeler, Strainer, Spoon, Grater, Saucepan, Plate
Description: The carrot. Often seen as a very everyday veggie, lacking excitement. But we won’t have it! The carrot is an absolute hero with its flamboyant orangeness and vitamin C. So, we’ve brought it back to its natural position - as the hero of this dish. It’s freekeh awesome!

Full Name: Fresh Start Aubergine Korma with Homemade Wholemeal Chapatis
Ingredients: Wholemeal Flour, Aubergine, Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Ground Coriander, Cumin, Ground Turmeric, Chilli Powder, Potato, Vegetable Stock Pot, Baby Spinach, Greek Yoghurt, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Knife, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin, Bowl
Description: Once you’ve had a taste of the good stuff it’s very difficult to go back. Nowhere is this more true than when it comes to bread. This year we want to give you a go at making your own to see just how amazing (and satisfying) it can be. Rather than go in at the deep end though, we’re kicking off with the simplest bread of them all: the humble chapati. Prized in India for its easiness to prepare (and the fact that they’re awesome for mopping up sauce).

Full Name: HelloFresh Turkey Katsu Curry
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Curry Powder, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Honey, Soy Sauce, Basmati Rice, Turkey Steak, Crème Fraîche, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Pot, Rolling Pin, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: As you can imagine, down at the Fresh Farm, lunch is a pretty big deal. We all sit around our long table and discuss our lunch decisions; the hands-down HelloFresh favourite lunch is undeniably the Katsu Curry (Elliot once managed to eat two and a half portions in one sitting!). In light of this HelloFresh obsession, Mimi decided to recreate a version for our lovely customers. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mediterranean Style Gnocchi with Basil Baked Cod
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Red Wine Vinegar, Tomato Passata, Courgette, Cod Fillet, Lemon, Gnocchi
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This dish is the perfect way to pair basil with fish. It’s not the most common of flavour combinations but it’s so tasty we can’t understand why people don’t do it more often. If you lay a couple of basil leaves on the fish fillet and bake it, the leaves get all crispy. BONUS!

Full Name: Refreshing Fresh Pasta with Peas, Pancetta and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Batman and Robin, Bert and Ernie. Some things were born to go better together. There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of foodie fashion and this dish is a testament to one such union. Marrying a time-honoured mixture of fresh peas, mint and pancetta this recipe spins a classic combination into a light, summery ensemble. It’s quick to make and perfect with a glass of something cold and bubbly.

Full Name: Shanghai Style Turkey Stir Fry with Noodles
Ingredients: Turkey Steak, Chinese 5 Spice, Red Pepper, Red Onion, Spring Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Grater, Strainer, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: The wonderful Rick Stein is one of André’s favourite chefs. One night before dinner André was watching good old Rick’s show and he did a cracking Shanghai style pork belly. Feeling inspired and somewhat ravenous, our André felt slightly sombre about the lack of pork he had in the house - and so his Shanghai style turkey stir-fry with noodles was born.

Full Name: Caribbean Spicy Sausages with Roasted Veggies and Mashed Potato
Ingredients: Green Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Courgette, Jerk Sauce, Mango Chutney 40g, Spicy Sausage, Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: This spicy dish is sure to get your taste buds talking. Caribbean food is renowned for being full of flavour and spice so get yourself prepared! The peppers and onion will caramelise so everything will be slightly sticky, which just adds to the flavour. We’ve also asked our butchers at Roaming Roosters to add a little chilli to the sausages to give them a bit of a kick!

Full Name: Warm Coronation Chicken with Parsley Potatoes and Garlicky Cabbage
Ingredients: Onion, New Potatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Savoy Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Chicken Breast, Curry Powder, Mango Chutney 40g, Raisins, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Grater, Strainer, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Fork, Plate
Description: Queenie’s second birthday week (lucky her!), so here is one of our Best of British dishes. Did you know that this dish was created by Constance Spry, a food writer, and Rosemary Hume, a chef, specifically for the Queen’s coronation back in 1953. We thought it only proper to put it in your boxes!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Prawn Pilaf with Beetroot and Herb Slaw
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vegetable Stock Pot, Sri Lankan Spice Blend, Basmati Rice, King Prawns, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Beetroot
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Mixing Bowl, Peeler, Bowl
Description: Sri Lanka - they call it the pearl of India - because it really is that beautiful. The food is one of its main treasures and as an island - just like us - they love a dish with some tasty, fresh seafood. Plus, we’ve added gorgeous, wonderful beetroot, because it’s in season so therefore at its most delicious! Fusion!

Full Name: British Summer Salad with Asparagus, Chives and Fennel
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Fennel, Lemon, Asparagus, Spring Onion, Chives, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Oven dish, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In honour of the Queen’s second birthday week (lucky her!), our chef André has created this delicious seasonal asparagus salad, bursting with yummy (and healthy!) ingredients. Arranging the leaves in a crown at the end makes it look like a salad fit for the queen! Arise Sir André, your salad has been knighted!

Full Name: Leek and Courgette Risotto with Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, Pine Nuts, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Courgette
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We’ve been told that the best and sweetest peas come from Kenya. However, Monsoon season has hit and has left our peas in a sorry state. Patrick didn’t want this to impact the fresh and summery flavours of his favourite risotto, so he’s reinvented it to pair leeks with courgettes. The result might even be his new favourite. He gobbled the lot before we could take a new photo with the courgettes instead of the peas (naughty chef), but you're gonna' love it!

Full Name: Tender Stir Fried Pork with Cashew Nuts and Black Bean Sauce
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Pepper, Carrot, Spring Onion, Cashew Nuts, Black Bean Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Certain dishes can’t help but inspire nostalgia. Black bean sauce was one of the gateway dishes into our childhood obsession with Chinese food. Tonight we’ve teamed it up with a beautifully cut piece of Pork Loin Medallion from our butcher extraordinaire Nick ‘The Knife’. We’ve thrown in a little restaurant trick too by adding cornflour to make your meat melt-in-the-mouth tender!

Full Name: Warm Coronation Chicken with Parsley Potatoes and Garlicky Cabbage
Ingredients: Onion, New Potatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Savoy Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Chicken Thighs, Curry Powder, Mango Chutney 40g, Raisins, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Strainer, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: Queenie’s second birthday week (lucky her!), so here is one of our Best of British dishes. Did you know that this dish was created by Constance Spry, a food writer, and Rosemary Hume, a chef, specifically for the Queen’s coronation back in 1953. We thought it only proper to put it in your boxes!

Full Name: Melt in the Middle Meatballs
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Mozzarella, Panko Breadcrumbs, Dried Thyme, Beef Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot
Description: Sleeves rolled up! Hands washed but still damp, let’s get rolling! The skill is in wrapping the cheese entirely with the meat, so it’s hiding, ready to be discovered when everyone tucks in. Surprise, surprise!

Full Name: Mexican Chicken Wraps with Appley Beetroot Slaw and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Beetroot, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt, Baby Gem Lettuce, Coriander, Chicken Breast, Mexican Spice, Honey, Wholemeal Tortilla, Tomato Mayonnaise
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Peeler, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Well, hello Mr. Beetroot! You’re looking awfully delicious! We’re making the best of wonderful seasonal vegetables in our Mexican chicken wraps with appley beetroot slaw and potato wedges.

Full Name: Pork Belly and Chickpea Stew with Spring Greens and Smoked Paprika
Ingredients: Pork Belly Rashers, Red Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Spring Greens, Red Wine Vinegar, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Chickpeas, Ciabatta
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Grater, Baking Tray, Bowl, Strainer
Description: These pork belly bacon rashers aren’t just good, they’re delicious.Our André delights in all things Spanish, so get ready to enjoy the subtle, sweet flavours of smoked paprika, spring greens and chickpea stew.

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Mortar, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result: 1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it 2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in and 3) Make sure you rest the steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it. Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Super Quick Creamy Pasta with Peas and Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Fusilli, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer, Bowl
Description: After a long day at work, there’s always the temptation to eat something super simple, so you can maximize your time on the couch in your fluffy slippers with a blanket and a cuppa. Well, your wish is our command! Our pea and bacon pasta is unbelievably tasty and quick in equal measure. Its oh-so-creamy sauce brings it all together! So, get those slippers ready, it’s going to be an awesome night in!

Full Name: Chopped Moroccan Halloumi Salad with Citrus Dressing
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Baby Spinach, Coriander, Carrot, Yellow Pepper, Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix, Lemon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Whether it’s Moroccan music, Moroccan plates or even his new Moroccan rug, it’s fair to say our Head Chef has become quite enthusiastic about all things… Morocco. He headed there a few weeks ago for a recipe reconnaissance mission that spanned everything from the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh (where he learned this salad recipe), to the Berber cave dwellings of the Atlas Mountains.

Full Name: Feta and Parsley Stuffed Tomatoes with Minty Aubergine Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Aubergine, Red Pepper, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Feta Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Knife, Baking Tray, Spoon, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Description: Have you heard of Les? He’s our herb farmer with R & G Herbs, and he’s a pretty passionate fellow. He comes from a long line of farmers, so he knows exactly what it takes to grow the most delicious herbs in the land. This herby salad full of parsley and mint wouldn’t be the same without the great ingredients from our wonderful suppliers. So, this dish is an ode to the fantastic farmers we work with. You rock!

Full Name: Vegetarian Curry with Toasted Cashews and Brown Rice
Ingredients: Green Beans, Baby Corn, Coriander, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Brown Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Yellow Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Coconut Milk
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Anthropomorphic. It’s not a word you hear all that much. It’s used to describe an object as if it had human character traits. Though virtue is more usually associated with someone like Mother Theresa than a humble curry, bear with us here. This recipe combines all the delicious flavours of a Thai yellow curry but with all the goodness of brown rice, vegetables and even low fat coconut milk. Devilishly good has never been so saintly!

Full Name: Grilled Chicken Ramen with Udon Noodles and Spring Greens
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chinese 5 Spice, Carrot, Onion, Leek, Spring Greens, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Coriander, Cinnamon Stick, Chicken Stock Pot, Lime, Udon Noodles, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Knife, Peeler, Grater, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: Have you heard of Tokyo’s bullet train? That train goes seriously fast - almost as fast as it takes to make a delicious HelloFresh dinner! Before HelloFresh it seems that our Chef André was QUITE the jet-setter. It was just before he got on Tokyo’s famous bullet train, that he had the steaming chicken ramen that inspired this dish.

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Lamb Bangladeshi Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Curry Powder, Lamb Mince, Peas, Mint, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Biryani is traditionally made with a leg of goat, but here we’ve made it with our delicious lamb mince from butchers Roaming Roosters. It’s a traditional dish from India and is often served at weddings and on big occasions … and is also delicious as a midweek meal! Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan Fried Cod with Roasted Tomatoes and Lemony Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Marjoram, Lemon, Parmesan Cheese, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Cod Fillet
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Fish and risotto are two things that a lot of people, including some HelloFresh cooks, seem to be a bit wary about cooking. So, Mimi made this for them to show how simple (and delicious) it is to cook both of them. You can do it!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Roasted Garlic and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Garlic Bulb, Rosemary, Chilli Flakes, Dried Oregano, Olive Oil, Flank Steak, Cherry Tomatoes, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Knife, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Like fish, perfectly cooking a piece of steak can be a little intimidating if you haven’t had much practice. Our top tips are: 1) take your steak out of the fridge an hour before you plan to cook it, so that it comes nearer to room temperature 2) get your pan really hot before cooking and 3) once you’ve cooked it, leave it to rest for a few mins before slicing. Easy!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move) has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Walnut & Rosemary Crusted Chicken with Crispy Potatoes and Salad
Ingredients: Red Potato, Rosemary, Walnuts, Chicken Breast, Panko Breadcrumbs, Balsamic Vinegar, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Plate
Description: Misplacing your house keys. Losing the TV remote. Forgetting where you parked your car. Life is full of memory-related frustrations, but luckily help is at hand. The key flavour to this tasty little dish is rosemary, which researchers have found improves memory! Apparently, the merest whiff of the stuff not only increases alertness but also the ability to do mental arithmetic too. Perfect for locating lost lottery tickets* or for children who ‘forget’ to do their maths homework!

Full Name: Chicken Milanese with Roasted New Potatoes and Chives
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Sour Cream, Garlic Salt, Lemon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Chives, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We tried sending out eggs once and it caused our operations guru Luke a whole world of scrambled trouble! When Luke saw Milanese on the menu his little face dropped at the thought of an egg wash for the breadcrumbs, but Patrick turned his frown upside down by using sour cream! If you’ve got ideas for future egg padding let us know!

Full Name: Mushroom and Broccoli Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Summer Time Freekeh Salad
Ingredients: Freekeh, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Mint, Coriander, Lemon, Zahtar Spice, Pomegranate Seeds, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Freekeh is a grain that’s very popular in Italy - you’ll usually find it in soups and salads. It’s got a good kick of fibre, iron and even some zinc but most importantly, it has the perfect taste and texture for this healthy July dinner.

Full Name: Sweet Spiced Moroccan Meatballs with Tabbouleh and Mint Raita
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Boiling Water, Onion, Garlic Clove, Cumin, Ground Cinnamon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Plain Flour, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt, Mint, Lamb Mince
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: If I could have one wish this week, it would be that you could all meet our chef, Vix. She’s such a generous, warm soul and you can tell from the first time you meet her, that her passion for food is indescribable and genuine. This tabbouleh is an absolute favourite of hers and she’s so proud of the flavours that she wants you all to try it. She believes it will bring some absolute sparkle to your dinner time and to your day. Enjoy!

Full Name: Aubergine and Paneer Curry with Cinnamon Rice
Ingredients: Paneer, Aubergine, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Water, Cinnamon Stick, Basmati Rice, Goan Xacuti Spice, Coconut Milk
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Paneer is a type of cheese used in a lot of Indian cooking, when fried it provides a lovely crispy texture on the outside, whilst also soaking up the flavour of the curry. Delicious!

Full Name: Lamb and Mint Burger with Cheese and Onion Chips
Ingredients: King Edward Potato, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Mint, Lamb Mince, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cucumber, Cheddar Cheese, Dijon Mustard, White Wine Vinegar, Olive Oil, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: "What's more British than cheese and onion?" our Chef André asks. "Mint and lamb, perhaps?" he replies. So, go on, get stuck in - and let us know what you think of it!!

Full Name: Hoisin Pork with Noodles, Peppers and Beansprouts
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Pork Medallion, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Lime, Beansprouts, Water
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Bowl, Peeler, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: A lot of people think of duck when they hear the word hoisin. But hoisin sauce is incredibly versatile and it’s delicious on a lot of things - including pork. Don’t believe us? Just give our hoisin pork with noodles, peppers and beansprouts a go, and you’ll be eating your hat as well!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Spiced Beef Ragout with Couscous,Coriander and Flaked Almonds
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Couscous, Boiling Water, Courgette, Coriander, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Knife, Bowl
Description: The word ragout comes from the French word meaning 'to revive the flavour'. So, jump right in and have yourself a flavour revival with André's Middle Eastern twist on minced beef! The texture of this dish is just sensational - with those flaked almonds to give it a crunch and that fluffy couscous to give it a ... fluff!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Spiced Beef Ragout with Couscous, Coriander and Flaked Almonds
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Couscous, Courgette, Coriander, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: The word ragout comes from the French word meaning ‘to revive the flavour’. So, jump right in and have yourself a flavour revival with André’s Middle Eastern twist on minced beef! The texture of this dish is just sensational - with those flaked almonds to give it a crunch and that fluffy couscous to give it a ... fluff!

Full Name: Quick Chicken with Body Boosting Veggies
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Chicken Breast, Shawarma Spice Mix, Organic Lentils, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: This week we’ve teamed up with Street Child’s “Girls Speak Out” Campaign! They’re helping at least 10,000 West African girls stay in school and get an education for a brighter future. We couldn’t be happier to support them and our very own Dom (who looks after The Granary, where your boxes are packed) cycled all the way to Paris to raise money. You can send them a cheeky monthly donation too: text ‘StreetChild £3’ or ‘StreetChild £10’ to 70707 or Visit www.street-child.co.uk/donate

Full Name: Herbed Pork and Tomato Risotto
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Fennel Seeds, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: There is a legend that a master glassmaker named Valerius invented risotto in Miland in 1574. We’re pretty grateful to him, or we wouldn’t be bringing you delicious creation!

Full Name: Duck à l’Orange with an Asian Twist
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Duck Breast, Orange, Spring Greens, Red Chilli, Lemongrass, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Star Anise
Utensils: Pot, Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Every week at the Fresh Farm we sit down and go over all of your feedback to decide what we’ll cook the following week. Lots of you love the classic dishes of your childhood, whilst the thrill seekers amongst you like to try out things you’ve never tasted before. This week we thought we’d try to tick both culinary boxes by creating an old favourite with a little oriental twist. Use more or less of the lemongrass according to taste and make sure you chop it up micro-fine for the best result.

Full Name: The Governor’s Kung Pao with Brown Rice and Cashews
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Ginger, Spring Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Cashew Nuts
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Wok, Bowl
Description:
Legend has it that in the late nineteenth century, the governor of Sichuan province, Ding Baozhen, was missing quite a few of his teeth. One day he ducked out of his palace to eat in a local restaurant, where the chef served him a dish of beautifully chopped up, quickly stir-fried ingredients. The governor was so impressed with the dish (not least because it was easy for him to eat), that he hired the chef full time and christened the recipe with his official name, Kung Pao. Though some people doubt the story, we’re convinced it’s the tooth*.
*Sorry, we couldn’t resist that one!

Full Name: Veggie Enchiladas with a Side Helping of Mexican Trivia
Ingredients: Baby Spinach, Spring Onion, Black Beans, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Cheddar Cheese, Sweetcorn, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Avocado
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Strainer, Knife, Saucepan, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Oven dish, Plate
Description: This week we’re taking a long overdue opportunity to clear up a bit of Mexican dinner time confusion; namely the difference between tortillas, fajitas and enchiladas. Our man in Mexico tells us that ‘tortilla’ is the general name given to the flour wraps that you fill up with Mexican food, whilst ‘fajitas’ are a soft tortilla filled with shredded beef. Enchiladas take the process a tasty step further as they are tortillas filled with ingredients, rolled up and then given a scattering of cheese before being baked in the oven. Phew, now we can all relax and get eating!

Full Name: Cheesy Chorizo and Pancetta Pasta Bake
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Yellow Pepper, Button Mushrooms, Mozzarella, Rigatoni Pasta, Chorizo, Pancetta, Baby Spinach, Chopped Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Bowl
Description: Ah. I love the way cheesy and easy rhyme - because they’re both such great things! So, for you guys this week, we’ve got Mimi’s moreish cheesy chorizo pancetta pasta. Her favourite pastime is layering the pasta bake with mozzarella. Get those kids involved!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: For tonight’s dinner, we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your ’taters come from!

Full Name: Pork Satay Burgers with Paprika Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Smoked Paprika, Coriander, Lime, Salted Peanuts, Pork Mince, Soy Sauce, Baby Gem Lettuce, Carrot, Peanut Butter, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Satay is usually done with chicken, but we’ve gone a bit ‘out there’ and created our very own pork satay burger! When you add in the zinginess of the lime and the creamy crunch of peanuts - you’ve got yourself a burger that is beyond scrumptious!

Full Name: Ginger Beef Stir Fry with Asparagus and Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Asparagus, Flank Steak, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, Oyster Style Sauce, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Spoon, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Today we’re talking about tenderisers. If you’ve ever wondered how those clever chefs down at your local Chinese eatery get their meat to be so juicy and soft , we’re going to let you in on a little trade secret: cornflour. When you coat your meat in this fantastic natural ingredient before cooking, it helps to keep all the juices inside the meat, leaving it succulently soft every time.

Full Name: Matador's Chicken and Chorizo Casserole with Crushed New Potatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Carrot, New Potatoes, Chicken Thigh, Chorizo, Chopped Tomatoes, Bay Leaf, Rosemary
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: When faced with the prospect of possible death in the bullring, we’re not entirely sure what a matador would choose to eat as his final meal. With the matador as inspiration we created a hearty, robust recipe that uses chorizo to give a distinctive, smoky character. Whether you’re up against a raging bull, or maybe just a traffic warden, this is the one for you...

Full Name: Stir-Fried Chinese Chilli Beef
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Ginger, Egg Noodle Nest, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Strainer, Frying Pan
Description: Well, you could knock us down with a feather! When Patrick whipped up this little number, we were instantly transported to a bustling backstreet eatery in Hong Kong. It blew our socks off! The trick with this dish is to slice your steak into ribbons as thinly as you can. Next, you need to cook it in a super hot frying pan in batches. By leaving space between each ribbon in the pan, they’ll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Aubergine Tagliatelle with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Chilli Flakes, Wholewheat Tagliatelle, Chopped Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Strainer
Description: Somedays you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Red Chilli, Thyme, Sage, Chicken Breast, Green Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: When asked what his favourite food is, Patrick, our Head Chef, will say “French” with very little hesitation. French food is to Patrick, what lentils are to the French. Known as the poor man’s caviar, the humble green lentil is an exalted ingredient in French cooking, with a texture superior to that of any other lentil variety. It has a delicious nutty flavour with a moreish smooth interior and nutritional credentials to knock your socks off. It’s also a cousin to the pea. Enjoy!

Full Name: Rosemary Lamb Burgers with Sweet Potato Chips and Sour Cream Dip
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Sweet Potato, Small Sweet Potato, Rosemary, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Brioche Bun, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There’s nothing quite like taste and sound to spark nostalgia. When our fresh-faced Head Chef was at university in the West Country, his favourite indulgence used to be the juicy lamb burgers down at his local pub. Many a productive afternoon of revision was spent in the beer garden of the Hog & Badger eating these BBQ’d delights and washing them down with a refreshing soft drink (ahem). If you have time to light up the BBQ (and make a jug of sangria) it can only enhance the experience!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Sweet Potato and Green Bean Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Beans, Small Sweet Potato, Coriander, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Chilli Flakes, Coconut Milk, Cashew Nuts, Desiccated Coconut, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Lactose Free, Spicy, Vegan, Veggie
Description: Today we are having a culinary geography lesson and the subject is: Sri Lanka. An island of just over 20 million people, Sri Lanka sits off the southern coast of India and is known as ‘The Pearl of the Indian Ocean’. Until 1972 it was actually called Ceylon (hence the tea!) and it’s particularly well known for its tasty spices. We had a word with our friends down at Seasoned Pioneers when we decided to create this recipe and they sent us this incredible fruity spice blend to transport you to sunnier climes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchilladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Strainer, Grater, Oven dish, Plate
Description:
Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to
sauces ... arriba!

Full Name: Mushroom Stuffed Courgettes with Balsamic Tomatoes and Spinach
Ingredients: Courgette, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Button Mushrooms, Button Mushrooms, Cherry Tomatoes, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Balsamic Vinegar, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Munchy Seeds: Sesame Sprinkle
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Spoon, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: Stuffing one food into another food is somewhat of an obsession for us humans. Wherever you find yourself in the world, there’s always SOMETHING stuffed on the menu. But we wonder where this obsession came from? We like to think that there was a boy called Bob and his mum said, “No Bob, you can’t have any mushrooms–it’s courgette night” and Bob defiantly hid the mushrooms inside the courgette.

Full Name: Quick Chicken and Apricot Tagine with Turmeric Roasted Cauliflower and Couscous
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Onion, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Cauliflower, Ground Turmeric, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Pistachios, Water
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Our chef Mimi is a bit of a cauliflower fanatic and in her opinion there’s no better way to cook this cloud shaped veg than roasting! “It’s so pretty when it’s all golden from the oven with the turmeric,” she says. She’s totally right, give this dish a go and it’ll be a vibrant feast for your eyes and for your taste buds.

Full Name: Tamarind Glazed Pork with Stir Fried Peppers and Fragrant Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Cinnamon Stick, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Pork Medallion, Tamarind Sauce, Sugar, Soy Sauce, Honey
Utensils: Pot, Grater, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The thing about tamarind is that it adds a beautiful tang to dishes, but it’s got a little bit of sweetness too. Sounds a bit like apple and as apple is normally pork’s partner in crime, we’re pretty sure tamarind is going to go down a storm!

Full Name: Lebanese Lamb Wraps with Minted Tzatziki and Toasted Almonds
Ingredients: Cucumber, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lemon, Carrot, Flaked Almonds, Ground Cumin, Sumac, Lamb Mince, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: It wasn’t so very long ago that Chef Patrick found himself wandering around the marketplaces of Beirut in search of culinary inspiration. And boy did he find some! The people of Lebanon have a sense of hospitality to rival the best of them and fortunately for Patrick their greatest expression of this is in their food.15 mins in one market and his hands were chock full of food given to him by the locals. This little number just happened to be one of them, so he felt inspired to recreate it for you. Yalla!

Full Name: Pan Fried Pork Steaks with Crispy Sage and Gooseberry Sauce
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Sage, Gooseberries, Garlic Clove, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Pork Medallion, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This dish is a pure parade of flavourful delight - salty bacon, herby sage, tangy and sweet gooseberry sauce (instead of apple sauce!) and garlic veggies. It’s really hard to imagine just how well all these flavours work together. So, you’ll have to try it for yourself. It also happens to be our Fruit of the Month! Enjoy!

Full Name: Chimichurri Sweet Potato, Goat’s Cheese and Chorizo Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Beetroot, Chorizo, Spring Onion, Mixed Salad, Argentinian Chimichurri Dressing, Goat's Cheese
