Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: This little dish has summer written all over it and the flavour combos are just out of this world! Sweet potato, beetroot, chorizo and goat’s cheese all in one dish ... what more could you want! We recommend eating this ‘al fresco’ with a cold glass of Pimm’s (or lemonade if it’s a school night!).

Full Name: Grilled Salmon Tarator with Bulgur Wheat Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Red Wine Vinegar, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Crème Fraîche, Walnuts
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: Our André reckons this is going to be your new favourite dish on a warm summer evening. This beautifully grilled salmon is topped with crème fraîche, walnuts, herbs and lemon zest and then served warm, rather than hot. I can’t wait to dig in, what about you?

Full Name: Deconstructed Ratatouille with Balsamic Tomatoes and Feta and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Aubergine, Cherry Tomatoes, Dried Italian Herbs, Courgette, Basil 20g, Balsamic Vinegar, Ciabatta, Feta Cheese, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The definition of deconstructed is ‘to reduce something to its constitutent parts’. We’re not sure we agree completely with this - we wouldn’t say there is any reduction going on here. This dish is such a show stopper, that we wanted to let everything from the ratatouille and feta to the garlicky ciabatta absolutely shine!

Full Name: Tomatoey Spinach Quinoa Curry with Gooseberry and Mustard Chutney and Cooling Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Carrot, Gooseberries, White Wine Vinegar, Mustard Seeds, Ground Turmeric, Ground Coriander, Ground Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Quinoa, Vegetable Stock Pot, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Peeler, Pan, Saucepan, Pot, Bowl
Description: The truth is the gooseberry, which happens to be our Fruit of the Month, is so much more versatile that we ever give it credit for. Its sweet tanginess means it complements spicy dishes and salty dishes alike. Here we’ve made it into a delicious chutney (new skill alert!) to compliment your quinoa curry. Don’t believe us - the proof will be on your plate with this one!

Full Name: An Inventive Summertime Pea and Mint Salad
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Sugar Snap Peas, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Lemon, Pine Nuts, Mint, Pea Shoots, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Strainer, Bowl, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: This little dish has summer written all over it and the flavour combos are just out of this world! Sugar snap peas, pine nuts and goat’s cheese all in one dish ... what more could you want! We recommend eating this ‘al fresco’ with a cold glass of Pimm’s (or lemonade if it’s a school night).

Full Name: Family Chicken Tagine with Marjoram, Chickpeas and Spinach
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Cumin Seeds, Lemon, Red Onion, Celery Stick, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Marjoram, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Chickpeas, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Mixing Bowl, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Pot, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Not a fan of sharing your food? Ahh … don’t be like that! In Morocco, tagines are plopped in the centre of a round table and the whole family shares. What could be more fun than sharing an exciting new dinner adventure with your loved ones?

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Tags: Family Box, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunch, on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this recipe we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing meal that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: Gammon Steaks with Spring Onion Mash with Garlicky Spring Greens and Gooseberry Ketchup
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Potato, Garlic Clove, Spring Onion, Spring Greens, Gooseberries, Tomato Ketchup, Star Anise, Cider Vinegar, Gammon Steak
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free
Description: Drum roll please for our British Fruit of the Month - the humble gooseberry. She hides in thorny bushes to elude us all, but she knows we know how deliciously sweet (and fierce) she can be. We've got you all worked out Mrs. Gooseberry… you're a sucker for some good old garlicky spring greens and some perfectly cooked gammon steaks. So, here goes...

Full Name: Pan Fried Paprika Cod and Fennel Moqueca
Ingredients: Onion, Fennel, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Star Anise, Basmati Rice, Water, Tomato Puree 30g, Smoked Paprika, Smoked Paprika, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cod Fillet, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Pan, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Who else thinks of sunshine and samba when they think of Brazil? This week is a chance to really find out about Brazil - and as always we want to know about the food. Cue Brazilian moqueca - but the HelloFresh kind! We’ve added fennel because it works so well!

Full Name: Paprika Pork with Crushed New Potatoes and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Bay Leaf, Water, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Red Pepper, Pork Fillet, Smoked Paprika, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Strainer, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A combination of Spanish delights. A very simple Spanish butter bean stew using fresh, seasonal tomatoes, rich in flavour and colour. A great little dish on its own! It’s difficult to go into a tapas bar and not find this on the menu. And of course, a traditional combination of paprika and pork that will send wonderful, zingy notes to your taste buds.

Full Name: Beef Kofta Curry with Sag Aloo
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, King Edward Potato, King Edward Potato, Coriander, Cumin, Ground Turmeric, Water, Beef Mince, Tandoori Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: One thing we love about curry is that it doesn’t always come with the same side. Rice is irresistible, but so are potatoes! The possibilities with potatoes seem to be endless! So, dig into this curry and enjoy!

Full Name: Refreshing Pasta with Peas, Pancetta and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Batman and Robin, Bert and Ernie. Some things were born to go better together. There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of foodie fashion and this dish is a testament to one such union. Marrying a time-honoured mixture of fresh peas, mint and pancetta this recipe spins a classic combination into a light, summery ensemble. It’s quick to make and perfect with a glass of something cold and bubbly.

Full Name: Brazillian Sweet Potato Veijoada Bake with Shallot Salsa Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Onion, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Black Beans, Ground Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Cheddar Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Echalion Shallot, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Strainer, Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl, Oven dish
Description: Feijoada is a traditional Brazilian meat stew eaten daily with black beans! And veijoada is our very own vegetarian take on this. If you’re not going to take part in the Summer Games, the next best thing is putting your feet up and enjoying some delicious Brazilian fodder!

Full Name: Spiced Lentils with Grilled Halloumi and Red Onion Textures
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Green Lentils, Red Onion, Halloumi, Pistachios, Plain Flour, Basmati Rice, Boiling Water, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pan with Lid, Baking Tray
Description: Great food is all about dimensions. For some people, food has only one dimension: they eat it for fuel. For others it has two dimensions: it not only keeps them going, but it tastes good too. However, as with Oscar winning blockbusters about blue people from Pandora, the full experience can really only be enjoyed in 3D. For this dish, we’ve added texture in the form of crispy onions and the hearty mouth filling indulgence that is grilled halloumi. Blue and red disposable glasses optional.

Full Name: Homemade Rocket Pesto Orzotto with Charred Courgettes and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vine Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Rocket, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Olive Oil
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Pan
Description: We’re all in favour of teaching new skills and this week we decided homemade pesto is on the menu. Don’t be alarmed at the amount of olive oil we’re asking you to use … the Mediterranean diet is famed for its health benefits, which can be attributed to the extensive use of olive oil. It’s crazy good for you due to its sky high antioxidant levels (found in its phenolic compounds) and omega-9 content. Omega-9 is one of the “good fats” everyone speaks of, with a plethora of health benefits. Olive oil is 85% good fat so tuck in!!!

Full Name: Brazilian Pork and Sausage Feijoada with Black Beans and Coriander
Ingredients: Pork Shoulder, Toulouse Sausage, Red Onion, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Smoked Paprika, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Black Beans, Coriander, Vine Tomatoes, Lime, Red Chilli
Utensils: Knife, Oven dish, Saucepan, Grater, Strainer, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Feijoada is a traditional Brazilian meat stew eaten daily with lots of beans! We’ve made ours with some pretty special pulled pork which has been slow cooked for 14 hours by our lovely friend Steve from Grubworkz in Somerset! And we’ve included some Roaming Roosters sausages! If you’re not going to take part in the Summer Games, the next best thing is putting your feet up and enjoying some delicious Brazilian fodder!

Full Name: Herb and Mustard Chicken with crushed Potatoes and Lemony Slaw
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Lemon Thyme, Chicken Thighs, Carrot, Red Cabbage, Garlic Mayonnaise, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Olive Oil, Dijon Mustard
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Strainer, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description:
Our chef André says: “I love this dish. The parsley and mustard dressing releases its incredibly warm flavours into the chicken.”
There you have it - straight from the horse’s mouth. This dish is zesty, warming and wholesome. So, what are you waiting for? Get cooking!

Full Name: Prawn and Serrano Linguine
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Chives, Serrano Ham, Tiger Prawns, Linguine, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description:
We’ve come a long way since Patrick stuck up his first week of recipes on the Fresh Farm notice board. From those five recipes
we’ve just finished cooking up our 1000th recipe and we’ve even created a HelloFresh Wall of Fame! At the top of the pops is this crazy good linguine. Patrick is pretty proud of it, and rightly so … it’s a corker.

Full Name: Chicken Shawarma Kebabs with Jewelled Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Bamboo Skewers, Shawarma Spice Mix, Red Onion, Boiling Water, Bulgur Wheat, Red Pepper, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Coriander, Lemon, Pomegranate Seeds, Natural Yoghurt, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Knife, Pot, Grater, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Do you know the Edgware Road in London? It runs north-west through our capital city from Marble Arch to Edgware on the
outskirts of London. Since the 19th century, Edgware Road has been famed for its delicious Middle Eastern food, from kebabs to
the very chicken shawarma that inspired this HelloFresh recipe.

Full Name: HelloFresh Five Spiced Chicken with Bok Choy
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Bok Choy, Spring Onion, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Chinese 5 Spice, Chicken Thighs
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What are these mysterious five spices that so often sneak their way into Chinese cooking? The exact formula can vary from place to place but usually it’s a concoction of star anise, cloves, Chinese cinnamon, fennel seeds and a bit of Sichuan pepper. This dish was actually inspired by a trip to Australia where they tend to use all sorts of Asian flavours in their cooking. We teamed it up with super fresh bok choy, ginger and garlic for a quick burst of flavour!

Full Name: Chorizo Burgers with Red Onion Marmalade
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chorizo, Balsamic Vinegar, Beef Mince, Dried Oregano, Ketchup, Baby Gem Lettuce, Avocado, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Mention the word pilgrimage and most people will think of Mecca, Graceland and far flung monasteries. For Patrick, it’s all about the burger. For years he has wandered the world in search of the perfect recipe and though he has not reached his culinary nirvana just yet, he’s getting close. Combining the best quality mince with spicy chorizo, the trick to this burger is not to pack the meat too tightly.

Full Name: Herby Sea Bass with Salsa Verde
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Green Olives, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Green Beans, Sea Bass Fillets
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Oh salsa verde, you cheeky little green sauce that makes eyes widen with joy, jaws drop with disbelief and forks fall to the floor (in slow motion). You may be green and mistaken for a pesto of kinds, but a pesto you are not! You’re your own sauce through and through. Stay who you are salsa verde, HelloFresh loves you.

Full Name: Pork Saltimbocca with Chestnut Mushrooms and Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Serrano Ham, Chestnut Mushrooms, Sage, White Wine Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Tagliatelle, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Frying Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: Saltimbocca literally translates to ‘jump in the mouth’ in Italian. Allegedly it was invented at the end of the 19th century and has been jumping into people’s mouths ever since! Teamed with some creamy crème fraîche and delicious tagliatelle, it’s a winner!!

Full Name: Thai Sweet Potato and Baby Corn Panang Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Broccoli, Fresh Thai Basil, Panang Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Though Panang is a mild curry, nutritionally it packs one hell of a punch! Sweet potatoes are full of beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as Holy basil!

Full Name: Lentil and Charred Vegetable Halloumi Salad
Ingredients: Courgette, Red Pepper, Green Lentils, Lemon, Thyme, Rocket, Halloumi
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Summer is finally here and down at the Fresh Farm we’re celebrating! Patrick got us in the mood last week, when this little number appeared from the Fresh Kitchen for a quick taste testing session. Bring on the flip flops!

Full Name: Mexican Tortilla Stack with Guacamole and Black Bean Salsa
Ingredients: Red Onion, Coriander, Organic Black Beans, Yellow Pepper, Chopped Tomatoes, Mexican Spice, Avocado, Lime, Corn Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: Head Chef Patrick doesn’t like fuss. He’s always telling us that the best kind of food is simple, soulful grub that makes you feel loved. That said, every dinner is a chance to practise your presentation skills. Bigger plates are a great way of framing your food and a sprinkle of herbs or a drizzle of olive oil at the end gives everything a bit more pizazz. For this recipe, we took classic Mexican ingredients and played with the presentation to create something that’s as tasty to the eye as it is to the tongue. Arriba!

Full Name: Penne all’Arrabiata with Smoked Pancetta and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Fresh Basil, Pancetta, Smoked Paprika, Penne Pasta, Chopped Tomatoes, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Food is described with an infinite number of adjectives but ‘angry’ is not one that immediately springs to mind. That’s unless we’re talking in Italian. This little dish is ‘Arrabbiata,’ (this means ‘angry’ in Italian),because of its chilli kick, but we’ll leave it to you to decide how much of a temper you want it to have. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time it takes to boil your pasta, there’s really nothing angry about it. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Braised Chicken with Mushrooms, Mashed Potatoes and Garlicky Broccoli
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Tomato Puree 30g, Chicken Stock Pot, Potato, Broccoli, Tarragon
Utensils: Frying Pan, Plate, Grater, Knife, Peeler, Pot, Potato Masher, Strainer
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Lactose Free
Description: This is a recipe inspired by the French classic, ‘Coq au Vin’, which is a favourite of our chef André! We’ve made it kid friendly by omitting the wine and have taken the bone out and skin off the chicken to make it easy to eat! We’ve also added some delicious tarragon! Voila!

Full Name: Pork Meatballs and Thai Style Coconut Curry with Fragrant Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Pork Mince, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Ground Coriander, Soy Sauce, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Lime
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Since our chef André’s arrival at the Fresh Farm he has been teaching everyone all sorts of tricks in the kitchen. Our favourite one is cooking rice with a star anise, a little trick that just gives the rice an aromatic taste and the whole dish that ‘je ne sais quoi’. Enjoy!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Roasted Garlic and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Bulb, Rosemary, Chili Flakes, Dried Oregano, Flank Steak, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Tags: Family Box, Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Like fish, perfectly cooking a piece of steak can be a little intimidating if you haven’t had much practice. Our top tips are: 1) take your steak out of the fridge an hour before you plan to cook it, so that it comes nearer to room temperature 2) get your pan really hot before cooking and 3) once you’ve cooked it, leave it to rest for a few mins before slicing. Easy!

Full Name: Beef and Chorizo Burgers with Red Onion Marmalade
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chorizo, Balsamic Vinegar, Beef Mince, Dried Oregano, Ketchup, Baby Gem Lettuce, Avocado, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mention the word pilgrimage and most people will think of Mecca, Graceland and far-flung monasteries. For our chef Patrick it’s all about the burger. For years he has wandered the world in search of the perfect recipe and though he has not reached his culinary nirvana just yet, he’s getting close. Combining the best quality mince with spicy chorizo, the trick to this burger is not to pack the meat too tightly.

Full Name: Stir-Fried Chinese Chilli Beef
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Ginger, Egg Noodle Nest, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Strainer, Frying Pan
Tags: Family Box, Healthy, Lactose Free, Spicy
Description: Well, you could knock us down with a feather! When Patrick whipped up this little number, we were instantly transported to a bustling backstreet eatery in Beijing. It blew our socks off! The trick with this dish is to slice your steak into strips as thinly as you can. Next, you need to cook it in a super hot frying pan in batches. By leaving space between each strip in the pan, they’ll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Quickfire Quesadillas with Homemade Citrus Guacamole
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Mexican Spice, Kidney Beans, Water, Coriander, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Bowl, Potato Masher, Grater, Oven dish, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up most of the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces. Keep a few whole ones back for texture too ... Arriba!

Full Name: Summertime Pork Schnitzel with Salad and New Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Pork Medallion, Panko Breadcrumbs, Sour Cream, Dijon Mustard, Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil, Rocket, Black Olives, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: Food can be a great opportunity for increasing your vocabulary and nowhere is this more apparent than with the word ‘schnitzel’. We conjured up a thousand ideas on what this word could mean, though it turns out it simply means ‘cut’ (as in a ‘cut’ of meat). The schnitzel also happens to be a close cousin of the escalope, the milanese and the milanesa in case you need to order it abroad!

Full Name: Garlicky Courgette Chicken Gratin with Roasted New Potatoes
Ingredients: Boursin, Chicken Breast, Courgette, New Potatoes, Baby Spinach, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Rolling Pin, Bowl, Plate
Description: Life’s most precious commodity is time, and tonight we want to make sure you’ve got more of it to do stuff that counts. That’s why tonight’s Quick Dish is big on flavour and nutrition but small on prep time. Get the oven pre-heating pronto, get a helper to grate the courgette and before you know it you’ll be relaxing and reflecting on another homemade dinner well done.

Full Name: Chicken with Cashew Nuts and Yellow Bean Sauce
Ingredients: Tenderstem Broccoli, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Chicken Thighs, Cornflour, Cashew Nuts, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Yellow Bean Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Water
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Yellow is the colour of sun, summer and sensational flavours. That’s why we threw together this chicken and cashew nut dish making sure it had plenty of yellow bean sauce. The sweet taste of ginger goes perfectly with our seasonal hero, broccoli. Not only is eating local seasonal produce great for the environment, but getting a vegetable in the right season makes a huge difference to the flavour!

Full Name: Oven Baked Greek Style Meatballs with Orzo and Veggies
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Courgette, Mint, Oregano, Lamb Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Orzo, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot, Plate, Bowl
Description: On the Greek island of Corfu, meatballs are traditionally served with a fragrant rice. Mimi has mixed it up with an Italian twist of orzo which is a rice shaped pasta - a perfect accompaniment to both hot or cold dishes (perfect leftovers for lunch!).

Full Name: Goats Cheese Stuffed Aubergine with Chermoula Freekeh and a Cucumber and Mint Salad
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Freekeh, Chermoula Spice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Balsamic Vinegar, Goat's Cheese, Cucumber, Mint, Lemon, Olive Oil, Wholegrain Mustard
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Strainer, Baking Tray, Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: We’re not lying when we say that as we read the name of this recipe … our stomachs rumbled a lot! Now, when our chef Mimi first cooked it for us … our stomachs were speechless - and wholly satisfied. If you think you’ll have leftovers from this one - you’re mistaken. You’re gonna want to get it in your belly ... !

Full Name: Mango Chutney Chicken with Spiced Bulgur and Roasted Romanesco
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Mango Chutney 40g, Cumin, Romanesco, Onion, Garlic Clove, Tomato Puree 30g, Bulgur Wheat, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We bet you’re wondering what that strange coral like vegetable is in your box this week? Well that folks is our veggie of the month ... Romanesco! This fascinating veggie is a cross between broccoli and cauliflower and if you can bring yourself to chop it up (we found it hard to stop admiring it), it goes pretty nicely with our sticky mango chutney chicken!

Full Name: Strolling Rigatoni with Cherry Tomatoes and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Chorizo, Black Olives, Mozzarella
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Large Pot, Frying Pan
Description: The key to this dish is gently roasting the cherry tomatoes and pepper to bring out their natural sweetness and then balancing this against tangy olives and mild, creamy mozzarella. We’ve made it super quick and easy, to leave more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: Crisp Fillet of Bream with Cassava Chips and Brazilian Salsa
Ingredients: Cassava, Vine Tomatoes, Red Onion, Green Pepper, Lime, Coriander, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Sea Bream Fillet
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Zester, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Oven dish, Plate
Description: With the final week of the summer sport event of the year looming, we’ve added a bit of Brazilian magic to this week’s fish dish. André’s revamped traditional British fish and chips with a latino twist - so get stuck into this fish and cassava chips!

Full Name: Hoisin Romanesco with Rice Noodles and Coriander Pesto
Ingredients: Romanesco, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Salted Peanuts, Soy Sauce, Lime, Rice Noodle, Hoisin Sauce
Utensils: Large Pot, Kettle, Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Bowl
Description: Hoisin sauce is a sweet and savoury sauce used in Cantonese style cooking. Sauces and condiments in Cantonese cooking aim to bring out and highlight the original flavour of the vegetable. In this case, the romanesco!

Full Name: Cajun Halloumi Burgers with Chunky Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Sweet Potato, Cajun Spice, Halloumi, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For this recipe the secret’s in the sauce. The garlic sauce to be precise. Rather than simply chopping the garlic into  little bits (which doesn’t spread the flavour evenly), you’ll be using the flat of your knife to make a paste instead. It’s a bit cheffy, but when you taste the end result you’ll never go back!

Full Name: Lebanese Lamb Wraps with Minted Tzatziki and Toasted Almonds
Ingredients: Cucumber, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lemon, Carrot, Flaked Almonds, Cumin, Sumac, Lamb Mince, Wholemeal Tortilla, Mint, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Zester, Peeler, Pan, Bowl
Description: It wasn’t so very long ago that chef Patrick found himself wandering around the marketplaces of Beirut in search of culinary inspiration. And boy did he find some! The people of Lebanon have a sense of hospitality to rival the best of them and fortunately for Patrick their greatest expression of this is in their food. 15 minutes in one market and his hands were chock full of food given to him by the locals. This little number just happened to be one of them, so he felt inspired to re-create it for you. Yalla!

Full Name: Pan Fried Pork Medallions with Tarragon and Potatoes
Ingredients: Tarragon, Boiling Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Leek, New Potatoes, Sour Cream, Pork Medallion
Utensils: Bowl, Large Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Another tough week of taste testing is over and this time we’ve been putting our butchers at Roaming Roosters to the test. They’ve sourced us some succulent pork and we’ve combined it with a divine tarragon sauce that’ll blow the socks off the people round your dinner table.

Full Name: Speedy Vietnamese Steak Stir Fry
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Water, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemongrass, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Large Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: Just like a rooster, these steaks are super quick! Known for being really tender, these flank steaks are served with steamy basmati rice. We’ve added some chilli and white wine vinegar, to give an authentic hot and sour flavour combination. To make sure you are getting at least some of your five-a-day, we have added some fresh green beans, spring onions and red pepper!

Full Name: Family Chicken and Romanesco Pasta Bake with Bacon and Courgette
Ingredients: Romanesco, Courgette, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Chicken Breast, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Double Cream, Hard Italian Cheese, Streaky Bacon Rasher
Utensils: Large Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Pan, Oven dish, Bowl
Description: We bet you’re wondering what that strange coral like vegetable is in your box this week? Well that folks is our veggie of the month ... Romanesco! This fascinating veggie is a cross between broccoli and cauliflower and if you can bring yourself to chop it up (we found it hard to stop admiring it), it goes beautifully in André’s creamy bacon and chicken sauce, enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean and Buckwheat Bake with Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Buckwheat, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Cumin, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Ground Cinnamon, Black Beans, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Cheddar Cheese, Chives
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Strainer, Oven dish
Description: *Drum rolllllll* Making a rare appearance, the star of tonight’s dish is ultra nutritious, super tasty buckwheat! Buckwheat is actually a seed related to rhubarb and quite apart from its delicious, nutty flavour it is absolutely chock full of nutrition. Slow-burning to keep your energy levels constant, it also contains magnesium which can help lower blood pressure and aid delivery of nutrients around the body. If you like to spice things up then use all of the chilli!

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Chicken
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Chicken Breast, Mexican Spice, Lime, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Our wonderful greengrocer has sourced these sweet tasting red and yellow cherry tomatoes, which we’ve combined with nutritious roasted sweet potatoes and the tanginess of lime, to transport you all the way to the Mexican Riviera!

Full Name: Thai ‘Moo Pad Krapow’
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Pork Mince, Ketjap Manis, Soy Sauce, Fish Sauce, Fresh Thai Basil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate, Bowl
Description: In a former life (well, about 10 years ago) our Head Chef used to be a lawyer. When his firm asked him where he’d like to go on secondment, they were probably expecting him to choose Berlin or possibly Munich. His answer? Thailand. Living there for three months he used to eat in the food halls with all the locals every lunchtime and this became his go-to dish. Stick a fried egg on for extra authenticity!

Full Name: Italian Pork and Tomato Risotto
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Fennel Seeds, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: Legend has it that a master glassmaker named Valerius invented risotto in Milan in 1574. We’re pretty grateful to him, or we wouldn’t be bringing you this delicious creation!

Full Name: Grain Mustard Potato Salad with Chicken
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Spring Onion, Celery Stick, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Pan, Slotted Spoon, Plate
Description: Tonight’s recipe comes with a little history lesson in mustard. We first heard mention of this fiery little condiment from the Romans back in the 4th century, but it really hit the headlines when it reached Dijon around 800 years later. In fact, people went so potty for the stuff that when the Duke of Burgundy threw a party in 1336 his guests ate 70 gallons of mustard in one sitting! We’ve sent you slightly less tonight, but we hope you’ll go potty too.

Full Name: Coconut Dal with Homemade Chapati
Ingredients: Wholemeal Flour, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Vegetable Stock, Red Split Lentils, Garlic Clove, Onion, Ginger, Red Chilli, Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Desiccated Coconut, Coriander
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: Many, many (many) years ago Head Chef Patrick was rushing to school when he remembered it was ‘Home Economics’ day. In his haste he grabbed the only things he could find: a tin of baked beans and a bag of wholemeal flour. His speciality that day was baked beans on homemade chapatis. We’re glad to say he’s increased his repertoire since then and tonight’s coconut dal is an absolute stonker!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed HelloFresh Chorizo Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Dried Italian Herbs, Mozzarella
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: We’re really excited to get you making the first ever HelloFresh calzone! Our good friends at The Northern Dough Company have made this beautiful pizza dough in advance, so that all you need to do is roll it out, top it with tastiness, fold it in half and bake it in your (pizza) oven. Make sure to cook this meal first this week so you get the dough at its absolute freshest!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Redcurrant Jelly, Water
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t even really know how to cook a steak well-done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Tasteology Grilled Haddock and Samphire
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Lemon, Dijon Mustard, Olive Oil, Chives, Haddock Fillet, Samphire
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description:
To celebrate the launch of the beautiful online series Tasteology, we’ve put together a special recipe. Tasteology is a series that explores the science behind taste and combines crazy, beautiful film-making with comments from the world’s leading food experts. One of the themes
in episode one is ‘foraging’ and nothing epitomises foraging quite like British coastal samphire! Watch the series whilst you eat tonight’s dinner at www.aeg.co.uk/tasteology

Full Name: Tasteology Prawn and Crème Fraîche Rigatoni with Samphire
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chives, Green Beans, Rigatoni Pasta, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Samphire
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Strainer, Bowl
Description:
To celebrate the launch of the beautiful online series Tasteology, we’ve put together a special recipe. Tasteology is a series that explores the science behind taste and combines crazy, beautiful film-making with comments from the world’s leading food experts. One of the themes
in episode one is ‘foraging’ and nothing epitomises foraging quite like British coastal samphire! Watch the series whilst you eat tonight’s
dinner at www.aeg.co.uk/tasteology

Full Name: Tasteology Paella with Veggies, Samphire and Olives
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Chervil, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Water, Arborio Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cherry Tomatoes, Samphire, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer, Bowl
Tags: Gluten Free, Healthy, Lactose Free, Vegan, Veggie
Description:
To celebrate the launch of the beautiful online series Tasteology, we’ve put together a special recipe. Tasteology is a series that explores the science behind taste and combines crazy, beautiful film-making with comments from the world’s leading food experts. One of the themes
in episode one is ‘foraging’ and nothing epitomises foraging quite like British coastal samphire! Watch the series whilst you eat tonight’s
dinner at www.aeg.co.uk/tasteology

Full Name: Cajun Lemon Cod with Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Cod Fillet, Lemon, Cajun Spice, Potato, Potato, Carrot, Thyme, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: At the Fresh Farm, we’ve noticed that the word ‘Cajun’ is thrown around a lot! It’s always ‘Cajun this’ and ‘Cajun that’. But Cajun isn’t just another spice like paprika or cumin, it’s a whole cooking tradition created by the French when they moved to Southern Louisiana. It was born out of fusion! So we’re taking our beloved friend fusion a bit further, by adding the sweet, hot flavours of Cajun spices to some delicious lemony British cod. Enjoy!

Full Name: Chicken Fried Rice with Mushrooms, Chilli, Peanuts and Soy
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Cinnamon Stick, Water, Chicken Thighs, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Coriander, Salted Peanuts, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Knife, Frying Pan
Description:
You know us at the Fresh Farm, we’re not into fancy things, we just love wonderful home cooking. So, André’s kept it simple with this chicken fried rice. It’s simple to make and simply delicious to eat.
Enjoy!

Full Name: Pork and Apple Burger with Rosemary Chips
Ingredients: Rosemary, Potato, Potato, Apple, Pork Mince, Brioche Bun, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress, Seville Orange & Honey Dressing
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description:
Nothing makes us happier than respinning a fast food favourite into an equally fast, but healthy dinner! This week we’ve turned our attention to the trusty hamburger. No crazy additives or
preservatives. Instead we’ve got the best pork we can lay our hands on from our butcher Nick ‘The Knife’ and added some homemade chunky chips. If you happen to have a slice of cheese in the fridge we won’t tell!

Full Name: Chipotle Corn on the Cob with Homemade Refried Beans
Ingredients: Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Coriander, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Corn on the Cob, Habanero Sauce, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Hard Italian Cheese, Avocado
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Sieve, Baking Tray, Pan with Lid, Bowl
Description:
Here at The Fresh Farm we like to think that we’re fairly ‘down with the kids’. Last week, someone was seen wandering around in a pair of skinny jeans* and our chef Patrick is really getting into his Mexican food.
It seems the flavours of Mexico are plotting a quiet revolution in some of the trendiest restaurants right now, so we’ve put together this recipe to keep you at the cutting edge. The key ingredient here is chipotle -
a spicy pepper which adds a fantastic earthy flavour to your veggies. Remember: you saw it here first. *Turns out it was a cycle courier.

Full Name: Oven-Baked Sea Bream with Chilli Spiked Mediterranean Vegetables
Ingredients: Lemon, Sea Bass Fillets, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, New Potatoes, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Zester, Knife, Pan with Lid, Frying Pan, Baking Tray
Description: The inspiration for this dish came from a sleepy little fishing village in Sicily. Fishermen head back into port in the morning and a queue of locals and restaurant owners jostle for position on the dockside to get the first pick. We’ve combined sea bream with a classic Italian mixture of tomatoes, garlic and chilli, to create a recipe that lifts us out of the kitchen and puts us right back on the dock of that bay. Bravissimo!

Full Name: Summer Jumble with Halloumi and Sweet Potato
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Quinoa, Red Pepper, Halloumi, Lemon, Chorizo, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: Summer is in full swing, so it’s time to get a bit of rainbow colouring on your plate! My grandma always said “The more colours on your plate, the better” – so she would have loved this dish. Red and yellow and green and ... ok, so we don’t have any blue, but you get the picture! So, for a meal that not only looks great, but also tastes sensational and will nourish you to your core, we’ve created our summer jumble.

Full Name: Tah-antilising Butternut Tahini Salad
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Chilli Flakes, Thyme, Cucumber, Tahini Paste, Lemon, Sunflower Seeds, Feta Cheese, Dried Cranberries, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Without tahini there would be no hummus (shock horror!). But tahini has lots of other uses, it is often mixed with honey and spread on toast for a delicious breakfast. Here we are mixing it with lemon juice and a splash of olive oil to make a delectable creamy dressing. Combined with delightfully sweet butternut squash and a whole host of mouth-watering ingredients, this really is a winning recipe.

Full Name: Beef Roly Poly's Mexican Style
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Smoked Paprika, Flour Tortillas, Crème Fraîche, Green Beans
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Cup, Kettle, Casserole, Pot, Bowl
Description: Get your sombreros out, wrap yourself in a stripy blanket and get ready for a Mexican-style meal. Flour tortillas stuffed with tasty mince and smothered in a cheesy sauce … making your mouth water? Get the kids to help with prep, whether it’s grating cheese or rolling up tortillas, they will be sure to enjoy their roly polys if they’ve had a hand in making them. Don’t forget the cold beers and a slice of lime!

Full Name: Sumac and Sesame Crusted Steak with Tomato Chickpea Mash and Green Beans
Ingredients: Sumac, Sesame Seeds, Flank Steak, Echalion Shallot, Vine Tomatoes, Mint, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Chickpeas, Water, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Frying Pan, Pot, Pan
Description: Steak is pretty good, but here we’ve made it even better with a delicious crust of sesame and sumac! Our top tip on cooking steak is to get the pan roasting hot before laying in the steak … when we say hot, WE MEAN HOT

Full Name: Spiced Chicken with Coconut Rice and Baked Corn on the Cob
Ingredients: Corn on the Cob, Honey, Shawarma Spice Mix, Chicken Drumstick, Onion, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Organic Black Beans, Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Knife, Sieve, Baking Tray, Pan with Lid
Description: This creamy coconut rice is (in our humble opinion), pretty amazing. Teamed with some delicious shawarma spiced chicken drumsticks and roasted corn on the cob, it’s going to be a sensational (but slightly messy!) dinner … Enjoy!

Full Name: Artisan Sausages with Roasted Garlic Mash and Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Garlic Clove, Cumberland Sausage, Rosemary, Cornflour, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Milk
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: So, you might call us crazy, but trust us - what Patrick is about to say will revolutionise your mashed potato experience. Here goes: “Roast your garlic until it’s nice and soft and then mash it into your potatoes”, says Patrick. For a mash you can be proud of ... get cooking!

Full Name: Greek Ragu with Almond, Aubergine and Basil Couscous
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Couscous, Aubergine, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Green Olives, Ground Almond, Basil 20g, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Fork, Plate
Description: The ancient Greeks are famed for their spectacular mythology, their gods and goddesses and their epic storytelling. But we think their ragu is one of their lesser known treasures. The gentle, warm tang of our tomatoes blends like a charm with ground almonds and aubergines. And when you add the herby basil couscous into the mix ... well - take our word for it, the whole family will love it!

Full Name: Sizzling Honey Mustard Sausages with Sweet Potato Mash and Sticky Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Honey Mustard Sausages, Sweet Potato, Maris Piper Potatoes, Red Onion, Beef Stock Pot, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan, Fork
Description: When everything is ready, fluff up your bulgur wheat with a fork and serve in bowls. Slice your pork medallions into roughly 2cm slices and serve on top with your spring greens on the side. Drizzle over your tomato sauce and any juices in the baking tray and devour!

Full Name: Quickfire Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Strainer, Knife, Baking Tray, Zester, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces ... arriba!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Italian Herbs
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray
Description:
We’re really excited to get you making the HelloFresh calzone! Our good friends at The Northern Dough Company have made this beautiful pizza dough in advance, so that all you need to do is roll
it out, top it with tastiness, fold it in half and bake it in your (pizza) oven. Make sure to cook this meal first this week so you get the dough at its absolute freshest!

Full Name: Oven Baked Greek Style Meatballs with Orzo and Veggies
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Courgette, Mint, Oregano, Lamb Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Orzo, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot
Description:
On the Greek island of Corfu, meatballs are traditionally served with fragrant rice. Mimi has mixed them up with an Italian twist of orzo, which is a rice shaped pasta - a perfect accompaniment to both hot
or cold dishes (makes great leftovers for lunch!).

Full Name: Mustard and Herb Crusted Pork with Roasted New Potatoes and Tenderstem Broccoli
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Oregano, Pork Fillet, Dijon Mustard, Panko Breadcrumbs, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Pot
Description:
Mmmm ... herbs are truly the saviour of flavour. This crusted pork is enticingly easy and delicious - so much so that you’ll be smacking hands away from your plate throughout dinner. Once you’ve manage
to fight off the quick eaters who’ve finished but can’t get enough of this - dig in and enjoy!

Full Name: Cajun Pork with Bulgur Wheat and Garlicky Spring Greens
Ingredients: Cajun Spice, Honey, Pork Steak, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Spring Greens, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Making bulgur from wheat is one of the oldest food processes in the world - some say it’s over 4000 years old. When something’s been around for that long, you know it must be pretty solid. Add that to rich, deep Cajun pork and some simple garlicky Spring Greens and you’ve got yourself a bit of a feast!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Limey Chicken with Healthy Noodle Broth
Ingredients: Lime, Chicken Breast, Spring Onion, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Cavolo Nero, Rice Noodle, Red Curry Paste, Water, Star Anise, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Bowl, Zester, Knife, Pot, Pan
Description: This broth is both full of delicious flavours and also pretty damn healthy. Cooking the chicken in a pan on high heat before popping it in the oven caramelises the outside to make it extra yummy!

Full Name: Chicken Satay Kebabs with Basmati Rice and Cucumber Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Malay Curry Powder, Lime, Red Onion, Bamboo Skewers, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Cucumber, Coriander, Soy Sauce, Peanut Butter, Water
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife, Plate
Description: A great summer dish, mildly curried chicken skewers with a zesty cucumber salad and nutty satay sauce.

Full Name: Vietnamese Pho with Cavolo Nero and Cashews
Ingredients: Vermicelli Rice Noodles, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Cavolo Nero, Spring Onion, Coriander, Red Curry Paste, Vegetable Stock Pot, Star Anise, Water, Cashew Nuts, Lime, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Pan
Description: When Andre cooked up this delicious Pho at The Fresh Farm, it got straight 10s and we couldn’t stop raving about it for weeks! It’s healthy, full of subtle flavours, and packed with veggies and different textures … it’s a winner!

Full Name: Roasted Chicken with Pancetta and Herbed Lentils
Ingredients: Chicken Thigh, Thyme, Carrot, Onion, Celery Stick, Green Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Green Lentils, Pancetta, Bay Leaf
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Pot, Strainer
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a rustic little cottage somewhere in the Provençal countryside. Lentils are often overlooked in favour of more conventional accompaniments, but when teamed up with pancetta and fresh herbs, they make the perfect bed for your crispy roasted chicken. If you happen to have a bottle of something Provençal in the wine rack then all the better. Bon appétit!

Full Name: Homemade Baking Tray Pizza
Ingredients: Yeast, Water, Flour, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Italian Herbs
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: Pizza is one of those things that everyone loves but not many people make at home. Well that is a thing of the past! Victoria has created this foolproof pizza recipe where you even make your own dough! The key to this recipe is all in the kneading, which, in our opinion can be very therapeutic ... Enjoy!

Full Name: Seared Steak Salad with Chimichurri Dressing
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Oregano, Chilli Flakes, Red Wine Vinegar, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Pan
Description: Luke has a new hero in his life. The poster on his wall of Taylor Swift has been taken down and replaced with a picture of none other than Nick ‘The Knife’ Mellin. He’s one of the guys behind the family run butchers, Roaming Roosters, who support local native British breeds, care about animals and work in collaboration with other local farmers. Located in Lancashire, the gorgeous free-range meat from their farm is what’s hitting your plate. Check out how great these guys are at www.roamingroosters.co.uk.

Full Name: Homemade Rocket Pesto Orzotto with Charred Courgettes and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vine Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Rocket, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Lemon, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: We’re all in favour of teaching new skills and this week we decided homemade pesto is on the menu. Don’t be alarmed at the amount of olive oil we’re asking you to use … the Mediterranean diet is famed for its health benefits, which can be attributed to the extensive use of olive oil. Olive oil is crazy good for you due to its sky high antioxidant levels (found in its phenolic compounds) and omega-9 content. Omega-9 is one of the “good fats” everyone speaks of, with a plethora of health benefits. Olive oil is 85% good fat so tuck in!!!

Full Name: Korean Beef Bulgogi with Ginger Stir Fried Broccoli
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Beef Mince, Boiling Water, Basmati Rice, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Pan
Description: Chinese food has been a regular part of the UK diet since we first started eating ‘After Eight’ mints (admit it, you ate them too!). Korean food on the other hand isn’t so well known. We’re absolutely in love with its flavours and aside from Kimchi (super trendy right now!), Bulgogi is practically a national dish. We’ve simplified it to within an inch of its life, so you can whip it up in minutes at home.

Full Name: Southern Style Chicken and Sweet Potato Chips
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Crème Fraîche, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Salt, Ground Turmeric, Chicken Breast, Panko Breadcrumbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Sometimes you need to get inventive to get the nippers to try something new. Kids these days are wising up to the old ‘hide-theveg- in-the-pasta-sauce’ trick, so we’ve been trying out a few sneaky ways to respin some decadent favourites. Tonight we’re taking southern fried chicken and giving it a total makeover.

Full Name: Panang Prawns with Egg Noodles and Coriander
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Coriander, Panang Curry Paste, Water, Tiger Prawns, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Grater, Pan
Description:
Our chef André wasn’t expecting a visit from a celebrity chef in the HelloFresh kitchen, but a couple of weeks ago that’s exactly what happened. Not so long ago 9 year old Clay sent us a video of his
HelloFresh cooking exploits at home and we were all so blown away, that we asked him to spend an afternoon with us at the Fresh Farm. After obligatory selfies with the entire customer care team (they were star-struck), he headed down to the kitchen to help André and this panang curry was the result. Check out his video at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_F86JJu6BAk ] You rock Clay!

Full Name: Soy and Orange Glazed Pork with Mediterranean Veggies and Couscous
Ingredients: Orange, Soy Sauce, Sugar, Pork Medallion, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Balsamic Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot, Plate
Description:
We love a bit of fruit on meat action! Everyone loves a bit of apple sauce on their pork, but if you’ve never had orange glazed pork, now’s your chance. We adore the way it works with fluffy couscous
and mediterranean veggies.

Full Name: Coriander Spiced Pork with Couscous, and Herby Salsa
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Ground Coriander, Couscous, Boiling Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Oregano, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dijon Mustard, Lemon, Olive Oil, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion
Utensils: Plate, Pot, Pan, Bowl
Description: Each month we nominate a HelloFresh hero - somebody who has gone above and beyond for someone at HelloFresh or for one of our customers, and this month it was none other than Damien. Damien was nominated for multiple reasons … from catching a fainting woman, to driving to Ipswich from London to deliver a HelloFresh box on his day off ... and all with a smile on his face. What a hero!

Full Name: Prince Harry's Birthday Chicken Pie
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Leek, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chicken Breast, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Double Cream, Cheddar Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Grater, Oven dish, Plate
Description: Seeing as it’s Prince Harry’s birthday this week, we thought we’d come up with a delicious British dish, which also happens (apparently) to be Prince Harry’s favourite supper! Chicken pie is (in our opinion) the ultimate comfort food, so we’re not surprised that this is his number one choice! Enjoy!

Full Name: Sausages with Parmesan Swede Wedges with Tenderstem & Red Onion Relish
Ingredients: Swede, Parmesan Cheese, Rosemary, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Tenderstem Broccoli, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage and mash is an absolute classic. But you know how we treat classics at HelloFresh, right? We like to give them a bit of a twist and sprinkle some healthy magic dust on top. So, here’s our sausage with parmesan swede chips. What a treat! And don’t forget your red onion relish. It’s more bangin’ than bangers and mash, trust us!

Full Name: Mimi's Coastal Fish Curry with Green Beans
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cardamom Pod, Tilapia Fillet, Lime, Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Mustard Seeds, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Water
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Pan
Description:
This dish is inspired by Mimi’s time in Asia. The curries we get in the UK are often thick and very rich, but this little number is delicate and fresh. We’re hoping it will transport your taste buds to the Sri Lankan
coast! Traditional Sri Lankan fish dishes often involve marinating for several hours but we’ve used some HelloFresh magic to whip this one up in just half an hour, using a delicious Seasoned Pioneers spice - enjoy!

Full Name: Quickdraw Quesadillas with Tomato Salsa and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Corn on the Cob, Cheddar Cheese, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Black Beans, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Lime, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Bowl, Pan, Sieve, Plate
Description:
Our chef Victoria LOVES quesadillas. Why? Because they are D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S with a capital D. They also remind her of the time when she hopped off to Mexico for a few months with a couple of
Mexican Pesos in her pocket and not much else. She would often eat quesadillas twice a day for weeks on end, and never tire of them! We’re hoping you enjoy these tasty Mexican beauties as much as her -
provecho!

Full Name: Mushroom and Spinach Stroganoff with Cardamon Rice
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Button Mushrooms, Portobello Mushroom, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cardamom Pod, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Basmati Rice, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream, Mild Paprika
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Plate
Description: The original stroganoff was named after Count Pavel Stroganoff, a noted 19th century Russian diplomat and military commander. He lived in Paris but longed for the food of his homeland, so instructed his private chef (lucky him!) to create a French-Russian fusion dish ... and the stroganoff was born!

Full Name: Roasted Butternut Squash and Halloumi Jumble
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Pepper, Smoked Paprika, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Pine Nuts, Halloumi, Red Wine Vinegar, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Apparently, some chefs recommend soaking halloumi in buttermilk for two days before eating it. Our chefs thought they might try this, but owing to the fact that they’re pretty greedy (and really like halloumi), they’ve never been able to wait that long!

Full Name: Chorizo Crusted Tilapia with Miniature Roasties
Ingredients: Chorizo, Panko Breadcrumbs, New Potatoes, Onion, Tilapia Fillet, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: When we started HelloFresh almost five years ago, we were on a mission to get the best quality food, and the knowledge to cook it, to as many people as possible. That’s why we teamed up with James Knight our wonderful fishmongers from the word go. Yes, they supply the Queen, but more importantly they care deeply about sustainable fishing and making sure you get the freshest fish possible. This week they’ve sent us a batch of beautiful tilapia for this quick, tasty dinner. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mushroom, Broccoli and Pancetta Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: BBQ Sausage Skewers with Cheesy Chips and Lemony Avocado Salad
Ingredients: Bamboo Skewers, Red Potato, Cheddar Cheese, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Honey Mustard Sausages, BBQ Sauce, Lemon, Wholegrain Mustard, Honey, Olive Oil, Avocado, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Fork, Knife, Plate
Description: If there’s one thing that makes us happy, it’s seeing families cooking together in the kitchen! This is a great one to get kids involved in … especially threading the sausage and veggie pieces onto the skewers, which is pretty fun (but pretty messy!). Just remember to share your cooking pictures on social media!

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Herbed Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Kecap Manis
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description:
Bulgur wheat isn’t the most frequent guest at the dinner table, so we’ve invited it to join the party for this recipe! High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, it’s a great source of nutrition and, more
importantly, it tastes great. Bulgur wheat is eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia where people have been enjoying it for thousands of years. We’ve teamed it up with a fantastic sweet and sour pork, for a
recipe which is as delicious as it is easy.

Full Name: Yoghurt and Dukkah Crusted Chicken with Aubergine and Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Aubergine, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Chicken Breast, Natural Yoghurt, Super Dukkah Mix
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray
Description:
Have you heard of dukkah? It’s a delicious Egyptian condiment full of nuts, spices and herbs. We’re so inspired by our dukkah suppliers - they ONLY make dukkah, so they’re absolute experts - that we made
this dish in their honour. Voila!

Full Name: Courgette, Broad Bean and Feta Orzotto with Pork Meatballs
Ingredients: Broad beans, Red Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Mint, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Feta Cheese, Lemon, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: Anyone say broad beans? Charlotte, our veggie buyer, loves thesegreen British beauties, so begged us to squirrel them into one of the dishes this week. Our chef, Victoria, accepted the challenge and voilà, a delicious cheesy broad bean orzotto. We’re sending you whole broad beans in their jackets (pods), so that they have a little extra safety padding for their journey to your kitchen this evening – happy podding!

Full Name: Seared Steak with Crispy Potato Salad
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Red Potato, Red Potato, Cherry Plum Tomatoes, Green Beans, Green Beans, Green Olives, Garlic Clove, Balsamic Vinegar, Basil 20g
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Plate
Description:
Our Spanish-inspired potato salad boasts crispy potatoes, briny olives, and fresh green beans for a salad like you’ve never tasted before. It’s hard to compete with a juicy pan-seared steak, but this
salad definitely gives that steak a run for its money.

Full Name: Honey and Mustard Glazed Pork with Apple Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Sage, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Rocket, Green Lentils, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer, Plate
Description:
An apple a day keeps the doctor away – at least that’s what they claim! With carrot, celery, lentils and rocket added to the mix, this dish is absolutely loaded with both flavour and nutrition. Now for
the decadent part ... we have taken the finest pork in the land and glazed it (generously) with the sweetness that only honey can pull off and the warmth of mustard. You are in for a treat!

Full Name: Ksar Char-Bagh Moroccan Beef Burgers
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Harissa Spice Mix, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: “What’s this Ksar Char-Bagh,” we hear you say?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Seasonal Broad Bean Risotto with Balsamic Glazed Cherry Tomatoes
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Arborio Rice, Broad beans, Cherry Plum Tomatoes, Tarragon, Hard Italian Cheese, Balsamic Cream, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Zester, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: Anyone say broad beans? Charlotte, our veggie buyer, loves these green British beauties, so begged us to squirrel them into one of the dishes this week. Our chef, Victoria, accepted the challenge and voilà, a delicious cheesy broad bean risotto. We’re sending you whole broad beans in their jackets (pods) so that they have a little extra safety padding for their journey to your kitchen this evening – happy podding!

Full Name: Steve’s Leaves with Sweet Potato Goat’s Cheese and Pecans
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Beetroot, Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil, Spring Onion, Steve's Leaves Fennel Tops, Sunflower Seeds, Goat's Cheese, Pecan Nuts
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl
Description: “Who the devil is Steve?!” we hear you cry. Well the first thing you need to know is that he has a PhD in the nutritional physiology of watercress and this week he’s joined the kitchen brigade to bring you this tasty recipe. ‘Doctor Watercress’ as he is known to his friends, has been pushing the boundaries of salad leaves for 30 years now and you can thank him for a lot of the leafy innovations that turn up on your plate. Check out his blog and all sorts of fascinating salad related banter at www.stevesleaves.co.uk

Full Name: Cauliflower and Lentil Dal
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cauliflower, Coriander, Green Beans, Curry Powder, Tomato Puree 30g, Organic Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl
Description: Every week we sit down and go through all your recipe scores and comments, and they make a huge difference to the way Head Chef Patrick plans your future dinners. The humble dal is a great example. Of all the Indian recipes we’ve created, this one stands out from the crowd both in taste and pure, body-nourishing warmth.

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Stir-Fried Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Black Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Strainer
Description:
Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and
creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Courgette, Broad Bean and Feta Orzotto with Pork Meatballs
Ingredients: Broad beans, Red Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Mint, Pork & Oregano Sausage, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Feta Cheese, Lemon, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description:
Anyone say broad beans? Charlotte, our veggie buyer, loves these green British beauties, so begged us to squirrel them into one of the dishes this week. Our chef, Victoria, accepted the challenge and voilà,
a delicious cheesy broad bean orzo. We’re sending you whole broad beans in their jackets (pods), so that they have a little extra safety padding for their journey to your kitchen this evening – happy podding!

Full Name: Moroccan Meatball Potato Bake
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Ras-el-Hanout, Beef Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese
Description: In this Top Chef recipe we have given our meatballs a Moroccan twist! We have a few Top Chef tips to making a great meatball. Firstly, don’t be afraid to get your hands dirty! Always mix your meatball ingredients with your hands rather than a spoon. This lighter touch allows all the ingredients to be incorporated without damaging the meat - you don’t want to form a paste! Secondly, when forming your meatballs don’t compact the meat too tightly. It helps to oil your hands before you form your balls so that the mixture does not stick and you can gently and quickly form the balls.

Full Name: Duck Breast with Kohlrabi and Lentils
Ingredients: Kohlrabi, Carrot, Celery Stick, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Duck Breast, Green Lentils, Balsamic Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Orange
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Frying Pan, Baking Tray
Description:
At the Fresh Farm we love to create recipes that will make any home cook feel like a Michelin starred chef. We feel this recipe fits this brief
brilliantly! Orange glazed duck with high end restaurant, but tonight you’ll find it gracing your humble kitchen!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Green Beans, Crème Fraîche, Dijon Mustard, Tarragon, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot
Description:
Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in a while we see a sharp spike in the scores, and until recently
we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: Tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Tuscan Pappardelle with Rich Fennel Pork Ragu
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Pappardelle, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Sometimes you just want to come home and devour a bowl of comforting pasta. Well, we’ve taken pasta to a whole new level with this recipe. Delicious Tuscan pork sausages from our friends at Roaming Roosters (along with some other yummy ingredients), make for a pretty tasty sauce, and coupled with our beautiful pappardelle pasta, we promise you’ll be very happy!

Full Name: Vegetable Tagine with Kohlrabi, Wholemeal Couscous and Black Olive Salsa
Ingredients: Kohlrabi, Courgette, Echalion Shallot, Celery Stick, Carrot, Chermoula Spice, Cinnamon Stick, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Boiling Water, Wholewheat Couscous, Coriander, Black Olives, Lemon, Chickpeas, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Strainer
Description: You may not have tasted a kohlrabi before, but we assure you, you will definitely want to taste one again after this delicious tagine hits your taste buds! Kohlrabi originates from the German words ‘kohl’ which means cabbage and ‘rube’ which means turnip. Guess what it tastes of?!

Full Name: Aubergine Linguine with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Wholewheat Tagliatelle, Chopped Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: Somedays you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. The sun-dried tomatoes used in this recipe are made from fresh tomatoes that are left for around ten days in the sun and lose roughly 90% of their water. This process intensifies their flavour so that even a couple will add a burst of sweet, intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Sticky Chicken Drumsticks with Herby Potatoes
Ingredients: Chicken Drumstick, BBQ Sauce, Honey, Dried Thyme, Red Potato, Carrot, White Cabbage, Lime, Smoked Paprika, Coriander, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Knife
Description: This is a real family favourite, but the HelloFresh healthy version! Sticky chicken drumsticks (coated in our delicious BBQ sauce), herby roasted potatoes and a healthy coleslaw. We recommend using your hands for the chicken, instead of a knife and fork … cutlery and chicken drumsticks are a tricky combination!

Full Name: Teriyaki Beef
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Bok Choy, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: The pearly white seeds you see here don’t come straight out of the fruit that way. They must be hulled from their darker shells first. We’re told that the famous phrase ‘Open Sesame’ from Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves is a reference to ripe sesame seeds popping out of their shells. Dinner and useful trivia … #winning.

Full Name: Pan Fried Sea Bream with Sweet Cherry Tomato Sauce
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, New Potatoes, Cherry Plum Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sea Bream Fillet, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: We love the instant gratification of food. The best things in life often take a long time to create, but a great recipe is the perfect antidote to long-term graft. One minute it’s a picture and a few lines of text on a recipe card, 30 minutes later it’s sitting on a plate in front of you and 5 minutes after that it’s gone! This one is definitely best enjoyed with a glass of something cold out in the fresh air.

Full Name: Saucy Mascarpone and Bacon Gnocchi with Salad
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Plum Tomatoes, Cucumber, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Gnocchi, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Baby Spinach, Mascarpone Cheese, Lime, Honey, Olive Oil, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Mix, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Gnocchi is quite rich, so we’ve included lots of veggies, and haven’t loaded up your plate with too much gnocchi, as it’s pretty filling! When our sales team tested this recipe, it was their absolute favourite dish. Delicious creamy gnocchi with a zingy salad is a winning combination (according to them), so we hope you enjoy it just as much!

Full Name: Chermoula Spiced Lamb and Minted Courgette Salad
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Carrot, Lamb Mince, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chermoula Spice, Water, Cheddar Cheese, Courgette, Mint, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan, Spoon
Description:
Not so long ago Head Chef Patrick headed off to Morocco for a bit of recipe reconnaissance. Winding through the back streets of a local
market with the scent of wood shavings, spices and charcoal grills in the air, he discovered a hole-in-the-wall eatery that specialised in
chermoula spiced lamb. See the adventure that inspired this recipe at blog.hellofresh.co.uk/our-stories/morocco/

Full Name: Poppy Seed Crusted Chicken With Creamy Rigatoni
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Thyme, Rigatoni Pasta, Leek, Garlic Clove, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Double Cream, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Panko Breadcrumbs, Poppy Seeds, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Strainer
Description:
Traditionally poppy seeds are sprinkled over breads and in cakes to give a sweet and nutty flavour. We decided to reinvent the poppy
seed as a crusted topping for our creamy chicken pasta bake. Just keep a toothpick handy for any rogue seeds, particularly if it is date night!

Full Name: Bacon Wrapped Pork Loin Medallion with Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, King Edward Potato, King Edward Potato, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Pork Medallion, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Black Peppercorns, Double Cream, Milk, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion
Utensils: Knife, Large Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Pot, Potato Masher
Description:
Does the aroma of bacon wafting up from the kitchen on a Saturday morning get your mouth watering? Now think of a tender pork
medallion wrapped in bacon teamed with fluffy mashed potato. Got your mouth watering yet? Yes we thought so!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Cod Parcel with Fragrant Couscous and Orange Dressing
Ingredients: Wholewheat Couscous, Vegetable Stock Pot, Boiling Water, Chermoula Spice, Cod Fillet, Orange, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Zester, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description:
It’s no secret that our chef Vix prides herself on her Moroccan inspired recipes. Chef André thought he would give her a bit of a run
for her money and team a sweet and delicately flavoured Moroccan couscous with spicy cod. Even Vix thinks this one is a winner!

Full Name: Asian Mushroom Broth with Udon Noodles
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Curry Paste, Water, Enoki Mushrooms, Coriander, Spring Onion, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Udon Noodles, Sesame Seeds, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Our dream is that every recipe is a mini adventure into the kingdom of cooking. Broth is super trendy at the moment and mushrooms will never go out of fashion - so André has added some udon noodles to the mix to make this a HelloFresh special. MMMmm!

Full Name: Courgette Parmigiana with Insalata Caprese
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Tomato Passata, Dried Oregano, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Oven dish
Description:
When we started HelloFresh from Patrick’s living room a few short years ago, we wanted to make dinner time easy. Whilst the emphasis
has always been on quick and tasty, there are certain recipes that deserve a bit more time and this parmigiana is one of them. We
recommend enlisting a sous chef to assist you with the prep. They’ll be more than happy to help once they smell what’s on the menu!

Full Name: Herby Dukkah Crusted Pork with Crushed Potatoes and Green Salad
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Lemon, Potato, Super Dukkah Mix, Pork Medallion, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Leaves
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray, Pot, Fork
