Description: According to our lovely Dukkah suppliers: ‘The Dukkah Company’, Dukkah can add a bit of magic to any dish, and we have to agree! The delicious blend of almonds, hazelnuts, sesame and spices will make your taste buds very happy. You’re onto a winner for dinner!

Full Name: Record Breaking Chicken Paella
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Chicken Thighs, Boiling Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Rosemary, Chorizo, Basmati Rice, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description: This chicken paella has managed to sneak in some spicy chorizo for double meaty goodness. Bold, even by our standards! This is a great dish for sharing with friends and family - just put the pot in the middle of the table and watch the spoons, forks and... even hands fling themselves toward it. It’s a real crowd-pleaser that you will love to cook again and again.

Full Name: Beef Ragout with Rigatoni, Black Olive and Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Dried Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Boiling Water, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Black Olives, Vine Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Large Pot, Pot, Bowl, Strainer
Description: We think this twist on the classic spag bol is a winner! Packed with flavour and extra nutrients, it will have everyone in your home going back for more - better get in there quick!

Full Name: Baked Cheesy Chicken Taquito with Zesty Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Mexican Spice, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Grater, Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description:
Taquitos are a traditional Mexican street food which are normally deep fried. We didn’t think that a deep fat fryer was something we
could expect everyone to have in their kitchen cupboard, so we’ve baked them instead which is also a lot more healthy! They should
crisp nicely in the oven while the cheesy centre melts... get excited because they’re delicious!

Full Name: Grilled Aubergine Spaghetti with Chilli, Chorizo and Sun Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Spaghetti, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: Some days you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with the classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their sweetness so that even a couple will add a burst of intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Redcurrant Jelly, Water
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description:
In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak
super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t even really know how to cook a steak well done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Pork Chops with Glazed Apples and Potatoes
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Braeburn Apple, Spring Onion, Sweetheart Cabbage, Pork Chops, Honey, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Wholegrain Mustard, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Plate
Description: We love a classic British dish and what could be more classic than pork chops and apple sauce? If possible, we think it can be made slightly better with homemade glazed apples! We have sourced the sweetest apples to bring out the most delicious flavour of the pork. Enjoy!

Full Name: Kylie’s Super Mexican Cottage Pie
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Green Pepper, Carrot, Onion, Red Chilli, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Chopped Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Baking Dish
Description: Who is this Kylie and why is this a super cottage pie? Kylie is a travelling filmmaker, who has created a few of our favourite guest recipes over the last few years. This one comes from a recent adventure she had in Mexico City; you can watch the short film she made by searching “Kylie Flavell in Mexico” on YouTube. Oh, and why super? Because it’s chock full of body boosting goodness!

Full Name: Harissa Halloumi with Pomegranate Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Water, Lemon, Bulgur Wheat, Red Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vine Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: Undoubtedly one of the most beautiful ingredients you can lay your mitts on, the pomegranate has been celebrated as a symbol of ambition and prosperity since Ancient Egypt. In fact, it seems that pretty much every ancient culture from the Middle East to the Far East has drawn, praised and written about it. For tonight’s dinner, you’ll be taking the bold step of adding it to this delicious recipe and we’re pretty sure you’ll be making your own little piece of dinner time history.

Full Name: Coconut Caribbean Soup with Home Baked Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Lime, Red Kidney Beans, Poudre de Columbo, Dried Thyme, Chopped Tomatoes, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Tags: Veggie, Vegan, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Healthy
Description: Poudre de Columbo is a Caribbean curry powder from our wonderful spice suppliers ‘Seasoned Pioneers’. It smells pretty damn good and cooked with creamy coconut milk, veggies and crispy tortilla chips on the side, it tastes pretty damn good too! Get stuck in!

Full Name: Spiced Cauliflower and Courgettes with Yellow Rice, Pistachios and Coriander
Ingredients: Cauliflower, Courgette, Nigella Seeds, Ground Turmeric, Onion, Garlic Clove, Mustard Seeds, Basmati Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander, Vine Tomatoes, Raisins, Spring Onion, Lime, Pistachios
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: It’s hard to describe this dish and its amazingness. There are just so many wonderful ingredients, so André thought - why not just bring them together to make this epic spiced cauliflower and courgette, with yellow rice and pistachios. You’ve got crunch, spice and tang - what more could you need?

Full Name: Chicken with Honey Infused Greek Yoghurt and Ginger Rice
Ingredients: Courgette, Coriander, Ginger, Basmati Rice, Water, Coriander Seeds, Chilli Flakes, Greek Yoghurt, Honey, Lime, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Knife, Grater, Pan, Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description:
We love our alternative remedies down at the Fresh Farm. Vivian is often spritzing the air with a chamomile and lavender calmness spray and Luke is never far away from his shea butter hand cream. For this recipe, we decided to make food your family’s pharmacy. Coriander contains natural antihistamines, chilli has anti-bacterial properties,
ginger and honey are nature’s anti-inflammatories and Greek yoghurt just tastes great! A nutritional powerhouse that tickles your taste buds? Just what the doctor ordered!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed HelloFresh Chorizo Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Rolling Pin, Spoon
Description: At the HelloFresh Farm we get pretty excited about pizza. But a combination of pizza and pie; the deliciousness is overwhelming!! This week we are bringing you the calzone - a pizza pie! We get the freshest dough from our supplier the Northern Dough Company, to make sure you get the tastiest pizza pie.

Full Name: Spicy Sausage Hot Pot with Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Spiced Pork Sausage, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Smoked Paprika, Ground Coriander, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Kidney Beans, Spring Onion, Lemon, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Pot, Grater, Strainer, Plate
Description: While many of us may be slowly dragging our feet into the chilliness of autumn, the changing of seasons is an exciting time at the FreshFarm. We love the new and varied ingredients each new season brings. To help you join in on our excitement André has whipped up an easy, warming stew with delicious, smoky flavours - a real warmer on a cold autumnal evening.

Full Name: Sweet Potato Cottage Pie with Roasted Broccoli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Broccoli, Sweet Potato, Potato, Beef Mince, Netherend Butter Salted, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Baking Dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mimi’s mum is said to make the absolute best cottage pie in the world. So, Mimi whipped up this recipe for her mum, because she knew if her mum liked it - it’d be a winner. Thankfully Mrs Morley gave her seal of approval (with a lot of mmmmmms to go with it)!

Full Name: Rosemary Glazed Chicken with Purple Mash and Buttered Leeks
Ingredients: Purple Potato 450g, Purple potato 700g, Leek, Spring Onion, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Chicken Breast, Tracklements Rosemary Jelly, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Dish, Pan, Baking Tray, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Our chef André loves a classic dish with a twist. What could be more classic than roast chicken, where is the twist you may ask? Well have you ever had roast chicken with purple mashed potato? We thought not! We think this dish is even better than the classic!

Full Name: Pork Satay Burgers with Paprika Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Small Sweet Potato, Coriander, Lime, Salted Peanuts, Pork Mince, Soy Sauce, Baby Gem Lettuce, Carrot, Peanut Butter, Brioche Bun, Mild Paprika 1.5 tsp, Mild Paprika, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description:
Satay is usually done with chicken, but we’ve gone a bit ‘out there’ and created our very own pork satay burger! When you add in the zinginess of the lime and the creamy crunch of peanuts - you’ve got yourself a
burger that is beyond scrumptious!

Full Name: Malay Chicken and Red Lentil Curry
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Cardamom Pod, Water for Rice, Basmati Rice, Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Water, Red Split Lentils, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt, Chicken Stock Pot, Malay Curry Powder
Utensils: Pan, Pot, Knife, Plate
Description: This delicious little curry ticks all the boxes, it’s super easy to prepare and cook, quick to wash up and, most importantly, tastes absolutely amazing! We think it will become a firm favourite in your kitchen!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Pine Nuts and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Pine Nuts, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Black Olives, Red Onion, Tomato Passata, Ciabatta, Cheddar Cheese, Dried Oregano
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pan, Knife, Bowl
Description:
Sicily, ‘The Old Country’, the birthplace of Vito Corleone and home to one of our favourite Italian dishes: Caponata. Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania
and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats. Buon Appetito!

Full Name: Psychedelic Veggie Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: Purple Potato 450g, Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Lentils, Ground Coriander, Ground Coriander
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Pan, Grater, Potato Masher, Baking Dish
Description: We have taken a trip down memory lane with this hippy trippy veggie shepherd’s pie. Not only is this dish packed with fibre, nutrients and antioxidants (from the trippy potatoes) it tastes great too! We hope you enjoy this feast for both your eyes and taste buds!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Easy Purple Potato Fish Pie
Ingredients: Purple Potato 450g, Leek, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sweetcorn, Water, Fish Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Smoked Fish Mix, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Cup, Baking Dish, Potato Masher, Bowl
Description: At the HelloFresh Farm we love to reinvent a classic dish and make it even better. In this dish we have made the classic fish pie, which is normally quite faffy, into a super simple, quick and easy to prepare meal. In addition, we’re adding funky purple potato mash, with all of the deliciousness of regular mash, but more of the nutritional benefits of the antioxidant rich purple potato.

Full Name: Bangladeshi Lamb Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Peas, Curry Powder, Lamb Mince, Mint, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Water
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Biryani is traditionally made with a leg of goat, but here we’ve made it with our delicious lamb mince from butchers Roaming Roosters. It’s a traditional dish from South Asia and is often served at weddings and on big occasions… and is also delicious as a mid-week meal! Enjoy!

Full Name: Pork and Apple Sauce with Chantenay Carrots and Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Pork Loin Fillet, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Cox's Apple, Honey, Vegetable Stock Pot, Apple and Sage Jelly, Water
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Plate
Description:
There’s nothing more comforting than food with a twist of nostalgia and this recipe is one of those classics, that so many of us grew up with. Pork, with a tangy apple sauce is the perfect comfort food. So, gather
the family around the dinner table and dig in! Why Chantenay carrots? These stocky looking little fellows are known for being the sweetest of all the carrot family. If you ask us, they’re the perfect complement to our creamy, crunchy roast potatoes.

Full Name: Mushroom, Broccoli and Pancetta Gnocchi..
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Mushroom, Broccoli and Pancetta Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Water, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coconut Rice and Toasted Cashews
Ingredients: Bok Choy, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce, Cashew Nuts, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Spoon, Bowl
Description:
Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish
in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you
years to master.

Full Name: Pan-Seared Sea Bass with New Potatoes and Cucumber-Dill Relish
Ingredients: Cucumber, Red Onion, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, White Wine Vinegar, Sea Bass Fillets, Dill, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Pot, Bowl, Pan, Plate
Description:
The star of this delicious summery dish is the sea bass from the guys over at JK Mayfair (who also supply fish to the Queen!). The trick with getting a crispy skin on your fish is to use a medium-hot pan, and while
the skin is cooking, try not to move the fish… it’s that easy!

Full Name: Southern Style Chicken and Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Crème Fraîche, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Salt, Ground Turmeric, Chicken Breast, Panko Breadcrumbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description:
Sometimes you need to get inventive to get the nippers to try something new. Kids these days are wising up to the old ‘hide-the-veg-in-the-pastasauce’ trick, so we’ve been trying out a few sneaky ways to respin some
decadent favourites. Tonight, we’re taking southern fried chicken and giving it a total makeover.

Full Name: Spicy Sausage Chilli with Homemade Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Chives, Spicy Sausage, Red Kidney Beans, Smoked Paprika, Ground Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Sieve, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description:
At the HelloFresh Farm, we like to pack as much flavour as possible into our dishes, in as short a time scale as we can. Our trick in achieving this is to use sausage meat already packed with delicious ingredients.
This little trick gives you the best tasting dish in minimal time! You are welcome!

Full Name: Persian Freekeh Pilaf with Mango Halloumi and Balsamic Charred Peppers
Ingredients: Onion, Red Pepper, Mint, Chermoula Spice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Balsamic Vinegar, Pistachios, Halloumi, Mango Chutney 40g, Lemon, Water, Freekeh
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: We’ve packed extra flavour into this delicious dish by caramelising the halloumi in mango chutney. The sugar in the chutney loses its water content and starts to ‘brown’ which gives it a beautiful glossy texture and an amazing golden caramel flavour. We hope you enjoy!

Full Name: Quickfire Enchiladas with Homemade Citrus Guacamole
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Mexican Spice, Red Kidney Beans, Coriander, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Pan, Fork, Knife, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up most of the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces. Keep a few whole ones back for texture too... Arriba!

Full Name: Seasonal Veggie Paella
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Button Mushrooms, Button Mushrooms, Red Kidney Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Tomato Puree 30g, Peas, Lemon, Black Olives, Red Pepper, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description:
The Spanish are considered to be very passionate, especially when it comes to their food! Traditional paellas come in many forms, but most can be easily recreated in your own kitchen. This FreshFarm veggie
paella encompasses delicious spices, seasonal vegetables and kidney beans to make this a well-rounded meal packed full of plant proteins! Place this beautiful and comforting dish right in the middle of your
dinner table because after all, this communal style of eating is the best and most traditional way to enjoy it!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red Cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Redcurrant Jelly, Water
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak is worth its weight in gold along with horse racing and chocolate. The thing is her whole family loves their steak super rare, or blue as the French say. So much so, that her mum doesn’t really know how to cook a steak well done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Oven Baked Bacon and Mushroom Risotto with Creamed Spinach
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Tarragon, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Chicken Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Baby Spinach, White Wine Vinegar, Crème Fraîche, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Spoon
Description: Risotto is such a delicious, creamy dish, but all the stirring that is required can often be a bit a daunting. André has simplified the process into the easiest recipe. Forget about the stirring, just shove your risotto in your oven - no stirring necessary, but with all the tastiness you would expect from a risotto. Enjoy!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Potato, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Shawarma Spice Mix, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Pot, Grater, Potato Masher, Baking Dish
Description: Potato skin has plenty of nutrients and more than half the fibre found in a potato is within its skin. So, why then do we peel these delightful little tubers? In this speedy shepherd’s pie we mash the potato, skin and all - and it is still creamy and delicious! We hope this super quick family favourite gives you time to put your feet up and enjoy a glass of wine!

Full Name: Spicy Sausage Chilli. with Homemade Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Chives, Spiced Pork Sausage, Red Kidney Beans, Smoked Paprika, Ground Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description:
At the HelloFresh Farm, we like to pack as much flavour as possible into our dishes, in as short a time scale as we can. Our trick in achieving this is to use sausage meat already packed with delicious ingredients.
This little trick gives you the best tasting dish in minimal time! You are welcome!

Full Name: Ksar Char-Bagh Moroccan Beef Burgers.
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Harissa Spice Mix, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: “What’s this Ksar Char-Bagh,” we hear you say?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Tuscan Pappardelle with Rich Fennel Pork Ragu
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Pappardelle, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: Sometimes you just want to come home and devour a bowl of comforting pasta. Well, we’ve taken pasta to a whole new level with this recipe. Delicious Tuscan pork sausages from our friends at Roaming Roosters (along with some other yummy ingredients), make for a pretty tasty sauce, and coupled with our beautiful pappardelle pasta, we promise you’ll be very happy!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coconut Rice and Bok Choy
Ingredients: Bok Choy, Water for Rice, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl, Fork, Plate
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. For thrill seekers out there, Fugu is a well-known delicacy which, if prepared incorrectly, can kill a rhinoceros within minutes. Chefs train for years to prepare the fish in just the right way, but they always leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips. Apparently diners enjoy the brush with death. We’re glad to say that teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master.

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Flank Steak, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Water
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description:
If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result:
1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it.
2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in.
3) Make sure you rest your steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it.
Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Spiced Pork with Creamy Lentils and Nigella Chapatis
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Olive Oil, Wholemeal Tortilla, Green Lentils, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Malay Curry Powder, Nigella Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray
Description: André has whipped up this great winter warmer to get you through the darkest of evenings. The fiery Malay spiced pork is tempered with creamy, filling lentils. He has even topped it off with super quick nigella seed flavoured chapatis - a taste sensation!

Full Name: Beef Ragout with Rigatoni, Black Olive and Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Dried Thyme, Tomato Passata, Tomato Puree 30g, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Black Olives, Vine Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Pot, Bowl, Strainer
Description: We think this twist on the classic spag bol is a winner! Packed with flavour and extra nutrients, it will have everyone in your home going back for more - better get in there quick!

Full Name: Cumberland Sausages with Roasted Garlic Mash and Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Red Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Garlic Clove, Cumberland Sausage, Rosemary, Cornflour, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Milk
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Pot, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: So, you might call us crazy, but trust us - what Patrick is about to say will revolutionise your mashed potato experience. Here goes: “Roast your garlic until it’s nice and soft and then mash it into your potatoes”, says Patrick. For a mash you can be proud of... get cooking!

Full Name: Creamy Vegetable and Feta Pie
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Leek, Celery Stick, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Thyme, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Kale and Rainbow Chard Mix, Panko Breadcrumbs, Feta Cheese, Double Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: At the Fresh Farm we dedicate a lot of time to customer feedback. Recently our lovely veggie customers have been requesting a vegetarian potato dish… Well your wish is our command! This delicious, creamy and comforting dinner is full of vegetables and topped with some crunchy breadcrumbs and feta… yum!

Full Name: Winter Warming Pork, Sage and Apple Casserole
Ingredients: Onion, Leek, Celery Stick, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Sage, Plain Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Cider Vinegar, Water, Potato, Pork Loin Fillet, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl, Potato Masher, Frying Pan
Description: There are few British flavour combinations as celebrated as apple and pork. Whether it’s in the form of a tasty little Cumberland sausage or chunky apple sauce on some roast pork, we love it. But how about a new twist? Our pork, sage and apple casserole brings tangy apple and sumptuous pork together in an eye-opening, taste bud tingling way! Enjoy.

Full Name: Smoked Cheese Burger with Sweet Potato Wedges and Rocket Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Beef Mince, Garlic Salt, Ketchup, Dried Oregano, Smoked Cheese, Brioche Bun, Vine Tomatoes, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan, Knife
Description:
Oregano is one of the nation’s most loved herbs. But while we sprinkle it into pasta sauces and lasagnes with ease, our burgers often lack this tasty herb. Well, no more! This beef burger is as happy as can be with its
new Italian buddy, oregano. And don’t forget to add this amazing Stokes ketchup. It’s DELICIOUS!

Full Name: A Slightly Surreal Singapore Chicken Laksa
Ingredients: Water, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Coriander, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Peanut Butter, Lime, Chicken Thighs, Egg Noodle Nest
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description:
Sometimes life throws bizarre situations at us. Patrick experienced this in Singapore airport recently when he was sitting in the food hall and suddenly saw himself on the television. Turns out his Italian cooking
show had made it over to the Far East and it wasn’t long before the staff in the restaurant were piling his plate high with all sorts of local deliciousness*. One of the six main courses (!) was a mouthwatering Singapore Laksa - practically a national dish. This one’s for the team at Singapore airport!
*In hindsight, probably not the wisest decision before enduring a 12 hour flight back to London.

Full Name: Chicken Fajitas with Pickled Chillies and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Red Onion, Green Chilli, Lime, Cheddar Cheese, Chicken Breast, Mexican Spice, Sour Cream, Flour Tortillas
Utensils: Knife, Bowl
Description: Fajitas are the ultimate crowd-pleaser, especially with ingredients as delicious as these. We’re upping the ante with our Mexican spice and an unbeatable zesty lime and sour cream topping. Finishedwith tangy quick-pickled green chillies, this will be a fajita night to remember.

Full Name: Creamy-Chivey Smoked Haddock with Crushed Potatoes and Buttery Greens
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Smoked Haddock, Milk, Chives, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description:
Our chef Victoria comes from Scotland, so she’s using her favourite Scottish staple: smoked haddock. Locals from the fishing town of Finnan tuck into a bowl of warm poached Finnan Haddie (haddock,
cold smoked over peat in Finnan) for brekkie! This dish is a gentler more fragrant version of this famous Scottish breakfast, served with some trusty crushed potato and delicious healthy greens.

Full Name: Tender Stir-Fried Pork with Black Bean Sauce and Cashew Nuts
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Water, Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Pepper, Carrot, Spring Onion, Cashew Nuts, Black Bean Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Pot, Pan
Description:
Certain dishes can’t help but inspire nostalgia. Black bean sauce was one of the gateway dishes into our childhood obsession with Chinese food. Tonight, we’ve teamed it up with a beautifully cut piece of Pork
Loin from our butcher extraordinaire Nick ‘The Knife’. We’ve thrown in a little restaurant trick too, by adding cornflour to make your meat melt-in-the-mouth tender!

Full Name: Treat Day Tomato, Chorizo and Mozzarella Orzo
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella and succulent cherry tomatoes… what more could you want? Our orzo is made by Delverde who use mineral water from the mountains in their pasta, which in our opinion creates something really quite special.

Full Name: One-Pot Vegetarian Chilli with Quinoa
Ingredients: Quinoa, Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Carrot, Coriander, Red Kidney Beans, Ground Cumin, Chilli Powder, Ground Cinnamon, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Lime, Sour Cream, Cornflour
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Tags: Healthy, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Veggie
Description: Presenting to you another versatile HelloFresh ‘one-pot wonder’! This delicious dish has a bit of a twist - quinoa (yes, cooked in the same pot as the chilli)! It still contains all of the flavours you know and love but with some new earthy cinnamon tones, add to this some hearty kidney beans, and you have one very satisfying and nutritious meal. Go for it!

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Roasted Aubergine and Mushrooms
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Water, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: In the world of curry, as in the world of cowboys, there are the good, the bad and the ugly. Amongst the bad ones are those that sit there innocuously on your plate, not saying boo to a goose, but loaded with enough chilli to take down a rhino. As for the ugly, you need only go to the local take-away. For this Thai massaman rice we combined the creaminess of peanut butter (our secret ingredient!) and coconut milk with the fresh tanginess of coriander and lime. It’s so good it should be made a saint!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Gnocchi Pomodoro with Walnut Chive Pesto
Ingredients: Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Gnocchi, Walnuts, Chives, Lemon, Olive Oil, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description:
Gnocchi with pesto is an all time favourite and we’ve given this one a fresh twist, by pan-frying the gnocchi to give it a beautiful crisp texture. We’ve also mixed up the pesto by replacing the usual basil and pine nuts
with chives and walnuts. This dish went down a treat at the HelloFresh Farm, we hope your family loves it too!

Full Name: Chicken Piccata with Buttery Garlic Sauce and Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Broccoli, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dried Thyme, Chicken Breast, Flour, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan
Description: In this tasty dish, you will be making an emulsion! An emulsion basically means combining fat and water, and it is the technique behind many great sauces like hollandaise, mayonnaise and aioli. Chemically speaking, water and fat do not mix, so in order to get these molecules to emulsify we beat the fat into as small particles as possible (this is where a whisk comes in handy!). In this recipe your emulsion will create a lovely thick buttery sauce perfect for roast veggies!

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunch, on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this recipe we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing meal that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: Pork Chop with Roasted Butternut, Braised Savoy and Apple and Sage Glaze
Ingredients: Savoy Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Pancetta, Pork Chops, Apple and Sage Jelly, Butternut Squash
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan, Baking Dish
Description:
You may be familiar with braising meat but in this recipe you will be braising cabbage! Braising is a combination cooking method, that uses both dry and moist heat. Braising usually follows two steps; first, pan searing
the cabbage on high heat, allowing it to brown and improve in flavour and second, simmering in liquid on low heat, allowing it to be packed full of moisture and giving a richer flavour.

Full Name: Fragrant Lamb Pilaf with Spinach, Apricots and Minted Yoghurt
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Onion, Ras-el-Hanout, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Mint, Lentils, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Our chef André has created this tasty lamb pilaf and given it a hearty boost with the addition of lentils. Lentils are a great filler in a dish, as they are packed full of fibre. The type of fibre found in lentils has fantastic benefits for heart and digestive health as well as keeping blood sugar levels stable. This dish also has a delicious flavour profile with zingy, minty yoghurt and hints of sweetness from the dried apricot.

Full Name: Treat Day Tomato, Chorizo and Mozzarella Orzo.
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella and succulent cherry tomatoes… what more could you want? Our orzo is made by Delverde who use mineral water from the mountains in their pasta, which in our opinion creates something really quite special.

Full Name: Chermoula Spiced Salmon with Freekeh Pilaf and Toasted Sesame Seeds
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Chermoula Spice, Olive Oil, Salmon fillet, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sesame Seeds, Lemon, Freekeh
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: Freekeh is an ancient grain that is set to knock quinoa off its superfood throne! Freekeh is a great source of both protein and fibre, which helps maintain healthy blood sugar levels. Combine this delicious grain with the brain boosting omega 3 oils found in salmon and we have a nutritional knockout!

Full Name: Mixed Bean and Pork Chilli with Brown Rice and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Pork and Oregano Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Mixed Beans, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Sour Cream, Ground Cumin
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Sausage meat in a chilli?! Yes, you read it right! It may be slightly crazy, but we assure you the delicious sausage meat from Roaming Roosters is an amazing meaty alternative to beef mince. Enjoy!

Full Name: Provençal Grilled Chicken with Body Boosting Veg
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Courgette, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Tomato Puree 30g, Red Wine Vinegar, Crème Fraîche, Provencale Herbs
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Plate
Description: This recipe is loaded with beautiful fresh veggies that really pull their weight in the nutritional stakes. Team these with a perfectly cooked herby chicken and you could be transported to the French countryside. We think this dish is best served with a bottle of something Provençal, just to increase the nutritional value!

Full Name: Lahmacun AKA Turkish Spiced Lamb Flatbread
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Lamb Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Flatbread, Feta Cheese, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Shawarma Spice Mix
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: Tonight we’re preparing Lahmacun, or more commonly known as Turkish flatbread. Lahmacun is a thin piece of dough, traditionally topped with minced beef or lamb (as it is here). With these tasty flavours all topped over moreish bread, it’s no wonder this dish has existed for thousands of years!

Full Name: Roasted Honey Feta with Garlicky Lentils and Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Echalion Shallot, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Feta Cheese, Lentils, Lemon, Olive Oil, Honey, Rocket, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Sieve, Bowl, Fork, Frying Pan
Description: Don’t let the amazing flavours of this dish distract you from the fantastic nutritional benefits you’ll find in the ingredients! The lentils and sweet potato are great sources of fibre to keep your blood sugar stable and your tummy feeling full! In addition rocket, pomegranate seeds, garlic and cherry tomatoes provide an array of phytonutrients just look at their beautiful rainbow colours to give you an idea!

Full Name: Lentil and Vegetable Hotpot with a Cheesy Potato Topping
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Green Lentils, Flat Leaf Parsley, Potato, Potato, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Soy Sauce, English Mustard, Baby Spinach, Netherend Butter Salted, Cheddar Cheese, Provencale Herbs
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Dish
Description: Lovely lentils and some tasty cheddar cheese provide a great twist on this British classic. It’s a dish that is part hotpot and part casserole with a nutritious blend of vegetables and lentils (perfect for helping with your ‘five-a-day’), plus a delicious sauce and some hearty potatoes! We topped it with cheese for that extra treat!

Full Name: Hoisin Pork with Noodles, Peppers and Beansprouts
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Pork Medallion, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Water, Beansprouts, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: A lot of people think of duck when they hear the word hoisin. But hoisin sauce is incredibly versatile and it’s delicious on a lot of things - including pork. Don’t believe us? Just give our hoisin pork with noodles, peppers and beansprouts a go, and you’ll be eating your hat as well!

Full Name: Chicken Tandoori Wraps with Bombay Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Onion, Chicken Thighs, Natural Yoghurt, Tandoori Masala Spice, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime, Vine Tomatoes, Ground Turmeric, Mustard Seeds, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Pan
Description: Turmeric has become quite the popular spice. This is because it contains a chemical called curcumin, which has great antiinflammatory properties. These anti-inflammatory traits make it useful in treating joint, digestive and heart conditions. You may have seen trendsetters adding it to all sorts of foods, even their coffee! We have used it in a more traditional manner in these tasty wraps.

Full Name: Super Quick Fish Curry with Cardamon Rice
Ingredients: Cardamom Pod, Water for Rice, Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Poudre de Columbo, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Cornflour, Baby Spinach, Smoked Fish Mix, Natural Yoghurt, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl
Description: Do dark winter days have you daydreaming of blue skies and warm seas? We thought we would help cheer up a chilly winter’s night by transporting you to the Caribbean with these heart warming flavours! This tasty little curry is packed with beautiful fresh veggies and delicious seafood - winter be gone!

Full Name: Sausages with Broccoli and Potato Gratin and Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Thyme, Carrot, Red Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Pancetta, Double Cream, Dijon Mustard, Panko Breadcrumbs, Cumberland Sausage, Honey, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Grater, Knife, Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish, Baking Tray
Description: Potato dauphinoise is possibly the most luxurious and delicious invention on the planet (according to our chef Mimi). This gratin however, is the slightly healthier version. Potatoes and broccoli combined with pancetta and cream, go hand in hand with some delicious sausages from our friends at Roaming Roosters, and with a side of honey glazed carrots, you can’t go wrong!

Full Name: Apricot and Pecan Stuffed Pork with Honey Glazed Carrots and Green Mash
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Pecan Nuts, Dried Apricots, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Loin Fillet, Pork Loin Fillet, Pork Loin Fillet, Cocktail Sticks, Honey, Tracklements Apple and sage Jelly, Mixed Chantenay Carrots
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Purple carrots and green mash sound like an interesting combination, however they are packed full of nutrients. A colourful plate is the key to a nutrient dense meal! By combining broccoli with potato your mash is still delicious and creamy but contains much more fibre, B vitamins and phytonutrients, such as cancer fighting sulforaphane. Little purple chantenay carrots take a bit more time to prepare but their taste and nutritional profile make up for it. They are packed full of vitamin A, beta carotene and the antioxidant anthocyanin.

Full Name: Surprisingly Filling Mexican Broth with Spicy Beef and Beans
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Mixed Beans, Potato, Coriander, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla, Sour Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This recipe calls for only one or two tortillas which means you will have quite a few leftover! We hate waste so are always thinking of ways to use leftover ingredients. One suggestion is to make ovenbaked tortilla chips (healthier than deep fried but still delicious!). You can brush them with oil and then make them savoury with a sprinkling of salt and some paprika, or sweet with cinnamon and sugar. A few minutes in a hot oven and voilà!

Full Name: Bacon, Chilli and Butternut Squash Risotto
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Parmesan Cheese, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Ladle
Description: Risotto is the ultimate comfort food; it’s warm, creamy and satisfying. With just the right amount of heat from the chillies, creaminess from the risotto rice and the roasted butternut squash, you’ll be cosying up on the couch to enjoy this bowl of goodness. Don’t forget the all important final squeeze of lemon!

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Spaghetti
Utensils: Pan
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunch, on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this recipe we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing meal that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: Roasted Chantenay Carrots with Lentil Dahl and Cumin Spiced Chapatis
Ingredients: Mixed Chantenay Carrots, Poudre de Columbo, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Chickpeas, Cumin Seeds, Red Split Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Grater, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Dahl is a delicious way to enjoy a large dose of veggies for dinner. This dahl is made with chickpeas, spinach and colourful chantenay carrots. These little carrots are packed full of flavour and nutrients, and are a tasty addition to this Indian dish. If all this wasn’t enough, we have also included cheat’chapatis, which make the best little shovel to scoop up your dahl!

Full Name: Soy and Honey Glazed Tofu with Healthy Noodle Broth
Ingredients: Tofu, Spring Onion, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Sweetheart Cabbage, Soy Sauce, Honey, Rice Noodle, Red Curry Paste, Water, Star Anise, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Pan
Description: We’re really determined to get people loving tofu, and with this recipe, we feel confident it’s a winner! Fried until crispy, then coated in sticky honey and soy sauce, you won’t even recognise it! What makes this tofu recipe even better is that it’s served with our delicious rice noodle broth, which aside from being ridiculously tasty, is also pretty healthy!

Full Name: Spiced Lentil Burger with Zesty Salad
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Coriander, Butterbeans, Red Curry Paste, Green Lentils, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lime, Natural Yoghurt, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Ginger, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Pan, Bowl, Potato Masher
Description: Every week, literally thousands of you wonderful cooks give us feedback on our recipes via the little questionnaire we email to you. And every week Ellie reads through every single answer (we’ve given her a comfortable chair and as much tea as necessary, to ease the process). We’ve had a lot of requests from our veggie customers recently for a delicious veggie burger, so André headed into the kitchen to create this masterpiece! Let us know what you think!

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti. with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Green Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Knife, Pan
Description: If this dish were a place, it would be a sunny little fishing village somewhere on the coast of Sardinia. If it were a time, it would be an al fresco lunch, on a sun-dappled terrace, with a cold bottle of rosé. For this recipe we combined simple, light, fresh flavours to create a nostalgia-inducing meal that will leave you plenty of time to get online and book your next holiday. Daydreams included as standard.

Full Name: Tomato Garlic Ragu with Spaghetti
Ingredients: Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Onion, Beef Mince, Soy Sauce, Dried Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: This classic Italian dish has a hint of Far Eastern charm thrown in. Traditionally, us Brits love the addition of a bit of Worcestershire sauce in our hotpots, pasta sauces and even ragus, but here at the Fresh Farm we’re all about a splash of soy sauce! The saltiness is a subtle but genius addition to the succulent minced beef, aromatic thyme and juicy tomatoes - a perfect combination for a night in! Give it a try in this dish and we’re sure you’ll be using soy sauce in everything soon

Full Name: Classic Chicken and Mushroom Pie with Honey Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Red Potato, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Leek, Tarragon, Button Mushrooms, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Bay Leaf, Mixed Chantenay Carrots, Honey, Thyme
Utensils: Pot, Potato Masher, Knife, Baking Dish, Baking Tray
Description: Chicken and mushroom pie with a creamy mash topping sounds like a meal worth rushing home for! We’ve given this classic dish a HelloFresh spin with roasted, honey glazed chantenay carrots. These beautifully coloured carrots are not only delicious, they are packed full of vitamins and phytonutrients, which gives them their glorious hue! It’s also the reason we made them our Veggie of the Month!

Full Name: Hunter's Chicken with Potato Wedges and Homemade Baked Beans
Ingredients: Potato, Chicken Breast, BBQ Sauce, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Onion, Cannellini Beans, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Baby Spinach, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pan
Description: Nothing makes our hearts sing like the words ‘all day breakfast’. Mimi loves her breakfast so much that she whipped together this delicious chicken dish with all of her favourite breakfast elements: bacon, beans and chips. This meal is so tasty you may find it appearing on your table more frequently than just at dinner time.

Full Name: Pork Chop with Braised Cabbage, Potato Wedges and Cranberry and Pistachio Jam
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Pistachios, Savoy Cabbage, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Pork Chops, Dried Cranberries, White Wine Vinegar, Water for Cranberry Jam, Water for Cabbage
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Peeler, Bowl, Pan
Description:
This tasty recipe is great for the chilly weeks leading up to Christmas; it’s warm and hearty and the pistachio and cranberry jam adds a beautiful sweet flavour that lifts the dish. The jam is a great accompaniment
to roasted meats such as pork, turkey and chicken and would fit in perfectly with a Christmas roast. Practice makes perfect...

Full Name: Lamb and Chickpea Curry
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Mustard Seeds, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Coriander, Chickpeas, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Water for Rice
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Sieve
Description: You will love this mouthwatering curry as it is really easy and quick to prepare! This curry is spiced with Sri Lankan curry powder and flavoured with ginger, garlic, coriander, mustard seeds and star anise! These herbs and spices are the stars of the dish and make, what is a really simple meal, fresh and delicious. You will favour it every time over your local takeaway!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta, Red Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan
Description:
Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective
of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Roast Duck with Bread Sauce and Honeyed Courgettes
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Small Sweet Potato, Thyme, Echalion Shallot, Cloves, Courgette, Milk, Duck Breast, Honey, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan
Description: André has given the classic British bread sauce his own spin in this delicious recipe. Bread sauce is a Christmas classic as it works beautifully with poultry. This sauce is so tasty and easy to make you may want to recreate it in a few weeks time for your own Christmas feast!

Full Name: Saffron and Fennel Risotto with Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Water, Saffron, Vegetable Stock Pot, Fennel, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description:
This oozy, creamy risotto is teamed with saffron, courgette and fennel. Fennel may be a new vegetable to your kitchen, but you may find that it’s seriously underrated! Fennel’s crisp, fresh flavour combined with the
sweet aromatic hint of saffron, makes this dish very special! It also includes 3 of your 5 a day, so it delivers on both taste and nutrition!

Full Name: Winter Warming Carrot and Lentil Soup with Herb Focaccia
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Potato, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Red Split Lentils, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Foccacia
Utensils: Knife, Pot
Description:
One of the (few) enjoyable things about winter is slurping up big bowls of hearty, nutrition-packed, homemade soup! This is one of Patrick’s absolute favourites, since it’s super quick to make but beats the pants
off any of the store bought alternatives. We’ve added a kick of chilli to raise your temperature that little bit more and fight off any winter colds. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Halloumi
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Halloumi, Mexican Spice, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan
Description:
This dish is full of beautiful, sunny colours - reds, oranges and yellows, which give a hint to the nutrient profiles of its ingredients. Brightly coloured vegetables are richer in phytonutrients than their dull coloured
counterparts. Red and yellow veggies are usually high in carotenoid pigments, which are powerful antioxidants that protect against certain cancers and are beneficial for eye and bone health. We hope you enjoy this bowl of sunshine!

Full Name: Chermoula and Yoghurt Spiced Chicken with Zesty Courgette Pilaf
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chermoula Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Pan, Pot, Baking Tray
Description:
When our chef André visited Marrakech, he adored the bustling night markets and the way they come alive when the sun sets. They’re just packed with the freshest most seductively well-spiced food for miles
around. That perfect memory of deep, rich, chargrilled chicken is the inspiration for his chermoula and yoghurt spiced chicken, with zesty courgette pilaf.

Full Name: Cajun Pork with Bulgur Wheat and Garlicky Spring Greens
Ingredients: Cajun Spice, Honey, Pork Medallion, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Spring Greens, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Making bulgur from wheat is one of the oldest food processes in the world - some say it’s over 4000 years old. When something’s been around for that long, you know it must be pretty solid. Add that to rich, deep Cajun pork and some simple garlicky greens and you’ve got yourself a bit of a feast!

Full Name: Penne all’Arrabbiata with Smoked Pancetta and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Pancetta, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Pan
Description: Food is described with an infinite number of adjectives but ‘angry’ is not one that immediately springs to mind. That’s unless we’re talking in Italian. This little dish is ‘Arrabbiata,’ (this means ‘angry’ in Italian), because of its spicy kick, but we’ll let your family decide how much of a temper you want it to have. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time it takes to boil your pasta, there’s really nothing angry about it. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Meatball Potato Bake
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Beef Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description:
It’s incredible how easy it is to revolutionise a well loved dish of the nation by adding some spices and a bit of feta cheese. We’ve taken on the British hotpot and we’re making it Middle Eastern. We’re here to
take you on an adventure, to explore new flavours. Fancy it? Then get cooking!

Full Name: Garlicky Prawns with Proper Mini Roast Potatoes and Walnut Parsley Pesto
Ingredients: King Edward Potato, King Edward Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley, Walnuts, Parmesan Cheese, Olive Oil, Red Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Tiger Prawns, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Bowl, Knife, Pan
Description:
This meal is a delicious feast in which you will learn how to make perfect mini roast potatoes. The trick is to parboil your potato first, then roast it on an oiled baking tray that has been in the oven so it's
baking hot! These are mini ones but if you do normal sized roasties, they would just take a little longer to par-boil and roast.

Full Name: Pistachio and Prune Stuffed Pork Loin with Mashed Parsnips and Mangetout
Ingredients: Pistachios, Prunes, Parsnip, Potato, Pork Loin Fillet, Pork Loin Fillet, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Water, Olive Oil, Plain Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Mangetout
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Pan, Potato Masher
Description: Pistachios have had some pretty famous fans throughout history. The Queen of Sheba loved pistachios so much that she demanded that the entire region’s pistachio harvest be set aside for her! We tend to agree and thought this delicious little nut would add tasty flavours to a stuffing. We think it's so delicious you may want to use it as inspiration for a fresh spin on your traditional Christmas stuffing!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Spiced Beef Ragout with Couscous and Flaked Almonds
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Couscous, Water, Courgette, Coriander, Flaked Almonds, Beef Stock Pot
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Bowl
Description: The word ragout comes from the French word meaning ‘to revive the flavour’. So, jump right in and have yourself a flavour revival with André’s North African twist on minced beef! The texture of this dish is just sensational - with those flaked almonds to give it a crunch and that fluffy couscous to give it a... fluff!

Full Name: Thai Moo Pad Krapow
Ingredients: Water, Basmati Rice, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Pork Mince, Ketjap Manis, Soy Sauce, Fish Sauce, Fresh Thai Basil
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: This tasty Thai dish ticks all our culinary boxes: quick, healthy and delicious! This recipe uses some traditional Thai ingredients that may be new to your kitchen, particularly Thai Basil. We love Thai Basil as it cools the fiery chilli, adds beautiful colour and an interesting, authentic flavour.

Full Name: Shanghai Style Chicken Stir-Fry with Noodles
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Chinese 5 Spice, Red Pepper, Red Onion, Spring Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Pan
Description:
The wonderful Rick Stein is one of André’s favourite chefs. One night before dinner, André was watching good old Rick’s show and he did a cracking Shanghai style pork belly. Feeling inspired and somewhat
ravenous, our André felt slightly sombre about the lack of pork he had in the house - and so his Shanghai style chicken stir-fry with noodles was born.

Full Name: Aromatic Sweet Potato Biryani
Ingredients: Water for Rice, Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Green Beans, Green Beans, Poudre de Columbo, Small Sweet Potato, Coriander, Mint, Flaked Almonds, Lime, Feta Cheese, Water
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Biryani, an Indian mixed rice dish, can be composed of a variety of spices, herbs, and vegetables. Our HelloFresh twist on the traditional biryani uses creamy feta and sweet potato, with green beans, tomatoes and fresh mint for flavour. This healthy meal also packs in 3.5 of your 5 a day, a winner all round!

Full Name: Vegetable Packed Moussaka with Cheat's Garlic Bread
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Tomato Puree 30g, Ground Cinnamon, Oregano, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Baking Dish
Description: This veggie moussaka is true to its name, giving you a whopping 5 of your 5 a day; it is PACKED with vegetables! The hearty lentils and warming spices, along with a big dose of immune boosting nutrients, makes this the perfect dish to chase those winter blues away!

Full Name: Chillibeany Fajitas with Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Coriander, Mixed Beans, Habanero Sauce, Ground Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Water, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: Fajitas go down a treat at the Fresh Farm. Mexican food has great combinations of clean citrus flavours, warm spices and complimentary textures of soft beans and crunchy peppers. For this simple recipe, you’ll be knocking up your own refried beans, spicing things up with some habanero sauce and topping it off with a cooling dollop of sour cream. It’s so good we might end up coming over for dinner ourselves!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Pot, Pan
Description: As you know we send out a questionnaire every week to see how you enjoyed your recipes. Ellie (our menu planning guru) sits down and gives our team the lowdown and from there we plan the weeks to come. Recently, we noticed a huge spike in popularity for fresh tarragon, hence the inspiration for tonight’s delicious dinner!

Full Name: Steak with Cheesy Mash and Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Red Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Echalion Shallot, Tarragon, Tomato Ketchup, Balsamic Vinegar, Flank Steak, Ground Coriander, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Bowl, Potato Masher
Description: When our chefs do mash, they like using their i-mash-inations! Whether it's garlic mash, swede or sweet potato, we're pushing the boundaries of mashness. This cheesy mash is a gentle, creamy way to bring together our succulent, juicy steak and sweet and tangy tomato salsa.

Full Name: Tender Stir-Fried Pork with Black Bean Sauce and Cashew Nuts
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Water, Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Pepper, Carrot, Spring Onion, Cashew Nuts, Black Bean Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Certain dishes can’t help but inspire nostalgia. Black bean sauce was one of the gateway dishes into our childhood obsession with Chinese food. Tonight, we’ve teamed it up with a beautifully cut piece of pork loin from our butcher extraordinaire Nick ‘The Knife’. We’ve thrown in a little restaurant trick too, by adding cornflour to make your meat melt-in-the-mouth tender!

Full Name: Shanghai Style Chicken Stir-Fry. with Noodles
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Chinese 5 Spice, Red Pepper, Red Onion, Spring Onion, Ginger, Coriander, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan
Description:
The wonderful Rick Stein is one of André’s favourite chefs. One night before dinner, André was watching good old Rick’s show and he did a cracking Shanghai style pork belly. Feeling inspired and somewhat
ravenous, our André felt slightly sombre about the lack of pork he had in the house - and so his Shanghai style chicken stir-fry with noodles was born.

Full Name: Oven Baked Greek Style Meatballs with Orzo and Veggies
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Courgette, Mint, Oregano, Lamb Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Ground Coriander, Chicken Stock Pot, Orzo, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: On the Greek island of Corfu, meatballs are traditionally served with a fragrant rice. Mimi has mixed it up with an Italian twist of orzo, which is a rice shaped pasta - a perfect accompaniment to both hot or cold dishes (makes great leftovers for lunch!).

Full Name: Giant Spiced Pigs in Blankets with Tomatoey Lentils
Ingredients: Streaky Bacon Rasher, Spiced Pork Sausage, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Ground Cumin, Red Split Lentils, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Peas
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan
Description: Pigs in blankets are a delicious, traditional Christmas accompaniment. So delicious that it is estimated that 128 million of them are consumed on the day! We have given these a HelloFresh spin, creating a giant version of the usual bite-sized treat. Children love these piggies and they are the perfect solution to avoid any Christmas day tantrums!

Full Name: Haddock with Mediterranean Aubergine and Butterbean Stew
Ingredients: Red Onion, Aubergine, Smoked Paprika, Flat Leaf Parsley, Butterbeans, Haddock Fillet, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Crispy haddock fillets with aubergine and butter bean stew make a tasty combination in this Mediterranean inspired dish. With a variety of disease fighting phytonutrients including anthocyanin from the aubergine's purple hue and lypocene from the deep red passata, teamed with heart healthy haddock, you can be assured of a deliciously nutritious meal.

Full Name: Roast Chicken with Mini Roasties, Veggies and Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Carrot, Broccoli, Thyme, Chicken Breast, Honey, Plain Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot
Description: Roast chicken may be such a frequent meal in your home that you can cook it with your eyes closed. What's special about this dish you may ask? It's all about the gravy! In the lead up to the festive season now is a great time to perfect your Christmas lunch accompaniments, like this delicious gravy, to avoid a Christ'mess' disaster!

Full Name: Leek and Potato Gratin with Goat's Cheese and Spinach
Ingredients: Red Potato, Leek, Tarragon, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Goat's Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Baking Dish
Description: The less experienced home chefs out there may be asking 'grat what'? Well this quick and absolutely delicious recipe is going to make gratin your new bestie! Gratin originated in French cuisine and is a culinary technique in which an ingredient is topped with a browned crust. In this recipe we have used our HelloFresh favourite panko breadcrumbs and creamy goat's cheese to give this dish an indulgent, crispy crust.

Full Name: Japanese Mushroom Rice with Baby Bok Choy and Cashews
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Water, Baby Bok Choy, Chestnut Mushrooms, Enoki Mushrooms, Spring Onion, Coriander, Lime, Garlic Clove, Cashew Nuts, Mirin, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: The authentic Japanese ingredients in this simple recipe will take your taste buds on a delicious adventure. Beautiful puffs of enoki mushrooms sautéed in mirin give this dish sweet, earthy flavours. Combined with aromatic rice, stir-fried bok choy and crunchy cashew nuts, you will definitely be going back for more!

Full Name: Coconut Dal with Roasted Butternut Squash, Onion Textures and Warm Flatbreads
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Curry Powder, Onion, Red Chilli, Vine Tomatoes, Coriander, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coconut Milk, Red Split Lentils, Plain Flour, Flatbread, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: This recipe is a total stonker. With a good kick of chilli it’s just the ticket for a windy weeknight. ‘Onion textures’ sound a little more posh than they need to - it just means some nice crunchy onions to add a bit of textural contrast to your dal. To make them really crispy, get the oil nice and hot and don’t overcrowd the pan. If they have a bit of space to cook then they'll fry well (instead of stewing), which will give you a perfect finish. Enjoy!

Full Name: Roast Chicken with Mini Roasties,. Veggies and Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Broccoli, Thyme, Chicken Breast, Honey, Plain Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot
Description: Roast chicken may be such a frequent meal in your home that you can cook it with your eyes closed. What's special about this dish you may ask? It's all about the gravy! In the lead up to the festive season now is a great time to perfect your Christmas lunch accompaniments, like this delicious gravy, to avoid a Christ'mess' disaster!

Full Name: Lamb and Mint Burger with Cheese and Onion Wedges
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Mint, Lamb Mince, Baby Gem Lettuce, Cucumber, Cheddar Cheese, Dijon Mustard, White Wine Vinegar, Olive Oil, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan
Description: "What's more British than cheese and onion?" our Chef André asks. "Mint and lamb, perhaps?" he replies. So, go on, get stuck in - and let us know what you think of it!!

Full Name: Grilled Aubergine Spaghetti with Chilli, Chorizo and Sun-Dried Tomato
Ingredients: Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Aubergine, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Spaghetti, Chopped Tomatoes
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot, Sieve
Description: Some days you want to be adventurous and others you just want a little more time to put your feet up. We made this dish with the classic Italian notions of simplicity and speed at its heart. To make this recipe, fresh tomatoes are left for around ten days in the sun and lose around 90% of their water to become sun-dried. The process intensifies their sweetness so that even a couple will add a burst of intense flavour to your dinner. Buon appetito!

Full Name: African Chicken Curry with Yellow Rice
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Curry Powder, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Chopped Tomatoes, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Cardamom Pod, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Green Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Pepper
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: Our chef André has used the heady aromas of the East African spice route as inspiration for this warming curry. The mild spices add delicious flavour but not too much heat, making it suitable and tasty for the whole family!

Full Name: Bacon and Apple Pork Parcel with Appley Leek Couscous and Tenderstem
Ingredients: Leek, Braeburn Apple, Tenderstem Broccoli, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Olive Oil, Pork Medallion, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Wholegrain Mustard, Sage
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Beautifully wrapped gifts are half the fun of the festive season. Mimi has created a little present of her own by cleverly wrapping pork and apple in bacon parcels. These tasty little presents are so delicious they are almost as exciting as gifts under the tree!

Full Name: Pan-fried Sea Bream Butternut Squash Wedges and Garlicky, Bacon Kalettes
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Kalettes, Garlic Clove, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Sea Bass Fillets, Kalettes
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Frying Pan
Description: Introducing our veggie of the month: kalettes! These cute little green bunches are a combination of kale and brussels sprouts. Could you think of a more nutritious veggie? Kalettes make a great replacement for the more traditional brussels sprout. We think you may find them so enjoyable that they find a spot on your Christmas table (in place of the sprouts that is!).

Full Name: Cheat's Lamb Moussaka
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Lamb Mince, Cinnamon Stick, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Baking Dish, Bowl
Description: Moussaka is one of our chef Mimi’s favourite dishes… if there’s one winter warmer that wins in her book, it’s this one. Normally moussaka takes hours to make, but with a bit of HelloFresh magic you’ll be whipping this up in no time at all!

Full Name: Cranberry and Cream Cheese Chicken Roulades with Roast Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Dried Cranberries, Broccoli, Chicken Breast, Philadelphia Cheese, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pot, Sieve
Description: With the big day so close we wanted to give you a bit of pre-match training. Tonight, you’re going to be practising how to make a roulade with traditional cranberry flavours. It’s dead simple and the perfect warm up to the 25th.

Full Name: Honey Roasted Chicken with Caramelised Shallot Gravy and Mashed Swede
Ingredients: Spiced Honey Mustard, Honey, Chicken Thighs, Swede, Echalion Shallot, Leek, Red Wine Vinegar, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water for Gravy, Peas, Water, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Saucepan
Description: Mashed potato is a lovely accompaniment to a traditional roast, but over the Christmas period it can get a little bit rich with all the other sides that are served for Christmas lunch. We have given mash a HelloFresh twist by using swede instead of potato. This tasty root veggie is a great replacement as it is lower in calories and higher in fibre. Give it a bash, it may find its way onto your Christmas table!

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed HelloFresh Chorizo Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Plum Tomatoes, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: At the Fresh Farm we get pretty excited about pizza. But a combination of pizza and pie; the deliciousness is overwhelming!! This week we are bringing you the calzone - a pizza pie! We get the freshest dough from our supplier, The Northern Dough Company, to make sure you get the tastiest pizza pie.

Full Name: Roasted Butternut with Garlicky Kalettes and Honeyed Walnut Halloumi
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Smoked Paprika, Kalettes, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Flat Leaf Parsley, Walnuts, Halloumi, Honey
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: You may have found a veggie in your box this week that looks a little unfamiliar. Introducing: kalettes, our veggie of the month. These cute little green bunches are a combination of brussels sprouts and kale. As you may have guessed they are packed full of nutrients, particularly bone health boosting vitamin K. We think these are one of the most delicious of the leafy green veggies, teamed with honey and walnut drenched halloumi, they are an absolute treat!

Full Name: Lentil Tagliatelle 'Bolognaise' with Homemade Minty Pesto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Carrot, Mint, Red Split Lentils, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Pistachios, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Button Mushrooms, Wholewheat Tagliatelle
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: In this veggie 'bolognaise' recipe you will learn how to make your own pesto. However this is no traditional pesto made with pistachio and mint it has a beautiful fresh flavour. The 'bolognaise' is quite special too, bursting with veggies so you will pack in 5 of your 5 a day!

Full Name: Tandoori Spiced Aubergine with Tomato and Coriander Rice and Nigella Yoghurt
Ingredients: Aubergine, Tandoori Masala Spice, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Spring Onion, Plum Tomatoes, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Nigella Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Bowl
Description: Our chef André isn’t a vegetarian but his veggie friends absolutely love this dish - he makes it whenever they come over - because they demand it! So get cooking his tandoori spiced aubergine!

Full Name: Creamy Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomato Pasta Bake with Buttery Kalettes
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Leek, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Fusilli, Crème Fraîche, Chicken Stock Pot, Kalettes, Water, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Poppy Seeds, Olive Oil, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Frying Pan, Pot, Baking Dish
Description: Hiding veggies in a pasta bake is an age old trick to get children to eat more of them. The cute little green bunches used in this recipe are kalettes. These are not the easiest to hide, but they are so adorable looking and taste so delicious you should have no problems getting your kids to love them!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tomato Puree 30g, Plum Tomatoes, Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray
