Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this family recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Pork Medallions with Tarragon and Potatoes
Ingredients: Tarragon, Chicken Stock Pot, Leek, Pork Medallion, New Potatoes, Sour Cream, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: Another tough week of taste testing is over and this time we’ve been putting our butchers at Roaming Roosters to the test. They’ve sourced us some succulent pork and we’ve combined it with a divine tarragon sauce, that’ll blow the socks off the people around your dinner table.

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed HelloFresh Chorizo Calzone.
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Plum Tomatoes, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: At the Fresh Farm we get pretty excited about pizza. But a combination of pizza and pie; the deliciousness is overwhelming!! This week we are bringing you the calzone - a pizza pie! We get the freshest dough from our supplier, The Northern Dough Company, to make sure you get the tastiest pizza pie.

Full Name: Chermoula and Yoghurt Spiced Chicken with Zesty Courgette Pilaf
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chermoula Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Pan, Baking Tray
Description: When our chef André visited Marrakech, he adored the bustling night markets and the way they come alive when the sun sets. They’re just packed with the freshest most seductively well-spiced food for miles around. That perfect memory of deep, rich, chargrilled chicken is the inspiration for his chermoula and yoghurt spiced chicken, with zesty courgette pilaf.

Full Name: Peppered Pork with Chorizo and Garlicky Roasted Sprouts
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Black Peppercorns, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Chorizo, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Brussels Sprouts
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Patrick has struck upon a secret formula that makes the Brussels sprout so delicious it can officially be moved to Santa's nice list! Roasting sprouts gives them a lovely flavour and texture that will make them a firm favourite on your Christmas dinner table this year. In this recipe, we have combined crispy sprouts with peppered pork and chorizo. If you’re feeling naughty, stir a teaspoon of butter into your gravy at the end. Nobody needs to know!

Full Name: Fruity Lebanese Lamb with Cumin Roasted Carrots
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dried Apricots, Ground Cumin, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Lamb Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Shawarma Spice Mix, Water for Lamb, Natural Yoghurt, Pomegranate Seeds, Carrot
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Pan, Bowl
Description: This rich, bubbly hotpot definitely hits the spot on a chilly winter evening, warming you from the inside out. This Lebanese inspired recipe is flavoured with warming spices and a touch of sweet, dried apricots. Topped with cumin roasted carrots and colourful pomegranate seeds, it's a real winner!

Full Name: Rosemary Pork Medallions with Roasted Cauliflower and Watercress
Ingredients: Potato, Rosemary, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Cauliflower, Raisins, Red Wine Vinegar, Dijon Mustard, Honey, Olive Oil, Cheddar Cheese, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Christmas feasts can sometimes feel like Groundhog Day, with the same recipes repeated year after year. Cauliflower cheese is a great side for a Christmas roast, but in this recipe André has given it a modern twist that will add new flavour and flair to your festive menu. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mascarpone and Mushroom Pizza with Caramelised Onion and Rocket
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Tomato Passata, Chestnut Mushrooms, Red Onion, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Mascarpone Cheese, Dried Thyme, Balsamic Vinegar, Rocket
Utensils: Saucepan, Knife, Rolling Pin, Spoon
Description: Mimi has given the traditional pizza a HelloFresh twist using creamy mascarpone cheese to replace traditional mozzarella. Topped with sweet caramelised onion, peppery rocket and mushrooms, this pizza is a real treat!

Full Name: Bean Chilli with Brown Rice and Citrus Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Mixed Beans, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Tomato Puree 30g
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: We’re a traditional bunch here at the Fresh Farm. That’s why we decided to use chipotle, a smoky chilli paste, produced by local farmers in the Oaxaca region of Mexico, who use age-old methods to work the land and produce this rich, sweet, spicy concoction. Add bit by bit, it’s hot!

Full Name: Deconstructed Ratatouille with Balsamic Tomatoes, Feta and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Aubergine, Plum Tomatoes, Dried Italian Herbs, Courgette, Basil 20g, Balsamic Vinegar, Ciabatta, Feta Cheese, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: The definition of deconstructed is ‘to reduce something to its constituent parts’. We’re not sure we agree completely with this - we wouldn’t say there is any reduction going on here. This dish is such a showstopper, that we wanted to let everything from the ratatouille and feta to the garlicky ciabatta, absolutely shine!

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Bulgur wheat isn’t the most frequent guest at the dinner table, so we’ve invited it to join the party for this recipe! High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, it’s a great source of nutrition and, more importantly, it tastes great. Bulgur wheat is eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia where people have been enjoying it for thousands of years. We’ve teamed it up with a fantastic sweet and sour pork, for a recipe which is as delicious as it is easy.

Full Name: Thyme Roasted Chicken and Potatoes with Spinach and Buttered Radishes
Ingredients: Chicken Thigh, Dried Thyme, New Potatoes, Red Onion, Radish, Garlic Clove, Baby Spinach, Water, Sugar, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Lemon Mayonnaise
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Pan
Description: We feel that the sweet little radish does not receive the love and respect it deserves. André aims to change this narrow thinking by transforming the radish from a salad veggie to a deliciously warm, buttery side? André... you are an absolute GENIUS!

Full Name: Grilled Sausages with Smoky Baked Beans and Mash
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Dried Thyme, Mixed Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Smoked Paprika, Chopped Tomatoes, Potato, Pork and Oregano Sausage
Utensils: Knife
Description: Patrick is a pretty open-minded guy. Except when it comes to baked beans. When Sous Chef Mimi said she could beat his favourite Heinz beans (it’s a bit of a guilty pleasure of his, with granary toast and salty butter) he just wasn’t convinced. And then the impossible happened! We recommend you co-ordinate the beans, mash and sausages at the same time, as far as your juggling skills allow, and the cooking time will be halved...

Full Name: Superquick Lamb and Pasta Bake with Rosemary, Spinach and Crème Fraiche
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Wholewheat Rigatoni, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Frying Pan, Large Pot, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: In Britain, rosemary is a traditional symbol of love and marriage. Brides once adorned their veils with it, which was a precursor to the modern bouquet! Show your family your love with this superquick and tasty dish!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Pot
Description: For tonight’s dinner, we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your ’taters come from!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Sausage Stew with Fruity Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Echalion Shallot, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Ras-el-Hanout, Tomato Passata, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Water for Bulgur Wheat, Bulgur Wheat, Dried Cranberries, Mint, Chickpeas, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Flaked Almonds, Lemon
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Pot
Description: Moroccan food has been heavily influenced by Berber, Moorish and Arab cuisine over the centuries and is alive with interesting flavours, textures and fragrances. This stew will take you on a taste trip to Morocco with a warmly spiced sauce and sweet, fruity bulgur wheat, topped with golden crunchy almonds.

Full Name: Sri Lankan Prawn Pilaf with Beetroot and Herb Slaw
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Sri Lankan Spice Blend, Basmati Rice, Tiger Prawns, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Olive Oil, Beetroot
Utensils: Knife, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: Sri Lanka - they call it the pearl of India - because it really is that beautiful. The food is one of its main treasures and as an island - just like us - they love a dish with some tasty, fresh seafood. Plus, we’ve added gorgeous, wonderful beetroot, because it’s in season so therefore at its most delicious! Fusion!

Full Name: Honey Mustard Chicken with Buttery Veggies and Mash
Ingredients: Leek, Carrot, Radish, Red Potato, Red Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chicken Thighs, Spiced Honey Mustard, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Milk, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Potato Masher
Description: Most people eat radishes raw, but cooking transforms this little root into a sweeter, more delicate veggie. In this recipe we poach the veggies to make them tender and tasty. Dolloping creamy butter over gives them such a smooth, melt in the mouth flavour - you’ll never want to cook your veggies any other way!

Full Name: Hoisin Pork with Noodles, Peppers and Beansprouts
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Water, Beansprouts, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Frying Pan
Description: A lot of people think of duck when they hear the word hoisin. But hoisin sauce is incredibly versatile and it’s delicious on a lot of things - including pork. Don’t believe us? Just give our hoisin pork with noodles, peppers and beansprouts a go, and you’ll be eating your hat as well!

Full Name: Tomatoey Bulgur and Mozzarella Stuffed Peppers with Sweet Onion Salad
Ingredients: Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Ground Coriander, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Coriander, Tomato Puree 30g, Bulgur Wheat, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Pine Nuts, Lemon, Olive Oil, Mozzarella, Panko Breadcrumbs, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Biber dolmasi are Turkish stuffed and roasted peppers.In this recipe, we have created a HelloFresh spin on this traditional dish by stuffing peppers with bulgur wheat and sun-dried tomatoes, to give a delicious smoky flavour. Paired with sweet red onion and peppery rocket salad, this dish is a firm veggie favourite at the HelloFresh Farm.

Full Name: Persian Inspired Soup with Garlicky Lemon Yoghurt and Smoked Cheese Ciabatta
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Ground Turmeric, Chilli Flakes, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Spring Onion, Mixed Beans, Flour, Baby Spinach, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Lemon, Greek Yoghurt, Smoked Cheese, Ciabatta
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife, Bowl
Description: This gorgeous soup is inspired by a lovely, family-run Persian restaurant in Leeds. It is packed with healthy beans, spinach, onions and fresh herbs and delicately spiced with earthy turmeric. The Greek yoghurt (in Persian cuisine they use a kind of creamy whey) really brings all the flavours together and adds a layer of temperature and textural contrast. And the smoky, cheesy ciabatta gives you something to dip!

Full Name: Homemade Rocket Pesto Orzo with Charred Courgettes and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vine Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Rocket, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Lemon, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We’re all in favour of teaching new skills and this week we decided homemade pesto is on the menu. Don’t be alarmed at the amount of olive oil we’ve suggested the Mediterranean diet is famed for its health benefits, which can be attributed to the extensive use of olive oil. Olive oil is crazy good for you due to its sky high antioxidant levels and omega-9 content. Omega-9 is one of the ‘good fats’ everyone speaks of, with a plethora of health benefits. Olive oil is 85% good fat so tuck in!!!

Full Name: Hoisin Pork. with Noodles, Peppers and Beansprouts
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Pork Medallion, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Water, Beansprouts, Lime
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: A lot of people think of duck when they hear the word hoisin. But hoisin sauce is incredibly versatile and it’s delicious on a lot of things - including pork. Don’t believe us? Just give our hoisin pork with noodles, peppers and beansprouts a go, and you’ll be eating your hat as well!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Water, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result: 1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it. 2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in. 3) Make sure you rest your steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it. Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Pork Meatballs, Thai Style Coconut Curry and Fragrant Basmati Rice
Ingredients: Pork Mince, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Ground Coriander, Soy Sauce, Basmati Rice, Water, Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Lime, Star Anise
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: Our chef André has been teaching everyone all sorts of tricks in the kitchen. For this recipe, he has been inspired by watching the footy and has created a football themed meal for all the family to enjoy. These delicious pork meatballs are packed full of protein, to fuel the home team! Cooking rice with star anise is one of his ideas, a little trick that gives the rice an aromatic taste, and the whole dish that ‘je ne sais quoi’. Enjoy!

Full Name: Creamy Gnocchi with Chorizo, Spinach and Peas
Ingredients: Gnocchi, Plum Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Chorizo, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Baby Spinach, Basil 20g, Crème Fraîche, Courgette
Utensils: Frying Pan, Knife
Description: Traditionally gnocchi is boiled in salted water. In this recipe we have given gnocchi a HelloFresh twist by pan-frying it instead. Pan-frying gnocchi gives the outside a beautiful crisp bite while the inside remains pillowy soft and delicious. This gives the benefit of both texture in one small package. We’ve mixed this with smoky chorizo, sweet plum tomatoes and crème fraîche for a delicious creamy dish!

Full Name: Shanghai Style Chicken Stir-Fry with Noodles
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chinese 5 Spice, Red Pepper, Red Onion, Spring Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Egg Noodle Nest, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce
Utensils: Knife, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: The wonderful Rick Stein is one of André’s favourite chefs. One night before dinner, André was watching good old Rick’s show and he did a cracking Shanghai style pork belly. Feeling inspired and somewhat ravenous, our André felt slightly sombre about the lack of pork he had in the house - and so his Shanghai style chicken stir-fry with noodles was born.

Full Name: Soy and Orange Glazed Pork with Mediterranean Veggies and Couscous
Ingredients: Orange, Soy Sauce, Sugar, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Balsamic Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Pot, Cutting board, Frying Pan
Description: We love a bit of fruit on meat action! Everyone loves a bit of apple sauce on their pork, but if you’ve never had orange glazed pork, now’s your chance. We adore the way it works with fluffy couscous and Mediterranean veggies.

Full Name: Zahtar Salmon with Fragrant Rice and Spinach
Ingredients: Courgette, Garlic Clove, Basmati Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Salmon fillet, Zahtar Spice, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Lemon, Ground Coriander
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Aluminum Foil, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Tonight we have made Middle Eastern cooking ultra simple using a traditional spice, Zahtar! Zahtar spice may be making its debut in your kitchen tonight, but we think it might be one to stay. This spice
has a tangy, nutty flavour and is made up of thyme, sesame seeds and - the secret ingredient - sumac! Zahtar tastes amazing sprinkled over meat, veggies and salmon in particular; we hope you enjoy this taste sensation!

Full Name: Super Quick Creamy Pasta with Peas and Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Fusilli, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Sieve, Bowl
Description: After a long day at work, there’s always the temptation to eat something super simple, so you can maximize your time on the couch in your fluffy slippers with a blanket and a cuppa. Well, your wish is our command! Our pea and bacon pasta is unbelievably tasty and quick in equal measure. Its oh-so-creamy sauce brings it all together! So, get those slippers ready, it’s going to be an awesome night in!

Full Name: Minty Sumac Chicken with Roasted Veggies and Cucumber Yoghurt
Ingredients: Parsnip, Carrot, Ground Cumin, Mint, Garlic Clove, Sumac, Chicken Thighs, Cucumber, Natural Yoghurt, Sugar Snap Peas
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Tonight, we plan to take your taste buds on an Arabian adventure. We have flavoured the chicken with a balance of garlic, fresh mint and sumac. Sumac is a tart spice that is an essential ingredient in Arabic cooking, where it is used in place of lemon to add bright acidity. Sumac comes from berries that are dried and crushed to form a red powder. Impress your family by using this exotic spice as a replacement for lemon in dressings and dishes.

Full Name: Ksar Char-Bagh Moroccan Beef Burgers
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Harissa Spice Mix, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Premium Baby Leaf Mix
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan
Description:
"What’s this Ksar Char-Bagh?" we hear you ask?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber
tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Ksar Char-Bagh Moroccan Beef Burgers.
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Harissa Spice Mix, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Tags: Eat first, Extra spicy, Family Box
Description: 'What’s this Ksar Char-Bagh?' we hear you ask?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Coconut Dal with Homemade Chapati
Ingredients: Wholemeal Flour, Water for Batter, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Red Split Lentils, Coconut Milk, Garlic Clove, Onion, Ginger, Red Chilli, Curry Powder, Kale, Kale, Desiccated Coconut, Coriander
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Pot, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Many, many (many) years ago Head Chef Patrick was rushing to school when he remembered it was ‘home economics’ day. In his haste he grabbed the only things he could find: a tin of baked beans and a bag of wholemeal flour. His speciality that day was baked beans on homemade chapatis. We’re glad to say he’s increased his repertoire since then and tonight’s coconut dal is an absolute stonker!

Full Name: Mexican Black Bean and Buckwheat Bake with Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Buckwheat, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Ground Cumin, Mild Paprika, Ground Cinnamon, Black Beans, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Cheddar Cheese, Chives
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Grater, Frying Pan, Sieve, Oven dish, Bowl
Description:
*Drum rolllllll* Making a rare appearance, the star of tonight’s dish is ultra nutritious, super tasty buckwheat! Buckwheat is actually a seed related to rhubarb and quite apart from its delicious, nutty flavour
it is absolutely chock full of nutrition. Slow-burning to keep your energy levels constant, it also contains magnesium which can help lower blood pressure and aid delivery of nutrients around the body. If you like to spice things up then use all of the chilli!

Full Name: Smoked Tofu Burger with Smashed Avocado, Golden Fries and Zesty Salad
Ingredients: Red Potato, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Lime, Coriander, Avocado, Smoked Tofu, Brioche Bun, BBQ Sauce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Fork, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Vix is not one to back down from a dare, so when André bet she could never make a tofu burger, as delicious as his mum's smoky BBQ burger, she had to accept the challenge. Using our delicious new smoked tofu and tasty Stoke's BBQ sauce as her secret weapon, she stepped up to the test with the tastiest veggie burger yet!

Full Name: Prawn and Serrano Linguine
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Chives, Serrano Ham, Tiger Prawns, Linguine, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: We’ve come a long way since Patrick stuck up his first week of recipes on the HelloFresh Farm notice board. From those five recipes, we’ve just finished cooking up our 1300th recipe and we’ve even created a HelloFresh Wall of Fame! At the top of the pops is this crazy good linguine. Patrick is pretty proud of it, and rightly so... it’s a corker.

Full Name: Honey and Mustard Glazed Pork with Lentils
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Braeburn Apple, Sage, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Green Lentils, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan
Description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away – at least that’s what they claim! With carrot, celery, lentils and rocket added to the mix, this dish is absolutely loaded with both flavour and nutrition. Now for the decadent part... we have taken the finest pork in the land and glazed it (generously) with the sweetness that only honey can pull off and the warmth of mustard. You are in for a treat!

Full Name: Mexican Chicken Wraps with Appley Beetroot Slaw and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Beetroot, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt, Baby Gem Lettuce, Coriander, Chicken Breast, Mexican Spice, Honey, Wholemeal Tortilla, Tomato Mayonnaise
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Well, hello Mr. Beetroot! You’re looking awfully delicious! We’re making the best of wonderful seasonal vegetables in our Mexican chicken wraps with appley beetroot slaw and potato wedges.

Full Name: Italian Pork and Tomato Risotto
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Parmesan Cheese, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Fennel Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Saucepan
Description: Legend has it that a master glassmaker named Valerius invented risotto in Milan in 1574. We're pretty grateful to him, or we wouldn’t be bringing you this delicious creation!

Full Name: A Surprisingly Simple Roasted Duck with Spiced Lentils and Caramelised Apples
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Echalion Shallot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Duck Breast, Green Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Spring Greens
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Baking Tray
Description: When we first started HelloFresh, we used to get all sorts of emails from people saying that they were ‘scared’ of fish. Whether Steven Spielberg related, or something to do with welding it to their frying pan, we soon knocked their phobia into touch with a few easy recipes. Next on our scary-food-hit list is duck - far more simple than you might believe! Our tip here is to leave the duck out of the fridge for 30 mins before you cook it, so it cooks evenly.

Full Name: Mixed Bean and Pork Chilli with Brown Rice and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Pork Sausage, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chipotle Paste, Lime, Sour Cream
Utensils: Pot, Sieve, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl, Grater
Description: Sausage meat in a chilli?! Yes, you read it right! It may be slightly crazy, but we assure you the delicious sausage meat from Roaming Roosters is an amazing meaty alternative to beef mince. Enjoy!

Full Name: Black Olive, Serrano Ham and Red and Yellow Cherry Tomato Pizza
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Serrano Ham, Black Olives, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Tomato Passata, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Rolling Pin
Description: Tonight, we're turning your kitchen into an authentic pizzeria! We've added some adventurous and tantalising toppings. Salty olives, crispy serrano ham, peppery basil and creamy mozzarella makes this a dream-worthy pizza!

Full Name: Chicken Fried Rice with Mushrooms, Chilli, Peanuts and Soy
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Cinnamon Stick, Water, Chicken Thighs, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Coriander, Salted Peanuts, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Frying Pan
Description: You know us at the Fresh Farm, we’re not in to fancy things, we just love wonderful home cooking. So, André’s kept it simple with this chicken fried rice. It’s simple to make and simply delicious to eat. Enjoy!

Full Name: Yoghurt and Dukkah Crusted Chicken with Aubergine and Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Aubergine, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Chicken Breast, Natural Yoghurt, Super Dukkah Mix
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray
Description: Have you heard of dukkah? It's a delicious Egyptian condiment full of nuts, spices and herbs. We're so inspired by our dukkah suppliers - they ONLY make dukkah, so they're absolute experts - that’s why we've made it spice of the month! Voilà!

Full Name: Pappardelle with Rich Fennel Pork Ragu
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Parmesan Cheese, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Fennel Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Pappardelle
Utensils: Pot, Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Plate, Strainer
Description: Sometimes you just want to come home and devour a bowl of comforting pasta. Well, we've taken pasta to a whole new level with this recipe. Delicious Tuscan pork sausages make for a pretty tasty sauce, and coupled with our beautiful pappardelle pasta, we promise you'll be very happy!

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Stir-Fried Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Frying Pan, Plate, Aluminum Foil, Potato Masher, Strainer
Description: Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Indian Minced Lamb Koftas with Coconut Pilaf and Minty Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Echalion Shallot, Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lamb Mince, Tandoori Masala Spice, Bamboo Skewers, Curry Powder, Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Water, Cinnamon Stick, Chicken Stock Pot, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Saucepan
Description: Kofta is the traditional name for a spiced meatball which features prominently in Middle Eastern and Indian cuisine. These delicately spiced lamb koftas are super easy to make and fun to eat! The creamy cinnamon spiced coconut pilaf makes a delicious accompaniment that your family will love!

Full Name: Soy and Orange Glazed Pork with Mediterranean Veggies and Couscous
Ingredients: Orange, Soy Sauce, Sugar, Pork Medallion, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Balsamic Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Grater, Mixing Bowl, Knife, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We love a bit of fruit on meat action! Everyone loves a bit of apple sauce on their pork, but if you’ve never had orange glazed pork, now’s your chance. We adore the way it works with fluffy couscous and Mediterranean veggies.

Full Name: Mushroom and Broccoli Gnocchi
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: Grilled Aubergine with Borlotti Beans and Goat's Cheese
Ingredients: Aubergine, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Black Olives, Goat's Cheese, Borlotti Beans
Utensils: Knife, Aluminum Foil, Baking Tray, Grater, Saucepan, Sieve, Baking Dish
Description: The humble aubergine also known as brinjal, eggplant, guinea squash and garden egg, goes by as many aliases as an MI5 agent! Whatever you may call this pretty purple veggie, you will agree that it makes a great addition to almost any vegetarian dish. We think that this simple bean stew topped with crispy aubergine and creamy goat's cheese just hits the spot and beautifully balances healthy ingredients with sumptuous, hearty flavours. Enjoy!

Full Name: Roasted Butternut and Bulgur Wheat Jumble with Toasted Pine Nuts and Halloumi
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Pepper, Smoked Paprika, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Pine Nuts, Halloumi, Red Wine Vinegar, Rocket
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Apparently, some chefs recommend soaking halloumi in buttermilk for two days before eating it. Our chefs thought they might try this, but owing to the fact that they're pretty greedy (and really like halloumi), they've never been able to wait that long!

Full Name: Crispy Skin Chicken with Buttery Veggies and Homemade Basil Oil
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Chicken Breast, Leek, Courgette, Basil 20g, Olive Oil, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Knife, Bowl
Description: In this recipe we have given the traditional family favourite, roast chicken and veg, a HelloFresh twist with homemade basil oil. Basil oil is super easy to make and gives a delicious peppery, aromatic flavour that tastes great drizzled over roast chicken and veggies.

Full Name: Pan-Fried Sea Bream with Sweet Plum Tomato Sauce
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Plum Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sea Bream Fillet, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Plate
Description: We love the instant gratification of food. The best things in life often take a long time to create, but a great meal is the perfect antidote to long-term graft. One minute it’s a picture and a few lines of text on a recipe card, 30 minutes later it’s sitting on a plate in front of you and 5 minutes after that it's gone! This one is definitely best enjoyed with a glass of something cold.

Full Name: Gnocchi with Homemade Crème Fraîche Pesto
Ingredients: Plum Tomatoes, Courgette, Pancetta, Parmesan Cheese, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Crème Fraîche, Gnocchi, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We want your family to eat only the best, which is why we know that food is about so much more than taste alone. Texture, colour and smell all play a part in the wonderful ensemble that is the perfect dinner. For this dish, we combined the chewy deliciousness of gnocchi and the colours and aromas of fresh basil and cherry tomatoes, to create a symphony that would make even Mozart proud.

Full Name: Sizzling Honey Mustard Sausages with Sweet Potato Mash and Sticky Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Honey Mustard Sausages, Sweet Potato, Potato, Red Onion, Beef Stock Pot, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Large Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Teaching people new skills is something which makes us pretty happy and this red onion gravy is no exception! Once you've mastered it (which should take about 4 minutes), you'll never go back to the bought stuff again! Gravy making skills: Tick!

Full Name: Spiced Caribbean Chilli with Coconut Rice and Sweetcorn Salsa
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Sweetcorn, Black Beans, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Coconut Milk, Basmati Rice, Dried Thyme, Beef Mince, Poudre de Columbo, Mango Chutney 40g, Tomato Puree 30g, Water for Beef, Coriander, Red Chilli, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Sieve, Saucepan
Description: Tonight we are transporting your kitchen to the sunnier climes of the Caribbean. This recipe packs a delicious Caribbean combination of sweet and spicy with mango chutney and apricots, seasoned with warming Poudre de Colombo spice. The dish is cooled off with smooth coconut milk and a zingy sweetcorn salsa. We think the unusual flavour combinations make it a winner!

Full Name: Baked Risotto with Brazil Nut Pesto and Grilled Goat's Cheese
Ingredients: Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Brazil Nuts, Basil 20g, Rocket, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Goat's Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Saucepan, Bowl
Description: Pesto is a great way to add plenty of flavour and healthy fats to a dish. In this recipe, you'll be making your own pesto with Brazil nuts, basil, rocket, hard Italian cheese and plenty of olive oil. You'll see how quick and easy pesto is to make, so if you are looking for more tasty pesto inspiration have a look at the HelloFresh blog this week!

Full Name: Cauliflower and Lentil Dal
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cauliflower, Coriander, Green Beans, Curry Powder, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Red Split Lentils, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Large Pot
Description: Every week we sit down and go through all your recipe scores and comments and they make a huge difference to the way our menu planning whiz, Ellie plans your future dinners. The humble dal is a great example. Of all the Indian recipes we’ve created, this one stands out from the crowd both in taste and pure, body-nourishing warmth.

Full Name: Veggie Packed Tagine with Honeyed Almonds
Ingredients: Cauliflower, Cumin Seeds, Onion, Carrot, Parsnip, Courgette, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Tomato Passata, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water for Stock, Wholewheat Couscous, Water, Almonds, Honey, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach
Description: This veggie packed tagine is a nutritional masterpiece packing in five of your five-a-day with a spectrum of colourful veggies. You may have heard the phrase 'eat the colours of the rainbow' as the colour of your food can tell you a lot about its nutritional value. Eating a variety of colours is one sure method to get as great a variety of vitamins and minerals as possible.

Full Name: Sizzling Honey Mustard Sausages. with Sweet Potato Mash and Sticky Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Honey Mustard Sausages, Sweet Potato, Potato, Red Onion, Beef Stock Pot, Tenderstem Broccoli
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pot
Description: Teaching people new skills is something which makes us pretty happy and this red onion gravy is no exception! Once you've mastered it (which should take about 4 minutes), you'll never go back to the bought stuff again! Gravy making skills: Tick!

Full Name: Beef Kofta Curry with Sag Aloo
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, King Edward Potato, Coriander, Mustard Seeds, Cumin, Ground Turmeric, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Beef Mince, Tandoori Paste, Coconut Milk, Baby Spinach, Lime
Utensils: Knife
Description: One thing we love about curry, is that it doesn’t always come with the same side. Rice is irresistible, but so are potatoes! The possibilities with potatoes seem to be endless! So, dig into this curry and enjoy!

Full Name: Chicken Shawarma Kebabs with Jewelled Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Shawarma Spice Mix, Red Onion, Bamboo Skewers, Water, Bulgur Wheat, Red Pepper, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Coriander, Lemon, Garlic Clove, Natural Yoghurt, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Bowl
Description: Do you know the Edgware Road in London? It runs north-west through our capital city from Marble Arch to Edgware on the outskirts of London. Since the 19th century, Edgware Road has been famed for its delicious Middle Eastern food, from kebabs to the very chicken shawarma that inspired this HelloFresh recipe.

Full Name: Family Calzone with Peppers, Bacon and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Mozzarella, Basil 20g, Tomato Passata, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Premium Baby Leaf Mix, Vine Tomatoes, Balsamic Vinegar
Description: Calzone, an Italian dish that originated in Naples, is an oven-baked folded pizza, so basically a pizza pie! We've filled this one with peppers , mozzarella and bacon. It's easy to make and delicious. It will, without doubt, be a family favourite!

Full Name: Creamy Prawn Rigatoni
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chives, Rigatoni Pasta, Fresh Peas, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Steve’s Leaves: Peashoots & Spinach
Description: This lip smackingly delicious meal looks like a dish you may find in a high-end Italian restaurant: creamy pasta with prawns, sweet peas, zesty pea shoots and chives. This dish is also almost as quick to cook as it is to eat! We think mums and families alike will love it!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Red Chilli, Thyme, Sage, Chicken Breast, Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: When asked what his favourite food is, Patrick, will say 'French' with very little hesitation. French food is to Patrick, what lentils are to the French. Known as the poor man’s caviar, the humble green lentil is an exalted ingredient in French cooking, with a texture superior to that of any other lentil variety. It has a delicious nutty flavour with a moreish smooth interior and nutritional credentials to knock your socks off. It’s also a cousin to the British pea. Enjoy!

Full Name: Stir-Fried Chinese Chilli Beef
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Ginger, Egg Noodle Nest, Tomato Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar
Utensils: Bowl, Large Pot, Frying Pan
Description: Well, you could knock us down with a feather! When Patrick whipped up this little number, we were instantly transported to a bustling backstreet eatery in Hong Kong. It blew our socks off! The trick with this dish is to slice your steak into strips as thinly as you can. Next, you need to cook it in a super hot frying pan in batches. By leaving space between each strip in the pan, they’ll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how it goes!

Full Name: Fragrant Lamb Pilaf with Spinach, Apricots and Minted Yoghurt
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Onion, Ras-el-Hanout, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Mint, Lentils, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon
Utensils: Frying Pan, Large Pot
Description: Our chef André has created this tasty lamb pilaf and given it a hearty boost with the addition of lentils. Lentils are a great filler in a dish, as they are packed full of fibre. The type of fibre found in lentils has fantastic benefits for heart and digestive health as well as keeping blood sugar levels stable. This dish also has a delicious flavour profile with zingy, minty yoghurt and hints of sweetness from the dried apricot

Full Name: Aubergine and Chicken Bake with Goat's Cheese
Ingredients: Aubergine, Red Pepper, Ground Coriander, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Mixed Beans, Chicken Thighs, Zahtar Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Sieve, Saucepan, Baking Dish
Description: This tasty zahtar spiced chicken bake will bring the warm, earthy flavours of the Middle East to your dinner table tonight. The beans you find in this recipe are a staple in Middle Eastern cuisine and provide a great alternative to carbohydrates like rice or potato. They are packed with fibre which helps stabilise blood sugar and keep your heart and tummy healthy.

Full Name: Refreshing Pasta with Mange Tout, Pancetta and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Mangetout, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Batman and Robin, Bert and Ernie. Some things were born to go together. There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of foodie fashion and this dish is testament to one such union. Marrying a time-honoured mixture of fresh peas, mint and pancetta this recipe spins a classic combination into a light ensemble. It’s quick to make, and perfect with a glass of something cold and bubbly.

Full Name: Chermoula, Honey and Sesame Aubergine, with Bulgur Wheat and a Pomegranate Salsa
Ingredients: Aubergine, Sesame Seeds, Honey, Chermoula Spice, Olive Oil, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Bulgur Wheat, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cucumber, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pomegranate Seeds, Sumac, Olive Oil for Salsa
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Large Pot
Description: You may notice that this recipe has a fairly high fat content, don't let this scare you away from this tasty dish! Fat has got a bit of a bad rap over the years, and often unnecessarily so! This recipe is particularly high in olive oil which has many health benefits. Good quality, extra virgin olive oil is high in monounsaturated fats (MUFAs) and polyphenols which can help prevent a whole range of afflictions including heart disease and diabetes, so eat up!

Full Name: Spiced Moroccan Lentil and Chickpea Soup
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chickpeas, Coriander, Ground Cumin, Ras-el-Hanout, Smoked Paprika, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Red Split Lentils, Ciabatta, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: They say 'you can lead a camel to water but you can’t make him drink'. We’re pretty sure if you led him to this steaming bowl of Moroccan soup, you wouldn’t have a problem! This recipe is inspired by Head Chef Patrick’s recent trip to the Atlas Mountains where he spent time with the nomadic Berbers.

Full Name: Homemade Vegetable Packed Calzone
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Leek, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs, Plum Tomatoes
Utensils: Baking Tray
Description: We’re really excited to get you making the HelloFresh calzone! Our good friends at The Northern Dough Company have made this beautiful pizza dough in advance, so that all you need to do is roll it out, top it with tastiness, fold it in half and bake it in your (pizza) oven. Make sure to cook this meal first this week so you get the dough at its absolute freshest!

Full Name: Refreshing Pasta, with Mange Tout, Pancetta and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Mangetout, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Description: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Batman and Robin, Bert and Ernie. Some things were born to go together. There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of foodie fashion and this dish is testament to one such union. Marrying a time-honoured mixture of fresh peas, mint and pancetta this recipe spins a classic combination into a light ensemble. It’s quick to make, and perfect with a glass of something cold and bubbly.

Full Name: Hoisin Pork Stir-Fry, with Yellow Peppers, Sugar Snap Peas and Brown Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Coriander, Celery Stick, Yellow Pepper, Ginger, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Sugar Snap Peas, Lime, Hoisin Sauce
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan
Description: So January has already passed and how many of those healthy resolutions have stuck? Well, let us help you back on that horse with this nourishing and tasty meal! Brown rice is packed full of fibre, whilst chilli will give your metabolism the jump start it needs. Combine that with immune boosting ginger and garlic and an array of vegetables and you’ve got a nutritional powerhouse! Enjoy!

Full Name: Gnocchi Bolognese with Cheesy Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Purple Sprouting Broccoli, Carrot, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, Provencale Herbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Gnocchi, Basil 20g
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: We've reinvented the family classic bolognese by teaming it with crispy gnocchi. This recipe also packs in a whopping 4 of your 5 a day, sneakily hidden in the bolognese sauce and under delicious melted cheese. This recipe is sure to make both mum and kids very happy!

Full Name: Butterflied Chicken with Feta, Leek and Minted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Leek, Chicken Breast, Feta Cheese, Mint
Description: For tonight’s dinner, we’ve sourced potatoes from our awesome potato people at Linroyale. They have been selecting their little bundles of treasure for four generations now and put an incredible amount of passion and care into what they do. Go check them out at www.linroyale.co.uk to see where your 'taters' come from!

Full Name: Butternut, Sage and Pancetta Pie with Honey Glazed Beans and Carrots
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Sage, Pancetta, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Dorset Puff Pastry Sheet, Carrot, Green Beans, Honey
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Pot
Description: This delicious pie is comfort food at its best. This recipe combines the sweet, creamy flavours of butternut squash with peppery sage and meaty pancetta, complemented with a side of crunchy honeyed carrots and beans. Our tummies are grumbling already...

Full Name: Cajun Pork with Bulgur Wheat and Garlicky Spring Greens
Ingredients: Cajun Spice, Honey, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Spring Greens, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Making bulgur from wheat is one of the oldest food processes in the world - some say it's over 4000 years old. When something's been around for that long, you know it must be pretty solid. Add that to rich, deep Cajun pork and some simple garlicky spring greens and you've got yourself a bit of a feast!

Full Name: Red Thai Prawn Curry with Star Anise Rice
Ingredients: Water for Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Carrot, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Lemongrass, Coriander, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Water, Tiger Prawns, Lime, Star Anise, Star Anise
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan
Description: This delicious and beautifully fragrant dish is super easy and quick to prepare. With its fresh flavours, this mild curry will warm you from the inside on a cold winter night.

Full Name: Sweet Potato Cottage Pie with Roasted Broccoli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Green Beans, Sweet Potato, Potato, Beef Mince, Netherend Butter Salted, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Green Beans
Utensils: Saucepan, Large Pot, Grater, Oven dish, Baking Tray
Description: Mimi's mum is said to make the absolute best cottage pie in the world. So, Mimi whipped up this recipe for her mum, with a bit of a twist, using sweet potato in the mash! This little trick adds more fibre, vitamins and delicious flavour to the mash. Thankfully Mrs Morley gave her seal of approval (with a lot of mmmmmms to go with it)!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Crème Fraîche, Dijon Mustard, Tarragon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Sieve
Description: Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in a while we see a sharp spike in the scores, and until recently we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: Tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tomato Puree 30g, Plum Tomatoes, Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage
Utensils: Saucepan, Baking Tray
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Freekeh Pilaf with Mango Halloumi and Balsamic Charred Peppers
Ingredients: Onion, Red Pepper, Mint, Chermoula Spice, Freekeh, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Balsamic Vinegar, Pistachios, Halloumi, Mango Chutney 40g, Lemon
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: We've packed extra flavour into this delicious dish by caramelising the halloumi in mango chutney. The sugar in the chutney loses its water content and starts to 'brown' which gives it a beautiful glossy texture and an amazing golden caramel flavour. We hope you enjoy!

Full Name: Veggie Meatballs with Linguine and Salsa Pomodoro
Ingredients: Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Black Beans, Flour, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Dried Oregano, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Provencale Herbs, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Linguine, Rocket, Basil 20g
Utensils: Sieve, Bowl, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Pot
Description: These baked meatless meatballs are a veggie's dream - jam packed with protein, fibre and B vitamins, and so easy to make (no food processor in sight!). We have teamed them up with a rich pomodoro sauce and linguine. We think you'll love these versatile veggie meatballs so much you'll want to remake them and pop them in a wrap, stuff them in a pita or serve them with some couscous. Enjoy!

Full Name: Brazilian Sweet Potato 'Veijoada' Bake with Shallot Salsa Salad
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Onion, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Black Beans, Ground Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Cheddar Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Echalion Shallot, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Sieve, Frying Pan, Grater, Baking Dish
Description: Feijoada is a traditional Brazilian meat stew eaten daily with black beans. It come from the Portuguese word feijão for beans. We've given this a HelloFresh spin with our very own 'veijoada' veggie bake. So put your feet up and enjoy some delicious Brazilian fodder!

Full Name: Mexican Spiced Chicken and Rice with Deconstructed Guacamole
Ingredients: Onion, Chicken Breast, Cumin Seeds, Mexican Spice, Basmati Rice, Water, Plum Tomatoes, Coriander, Lime, Avocado, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: This simple chicken and rice dish is flavoured with bold spices like cumin seeds and our fantastic Mexican Fajita spice blend. Toasting the rice in a bit of the chicken fat adds big taste too. The dish is finished with our take on deconstructed guacamole - all the flavours of guacamole with no mashing required!

Full Name: Roasted Pork Medallion with Sweet Potato Mash and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Sweet Potato, Broccoli, Black Peppercorns, Crème Fraîche, Water, Beef Stock Pot
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Pot, Potato Masher
Description: We’ve taken the best Pork Medallion we could lay our hands on and teamed it with super nutritious sweet potato mash and broccoli. The easy to make and super tasty peppercorn sauce makes this dish extra special.

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Chicken and Chestnut Mushrooms
Ingredients: Water, Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Chicken Thighs, Basmati Rice, Cornflour, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: When our Head Chef decided to get some work experience in a law firm after university, the usual choices (London, Belgium, Frankfurt) didn’t really appeal. So he decided to go to Bangkok. A month in an office meant three months of pocket money on the islands, so the maths made sense. During the day instead of eating with the lawyers at lunchtime, he’d nip over to a nearby food hall and feast with all the locals. Massaman rice was his go-to dish, so this week he decided to take a trip down memory lane.

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Fish and Chips with Cooling Cucumber Raita
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Cucumber, Mint, Ras-el-Hanout, Flour, Tilapia Fillet, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Baking Tray, Peeler, Sieve, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Who says this national treasure of a dish can’t be given a cheeky international twist? Almost two years ago now a young, footloose, fancy-free Patrick predicted that Tilapia would be ‘the fish of the future’. Well the future is here and his prediction is coming along nicely. A delicious, firm fish, popular in tropical climes, Tilapia is a sustainable fish that’s perfectly complemented by robust Moroccan spices.

Full Name: Mexican Spiced Chilli Tostadas with Guac and Cheese
Ingredients: Wholemeal Tortilla, Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Red Kidney Beans, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Beef Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Avocado, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Sieve, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Mimi has whipped up a delicious Mexican feast, piled high on homemade tostadas. Tostadas are simply toasted tortillas, making them crispy and crunchy! We have given you plenty of tortillas in this recipe; have a look at the HelloFresh blog for ideas on what you can do with the leftovers!

Full Name: Spicy Sausage with Broccoli Mash and Cheat's Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Broccoli, Spring Onion, Spiced Pork Sausage, Original Onion Marmalade, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Large Pot, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Potato Masher, Sieve
Description: We have added a sneaky HelloFresh twist to the family favourite, sausage and mash, by adding broccoli to the mash! Not only is it creamy and delicious, but with the hidden nutritional benefit of broccoli, it's a real winner!

Full Name: Spaghetti with Creamy Smoked Salmon and Crispy Broccoli Spaghetti
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Chives, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Hot Smoked Salmon, Spaghetti, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Large Pot, Bowl, Sieve, Frying Pan
Description: Salmon is one of our favourite ingredients, not only is it delicious, it is choc-full of healthy fats. Oily fish, like salmon, are the best dietary sources of omega 3 fatty acids which are essential for healthy brain function and eye health. These fats are also anti-inflammatory which helps prevent chronic conditions like heart disease, diabetes and arthritis.

Full Name: Baked Tuscan Sausage Tortilla
Ingredients: Tuscan Pork Sausage, Echalion Shallot, Red Pepper, Tomato Passata, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Wholemeal Tortilla, Baby Spinach, Hard Italian Cheese, Rocket, Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: At the HelloFresh Farm we love to take a traditional recipe and give it a fresh twist. In this recipe we have morphed the sausage roll into a far healthier and (we think) tastier version. These baked sausage tortillas are packed full of flavour and goodness. We think they may become a new family favourite!

Full Name: Middle Eastern Risotto with Zaatar Portobellos
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Portobello Mushroom, Red Pepper, Ras-el-Hanout, Arborio Rice, Zahtar Spice, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: This dish is a delicious fusion of Italian and Middle Eastern flavours. The risotto is seasoned with zahtar spice; a blend of sumac, sesame seeds and thyme. It's delicate flavour combination teams beautifully with the earthy portobello mushrooms and creamy risotto.

Full Name: Smoky Ratatouille with Goat’s Cheese and Garlic Bruschetta
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Ciabatta, Basil 20g, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: One of our favourite spices is most definitely smoked paprika. Regular paprika is often made by drying out peppers in the sun and then grinding them to a spicy powder. The smoked variety are dried in smoke sheds using wood such as oak to give them their delicious, distinctive flavour. For this recipe, we balanced it against the mild flavour of our fantastic goat’s cheese, to make this perky, fresh dinner time favourite!

Full Name: Paprika Pork with Crushed New Potatoes and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Bay Leaf, Water, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Red Pepper, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Smoked Paprika, Pork Medallion
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Lid, Sieve, Spoon, Baking Tray, Pot, Fork, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A combination of Spanish delights. A very simple Spanish butter bean stew using fresh tomatoes, rich in flavour and colour. A great little dish on its own! It’s difficult to go into a tapas bar and not find this on the menu. And of course, a traditional combination of paprika and pork that will send wonderful, zingy notes to your taste buds.

Full Name: Chickpea Pancakes with Cajun Chicken and Sweetcorn Salsa
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Chicken Thighs, Sour Cream, Cajun Spice, Lime, Gram Flour, Ground Coriander, Water, Sweetcorn, Coriander, Vine Tomatoes, Premium Baby Leaf Mix, Premium Baby Leaf Mix
Utensils: Baking Tray, Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Large Bowl, Whisk, Bowl, Sieve, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Spatula, Aluminum Foil, Plate
Description: In honour of pancake day, Mimi has created these beautiful chickpea pancakes! They are egg and gluten free and are light and savoury. It is always best to have a test run with your first pancake, so we have given you extra batter to play with!

Full Name: Spaghetti with Creamy Smoked Salmon and Crispy Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Chives, Red Chilli, Hot Smoked Salmon, Spaghetti, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Large Pot, Fork, Sieve, Frying Pan
Description: Salmon is one of our favourite ingredients, not only is it delicious, it is chock-full of healthy fats. Oily fish, like salmon, are the best dietary sources of omega 3 fatty acids which are essential for healthy brain function and eye health. These fats are also anti-inflammatory which helps prevent chronic conditions like heart disease, diabetes and arthritis.

Full Name: Caribbean Spicy Sausages
Ingredients: Green Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Jerk Spice Mix, Mango Chutney 40g, Spiced Pork Sausage, Potato, Potato, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Cutting board, Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Large Pot, Lid, Potato Masher, Sieve, Plate
Description: This spicy dish is sure to get your taste buds talking. Caribbean food is renowned for being full of flavour and spice so get yourself prepared! The peppers and onion will caramelise so everything will be slightly sticky, which just adds to the flavour. We’ve also asked our butchers to add a little chilli to the sausages to give them a bit of a kick!

Full Name: Beef Meatball Goulash with Rice
Ingredients: Red Onion, Green Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dried Thyme, Mild Paprika, Ground Coriander, Beef Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Water, Basmati Rice, Water for Rice, Beef Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Spoon, Pan with Lid, Mixing Bowl, Aluminum Foil, Bowl, Ladle
Description: André has created a HelloFresh twist on a classic goulash with herby, smoky meatballs and rice. Authentic goulash or gulyás is a beef dish cooked with onions, paprika, tomatoes and green pepper. Hungarian goulash is neither a soup nor a stew, but something in between; we hope you enjoy this 'stoup'!

Full Name: Goat's Cheese and Caramelised Onion 'Chic Pea' Pancake
Ingredients: Red Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Cherry Tomatoes, Gram Flour, Water, Balsamic Vinegar, Goat's Cheese, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Whisk, Pan
Description: In honour of pancake day, Mimi has created these beautiful chickpea pancakes! They are egg and gluten free and make beautiful, light savoury crepes. A little chef's trick you learn in this recipe is to rest your pancake batter for a few minutes before cooking, this helps create a more even texture for lighter, fluffier pancakes!

Full Name: Farmhouse Vegetable Gratin with Mozzarella and Mixed Beans
Ingredients: Aubergine, Courgette, Onion, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Mixed Beans, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Provencale Herbs, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Mozzarella
Utensils: Bowl, Sieve, Frying Pan, Baking Dish
Description: What’s in a name? When it comes to naming our recipes it’s a pretty simple case of imagining where you might eat this dish if you weren’t in your kitchen. We quite fancied that we’d eat this in a cosy little cottage on a hilltop in the south of France. Mozzarella and Italian cheese give a little touch from across the border and add a great source of protein too! Bon appétit!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Red Chilli, Thyme, Sage, Chicken Breast, Green Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: When asked what his favourite food is, Patrick, will say 'French' with very little hesitation. French food is to Patrick, what lentils are to the French. Known as the poor man’s caviar, the humble green lentil is an exalted ingredient in French cooking, with a texture superior to that of any other lentil variety. It has a delicious nutty flavour with a moreish smooth interior and nutritional credentials to knock your socks off. It’s also a cousin to the British pea. Enjoy!

Full Name: Cumin Spiced Meatball Feta Bake with Speedy Sauce and Linguine
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Basil 20g, Garlic Clove, Beef Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Ground Cumin, Dried Thyme, Tomato Passata, Peas, Feta Cheese, Linguine
Utensils: Bowl, Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Pot
Description: This pasta bake features a great chef hack that is simple and healthy! Create a 'raw' sauce by mixing tomato passata, garlic, fresh basil plus any veggies you choose and baking with a choice of toppings like the meatballs and feta featured in this dish. This trick is quick and simple and eliminates the necessity for sugar-laden store bought pasta sauce!

Full Name: Grilled Chicken with Saffron Spiced Freekeh and Zahtar
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Lemon, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Saffron, Water, Freekeh, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Red Chilli, Zahtar Spice, Red Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: We can almost see spring on the horizon and we are so excited for the flowers to blossom and the sun to return that we are celebrating with this super healthy dish. This lemony grilled chicken breast teamed with saffron spiced freekeh and a zingy zahtar dressing is the perfect dish to give you that (almost) springtime feeling!

Full Name: Strolling Rigatoni with Plum Tomatoes and Mozzarella Cheese
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Chorizo, Black Olives, Mozzarella
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Frying Pan
Description: The key to this dish is gently roasting the cherry tomatoes and pepper to bring out their natural sweetness and then balancing this against tangy olives and mild, creamy mozzarella cheese. We’ve made it super quick and easy, to leave more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: Crispy Sea Bream with Braised Fennel, Parsley Mash and Zesty Crumbs
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Fennel, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Water, Panko Breadcrumbs, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Sea Bream Fillet
Utensils: Pot, Frying Pan, Bowl, Potato Masher
Description: At HelloFresh we love to take familiar favourites and give them a fresh twist. In this recipe we replaced the traditional crumbed fish with a 'deconstructed' zesty crumb. Served with braised fennel and parsley mash this one definitely takes it up a notch!

Full Name: Smoky Homemade Hamburgers with Rustic Chips and a Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Smoked Paprika, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Cheddar Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan
Description: You can learn a lot from the television. Endless hours of daytime television have allowed Caroline to perfect her cross stitch. Another trick we recently learned came from a certain US cooking show where the host is challenged to eat the biggest/hottest/baddest food in the west. In one episode, a famous burger joint uses the tip in step 6 to get their burgers extra juicy. We thought we’d give it a try...

Full Name: Mexican Veggie Beanie Tostadas with Cheat's Guacamole and Cheese
Ingredients: Corn Tortilla, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Courgette, Mixed Beans, Mexican Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Avocado, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Sieve, Frying Pan, Bowl, Grater
Description: Mimi has whipped up a delicious Mexican feast, piled high on homemade tostadas. Tostadas are simply toasted tortillas, making them crispy and crunchy! We have given you plenty more tortillas than needed in this recipe; have a look at the HelloFresh blog for ideas on what you can do with the leftovers!

Full Name: Herby Cumin Chicken with Patatas Bravas and Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Flat Leaf Parsley, Olive Oil, Ground Cumin, Lemon, Chicken Thighs, Red Potato, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Courgette
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: This delicious recipe was inspired by a visit to a tapas restaurant in Dundee! Patatas bravas is a typical Spanish dish which consists of sautéed potatoes dressed in a spicy tomato sauce. For this meal, we've created a tapas style dinner with herby cumin chicken, charred courgettes and the game changing patatas bravas. Enjoy!

Full Name: Spaghetti with Speedy Fennel and Lamb Ragu
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Rosemary, Fennel, Lamb Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan, Pot, Sieve
Description: This recipe features fennel, an uncommon ingredient which we feel is terribly undervalued! Fennel adds a sweet liquorice flavour that fuses beautifully with lamb and olives. The trick to preparing the fennel is to slice it as thinly as possible, so it browns and caramelises evenly and quickly.

Full Name: Spiced Chicken with Coconut Rice and Baked Corn on the Cob
Ingredients: Corn on the Cob, Honey, Shawarma Spice Mix, Chicken Drumstick, Onion, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Black Beans, Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Bowl, Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: This creamy coconut rice is (in our humble opinion), pretty amazing. Teamed with some delicious shawarma spiced chicken drumsticks and roasted corn on the cob, it's going to be a sensational (but slightly messy!) dinner... Enjoy!

Full Name: Sausage and Mustard Casserole with Roasted Butternut Wedges
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Tarragon, Pancetta, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Wholegrain Mustard, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach, Toulouse Sausage
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pot, Pan, Sieve
Description: Roasted butternut is a delicious and nutritious alternative to potato. We like to roast the butternut with the skin on as it saves time and the skin is full of nutrients and fibre. We hope you enjoy this creamy sausage casserole with its new easy cook accomplice!

Full Name: Chicken Shawarma with Dukkah Courgettes and Chickpeas
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Shawarma Spice Mix, Courgette, Super Dukkah Mix, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Mint, Chickpeas, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Lemon, Greek Yoghurt
Description: This chicken shawarma recipe features many of our favourite  elements of Middle Eastern cuisine. 'Firstly, it has great flavour, with the inclusion of warm shawarma seasoning and nutty dukkah spice and secondly, it has good texture and nutritional benefits from the addition of the chickpeas.

Full Name: Mediterranean Stew with Grilled Sea Bream
Ingredients: Carrot, Leek, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Provencale Herbs, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Ciabatta, Olive Oil, Sea Bream Fillet, Tinned Plum Tomates
Description: The inspiration for this dish came from a sleepy little fishing village in Sicily. Fishermen head into port in the morning and a queue of locals and restaurant owners jostle for position on the dockside to get the first pick. We combined the beautifully fresh sea bream with a classic Mediterranean mixture of tomatoes, garlic and herbs to create a recipe that lifts us out of the kitchen and puts us right back on the dock of that bay. Bravissimo!

Full Name: Coconut Caribbean Soup with Home Baked Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Lime, Red Kidney Beans, Poudre de Columbo, Dried Thyme, Chopped Tomatoes, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla
Utensils: Knife, Strainer, Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Tags: Veggie, Vegan, One Pot Wonder, Spicy, Healthy
Description: Poudre de Columbo is a Caribbean curry powder from our wonderful spice suppliers ‘Seasoned Pioneers’. It smells pretty damn good and cooked with creamy coconut milk, veggies and crispy tortilla chips on the side, it tastes pretty damn good too! Get stuck in!

Full Name: Greek Ragu with Almond, Aubergine & Basil Couscous
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Onion, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Aubergine, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Green Olives, Ground Almond, Basil 20g, Feta Cheese
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pan, Fork, Plate
Description: The Ancient Greeks are famed for their spectacular mythology, their Gods and Goddesses and their epic storytelling. But we think their ragu is one of their lesser known treasures. The gentle, warm tang of our tomatoes blends like a charm with flaked almonds and aubergines. And when you add the herby basil couscous into the mix...  Well - take our word for it, the whole family will love it!

Full Name: Mushroom and Pancetta Gnocchi.
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Pancetta, Gnocchi, Broccoli, Parmesan Cheese, Crème Fraîche, Chestnut Mushrooms, Water
Utensils: Knife, Frying Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: We think that crispy pan-fried gnocchi with crème fraîche is not only super tasty but incredibly easy to make! The gnocchi has a crispy coating and a pillow-like centre, accompanied by ‘meaty’ chestnut mushrooms, tasty broccoli, cheese and flat leaf parsley. We think we’ve made our own delicacy with this twist on a classic Italian dish!

Full Name: LEON Warm Chicken Kale Caesar Salad
Ingredients: Olive Oil, White Wine Vinegar, Honey, Dijon Mustard, New Potatoes, Chicken Thighs, Spring Greens, Chives, Parmesan Cheese, Kale
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate, Pot, Sieve
Description: A recipe from Naturally Fast Food chain LEON, who’s seventh cookbook Fast & Free is out now. Although this does not use traditional Caesar dressing, the mustard and parmesan make it highly reminiscent of one. People really do hail the kale at LEON.

Full Name: Prawn and Chorizo Chickpea Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Chorizo, Mild Paprika, Chopped Tomatoes, Chickpeas, Vegetable Stock Pot, Tiger Prawns, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Frying Pan
Description: A HelloFresh fave, this tomato-based stew is taken up a notch with chorizo, and sweet, juicy prawns. We’ve included paprika for added smoky flavour and rich colour and some chickpeas for protein and health boosting fibre. Enjoy!

Full Name: Minted Lamb and Feta Burgers with a Crunchy Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Baby Gem Lettuce, Radish, Spring Onion, Mint, Lamb Mince, Feta Cheese, Brioche Bun
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: For Da Vinci, it was Mona Lisa. For Banksy, Kate Moss. Down the centuries great artists have been moved to great feats of creativity by a beautiful muse. For Head Chef Patrick, that mythical muse is the burger. A thing of such delicious, dribble-down-your-chin simplicity, it can be re-invented time and time again to create the most divine dinner time results. For this little incarnation, he’s taken lamb mince and thrown in a Greek twist with a kick of minty freshness.

Full Name: Spiced Pork with Creamy Lentils and Nigella Chapatis
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Malay Curry Powder, Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Nigella Seeds, Olive Oil, Wholemeal Tortilla, Green Lentils, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Plate, Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Sieve
Description: André has whipped up this great warming dish to get you through the final push to spring. The fiery Malay spiced pork is tempered with creamy, filling lentils. He has even topped it off with super quick nigella seed flavoured chapatis - a taste sensation!

Full Name: Pimped Up Pan Haggerty
Ingredients: Red Potato, Dried Thyme, Echalion Shallot, Leek, Cheddar Cheese, Broccoli, Courgette, Wholegrain Mustard, Feta Cheese, Olive Oil, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Baking Tray, Cutting board, Knife, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Pan haggerty is a traditional Northumbrian vegetarian dish containing potato, onion and cheese. We've pimped it up with the addition of broccoli, leek, courgette and delicate pea shoots. This dish will warm you from the inside and pack in plenty of extra veggies!

Full Name: Mushroom Risotto
Ingredients: Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Flat Leaf Parsley, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Large Pot, Cutting board, Knife, Large Pan, Ladle, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Do not let the fear of continuous stirring put you off this risotto. The secret to an enjoyable risotto is to cook it slowly while stirring, so as to release and stabilise the starch within the arborio rice. Adding too much stock at once will only produce gluggy risotto, so make sure you only a ladle of stock when the rice is looking dry and thirsty. The nutty flavour of the mushroom paired with the hard Italian cheese are the perfect additions to the rice.

Full Name: Quickdraw Quesadillas with Tomato Salsa and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Corn on the Cob, Cheddar Cheese, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Black Beans, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Lime, Sour Cream, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Bowl, Pan, Sieve, Plate
Description:
Our chef Victoria LOVES quesadillas. Why? Because they are D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S with a capital D. They also remind her of the time when she hopped off to Mexico for a few months with a couple of
Mexican Pesos in her pocket and not much else. She would often eat quesadillas twice a day for weeks on end, and never tire of them! We’re hoping you enjoy these tasty Mexican beauties as much as her -
provecho!

Full Name: Tomato Garlic Ragu with Spaghetti
Ingredients: Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Onion, Beef Mince, Soy Sauce, Dried Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: This classic Italian dish has a hint of Far Eastern charm thrown in. Traditionally, us Brits love the addition of a bit of Worcestershire sauce in our hotpots, pasta sauces and even ragus, but here at the Fresh Farm we’re all about a splash of soy sauce! The saltiness is a subtle but genius addition to the succulent minced beef, aromatic thyme and juicy tomatoes - a perfect combination for a night in! Give it a try in this dish and we’re sure you’ll be using soy sauce in everything soon

Full Name: Sweet Potato Cottage Pie with Roasted Broccoli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Broccoli, Sweet Potato, Potato, Beef Mince, Netherend Butter Salted, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese
