Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Baking Dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mimi’s mum is said to make the absolute best cottage pie in the world. So, Mimi whipped up this recipe for her mum, because she knew if her mum liked it - it’d be a winner. Thankfully Mrs Morley gave her seal of approval (with a lot of mmmmmms to go with it)!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Crème Fraîche, Dijon Mustard, Tarragon, Chicken Breast
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Pan, Pot
Description:
Every week we painstakingly go through the results of your recipe feedback to make sure we’re on track to make tastier meals. Every once in a while we see a sharp spike in the scores, and until recently
we couldn’t put our finger on the reason. Then we realised: Tarragon. It seems this little wonder herb perks up dinner time no end. Expect to see more on the menu soon!

Full Name: Super Quick Creamy Pasta with Peas and Bacon
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Fusilli, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer, Bowl
Description: After a long day at work, there’s always the temptation to eat something super simple, so you can maximize your time on the couch in your fluffy slippers with a blanket and a cuppa. Well, your wish is our command! Our pea and bacon pasta is unbelievably tasty and quick in equal measure. Its oh-so-creamy sauce brings it all together! So, get those slippers ready, it’s going to be an awesome night in!

Full Name: Fragrant Fish Tagine with Lemon Couscous
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chermoula Spice, Chopped Tomatoes, Raisins, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Couscous, Tilapia Fillet, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Large Pan, Kettle, Bowl, Lid, Zester, Fork
Description:
Spring makes us yearn for a mellow seaside and some freshly caught fish. Unfortunately we're out of seasides, but we do have this incredible Tilapia from our lovely fishmonger. This fish tagine is perfectly spiced with chermoula AND raisins for a dash of sweetness.
Serve it on a bed of lemony couscous. If you fancy some wine, it goes perfectly with a Beaujolais.

Full Name: Ksar Char-Bagh Moroccan Beef Burgers.
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Harissa Spice Mix, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Tags: Eat first, Extra spicy, Family Box
Description: 'What’s this Ksar Char-Bagh?' we hear you ask?! Head Chef Patrick recently did a recipe reconnaissance mission to Morocco and after spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he decided to treat himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel in Marrakech. Their Moroccan spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression! Check out his Moroccan video diary on our blog.

Full Name: Hearty Toulouse Sausage Cassoulet with a Kick of Chilli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tomato Puree 30g, Plum Tomatoes, Cannellini Beans, Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Red Chilli, Toulouse Sausage
Utensils: Saucepan, Baking Tray
Description: Much as the Italians will often add a whole, unchopped clove of garlic to the pan to add a milder flavour, here you’ll just stab the chilli to release a bit of heat and flavour. The beauty of this recipe is that you can adjust the spice level by sticking your knife in as many times as you like. Patrick likes his cassoulet a bit cheeky so his chilli looked like a pin cushion!

Full Name: Keftedes with Tabbouleh and Mint Tzatziki
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Boiling Water, Onion, Garlic Clove, Cumin, Ground Cinnamon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Plain Flour, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt, Mint, Lamb Mince
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: This Greek inspired tabbouleh with keftedes (that’s Greek for meatballs) is an absolute favourite of our chef Vix, she’s so proud of the flavours that she wants you all to try it. She believes it will bring some absolute sparkle to your dinner time and to your day. Enjoy!

Full Name: Honey and Mustard Glazed Pork with Apple Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Sage, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Rocket, Green Lentils, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Apple, Red Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer, Plate
Description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away – at least that’s what they claim! With carrot, celery, lentils and rocket added to the mix, this dish is absolutely loaded with both flavour and nutrition. Now for the decadent part ... we have taken the finest pork in the land and glazed it (generously) with the sweetness that only honey can pull off and the warmth of mustard. You are in for a treat!

Full Name: Veggie Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Carrot, Celery Stick, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cheddar Cheese, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Lentils, Ground Coriander, Ground Coriander
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Pot, Pan, Grater, Potato Masher, Baking Dish
Description: This pie features a filling of colourful veggies and meaty mushrooms crowned with creamy mash. It’s warm and comforting, the perfect antidote to a chilly winter evening!

Full Name: Honey and Mustard Glazed Pork with Apple Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Sage, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Rocket, Green Lentils, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Pork Medallion, Red Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Baking Tray, Strainer, Plate
Description: An apple a day keeps the doctor away – at least that’s what they claim! With carrot, celery, lentils and rocket added to the mix, this dish is absolutely loaded with both flavour and nutrition. Now for the decadent part ... we have taken the finest pork in the land and glazed it (generously) with the sweetness that only honey can pull off and the warmth of mustard. You are in for a treat!

Full Name: Creamy Leek and Mustard Chicken with Stir-Fried Green Beans
Ingredients: Leek, Potato, Green Beans, Chicken Breast, Double Cream, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Mustard Seeds
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Pan, Strainer
Description: Why did the chicken cross the road? In this case, it’s definitely to get to the mustard on the other side, because, boy, do those two make a mean combination! We’ve added some tender, crunchy green beans and creamy potatoes to soften the mustardy goodness. This mustard means business – particularly when you add the extra mustard seeds.

Full Name: Lamb Kofta with Almond Couscous and Cucumber Salad
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Red Onion, Mint, Almonds, Bamboo Skewers, Lamb Mince, Allspice, Ground Cinnamon, Cumin, Cucumber, Lime, Natural Yoghurt, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous, Water
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Bowl, Peeler, Lid, Pot, Fork, Grater
Description: We’ve been working on a theory down here at The Fresh Farm. We’re convinced that if you can eat a meal with only a fork, or even better simply gnaw it off a stick, then it’s bound to be tasty. Think about it: spaghetti bolognese, shepherd’s pie and every single one of those delicious ‘sticky’ street food morsels you’ve had whilst on holiday. This evening we’re putting the theory to the test!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Flank Steak, Flank Steak, New Potatoes, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Water
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description:
If we had a penny for every time we saw a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. There are certain cardinal tips you have to follow for a perfect result:
1) Allow your steak to come up to room temperature before you cook it.
2) Get your frying pan super hot before your steak goes in.
3) Make sure you rest your steak on a warm plate for a few mins after cooking before you cut into it.
Right, now you’re ready!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta, Red Pepper
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Pan
Description:
Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective
of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Chicken Saltimbocca with Squashed Butternut and Garlicky Beans
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Green Beans, Green Beans, Garlic Clove, Sage, Chicken Breast, Serrano Ham
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Large Pot, Baking Tray, Plate
Description:
The Italian word saltimbocca loosely translates as ‘jump in the mouth’. This dish is traditionally made with veal, ham and
sage. We have mixed it up a little in this recipe using chicken in place of veal. We think it truly lives up to its name and will
make your taste buds sing!

Full Name: Iranian Lamb Stew Ghormeh Sabzi with Fluffy Rice and Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Kidney Beans, Water for Rice, Basmati Rice, Lamb Mince, Ground Turmeric, Sabzi Ghormeg, Chicken Stock Pot, Water for Lamb, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Lime, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Bowl
Description: This evening we bring you the spice of the month Ghormeh Sabzi! This herb mixture gives its name to the dish in which it is used, often said to be the national dish of Iran! Its history dates back over 2000 years! Ghormeh Sabzi translates to 'stewed herbs' and the herb blend contains feugreek leaves which give it its interesting and distinct flavour. With its delicious taste and texture this stew has definitely stood the test of time!

Full Name: Italian Polpetti Soup with Conchiglioni and Ciabatta
Ingredients: Oregano, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Carrot, Parmesan Cheese, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Mince, Chilli Flakes, Conchiglioni, Ciabatta
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: As far back as 1897, Pellegrino Artusi, author of 'The Science of Cooking and the Art of Eating Well', included three recipes for ‘polpetti’. In Tuscany they were a favourite of housewives who frugally made them using scraps of meat and bread to feed their hungry families. We are of course referring to the (not so humble) meatball. Here we’ve jazzed up the recipe with parmesan and a kick of chilli to tickle your taste buds.

Full Name: Coconut Dal with Roasted Butternut Squash, Onion Textures and Warm Flatbreads
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Curry Powder, Onion, Red Chilli, Vine Tomatoes, Coriander, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coconut Milk, Red Split Lentils, Plain Flour, Flatbread, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan
Description: This recipe is a total stonker. With a good kick of chilli it’s just the ticket for a windy weeknight. ‘Onion textures’ sound a little more posh than they need to - it just means some nice crunchy onions to add a bit of textural contrast to your dal. To make them really crispy, get the oil nice and hot and don’t overcrowd the pan. If they have a bit of space to cook then they'll fry well (instead of stewing), which will give you a perfect finish. Enjoy!

Full Name: Creamy Vegetable and Feta Pie
Ingredients: Potato, Potato, Leek, Celery Stick, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Thyme, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Kale and Rainbow Chard Mix, Panko Breadcrumbs, Feta Cheese, Double Cream
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: At the Fresh Farm we dedicate a lot of time to customer feedback. Recently our lovely veggie customers have been requesting a vegetarian potato dish… Well your wish is our command! This delicious, creamy and comforting dinner is full of vegetables and topped with some crunchy breadcrumbs and feta… yum!

Full Name: Zahtar Spiced Halloumi with Grilled Aubergine Orzo
Ingredients: Aubergine, Ground Coriander, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Orzo, Zahtar Spice, Lemon, Flat Leaf Parsley, Halloumi
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: In this dish we bring you a fusion of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisine. Zahtar spice gives the orzo a distinct zingy flavour, synonymous with Middle Eastern dishes, which balances beautifully with creamy halloumi and coriander spiced aubergine.

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Knife, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let’s keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Cajun Pork with Bulgur Wheat and Garlicky Spring Greens
Ingredients: Cajun Spice, Honey, Pork Medallion, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Spring Greens, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Bowl, Pot, Knife, Pan
Description: Making bulgur from wheat is one of the oldest food processes in the world - some say it’s over 4000 years old. When something’s been around for that long, you know it must be pretty solid. Add that to rich, deep Cajun pork and some simple garlicky greens and you’ve got yourself a bit of a feast!

Full Name: Cheeky Chicken Chow Mein with Oyster Style Sauce and Water Chestnuts
Ingredients: Broccoli, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Carrot, Spring Onion, Water Chestnuts, Ginger, Chicken Thighs, Soy Sauce, Tomato Passata, Egg Noodle Nest, Oyster Style Sauce, Beansprouts
Utensils: Grater, Spoon, Large Pan, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Chicken Chow Mein is a classic dish that has been adopted around the world. Chow Mein simply means ‘fried noodles’ and the dish can be interpreted according to your taste. The trick with this dish is to reserve half a cup of the salted water in which you cooked the noodles and broccoli. Right at the end you’ll add it to the pan to loosen up your noodles and create a delicious sauce. Yum!

Full Name: Beef Enchiladas with Homemade Ranchero Beans
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Red Kidney Beans, Mexican Spice, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Sour Cream, Lime
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Grater, Bowl, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces… Arriba!

Full Name: Honey Mustard Gammon with Parsley Sauce
Ingredients: Carrot, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Potato, Honey, English Mustard, Gammon Steak, Boiling Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Baking Tray, Potato Masher, Strainer, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There are quite a few versions of how curing meat to make ham and gammon came about. Some say it was the Chinese and others say it was the Gauls. Either way, we’re mighty happy that they did, because gammon is so good. The saltiness of a gammon steak is absolutely divine when you add a bit of honey. So, get that honey and gammon and get cooking!

Full Name: Bangladeshi Lamb Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Mangetout, Poudre de Columbo, Lamb Mince, Mint, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Water
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Bowl
Description: Biryani is traditionally made with a leg of goat, but here we’ve made it with our delicious lamb mince from butchers Roaming Roosters. It’s a traditional dish from South Asia and is often served at weddings and on big occasions… and is also delicious as a mid-week meal! Enjoy!

Full Name: Harissa Halloumi with Pomegranate Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Water, Lemon, Bulgur Wheat, Red Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Vine Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Bowl, Pan
Description: Undoubtedly one of the most beautiful ingredients you can lay your mitts on, the pomegranate has been celebrated as a symbol of ambition and prosperity since Ancient Egypt. In fact, it seems that pretty much every ancient culture from the Middle East to the Far East has drawn, praised and written about it. For tonight’s dinner, you’ll be taking the bold step of adding it to this delicious recipe and we’re pretty sure you’ll be making your own little piece of dinner time history.

Full Name: Sri Lankan Sweet Potato and Green Bean Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Green Beans, Small Sweet Potato, Coriander, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Cashew Nuts, Desiccated Coconut, Lime, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Pot, Strainer, Knife, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Today we are having a culinary geography lesson and the subject is: Sri Lanka. An island of just over 20 million people, Sri Lanka sits off the southern coast of India and is known as ‘The Pearl of the Indian Ocean’. Until 1972 it was actually called Ceylon (hence the tea!) and it’s particularly well known for its tasty spices. We had a word with our friends down at Seasoned Pioneers when we decided to create this recipe and they sent us this incredible fruity spice blend to transport you to sunnier climes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Winter Warming Pork, Sage and Apple Casserole
Ingredients: Onion, Leek, Celery Stick, Carrot, Cox's Apple, Sage, Plain Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Cider Vinegar, Water, Potato, Pork Loin Fillet, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Crème Fraîche, Kale
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl, Potato Masher, Frying Pan
Description: There are few British flavour combinations as celebrated as apple and pork. Whether it’s in the form of a tasty little Cumberland sausage or chunky apple sauce on some roast pork, we love it. But how about a new twist? Our pork, sage and apple casserole brings tangy apple and sumptuous pork together in an eye-opening, taste bud tingling way! Enjoy.

Full Name: Smoky Homemade Hamburgers with Rustic Chips and a Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Smoked Paprika, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Cheddar Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan
Description: You can learn a lot from the television. Endless hours of daytime television have allowed Caroline to perfect her cross stitch. Another trick we recently learned came from a certain US cooking show where the host is challenged to eat the biggest/hottest/baddest food in the west. In one episode, a famous burger joint uses the tip in step 6 to get their burgers extra juicy. We thought we’d give it a try...

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Roasted Aubergine and Mushrooms
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Water, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Massaman Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Knife, Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl
Description: In the world of curry, as in the world of cowboys, there are the good, the bad and the ugly. Amongst the bad ones are those that sit there innocuously on your plate, not saying boo to a goose, but loaded with enough chilli to take down a rhino. As for the ugly, you need only go to the local take-away. For this Thai massaman rice we combined the creaminess of peanut butter (our secret ingredient!) and coconut milk with the fresh tanginess of coriander and lime. It’s so good it should be made a saint!

Full Name: Bacon Wrapped Pork Loin Medallion with Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, King Edward Potato, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Pork Medallion, Broccoli, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Black Peppercorns, Double Cream, Milk
Utensils: Knife, Large Pot, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Pot, Potato Masher
Description:
Does the aroma of bacon wafting up from the kitchen on a Saturday morning get your mouth watering? Now think of a tender pork
medallion wrapped in bacon teamed with fluffy mashed potato. Got your mouth watering yet? Yes we thought so!

Full Name: Beef Meatball Goulash with Rice
Ingredients: Red Onion, Green Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dried Thyme, Mild Paprika, Ground Coriander, Beef Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Water, Basmati Rice, Water for Rice, Beef Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Spoon, Pan with Lid, Mixing Bowl, Aluminum Foil, Bowl, Ladle
Description: André has created a HelloFresh twist on a classic goulash with herby, smoky meatballs and rice. Authentic goulash or gulyás is a beef dish cooked with onions, paprika, tomatoes and green pepper. Hungarian goulash is neither a soup nor a stew, but something in between; we hope you enjoy this 'stoup'!

Full Name: Tomato Garlic Ragu with Spaghetti
Ingredients: Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Thyme, Onion, Beef Mince, Soy Sauce, Dried Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Knife, Pan, Pot, Bowl
Description: This classic Italian dish has a hint of Far Eastern charm thrown in. Traditionally, us Brits love the addition of a bit of Worcestershire sauce in our hotpots, pasta sauces and even ragus, but here at the Fresh Farm we’re all about a splash of soy sauce! The saltiness is a subtle but genius addition to the succulent minced beef, aromatic thyme and juicy tomatoes - a perfect combination for a night in! Give it a try in this dish and we’re sure you’ll be using soy sauce in everything soon

Full Name: Pan Fried Pork with Crispy Sage and Apple Sauce
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Sage, Garlic Clove, Braeburn Apple, Water, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Pork Medallion, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This dish is a pure parade of flavourful delight - salty bacon, herby sage, tangy and sweet apple sauce and garlic veggies. It’s really hard to imagine just how well all these flavours work  together. So, you’ll have to try it for yourself.

Full Name: Tiger Prawns with Samphire, Crème Fraîche and Rigatoni
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chives, Rigatoni Pasta, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Samphire
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Small pot, Bowl, Strainer
Description: If you know our chefs, you'll know they love a tiger prawn pasta dish. I mean, to be fair to them, who doesn't? We've added a sprinkling of samphire AKA 'asparagus of the sea'. We're sea lovers and delicious interesting produce makes us burst with joy.

Full Name: Beef Enchiladas
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Red Kidney Beans, Mexican Spice, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Sour Cream, Lime, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Oven dish, Bowl, Grater, Plate
Description: Patrick’s been trying out a few new Mexican dishes in the Fresh Kitchen of late and the main technique in tonight’s dinner has become a favourite. By mashing up the kidney beans instead of adding them whole, you suddenly add a rich, creamy texture to sauces... arriba!

Full Name: Vietnamese Chicken and Mushroom Ca-Ri Ga with Brown Rice
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Lemongrass, Brown Basmati Rice, Leek, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Chicken Breast, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Water, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Our chefs at HelloFresh spend a lot of time critiquing one another's recipe creations, to ensure they produce the best recipes possible (this can get quite heated at times!). Not so long ago we had the Olympic heroes, the Brownlee brothers, visiting the HelloFresh Farm. They helped our chefs appraise this recipe and it went down a treat!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Salmon with Lemon and Caramelised Onion Couscous
Ingredients: Ras-el-Hanout, Olive Oil, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Mint, Vine Tomatoes, Lemon, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Lid, Saucepan, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Take an adventurous trip to Morocco with this delicious and healthy dish! Salmon is considered an 'oily fish', which means it is high in omega-3 fatty acids, contributing to greater heart health and decreased blood pressure

Full Name: LEON Goat's Cheese Chicken with Red Cabbage and Hazelnuts
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Goat's Cheese, Red Cabbage, Braeburn Apple, Original Onion Marmalade, Hazelnuts, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A recipe from the LEON Happy Salads cookbook. This salad tastes good, and does you good. You can serve it both warm and at room temperature, whichever takes your fancy!

Full Name: Keftedes with Tabbouleh and Mint Tzatziki
Ingredients: Bulgur Wheat, Boiling Water, Onion, Garlic Clove, Cumin, Ground Cinnamon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Plain Flour, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Natural Yoghurt, Mint, Lamb Mince
Utensils: Bowl, Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: This Greek inspired tabbouleh with keftedes (that’s Greek for meatballs) is an absolute favourite of our chef Vix, she’s so proud of the flavours that she wants you all to try it. She believes it will bring some absolute sparkle to your dinner time and to your day. Enjoy!

Full Name: Classic Sausage Burger with Onion Marmalade, Wedges and Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Dried Thyme, Pork Sausage, Cheddar Cheese, Original Onion Marmalade, Cucumber, Brioche Bun, Lemon, Olive Oil, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Grater, Lid, Mixing Bowl, Plate
Description: You may find this trick helpful to prepare the most even-shaped, flat burger patties. To avoid a saucer-shaped patty, make an indent with your thumb in the centre of your raw patty. When meat cooks it contracts, so the edges of the burger tighten and the middle swells. By making a hollow in the middle of the burger it helps the meat cook evenly, maintaining its shape as it shrinks during cooking!

Full Name: Moroccan Meatball Potato Bake
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Potato, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Beef Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Baby Spinach, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese
Description: It's incredible how easy it is to revolutionise a well loved dish of the nation by adding some spices and a bit of feta cheese. We've taken on the British hotpot and we're making it a Moroccan hotpot. We're here to take you on an adventure, to explore new flavours. Fancy it? Then get cooking!

Full Name: Hoisin Pork with Noodles, Peppers and Beansprouts
Ingredients: Egg Noodle Nest, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Red Chilli, Pork Medallion, Soy Sauce, Hoisin Sauce, Water, Beansprouts, Lime
Utensils: Pot, Knife, Pan, Frying Pan
Description: A lot of people think of duck when they hear the word hoisin. But hoisin sauce is incredibly versatile and it’s delicious on a lot of things - including pork. Don’t believe us? Just give our hoisin pork with noodles, peppers and beansprouts a go, and you’ll be eating your hat as well!

Full Name: Springtime Jumble with Halloumi and Sweet Potato
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Wholewheat Couscous, Water, Red Pepper, Halloumi, Lemon, Chorizo, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pan, Grater, Large Bowl, Bowl
Description: Summer is almost here, so it’s time to get a bit of rainbow colouring on your plate! My grandma always said "The more colours on your plate, the better" – so she would have loved this dish. Red and yellow and green  and… ok, so we don’t have any blue, but you get the picture! So, for a meal that not only looks great, but also tastes sensational and will nourish you to your core, we’ve created our springtime jumble.

Full Name: Middle Eastern Shepherd's Pie
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Potato, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Shawarma Spice Mix, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Tenderstem Broccoli, Water
Utensils: Pan, Knife, Pot, Grater, Potato Masher, Baking Dish
Description: Potato skin has plenty of nutrients and more than half the fibre found in a potato is within its skin. So, why then do we peel these delightful little tubers? In this speedy shepherd’s pie we mash the potato, skin and all - and it is still creamy and delicious! We hope this super quick family favourite gives you time to put your feet up and enjoy a glass of wine!

Full Name: Spicy Sausage with Broccoli Mash and Cheat's Red Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Red Potato, Broccoli, Spring Onion, Spiced Pork Sausage, Original Onion Marmalade, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Large Pot, Baking Tray, Saucepan, Potato Masher, Sieve
Description: We have added a sneaky HelloFresh twist to the family favourite, sausage and mash, by adding broccoli to the mash! Not only is it creamy and delicious, but with the hidden nutritional benefit of broccoli, it's a real winner!

Full Name: Creamy Prawn Rigatoni
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chives, Rigatoni Pasta, Fresh Peas, Tiger Prawns, Crème Fraîche, Lemon, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Saucepan, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: This lip smackingly delicious meal looks like a dish you may find in a high-end Italian restaurant: creamy pasta with prawns, sweet peas, zesty pea shoots and chives. This dish is also almost as quick to cook as it is to eat! We think parents and kids alike will love it!

Full Name: Pan Fried Halloumi with Caramelised Red Onion and Lentils
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Red Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Mint, Halloumi, Lentils, Balsamic Vinegar, Baby Spinach, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Saucepan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This quick and easy dish has variety, taste and texture that makes every mouthful absolutely delicious! The hearty lentils balance beautifully against the fresh mint and sweet onion and the pumpkin seeds give it a lovely crunch alongside the creamy halloumi! Enjoy!

Full Name: LEON Roasted Vegetables with Zahtar Freekeh and Orange and Apricot Yoghurt
Ingredients: Baby Parsnip, Carrot, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Freekeh, Zahtar Spice, Orange, Dried Apricots, Mint, Red Chilli Flakes, Natural Yoghurt, Ground Cumin, Steve’s Leaves: Baby Watercress
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Sieve, Bowl, Plate
Description: A recipe from LEON’s Happy Salads cookbook. If you’re making this the night before, leave the watercress and garnish separate until you’re just about to tuck in. Then get your freekeh on.

Full Name: Creamy Butternut Squash and Sage Gratin
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Sage, Double Cream, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Peas, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Mixing Bowl, Baking Dish, Plate
Description: Oh how we could sing the praises of butternut and sage, the go together like a culinary love story! The sweet, warm flavours of this blissful dish will wrap you up like a warm hug and have you going back for more!

Full Name: Thai Sweet Potato and Baby Corn Panang Curry
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Sweet Potato, Salted Peanuts, Broccoli, Thai Holy Basil, Coconut Milk, Baby Corn, Panang Curry Paste
Utensils: Saucepan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This Panang curry packs one hell of a nutritional punch! Sweet potatoes are full of beta-carotene (good for your eyesight!) and vitamin C, but the really interesting ingredient is Thai basil. For centuries it’s been used in Ayurvedic medicine to ward off everything from headaches, fever, respiratory problems and even anxiety. No wonder it’s otherwise known as holy basil!

Full Name: Moroccan Meatball Potato Bake
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ras-el-Hanout, Beef Mince, Chopped Tomatoes, Baby Spinach, Feta Cheese, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs
Utensils: Pot, Baking Tray, Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: It’s incredible how easy it is to revolutionise a well loved dish of the nation by adding some spices and a bit of feta cheese. We’ve taken on the British hotpot and we’re making it Middle Eastern. We’re here to take you on an adventure, to explore new flavours. Fancy it? Then get cooking!

Full Name: Mexican Soup with Mixed Beans and Homemade Tortilla Strips
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Green Pepper, Mixed Beans, Potato, Coriander, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla, Sour Cream
Utensils: Grater, Peeler, Sieve, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: This recipe calls for only one or two tortillas, which means you will have quite a few le over! We hate waste so are always thinking of ways to use leftover ingredients. One suggestion is to make oven baked tortilla crisps. You can brush them with oil and then make them savoury with a sprinkling of salt and some paprika or sweet with cinnamon and sugar. A few minutes in a hot oven and voila!

Full Name: Leek and Pea Risotto with Toasted Pine Nuts
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Echalion Shallot, Pine Nuts, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Peas, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Saucepan, Bowl
Description: This evening we’re covering risotto technique. Italians broadly fall into two camps: the flippers and the stirrers. Some argue that a risotto must be constantly massaged to develop its creaminess, whilst others (the head chef at the Bulgari hotel in Milan for one) advocate flipping the rice in the pan whilst cooking. We’ve gone for stirring as there is less chance of covering the walls, but flip it if you dare!

Full Name: Chermoula Spiced Chicken with Zesty Courgette Pilaf
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Chermoula Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Lemon, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Bowl, Large Pan, Lid, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: When our chef André visited Marrakech, he adored the bustling night markets and the way they come alive when the sun sets. They’re just packed with the freshest most seductively well-spiced food for miles around. That perfect memory of deep, rich, chargrilled chicken is the inspiration for his chermoula and yoghurt spiced chicken, with zesty courgette pilaf.

Full Name: Paprika Pork with Crushed New Potatoes and Butter Bean Stew
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Butterbeans, Red Pepper, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Bay Leaf, Water, New Potatoes, Pork Loin Fillet, Smoked Paprika
Utensils: Grater, Pan with Lid, Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: A combination of Spanish delights. A very simple Spanish butter bean stew using fresh, tomatoes, rich in flavour and colour. A great little dish on its own! It’s di icult to go into a tapas bar and not find this on the menu. And of course, a traditional combination of paprika and pork that will send wonderful, zingy notes to your taste buds.

Full Name: Crispy Roast Chicken with Mini Roasties, Veggies and Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Broccoli, Thyme, Chicken Breast, Honey, Flour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water
Utensils: Baking Dish, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Plate
Description: Roast chicken may be such a frequent meal in your home that you can cook it with your eyes closed. What's special about this dish you may ask? It's all about the gravy! In this recipe you'll learn how to make a great gravy by making a roux (a traditional sauce thickener) with flour and leftover chicken fat.

Full Name: Quick Fusilli Ragu with Mozzarella and Honey Dressed Leaves
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Onion, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Tinned Plum Tomates, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Worcestershire Sauce, Fusilli, Parmesan Cheese, Mozzarella, Mini Cucumber, Lemon, Honey, Baby Leaves
Utensils: Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl, Oven dish
Description: Ragu is a slow cooked meat-based sauce that is traditionally served with pasta. We've sped it up a little in this tasty pasta bake topped with mozzarella and served with delicate honey dressed leaves. Delicious!

Full Name: Springtime Jumble with Halloumi and Sweet Potato
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Wholewheat Couscous, Water, Red Pepper, Halloumi, Lemon, Chorizo, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Saucepan, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Spring is here! My grandma always used to say: "The more colours on your plate, the better..." So she would have loved this dish. Red and yellow and green and... OK no blue, but you get the picture! We created the Springtime Jumble to be a meal that not only looks great but tastes sensational and will nourish you to your core!

Full Name: Singapore Chicken Laksa
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Coriander, Red Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Boiling Water, Kaffir Lime Leaf, Peanut Butter, Lime, Chicken Thighs, Egg Noodle Nest
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Sometimes life throws bizarre situations at us. Patrick experienced this in Singapore airport when he saw himself on the television. Turns out his cooking show had made it over to the Far East and it wasn’t long before the staff in the restaurant were piling his plate with all sorts of local deliciousness. One of the dishes was a mouth-watering Singapore laksa - practically a national dish.

Full Name: Speedy Steak Stir-Fry
Ingredients: Water, Basmati Rice, Spring Onion, Green Beans, Red Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Lemongrass, Flank Steak, Cornflour, Soy Sauce, White Wine Vinegar
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl
Description:
This speedy recipe is packed full of flavour and is the perfect antidote for a long, hard day! The ultra-quick to prepare flank
steak is served with steamy basmati rice. We’ve added some chilli and white wine vinegar, to give an authentic hot and
sour flavour combination. To make sure you are getting a good portion of your five-a-day, we have added some fresh green
beans, spring onion and red pepper!

Full Name: LEON's Dukkah Prawns with Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Sugar Snap Peas, Garlic Clove, Olive Oil, Lemon, Tiger Prawns, Dill, Mint, Super Dukkah Mix
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A recipe from LEON Happy Salads cookbook. Everybody at LEON ate this at the launch party of Happy Salads, and then again at their Summer WellBeing Festival. In fact, they can’t stop eating it, and you won’t be able to either. Enjoy.

Full Name: Pork Steak with Creamy Peas and Roasted Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Rosemary, Peas, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Pork Steak, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This recipe gives our traditional mushy peas a delicious revamp. The easy to make mix of sweet peas with zesty lemon and crème fraîche make this a creamy, refreshing addition that you'll want to make again and again!

Full Name: Treat Day Orzo with Mozzarella, Tomato and Chorizo
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Plum Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Boiling Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Bowl
Description:
This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella, succulent plum
tomatoes and flavoursome chorizo what more could you want?

Full Name: Gnocchi Pomodoro with Brazil Nut and Chive Pesto
Ingredients: Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Chopped Tomatoes, Gnocchi, Brazil Nuts, Chives, Olive Oil, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Gnocchi with pesto is an all-time favourite, and we've given this one a fresh twist by pan-frying the gnocchi to give it a beautiful crisp texture. We've also mixed up the pesto by replacing the usual basil and pine nuts with chives and Brazil nuts. This dish went down a treat at the Fresh Farm; we hope your family loves it too!

Full Name: Thai Coconut Noodle Soup with Charred Bok Choy and Nutty Asian Dressing
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Baby Bok Choy, Salted Peanuts, Coriander, Olive Oil, Lime, Soy Sauce, Rice Noodle, Yellow Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Large Pan, Frying Pan
Description: In this recipe you will learn how quick and easy it is to prepare rice noodles! They are much more delicate and fragile than their wheat noodle counterparts, so even quicker to prepare. They only need to be soaked briefly in boiling water and voila! A simple addition to a delicious Thai soup!

Full Name: Veggie Loaded Spanish Style Rice
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Button Mushrooms, Red Kidney Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Tomato Puree 30g, Peas, Lemon, Black Olives
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Traditional paellas come in many forms, but most can be easily recreated in your own kitchen. This Spanish style rice encompasses delicious spices, seasonal vegetables and kidney beans to make a well-rounded meal packed full of plant protein! Place this beautiful and comforting dish right in the middle of your dinner table and enjoy in a traditional, communal style!

Full Name: Treat Day Orzo with Mozzarella, Tomato and Chorizo
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Plum Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Boiling Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: This dish uses orzo, a rice shaped pasta ideal for risotto-style dishes. Combined with creamy mozzarella, succulent plum tomatoes and flavoursome chorizo what more could you want?

Full Name: Oven Baked Bacon and Mushroom Risotto
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Tarragon, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Honey, Olive Oil, Baby Leaves, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Risotto is such a delicious, creamy dish, but all the stirring that is required can make it a bit daunting. In this easy recipe, André has simplified the process. Forget about the stirring, just shove your risotto in the oven. All the creamy luxurious texture with none of the elbow work!

Full Name: Chicken Piccata with Buttery Garlic Sauce and Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Dried Thyme, Broccoli, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chicken Breast, Flour, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Baking Dish, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For this tasty dish, you will be making an emulsion to create a lovely buttery sauce for roast veggies! An emulsion combines fat and water, and making one is the technique behind many great sauces like hollandaise, mayonnaise and aioli. Chemically speaking, water and fat don't mix, so to get these molecules to emulsify we beat the butter into as tiny particles as possible. This is where a whisk comes in handy!

Full Name: Spaghetti Pomodoro with Melt in the Middle Meatballs
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Mozzarella, Panko Breadcrumbs, Dried Thyme, Beef Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Large Pan, Plate
Description: Sleeves rolled up! Hands washed but still damp, let’s get rolling! The skill is in wrapping the mozzarella cheese entirely with the meat, so it’s hiding, ready to be discovered when everyone tucks in. Surprise, surprise!

Full Name: Spiced Pork with Creamy Lentils and Nigella Chapatis
Ingredients: Pork Medallion, Malay Curry Powder, Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Green Lentils, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Nigella Seeds, Olive Oil, Wholemeal Tortilla, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Plate, Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: André has whipped up this great warming dish to get you through the final push to spring. The fiery Malay spiced pork is tempered with creamy, filling lentils. He has even topped it off with super quick nigella seed flavoured chapatis - a taste sensation!

Full Name: Cheat's Lamb Moussaka with Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Lamb Mince, Cinnamon Stick, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Parmesan Cheese, Rocket
Utensils: Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Oven dish, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Moussaka is one of our chef Mimi's favourite dishes…if there's one winter warmer that wins in her
book, it's this one. Normally this Greek classic takes hours to make, but with a bit of HelloFresh magic
you’ll be whipping it up in no time at all!

Full Name: Zanzibar Chicken Curry with Fragrant Rice
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Basil 20g, Lime, Chicken Breast, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Star Anise, Basmati Rice, Zanzibar Curry Spice Mix, Coconut Milk
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Tonight we bring the warm flavours of Zanzibar to your dinner table! This fragrant curry is spiced with Zanzibar curry powder, sourced by our wonderful friends at Seasoned Pioneers. The curry powder blend of paprika, coriander, cinnamon and chilli, will transport you across the seas to warm African nights. Read more about this delicious curry blend in our Spice of the Month!

Full Name: Penne all’Arrabiata with Bacon and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Balsamic Vinegar, Chopped Tomatoes, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese, Red Chilli
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Food is described with an infinite number of adjectives but ‘angry’ isn't usually one of them. However, that's exactly what arrabbiata means in Italian. This dish is so called because of its chilli kick - although we’ll leave you to decide how much of a temper you want it to have. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time it takes to boil your pasta, there’s really nothing to be angry about. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Chicken Stew with Tarragon and Mashed Potatoes
Ingredients: Potato, Onion, Garlic Clove, Leek, Carrot, Tarragon, Flour, Chicken Thighs, Cider Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Milk
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Peeler, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This dish is so soothing. Sometimes the simplest ingredients come together to create a dish that's far greater than the sum of their parts. With a warming but bright-flavoured sauce and a good helping of smooth, creamy mash it's comfort food at its best. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

Full Name: Spicy Sausage Chilli with Homemade Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Chives, Spicy Sausage, Smoked Paprika, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Natural Yoghurt, Mixed Beans
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Sieve, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description:
At the Fresh Farm, we like to help you pack as much flavour as possible into your cooking in as short a time as possible.
One trick for achieving this is to use sausage meat as it's already well seasoned and packed with delicious herbs and spices.
Savoury and time saver-y! You're welcome!

Full Name: Veggie Dosas with Fragrant Potato and Toasted Coconut Yoghurt
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Gram Flour, Nigella Seeds, Water for Batter, Desiccated Coconut, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Tandoori Masala Spice, Mustard Seeds, Water, Peas, Baby Spinach, Mango Chutney 40g
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description: Dosas are a type of pancake eaten in India. They are traditionally eaten for breakfast, and are especially popular in South India! This meal is intended to be beautifully light and fragrant, cooled with a delicious coconut yoghurt. We think the coconut yoghurt is so tasty you may even want to recreate it for your brekkie!

Full Name: Mexican Tomato Jumble with Spiced Citrus Halloumi
Ingredients: Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Sweet Potato, Red Onion, Halloumi, Mexican Spice, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This dish is full of beautiful, sunny colours and the reds, oranges and yellows hint to the nutrient profiles of its ingredients. Brightly coloured vegetables are richer in phytonutrients than their dull-coloured counterparts. Red and yellow veggies are high in carotenoids, which are powerful antioxidants that protect against certain cancers and are beneficial for eye and bone health. We hope you enjoy this bowl of sunshine!

Full Name: French Lentils with Roasted Veggies, Walnuts and Cheesey Croutons
Ingredients: Carrot, Baby Parsnip, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tarragon, Lentils, Red Wine Vinegar, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Ciabatta, Hard Italian Cheese, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche, Wholegrain Mustard, Honey, Walnuts
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Sieve, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: This French-inspired dish is a delight, bursting with aromatics from tarragon and garlic and the earth tones of lentils and walnuts. Then there's the warmth of wholegrain mustard, the sweetness of honey and everything gets topped off with crunchy crutons. It's a winner!

Full Name: Spicy Sausage Chilli with Homemade Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: Leek, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Chives, Spicy Sausage, Red Kidney Beans, Smoked Paprika, Cumin, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Natural Yoghurt
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: At the Fresh Farm, we like to help you pack as much flavour as possible into your cooking in as short a time as possible. One trick for achieving this is to use sausage meat as it's already well seasoned and packed with delicious herbs and spices. Savoury and time saver-y! You're welcome!

Full Name: Sweet and Sour Pork with Herbed Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Medallion, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Grater, Plate, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Bowl
Description: High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, bulgur wheat is a good source of nutrition and, most importantly, it tastes great. It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might expect to find with rice. Have a taste! We think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Herb Crusted Haddock with Creamy Leeks and Potatoes
Ingredients: Red Potato, Thyme, Leek, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Haddock Fillet, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Lemon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Getting your oil really hot is the trick to producing crispy roast potatoes. Tonight we'll be having them alongside beautiful, flaky fillets of haddock generously crusted with herby, cheesy crumbs. Pure gold!

Full Name: Bacon Gnocchi with Mascarpone and a Zingy Salad
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Mini Cucumber, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Gnocchi, Tomato Puree 30g, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Baby Spinach, Mascarpone Cheese, Lime, Honey, Olive Oil, Baby Leaves, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Gnocchi occupy the delicious middle ground between pasta and dumplings. These lovely little pillows are quite rich and filling, so we've included lots of veggies to balance them out. When our sales team tested this recipe it was their absolute favourite and we hope you enjoy it just as much!

Full Name: Chicken and Mushroom Pie with Honey Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Red Potato, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Leek, Tarragon, Button Mushrooms, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Dried Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Honey
Utensils: Large Pan, Potato Masher, Frying Pan, Grater, Oven dish, Plate
Description:
Chicken and mushroom pie with a creamy mash topping sounds like a meal worth rushing home for! We've given this classic
dish a HelloFresh spin with roasted, honey glazed chantenay carrots. These miniature carrots are not only delicious, but
packed full of vitamins and phytonutrients, which gives them their glorious hue!

Full Name: Rosemary Glazed Chicken with Mash and Buttered Leeks
Ingredients: Potato, Leek, Spring Onion, Chicken Stock Pot, Boiling Water, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Chicken Breast, Tracklements Rosemary Jelly
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Potato Masher, Strainer, Baking Dish, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Plate
Description:
Classics are classic for a reason. What could be more traditional or more delicious than crispy-skinned roast chicken? But
there's always room for improvement and André has added a HelloFresh twist with a fragrant rosemary glaze. Paired it with
fluffy mash and buttery leeks it's not only classic but classy too!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Spiced Cod with Fruity Freekeh
Ingredients: Cod Fillet, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Freekeh, Green Pepper, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Mustard Seeds, Lemon, Craisin
Utensils: Grater, Mixing Bowl, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Sieve, Plate
Description: Fragrant Sri Lankan spices go perfectly with delicate, flaky cod. You'd usually eat a dish like this with rice but here Andre has changed it up for freekeh. This delicious grain is wheat, harvested when it's young and green and then roasted for a distinctive nutty taste. It's full of protein and fibre and is best served with a joke about "getting your freekeh on". Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Broth with Spicy Beef and Beans
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Mixed Beans, Potato, Coriander, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Mild Paprika, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla, Sour Cream
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: Preheat your oven to 200 degrees. This recipe calls for only one or two tortillas which means you will have quite a few left over! We hate waste so are always thinking of ways to use leftover ingredients. Why not try oven-baked tortilla chips? Cut them into triangles (or whatever shape you choose), bush them with oil and sprinkle with salt and paprika. A few minutes in a hot oven and voila!

Full Name: Korean Chicken Drumsticks with Black Rice and Cucumber Pickle
Ingredients: Cucumber, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Sesame Seeds, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Black Rice, Honey, Chicken Drumstick, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Sweetheart Cabbage
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Sieve, Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We love introducing our customers to fabulous, new ingredients, and this week we'd like you make the acqaintance of black rice. It's an ancient grain that has been eaten in Asia for thousands of years. For centuries it was reserved for Chinese royalty but fortunately these days is available to the rest of us too!

Full Name: Creamy Risotto with Bacon, Chilli and Butternut Squash
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Parmesan Cheese, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Lemon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Ladle, Plate
Description: Risotto is the ultimate comfort food. This one has got creaminess from the risotto rice androasted butternut squash and just enough heat form the chillies. This bowl of goodness is best eaten cosied up on the coauch but don’t forget the all-important final squeeze of lemon!

Full Name: Saffron Risotto with Fennel and Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Fennel, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Water, Saffron, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Pea Shoots
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Large Pan, Ladle, Bowl
Description: Golden saffron brings the glamour to this oozy, creamy risotto dish but don't underestimate the fennel! It's fresh, crisp flavour has just a hint of aniseed and, combined with the saffron's sweet, aromatic hit, makes this dish very special!

Full Name: Shawarma Roasted Carrots with Goat's Cheese and Minty Cumin Couscous
Ingredients: Carrot, Shawarma Spice Mix, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cumin, Wholewheat Couscous, Garlic Clove, Mint, Goat's Cheese, Mangetout, Munchy Seeds: Honey Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Lid, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This dish teams tasty shawarma roasted carrots, with crispy sugar snaps, creamy, creamy Goat's cheese and the sweetest, crunchiest honeyed seeds! Pefection on a plate!

Full Name: Rainbow Pepper Fajitas with Refried Beans and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Green Pepper, Red Onion, Coriander, Mixed Beans, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Water, Lime, Sour Cream, Wholemeal Tortilla, Rocket
Utensils: Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Grater, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Fajitas always go down a treat at the Fresh Farm. Mexican food combines clean citrus flavours and warm spices, and is texturally exciting too with soft beans brushing up against crunchy peppers. For this simple recipe you’ll be knocking up your own refried beans. It’s so good we might end up coming over for dinner ourselves!

Full Name: Prawn & Chorizo Spaghetti with Fresh Vine Tomatoes
Ingredients: Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Tiger Prawns, Spaghetti, Tomato Passata, Vine Tomatoes
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Strainer, Frying Pan
Description: In the heady days of his youth, Patrick's favourite date night restaurant was a little Spanish place in London's Borough market. He ended up going there so often that he became best mates with the chef and started working in the kitchen at weekends! This classic Iberian combo of prawns and chorizo remains a favourite and he presents it here, so you can do date night without leaving the house...

Full Name: Creamy Risotto with Bacon, Chilli and Butternut Squash
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Parmesan Cheese, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Lemon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Ladle, Bowl
Description: Risotto is the ultimate comfort food. This one has got creaminess from the risotto rice androasted butternut squash and just enough heat form the chillies. This bowl of goodness is best eaten cosied up on the coauch but don’t forget the all-important final squeeze of lemon!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Biryani with Chicken, Craisins and Minty Yoghurt
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Onion, Carrot, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Ground Turmeric, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Craisin, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Coriander, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Bowl
Description: Biryani is one of the all-time great one-pot dishes. Tender meat, fresh veggies and fragrant rice, all nestling favourfully together. It often contains raisins but today we're using Craisins instead. Not heard of a Craisin? It's a dried cranberry - a cranberry that's been raisinified! Since you ask - no, they're not native to Sri Lanka! But, in our book, deliciousness always trumps authenticity...

Full Name: Smoky Pork Burgers with Rustic Wedges and Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Smoked Paprika, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Cheddar Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce
Utensils: Baking Tray, Mixing Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: Sausages are a lazy cook's best friend. Take off their skins and you have ready-seasoned meat that's good for all sorts of things. Break it up into mince and use as the basis of a pasta sauce or roll it into meatballs (cheatballs!). In this recipe it makes a banger of a burger. Popping a lid on the pan while you cook them (see the tip in Step 6) keeps everything super juicy and gives you perfectly melted cheese.

Full Name: Crispy Herb Chicken with Cheese & Onion Mash and Garlicky Beans
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red Onion, Green Beans, Cheddar Cheese, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Panko Breadcrumbs, Chicken Breast, Provencale Herbs, Crème Fraîche, Water, Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Lid, Strainer, Plate
Description: This recipe is a celebration of contrasts. The creamy mash is flavoured with sweet caramelised onion and sharp, salty cheese. Its pillowy softness is the perfect counterpart to juicy chicken in a crispy coating of herbed breadcrumbs. Comfort food of the highest order! But with a side of garlicky green beans to keep things light.

Full Name: Prawn & Chorizo Spaghetti with Fresh Vine Tomatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tiger Prawns, Vine Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate, Strainer
Description: In the heady days of his youth, Patrick's favourite date night restaurant was a little Spanish place in London's Borough market. He ended up going there so often that he became best mates with the chef and started working in the kitchen at weekends! This classic Iberian combo of prawns and chorizo remains a favourite and he presents it here so you can do date night without leaving the house...

Full Name: Chicken & Mushroom Pie with Honey Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Red Potato, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Leek, Tarragon, Button Mushrooms, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Dried Thyme, Bay Leaf, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Honey
Utensils: Large Pan, Potato Masher, Strainer, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Description: A chicken and mushroom pie with creamy mash topping sounds like a meal worth rushing home for! We've given this classic dish a HelloFresh spin with roasted, honey glazed Chantenay carrots. These miniature carrots are not only delicious, but packed full of vitamins and phytonutrients, which gives them their glorious hue!

Full Name: Teriyaki Beef with Garlicky Bok Choy and Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Bok Choy, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Sieve, Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description:
The 'teri' in 'teriyaki' is the Japanese word for 'gloss' or 'glaze' which makes it perfect for describing the gorgeous sheen that
develops when you cook anything in this delicious sauce. And, since you asked, 'yaki' means roast, fried or grilled!

Full Name: Greek Lamb & Lentil Ragu with Tzatziki
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Oregano, Flaked Almonds, Lamb Mince, Ground Cumin, Cinnamon Stick, Red Split Lentils, Chopped Tomatoes, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Bulgur Wheat, Cucumber, Mint, Greek Yoghurt
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Bowl
Description: Greek food pulls off the clever trick of being both hearty and summery! This delicious dish of tomatoey lamb and lentils with nutty bulgur wheat and refreshing cucumber tzatziki will bring the holiday vibes straight to you. Bouzouki music optional…

Full Name: Pork Medallions with Tarragon Sauce and Potatoes
Ingredients: Tarragon, Leek, Pork Medallion, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, New Potatoes, Sour Cream
Utensils: Large Pan, Strainer, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Who remembers 'Medallion Man'? That swaggering 1980s cliché with his shirt unbuttoned, flashy gold jewellery nestling against a copious carpet of chest hair? But medallions can be done tastefully and this dish shows you how. Pork in tarragon sauce is a classic French combination and positively exudes understated elegance. Not a swagger in sight, just pure deliciousness...

Full Name: Cheddar Beanie Burger with Chips and Nutty Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Mixed Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Cheddar Cheese, Ground Cumin, Ground Coriander, Panko Breadcrumbs, Wholegrain Mustard, Vine Tomatoes, Rocket, Walnuts, Brioche Bun, Original Onion Marmalade, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Rich but very light, brioche is made from a bread dough that has been enriched with so much butter
it's almost halfway to being a cake! You could say it has been 'breadazzled'... It's the perfect bun for
these savoury veggie burgers. Served with wedges and a lovely fresh salad, they're a real treat!

Full Name: Chickpea Falafel with Saffron Couscous and Harissa Yoghurt
Ingredients: Chickpeas, Panko Breadcrumbs, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Carrot, Water, Cumin, Lemon, Wholewheat Couscous, Saffron, Vegetable Stock Pot, Flaked Almonds, Vine Tomatoes, Natural Yoghurt, Harissa Spice Mix, Raisins, water for couscous
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Potato Masher, Strainer, Large Pan, Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Falafel are a popular street food all across the Middle East and Egypt but there's a lot of disagreement as to where they originated and who makes the finest. We think ours are up there with the best! Try them and see if you agree!

Full Name: The Governor's Kung Pao with Brown Rice and Cashews
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Chestnut Mushrooms, Broccoli, Soy Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Cashew Nuts
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Sieve, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Legend has it that in the late nineteenth century, the governor of Sichuan province was missing more than a few teeth. One day he left his palace to eat in a local restaurant, where he was served a dish of beautifully chopped, stir-fried ingredients. The governor was so impressed with the dish (not least because it was easy for him to eat), that he hired the chef and christened the recipe with his official name, Kung Pao.

Full Name: Beef Ragu Rigatoni with Black Olive & Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Basil 20g, Beef Mince, Dried Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Rigatoni Pasta, Black Olives, Vine Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description:
'Al dente' is one of those phrases people throw around a lot when talking about pasta, but what does it actually mean? The Italian translates as 'to the tooth' and pasta cooked perfectly 'al 
dente' should still have a little bit of firmness to it. The way to tell is by biting through a piece - have a little nibble on one of this week's rigatoni before you serve up. If you can see a thin centre of white in the middle of the cooked pasta then it's spot on and time to tuck in!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Turkey Steak with Mushroom Sauce and Pancetta Roasties
Ingredients: Red Potato, Echalion Shallot, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Lemon Thyme, Turkey Steak, Pancetta, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: There are many ways you can tenderise meat. Marinating is good. Hanging works especially well for game. In some parts of the world they like to wrap stuff in papaya leaves. But our method of choice today is whacking the daylights out of our meat with a frying pan! Simple, effective and fun...

Full Name: Sausage & Butterbean Stew
Ingredients: Netherend Butter Unsalted, Onion, Carrot, Chestnut Mushrooms, Sweetheart Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Butterbeans, Honey Mustard Sausages, Dried Oregano, White Wine Vinegar, Plain Flour, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Ciabatta
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Down at the Fresh Farm, we love a bit of constructive criticism. We want to make sure everything is
the best it can be before it goes in your box! When Mimi came up with this delicious stew, André liked
it but felt it needed a little 'something extra'. He suggested making some garlic croutons to sit on top
and soak up the sauce. We're sure you'll agree it provides the perfect finishing touch!

Full Name: Beef Stir-Fry with Noodles
Ingredients: Flank Steak, Spring Onion, Green Pepper, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Tomato Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Sweet Chilli Sauce, Rice Vinegar, Water, Chinese 5 Spice, Cornflour, Egg Noodle Nest
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper
Description: Let tonight's dinner transport you to the bustling backstreets of Hong Kong - a place where they really know their noodles. The trick with this dish is to slice the steak as thinly as you can and cook it in a super-hot frying pan. Do it in batches - that way it'll crisp up rather than stew. Let us know how you go!

Full Name: Balsamic Steak with Red cabbage and Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Balsamic Vinegar, Steak, Potato, Rosemary, Onion, Red Cabbage, Mustard Seeds, White Wine Vinegar, Redcurrant Jelly
Utensils: Bowl, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: In Mimi’s house, steak reigns supreme. Along with chocolate and horse racing, it's something the whole family can agree on. They all love their steak super-rare; what the French would call 'bleu'. So much so that Mimi's mum doesn't even know how to cook a steak well done! But don’t worry, however you like your steak cooked, this recipe will taste sensational.

Full Name: Asian Chicken with Stir-Fried Kale and Coconut
Ingredients: Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Lime, Coriander, Chicken Breast, Desiccated Coconut, Ketjap Manis, Kale, Soy Sauce, Water
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Dish
Description: Poaching chicken keeps it super tender and juicy. Today we'll be combining it with fluffy rice, golden toasted coconut and a zingy soy and lime dressing. And some lovely, green kale - the undisputed leafy veg of the moment - for a plateful that's as healthy as it is delicious!

Full Name: Gnocchi Bolognese with Cheesy Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Broccoli, Carrot, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, Provencale Herbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Gnocchi, Basil 20g
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We've reinvented the classic bolognese by teaming it with crispy gnocchi. These delicious, pillowy little dumplings become extra tasty when fried 'til golden brown. It's a dish that looks indulgent but, hidden under the melted cheese, contains three-and-a-half of your five-a-day!

Full Name: Nutty Crusted Haddock with Roasted Carrots and Mash
Ingredients: Red Potato, Carrot, Dried Thyme, Basil 20g, Hazelnuts, Panko Breadcrumbs, Olive Oil, Haddock Fillet, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Bowl, Potato Masher, Strainer, Plate
Description: Hazelnuts and herbs combine to make a fabulous pesto crust for flaky haddock. Served with fluffy mash and sweet, thyme-roasted carrots  it makes a colourful and - more importantly - delicious plateful!

Full Name: Mixed Bean & Pork Chilli with Brown Rice and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Lime, Sour Cream, Pork Sausage, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Chipotle Paste, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Strainer, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage meat in a chilli? Yes, you read it right! It may be slightly unorthodox, but pork and beans is such a classic combination that we're positive you'll love this alternative to beef mince. Enjoy!

Full Name: Honey-Walnut Halloumi with Roasted Butternut and Broccoli
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Smoked Paprika, Broccoli, Red Chilli, Flat Leaf Parsley, Walnuts, Halloumi, Honey
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Here at the Fresh farm we can't get enough halloumi. We love the "squeak" when you sink your teeth into a slice. It seems we're not alone either - Britain now consumes more of this cheese than anywhere outside its native Cyprus. We're sure you'll find tonight's dinner somewthing to squeak about!

Full Name: Mushroom Stifado with Potato & Parsnip Mash and Black Olive Salsa
Ingredients: Dried Porcini Mushrooms, Boiling Water, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Chestnut Mushrooms, Parsnip, Potato, Allspice, Tomato Puree 30g, Red Wine Vinegar, Vegetable Stock Pot, Honey, Bay Leaf, Netherend Butter Salted, Flat Leaf Parsley, Black Olives, Olive Oil
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Large Pan, Strainer, Frying Pan, Potato Masher
Description: Stifado is a Greek classic. Almost every taverna on the islands serves some variation on this rich, tomatoey stew. Tonight we're making it with mushrooms, including dried porcini for extra umami power!

Full Name: One-Pot Veg Chilli with Quinoa
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Pepper, Carrot, Coriander, Red Kidney Beans, Cumin, Chilli Powder, Ground Cinnamon, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Quinoa, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Lime, Sour Cream, Cornflour
Utensils: Grater, Strainer, Large Pan, Lid, Bowl, Plate
Tags: Extra spicy, One Pot Wonder, Veggie
Description: Presenting to you another versatile HelloFresh 'one pot wonder'! This delicious dish has a bit of a twist - quinoa, cooked in the same pot as the chilli! It provides all the flavours you'd expect from a chilli but with some added cinnamon tones and a nutty texture. Kidney beans and plenty of veg make it a hearty and nutitious meal. Go for it!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let's keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Cheesy Chicken Taquito with Zingy Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Lime, Mexican Spice, Baby Spinach, Sour Cream, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Taquitos are a traditional Mexican street food. They're normally deep fried but we didn't think that a deep fat fryer was something we could expect everyone to have in their kitchen cupboard... So we've baked them here instead which is easier and also healthier! They should crisp nicely in the oven while the cheesy centre melts. Get excited because they're delicious!

Full Name: Caribbean Chilli with Coconut Rice and Sweetcorn Salsa
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Sweetcorn, Black Beans, Water for Stock, Chicken Stock Pot, Coconut Milk, Basmati Rice, Dried Thyme, Minced Beef, Poudre de Columbo, Tomato Puree 30g, Mango Chutney 40g, Water for Beef, Coriander, Red Chilli, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: In one of those complicated bits of culinary etymology, Colombo is the capital of Sri Lanka and also the name of a curry from the French Carribean islands. Its essential spice mix, Poudre de Colombo, may have originated in Sri Lanka but adds an unmistakably sunny Carribean vibe to anything you cook with it, including tonight's chilli... Sweetened with mango chutney and served with coconut rice, it's a true taste of sunshine!

Full Name: Pork Steaks with Leek & Potato Mash and Onion Gravy
Ingredients: Potato, Leek, Red Onion, Rosemary, Pork Steak, Milk, Cornflour, Chicken Stock Pot, Water
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Potato Masher, Plate, Small pot
Description: A little thing that makes a massive difference to pork is making sure that the fat gets crisped up. Some people call this 'crozzling' which is an excellent word, nearly as enjoyable to say as a properly crozzled piece of pork is to eat! You can help things along by holding the meat on its edge for a minute or so when searing (see step 4). Serve with mash and rich onion gravy for a deliciously traditional dinner!

Full Name: Fruity Lebanese Lamb with Cumin Roasted Carrots
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Carrot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Dried Apricots, Ground Cumin, Water for Bulgur Wheat, Chicken Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Lamb Mince, Tomato Puree 30g, Shawarma Spice Mix, Water for Lamb, Natural Yoghurt, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This Lebanese-inspired recipe has so much going on! Subtle spices combine with a hit of fruity, apricot sweetness. Pomegranate seeds and cumin-roasted carrots deliver flavours as bright as their colours to make it a truly winning dish!

Full Name: Venetian Chicken Pasta with Honey, Raisins & Walnuts
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Walnuts, Flat Leaf Parsley, Parmesan Cheese, Chicken Thighs, Raisins, Honey, Penne Pasta, Netherend Butter Salted, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Sieve, Bowl
Description: There can't be many more romantic cities than Venice. The Grand Canal lined with pastel-coloured palazzi, gondoliers singing serenades at sunset, the majesty of the Piazza San Marco... And let's not forget the delicious food! Sweet-savoury combinations are a Venetian speciality and they inspired Mimi to create this chicken pasta dish. We think you'll love the addition of raisins, honey and nuts. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Bream with Crushed New Potatoes and Sweet Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Vine Tomatoes, Black Olives, Basil 20g, Honey, Red Wine Vinegar, Olive Oil, Sea Bream Fillet
Utensils: Large Pan, Bowl, Strainer, Plate
Description: Now here's a dish to bring the sunshine! It's British Tomato Week so take a moment to appreciate the beautiful little number from our friends at The Tomato Stall which have been grown on the Isle Of Wight. A little honey in the dressing really brings out their sweetness. Cook the fish at the end, when everything else is ready so it will have perfect crispy skin and pearly flesh. Enjoy!

Full Name: Hearty Roast Chicken with Dijon-Mushroom Sauce and Brown Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Breast, Thyme, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Dijon Mustard, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description:
A trip down memory lane this evening with one of our head chef Patrick’s favourite childhood recipes. Nutritious, chewy
brown rice is the perfect bed for crispy-skinned roast chicken in a flavour-packed sauce. Nostalgic and modern, all at the same time!

Full Name: Italian Tomato Risotto with Tuscan Pork Sausages
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Parmesan Cheese, Arborio Rice, Fennel Seeds, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Ladle, Bowl
Description: Risotto is a speciality of Northern Italy where they grow rice instead of the wheat that becomes pasta in the South. It's traditionally served in small portions as a 'primo' - a first course before the main. But when something is this delicous why restrict it to a starter?

Full Name: Coconutty Veggie Curry with Yellow Rice and Peanuts
