Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Baby Corn, Tomato Puree 30g, Goan Xacuti Spice, Tamarind Sauce, Ground Turmeric, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Basmati Rice, Salted Peanuts
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: May's Spice Of The Month is Goan Xacuti Curry Powder. It's pronounced za-coo-tea and is a blend of fiery dried chilli, sweet cinnamon and coriander (amongst other deliciously fragrant things). It's traditional in Goa to balance the heat of spices with creamy, soothing coconut milk as André has done here. He's also filled it full of lovely veggies  and topped the whole thing off with peanuts for a bit of extra crunch. Enjoy!

Full Name: Lentil & Vegetable Hotpot with Cheesy Potato Topping
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Chestnut Mushrooms, Green Lentils, Flat Leaf Parsley, Potato, Provencale Herbs, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Soy Sauce, English Mustard, Baby Spinach, Netherend Butter Salted, Cheddar Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Oven dish, Bowl
Description: Hotpot is an odd name for a dish when you think about it. After all, nearly anything you cook will involve a pot getting hot! But the traditional potato-topped bake remains a firm favourite for good reason. We've given this veggie version a cheesy twist to make it extra special. Enjoy!

Full Name: Moroccan Spiced Halloumi with Tabbouleh and Mint Raita
Ingredients: Water for Bulgur Wheat, Bulgur Wheat, Mint, Natural Yoghurt, Vine Tomatoes, Spring Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Olive Oil for Tabbouleh, Halloumi, Olive Oil for Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Vix was so pleased with herself when she came up with this recipe. She wouldn’t stop talking about it and ate it every day for a week! But she enjoyed every mouthful and we hope you do too!

Full Name: Mexican Tostadas with Guacamole and Cheese
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Red Kidney Beans, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Avocado, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Strainer, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Tostadas are simply toasted tortillas. It makes them deliciously crispy! We've given you more tortilla's here than you need for the recipe. Why not make your own tortilla chips with what's left? Just cut them into triangles, drizzle with oil and season with salt, black pepper and any other spices you fancy before baking in the oven until crunchy. Enjoy!

Full Name: Chicken & Chorizo Pilaf Packed with Plenty of Veggies
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Cherry Tomatoes, Chicken Thighs, Rosemary, Lemon, Chorizo, Basmati Rice, Chicken Stock Pot, Boiling Water
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: This pilaf is a great dish for sharing with friends and family - just put the pan in the middle of the table, Spanish-style, and let everyone help themselves. The double joy of chicken and chorizo make it a real crowd pleaser. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Tender tilapia and tasty tarragon! Try saying that ten times in a row! It may be a bit of a tongue twister but we're sure it'll be a taste bud pleaser too. Enjoy!

Full Name: Penne all'Arrabbiata with Smoked Pancetta and Fresh Basil
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Pancetta, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Grater, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description:
A great number of adjectives are used to describe food but 'angry' isn't usually one of them. Although
that's exactly what 'arrabbiata' means in Italian. Given that this tasty recipe can be ready in the time
it takes to boil some pasta, there’s really nothing to be angry about. So smile and tuck in!

Full Name: Salmon Tarator with Bulgar Tabbouleh
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Olive Oil, Bulgur Wheat, Salmon fillet, Red Onion, Red Wine Vinegar, Mint, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Crème Fraîche, Walnuts
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: You might be wondering what a tarator is. It sort of sounds like it might be an energetic Spanish dance doesn't it? Or - shudder - a spider! Thankfully, it's neither of those things. Instead it's a lovely yoghurt-based sauce from Bulgaria. We've used crème fraîche here for a richer taste, perfect with warm salmon fillets and herby bulgur wheat. André thinks it's going to be your new favourite summer supper!

Full Name: BBQ Chicken Ciabatta with Potato Wedges and Zingy Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Dried Thyme, Chicken Breast, BBQ Sauce, Lime, Ciabatta, Honey, Olive Oil, Mayonnaise, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Mix
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: With summer approaching, our minds have turned to al fresco dining. Food cooked over coals is great but there's not always time (or appropriate weather!) to barbecue. Which is why Mimi created this delicious grilled chicken sandwich. All those lovely smoky flavours, without hours spent huffing and puffing at defiantly unlit charcoal...

Full Name: Lamb & Chickpea Curry with Fragrant Rice
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Onion, Yellow Pepper, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Chickpeas, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Water for Rice, Mustard Seeds, Sri Lankan Spice Blend, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Water for Curry, Coriander, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Sieve, Large Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: You'll love how quick and easy it is to prepare this mouth-watering curry of tender lamb and nutty chickpeas. Sri Lankan curry powder combines with mustard seeds, ginger and garlic to tingle all your taste buds whilst coriander keeps things fresh. Time to throw away those takeaway menus!

Full Name: Chimichurri Steak with Potato & Spinach Salad
Ingredients: Flank Steak, New Potatoes, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Oregano, Chilli Flakes, Red Wine Vinegar, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Some steak lovers like their meat unadorned but we think it's fun to 'gild the lily'! Today we're pairing a fabulous, flavourful flank steak with chimichurri. It's a spicy Argentinian sauce made from garlic, parsley, oregano and chilli flakes mixed with olive oil. And what the Argentineans don't know about steak ain't worth knowing! So give it a go - we think you'll agree it's the perfect accompaniment...

Full Name: Apple-Glazed Pork Steaks with Roasted Butternut
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Broccoli, Boiling Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Pancetta, Pork Steak, Tracklements Apple and sage Jelly
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What goes better with pork than more pork? Pairing these juicy pork steaks with crisp, salty pancetta takes them to the next level! Add some sweet roasted butternut squash, crispy broccoli and an appley sauce and we're sure you'll love tonight's dinner.

Full Name: Veggie-Packed Moussaka with Cheat's Garlic Bread
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Oregano, Tomato Puree 30g, Cinnamon Stick, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Description: This moussaka lives up to its name - it really is absolutely packed with veggies! It's got lentils too, for protein, all under a creamy, cheesy topping. Delicious!

Full Name: Sun-Dried Tomato Risotto with Asparagus and Fennel
Ingredients: Water, Shallot, Garlic Clove, Fennel, Asparagus, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Tomato Puree 30g, Arborio Rice, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Risotto has a bad reputation. Many people think it's hard to cook. But they're wrong! It's super easy! Yes, there's a bit of stirring but that's what makes it such a creamy, comforting dish. However, there is one area where risotto can be demanding: once ready, it doesn't like being kept waiting and should be eaten without delay! Hardly sounds like a chore to us...

Full Name: Sweetcorn Fritters with Avocado, Tomato & Feta Salad
Ingredients: Red Chilli, Spring Onion, Coriander, Lime, Sweetcorn, Gram Flour, Water, Cherry Tomatoes, Avocado, Feta Cheese, Orange, Honey, Olive Oil, Pumpkin Seeds
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Frittering one's life away is generally considered a bad thing. But we think it sounds rather nice… when the fritters are as delicious as these little sweetcorn numbers! Add an avocado salad on the side and it's sunshine on a plate. Enjoy!

Full Name: Oven-Baked Sausages with Broccoli & Potato Gratin and Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Thyme, Carrot, Red Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Pancetta, Double Cream, Dijon Mustard, Panko Breadcrumbs, Toulouse Sausage, Honey, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: This meal is like a meeting of the Tasty Things Association. Potato is rubbing shoulders with pancetta, cheese and broccoli in a gorgeous gratin. Carrots are getting on like a house on fire with honey and thyme. And is that sausage and onion having a little dance? You won't know what to eat first. May we suggest a bit of everything?

Full Name: Tiger Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Red Chilli, Tiger Prawns, Red Wine Vinegar, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Simple fresh flavours are combined in this dish to create something really special. Juicy prawns and tangy sun-dried tomatoes will transport you to the Mediterranean sunshine in the time it takes to cook spaghetti. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Walnut & Rosemary Chicken with Crispy Potatoes and Salad
Ingredients: Red Potato, Rosemary, Walnuts, Chicken Breast, Panko Breadcrumbs, Balsamic Vinegar, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Leaves
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Although walnuts and rosemary and delicious individually, together they're an absolute winner! But this crispy chicken isn’t just delicious, it's good for you too. Walnuts are full of omega-3 which is great for brain health and researchers have also recently discovered that rosemary helps with memory. You could say this dish was food for thought!

Full Name: Teriyaki Beef with Garlicky Bok Choy and Brown Rice
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Spring Onion, Bok Choy, Soy Sauce, Honey, Flank Steak, Sesame Seeds
Utensils: Large Pan, Sieve, Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The 'teri' in 'teriyaki' is the Japanese word for 'gloss' or 'glaze' which makes it perfect for describing the gorgeous sheen that develops when you cook anything in this delicious sauce. And, since you asked, 'yaki' means roast, fried or grilled!

Full Name: Saffron Risotto with Fennel and Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Fennel, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Water, Saffron, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Pea Shoots
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Large Pan, Ladle, Bowl
Description: Golden saffron brings the glamour to this oozy, creamy risotto dish but don't underestimate the fennel! It's fresh, crisp flavour has just a hint of aniseed and, combined with the saffron's sweet, aromatic hit, makes this dish very special!

Full Name: Orange Glazed Duck with Crushed Potato, Green Beans and Roasted Tomato
Ingredients: Potato, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Green Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Orange, Duck Breast
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Anthony and Cleopatra. Batman and Robin. Love and Marriage. Crime and Punishment. History and literature and full of iconic pairings but one of our favourites has to be duck and orange. Some might call it retro. We say it's a classic. With this recipe you're going to learn how to melt the fat on the duck breasts. Cheffy types call this 'rendering' and it makes the skin lovely and crisp. Enjoy!

Full Name: Moroccan Beef Stew with Couscous and Flaked Almonds
Ingredients: Beef Mince, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Courgette, Coriander, Ras-el-Hanout, Chopped Tomatoes, Beef Stock Pot, Couscous, Water, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl
Description: Ras-el-Hanout is a spice mixture used throughout North Africa. Literally translated, the name means 'top of the shop'. Kind of like our 'top drawer' - the best each spice seller has to offer. No two merchants have quite the same blend but ours contains chillies, rose petals and ginger amongst other deliciously fragrant things. It brings fabulous aromas and flavours to this stew. Enjoy!

Full Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Coconut Rice and Bok Choy
Ingredients: Water, Bok Choy, Garlic Clove, Chicken Thighs, Coconut Powder, Basmati Rice, Ginger, Honey, Soy Sauce, Cashew Nuts
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Bowl, Lid, Frying Pan
Description: Japanese food can be pretty dangerous stuff. Thrill seekers pay a fortune to eat fugu, a fish which, if prepared incorrectly, is deadly poisonous! Chefs train for years to learn right way - the trick is to leave just enough poison on each piece to numb the lips but without causing any other adverse effects! We're glad to say that today's Japanese special of teriyaki is neither dangerous, nor will it take you years to master...

Full Name: Hoisin Glazed Prawns with Spicy Malay Noodles
Ingredients: Rice Noodle, Echalion Shallot, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Courgette, Salted Peanuts, Tiger Prawns, Hoisin Sauce, Malay Curry Powder, Soy Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan
Description: The deliciousness of hoisin sauce is undisputed. Yet it remains mysterious. The name means 'seafood' yet it isn't made with any. These day's it's become multi-purpose as an ingredient or dipping sauce and there's not that isn’t made more delicious by a bit of sweet-savoury hoisin. We're taking it back to its seafood roots, paired with plump prawns and served with spicy vermicelli noodles. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sicilian Penne Caponata with Tuscan Sausage
Ingredients: Aubergine, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Olives, Tuscan Pork Sausage, White Wine Vinegar, Chopped Tomatoes, Penne Pasta, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: This recipe was born out of Patrick’s love for all things Italian. Caponata is also one of Sicily’s best kept secrets, soo, mum's the word. We don’t want to get in trouble with the locals!

Full Name: Creamy Pesto Gnocchi with Courgette and Cherry Tomato
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Pine Nuts, Basil 20g, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Gnocchi, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Juicy cherry tomatoes combine beautifully with plump little gnocchi, fried until their golden. Add a creamy pesto sauce and it becomes a symphony of summery flavour. Enjoy!

Full Name: Moroccan Halloumi Salad with Citrus Dressing
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Baby Spinach, Coriander, Carrot, Yellow Pepper, Halloumi, Harissa Spice Mix, Olive Oil, Lemon
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: This salad is fabulously summery. Lovely 'squeaky' halloumi, sweet potato and plenty of veg, all with a zingy lemony dressing. Here's a cheffy tip to help in the preparation: to get more juice from your lemon, roll it firmly on a work surface with the palm of your hand. This breaks down the juice sacs so more comes out when you cut it half and squeeze.

Full Name: Coconut & Lentil Dal with Homemade Yoghurt & Coriander Flatbreads
Ingredients: Natural Yoghurt, Flour, Ground Coriander, Onion, Garlic Clove, Vine Tomatoes, Mixed Beans, Poudre de Columbo, Coconut Milk, Water, Red Lentils, Vegetable Stock Pot, Kale, Flat Leaf Parsley, Netherend Butter Salted, Olive Oil, Lime
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Sieve, Large Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Making your own flatbreads is surprisingly easy. Particularly these delicious coriander yoghurt numbers which make a great accompaniment for today's spicy dal. If you don't have a rolling pin, just use a clingfilm-covered wine bottle!

Full Name: Spiced Chicken with Couscous, Toasted Sweetcorn Salsa and Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Cucumber, Lime, Sweetcorn, Chives, Chicken Breast, Curry Powder, Couscous, Sour Cream, Water, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Sieve, Bowl, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pan with Lid, Plate
Description: Toasting sweetcorn brings out a delicious nuttiness in the kernels. Along with cooling cumber it makes a great contrast to lightly spiced chicken. Add some red pepper and this is a dish that not only tastes summery but looks the part too. Enjoy!

Full Name: Homemade Chorizo Calzone Packed With Veggies
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin, Plate
Description: At the Fresh Farm we get pretty excited about pizza. We're partial to a pie too. But a pizza-pie hybrid? Wow! The deliciousness is almost overwhelming! As a folded pizza, the calzone combines the best of both worlds. It's name comes from the Italian word for 'shoe' or 'stocking', so called becasue it's stuffed full of good things. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pork Steak with Creamy Mash and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Red Potato, Broccoli, Echalion Shallot, Pork Chops, Rosemary, Black Peppercorns, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Strainer, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate, Potato Masher
Description: Sage is always seen as the traditional herb to accompany pork but rosemary works beautifully too. Tonight's dinner combines these two complimentary flavours with creamy masha and a piquant peppercorn sauce. Delicious!

Full Name: Mexican Cottage Pie with Sweet Potato and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Green Pepper, Carrot, Onion, Red Chilli, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Beef Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Oven dish
Description: What makes a pie a pie? We know some people who insist it must have a 'pastry hat and coat' to qualify. But what about a cottage pie? Surely that counts too, even though it's topped with potato? And what about this cottage pie? We've given it a HelloFresh twist with Mexican spices and a sweet potato crown. Whatever you call it, there's no denying it's tasty!

Full Name: Pork Medallions with Tarragon Sauce and Potatoes
Ingredients: Tarragon, Leek, Pork Medallion, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, New Potatoes, Sour Cream
Utensils: Large Pan, Strainer, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Who remembers 'Medallion Man'? That swaggering 1980s cliché with his shirt unbuttoned, flashy gold jewellery nestling against a copious carpet of chest hair? But medallions can be done tastefully and this dish shows you how. Pork in tarragon sauce is a classic French combination and positively exudes understated elegance. Not a swagger in sight, just pure deliciousness...

Full Name: Cheddar Beanie Burger with Chips and Nutty Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Mixed Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lemon, Cheddar Cheese, Ground Cumin, Ground Coriander, Panko Breadcrumbs, Wholegrain Mustard, Vine Tomatoes, Rocket, Walnuts, Brioche Bun, Original Onion Marmalade, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Strainer, Bowl, Plate
Description:
Rich but very light, brioche is made from a bread dough that has been enriched with so much butter
it's almost halfway to being a cake! You could say it has been 'breadazzled'... It's the perfect bun for
these savoury veggie burgers. Served with wedges and a lovely fresh salad, they're a real treat!

Full Name: Tempting Tiger Prawn Risotto With Tender Asparagus Spears and Dukkah Spice
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Asparagus, Tiger Prawns, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Super Dukkah Mix, Hard Italian Cheese, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Basil 20g
Utensils: Grater, Knife, Pot, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate, Bowl
Description: Beautifully balanced between creaminess and 'al dente' bite, even the simplest risotto is luxurious. But we've really gone to town with this one! It's bursting with plump tiger prawns and tender asparagus spears. Fragrant, nutty dukkah provides the finishing touch. Don't neglect what the Italians call 'tostatura': cooking the rice in oil before adding stock. It takes only a minute but makes all the difference. Enjoy!

Full Name: Confit Duck Leg with Caramelised Apples, Pancetta Potatoes and Peashoot Salad
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Thyme, Pancetta, Confit Duck Leg, Walnuts, Wholegrain Mustard, Lemon, Olive Oil, Braeburn Apple, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Tracklements Apple and sage Jelly, Baby Spinach, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Using confit duck legs in this dish gives a beautiful 'cheffy' result with minimum effort! Crisp skin and tender meat make for a delightful dinner, worthy of a special occasion. Especially when accompanied by pancetta potatoes and caramelised apples. Don't throw away the fat from around the duck legs either. It'll keep for weeks in the fridge and makes great roasties!

Full Name: Prawn & Chorizo Spaghetti with Fresh Vine Tomatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tiger Prawns, Vine Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Chilli Flakes, Chorizo, Tomato Passata
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate, Strainer
Description: In the heady days of his youth, Patrick's favourite date night restaurant was a little Spanish place in London's Borough market. He ended up going there so often that he became best mates with the chef and started working in the kitchen at weekends! This classic Iberian combo of prawns and chorizo remains a favourite and he presents it here so you can do date night without leaving the house...

Full Name: Beef Ragu Rigatoni with Black Olive & Tomato Salsa
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Basil 20g, Beef Mince, Dried Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Tomato Passata, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Rigatoni Pasta, Black Olives, Vine Tomatoes, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description:
'Al dente' is one of those phrases people throw around a lot when talking about pasta, but what does it actually mean? The Italian translates as 'to the tooth' and pasta cooked perfectly 'al 
dente' should still have a little bit of firmness to it. The way to tell is by biting through a piece - have a little nibble on one of this week's rigatoni before you serve up. If you can see a thin centre of white in the middle of the cooked pasta then it's spot on and time to tuck in!

Full Name: Homemade Chorizo Calzone Packed with Veggies
Ingredients: Red Onion, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Chorizo, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs, Red Pepper
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Rolling Pin
Description: At the Fresh Farm we get pretty excited about pizza. We're partial to a pie, too. But a pizza-pie hybrid? Wow! The deliciousness is almost overwhelming! As a folded pizza, the calzone combines the best of both worlds. It's name comes from the Italian word for 'trouser-leg' or 'stocking', so called because it's stuffed full of good things. Enjoy!

Full Name: Cajun Lemon Cod with Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Potato, Carrot, Thyme, Cod Fillet, Lemon, Cajun Spice, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Way back in the 18th century, Louisiana was a massive cultual melting pot. French, Spanish and African settlers congregated in this part of America's Deep South and pooled their culinary heritage. Cajun food was born! We've created our own cultural mash-up right here at the Fresh farm by bringing hot and sweet Cajun spice to cod, the Brit's favourite fish. Enjoy!

Full Name: Turkey Saltimbocca with Creamy Mushroom Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Turkey Steak, Serrano Ham, Sage, White Wine Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Tagliatelle, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl, Strainer
Description: The Italian word saltimbocca loosely translates as ‘jump in the mouth’. This dish is traditionally made with veal, ham and sage. We have mixed it up a little in this recipe, using turkey in place of veal. Paired with creamy mushroom tagliatelle, we think it truly lives up to its name and will make your taste buds dance!

Full Name: Minted Lamb Meatballs with Couscous and Garlicky Beans
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Mint, Dried Apricots, Green Beans, Lamb Mince, Panko Breadcrumbs, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous, Dried Thyme, Cumin Seeds, Chopped Tomatoes, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan
Description: You only have to think of traditional Sunday roasts to know that lamb and mint is a match made in herb heaven. We're bringing a Middle Eastern twist to this classic combination with these minted meatballs. Enjoy!

Full Name: Chermoula Spiced Chicken with Courgette Rice and Lemon Yoghurt
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Chermoula Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Onion, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Lemon, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: When our chef André visited Marrakech, he adored the bustling night markets and the way they come alive when the sun sets. The stalls are just packed with the freshest, most seductively-spiced food for miles around. He ate the best chargrilled chicken of his life there and his memory of it inspired this dish. We hope you love it as much as he did!

Full Name: Samphire Paella with Veggies and Olives
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Chervil, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Arborio Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cherry Tomatoes, Samphire, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Samphire is a fabulous vegetable. It grows by the sea and is one of the great tastes of British summertime. But veggies need a change of scene, just like the rest of us. So today we're sending it on holiday to Spain as part of this delicious paella! The trick to a great paella is not to stir too much, so it develops a crispy crust at the bottom of the pan. The Spanish call this the 'socarrat'. It's considered the best bit!

Full Name: Honey-Roasted Feta with garlicky lentils and Sweet Potato Wedges
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Echalion Shallot, Cherry Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Feta Cheese, Lentils, Lemon, Olive Oil, Honey, Rocket, Pomegranate Seeds
Utensils: Grater, Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Don't let the amazing flavours of this dish distract you from the fantastic nutritional benefits you'll find in the ingredients. The lentils and sweet potato are a great source of fibre to keep your blood sugar stable and your tummy feeling full. In addition, rocket, pomegrante seeds, garlic and cherry tomatoes provide an array of phytonutrients - just look at their beautiful rainbow colours to get the idea!

Full Name: Mexican Spiced Corn-on-the-Cob with Black Bean Stew
Ingredients: Corn on the Cob, Mexican Spice, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Celery Stick, Smoked Paprika, Tomato Passata, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Black Beans, Coriander, Lime, Sour Cream, Flatbread
Utensils: Aluminum Foil, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Grater, Strainer, Bowl
Description: Did you know that Mexican cuisine is recognised by UNESCO as an 'Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity'? Today's recipe demonstates why: a hearty black bean stew is the perfect compliment to sweet and smoky spiced corn on the cob. De nada!

Full Name: Creamy Salmon Spaghetti with Tomato and Basil
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Tomato Passata, Chopped Tomatoes, Salmon fillet, Lemon, Spaghetti, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Strainer
Description: Everyone loves pesto! Basil leaves just smell and taste so perfectly of summer. But did you know how easy it is to make your own? We're teaing it here with a vibrantly flavoured tomato sauce and some delcious, flaky salmon. Enjoy!

Full Name: Tarragon Pork with Creamy Potatoes and Garlicky Veg
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Red Potato, Tarragon, Green Beans, Panko Breadcrumbs, Olive Oil, Pork Medallion, Tenderstem Broccoli, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Potato Water, Double Cream
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Lid, Large Pan, Baking Dish, Plate
Description: In today's recipe you're going to learn the cheffy trick of using potato cooking water to thicken a sauce. The residial starch swells and bursts, making your gratin extra creamy! It's the perfect accompaniment to some juicy tarragon pork and fresh, garlicky greens.

Full Name: Five Spice Chicken with Brown Rice and Garlicky Bok Choy
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Chicken Thighs, Bok Choy, Spring Onion, Red Chilli, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Rice Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Chinese 5 Spice
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What are these mysterious five spices that so often sneak their way into Chinese cooking? The exact formula can vary from place to place but usually it’s a concoction of star anise, cloves, cinnamon, fennel seeds and Sichuan pepper. This dish was inspired by a trip to Australia where they use all sorts of Asian flavours in their cooking. We teamed it up super fresh bok choy for a summertime burst of flavour!

Full Name: Classic Sausage Burger with Onion Marmalade, Wedges and Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Dried Thyme, Pork Sausage, Cheddar Cheese, Original Onion Marmalade, Cucumber, Brioche Bun, Lemon, Olive Oil, Rocket
Utensils: Bowl, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Lid, Plate
Description: Sausages are a lazy cook's best friend. Take off their skins and you have ready-seasoned meat that's good for all sorts of things. Break it up into mince and use as the basis of a pasta sauce or roll it into meatballs (cheatballs!). In this recipe it makes a banger of a burger. Popping a lid on the pan while you cook them (see the tip in Step 6) keeps everything super juicy and gives you perfectly melted cheese.

Full Name: Chicken & Sage Saltimbocca with Lemony Artichoke Risotto
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Sage, Flat Leaf Parsley, Grilled Artichoke, Lemon, Parmesan Cheese, Serrano Ham, Cheddar Cheese, Chicken Breast, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Ladle, Bowl
Description:
The Italian word saltimbocca loosely translates as ‘jump in the mouth’. Tender chicken and savoury sage, all wrapped in serrano ham is a feast for the senses. We've added some cheese too which melts and makes everything deliciously unctuous. It all sits atop a creamy risotto, flavoured with lemon and studded with artichoke hearts. Definitely something to
make the tate buds leap for joy!

Full Name: Honey-Walnut Halloumi with Roasted Butternut and Broccoli
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Smoked Paprika, Broccoli, Red Chilli, Flat Leaf Parsley, Walnuts, Halloumi, Honey
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Here at the Fresh farm we can't get enough halloumi. We love the "squeak" when you sink your teeth into a slice. It seems we're not alone either - Britain now consumes more of this cheese than anywhere outside its native Cyprus. We're sure you'll find tonight's dinner somewthing to squeak about!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlic Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Olives, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let's keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Mixed Bean & Pork Chilli with Brown Rice and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Brown Basmati Rice, Red Onion, Mixed Beans, Lime, Sour Cream, Pork Sausage, Cumin, Tomato Puree 30g, Chipotle Paste, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetable Stock Pot, Coriander
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Strainer, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage meat in a chilli? Yes, you read it right! It may be slightly unorthodox, but pork and beans is such a classic combination that we're positive you'll love this alternative to beef mince. Enjoy!

Full Name: Lamb-Stuffed Aubergine with Minted Courgette Salad
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Carrot, Lamb Mince, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chermoula Spice, Cheddar Cheese, Courgette, Mint, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Peeler, Plate
Description: There can't be many words more fun to say than 'babaghanoush'. Try it now! Babaghanoush. Babaghanoush. Trips off the tongue so beautifully, doesn’t it? The fabulously-named aubergine dip is the inspiration behind this recipe which mixes a babaghanoush base with spiced lamb to create a delicious stuffing. It's served with an elegant salad of courgette ribbons. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Prawn Stir-Fry with Lime & Mango Dressing and Toasted Coconut Rice
Ingredients: Green Pepper, Red Pepper, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Lime, Water for Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Mango Chutney 40g, Mustard Seeds, Rice Vinegar, Desiccated Coconut, Tiger Prawns, Curry Leaves
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Head Chef Patrick has gone on a Sri Lankan adventure! This week it took him to one of the country's most famous landmarks, the mighty Sigiriya rock. After taking in the breathtaking panorama from the top (check out our Instagram to see the story!) he headed down to the plantations below and cooked up this beautiful prawn stir fry in a ramshackle mud hut. Find out which ingredient in tonight's recipe could hold the secret to eternal youth at blog.hellofresh.co.uk/sri-lanka/

Full Name: Spicy Mexican Chicken with Homemade Refried Beans
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Shallot, Coriander, Green Chilli, Mixed Beans, Chicken Stock Pot, Mexican Spice, Water, Chicken Breast, Olive Oil, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Lid, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: In this flavoursome Mexican recipe you'll learn how to butterfly chicken. It's a great time-saving technique as it means the meat cooks through quicker. And anything that gets dinner on the table sooner is a good thing, right?

Full Name: Mango Chutney Chicken with Spiced Bulgar Wheat and Roasted Cauliflower
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Mango Chutney 40g, Cumin, Cauliflower, Onion, Garlic Clove, Tomato Puree 30g, Bulgur Wheat, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Flaked Almonds
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Dish, Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Cooking chicken in mango chutney makes it deliciously sticky. Don't be afraid of letting the chutney caramelise and blacken slightly - this will only add to the flavour! We're serving it with nutty bulgur wheat and some roasted cauliflower, all finished off with a sprinkling of toasted almonds. Delicious!

Full Name: Creamy Pancetta Penne with Peas and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Water, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of outrageous foodie fortune. This dish is a testament to one such union: salty, savoury pancetta and sweet, green peas are a classic combination. The addition of mint turns the whole things into a beautifully summery ensemble. Enjoy!

Full Name: Courgette Parmigiana with Insalata Caprese and Foccacia
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Tomato Passata, Oregano, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Bowl, Plate
Description: Parmigiana is a Norther Italian classic. It's traditionally made with fried aubergine but we're using courgettes here for a lighter taste. It takes a little while to assemble but we're sure you'll think it's time well spent when you taste the results!

Full Name: Tandoori Spiced Aubergine with Tomato & Coriander Rice and Nigella Yoghurt
Ingredients: Aubergine, Tandoori Masala Spice, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Garlic Clove, Ginger, Tumeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Spring Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Coriander, Natural Yoghurt, Nigella Seeds
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: Our chef André isn’t a vegetarian but his veggie friends absolutely love this dish and ask for it it whenever they come round. We're sure you'll love it too. Just be careful who you feed it to, or you might end up with your own set of demanding houseguests!

Full Name: Goat's Cheese Fritters with Charred Courgette Salad
Ingredients: Spring Onion, Goat's Cheese, Flat Leaf Parsley, Gram Flour, Water, Original Onion Marmalade, Courgette, Lemon, Spiced Honey Mustard, Olive Oil, Baby Leaves, Walnuts
Utensils: Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Frittering one's life away is generally considered a bad thing. But we think it sounds rather nice… when the fritters are as delicious as these goat's cheese numbers! They're served on top of a charred courgette salad and finished with walnuts. Just gorgeous!

Full Name: Paprika Chicken Dippers with Cheesy Wedges and Zingy Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Cheddar Cheese, Dried Thyme, Cucumber, Lime, Honey, Olive Oil, Chicken Breast, Plain Flour, Mild Paprika, Baby Leaves, Ketchup
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Bowl, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Everyone loves crispy chicken but breading and deep frying are a bit of a faff. This version uses a flour coating and a frying pan, to get a result that's just as tasty with a fraction of the fuss. It's healthier too! The secret is to let the pan get really hot before you cook the chicken. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with Chorizo Potatoes and Rocket
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Onion, Thyme, Chorizo, Tilapia Fillet, Rocket, Lemon
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We all have irrational fears. For Patrick it’s pretty much anything with more than about five legs. Recently we’ve had a few messages saying that HelloFresh has helped some of you conquer your fears of cooking fish which is great news! Here's another fish recipe that's as easy as it is delicious, so step boldly up to your stove and make it happen!

Full Name: Lamb Pasta Bake with Rosemary, Spinach &  Crème Fraîche
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Wholewheat Rigatoni, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Rosemary, Tomato Passata, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Crème Fraîche, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Large Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish, Plate
Description: In Britain, rosemary is a  traditional symbol of love and marriage. Brides once adorned their veils with it - a precurser to the modern bouquet. Show your family some love with this superquick and tasty dish!

Full Name: Spiced Chicken with Coconut Rice and Baked Corn on the Cob
Ingredients: Corn on the Cob, Honey, Shawarma Spice Mix, Chicken Drumstick, Onion, Red Pepper, Vine Tomatoes, Garlic Clove, Black Beans, Basmati Rice, Coconut Milk, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: This creamy coconut rice is (in our humble opinion), pretty amazing! Teamed with delicious shawarma spiced chicken drumsticks and roasted corn on the cob, it's going to be a sensational (but slightly messy) dinner… Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Sea Bass with Golden Saffron Mash, Piquant Chorizo Salsa and Sugar Snap Peas
Ingredients: Red Potato, Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Lemon, Chorizo, Spring Onion, Butter, Crème Fraîche, Saffron, Sugar Snap Peas, Sea Bass Fillets
Utensils: Bowl, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Strainer
Description:
Chorizo is the perfect partner for seafood. In this beautiful dish, the paprika-infused oil mingles with sweet tomato and
fragrant basil to make a piquant salsa for pearly-white sea bass fillets. Golden saffron brings an air of glamour to creamy
mashed potato. Add some fresh, green sugar snap peas and you've got a plateful that's as lovely to look at as it is to eat!

Full Name: Italian Tomato Risotto with Tuscan Pork Sausages
Ingredients: Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Tomato Passata, Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Parmesan Cheese, Arborio Rice, Fennel Seeds, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Large Pan, Grater, Ladle, Bowl
Description: Risotto is a speciality of Northern Italy where they grow rice instead of the wheat that becomes pasta in the South. It's traditionally served in small portions as a 'primo' - a first course before the main. But when something is this delicous why restrict it to a starter?

Full Name: Coconutty Veggie Curry with Yellow Rice and Peanuts
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Baby Corn, Tomato Puree 30g, Goan Xacuti Spice, Tamarind Sauce, Ground Turmeric, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Basmati Rice, Salted Peanuts
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: May's Spice Of The Month is Goan Xacuti Curry Powder. It's pronounced za-coo-tea and is a blend of fiery dried chilli, sweet cinnamon and coriander (amongst other deliciously fragrant things). It's traditional in Goa to balance the heat of spices with creamy, soothing coconut milk as André has done here. He's also filled it full of lovely veggies  and topped the whole thing off with peanuts for a bit of extra crunch. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Tostadas with Guacamole and Cheese
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Red Kidney Beans, Beef Mince, Mexican Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Beef Stock Pot, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Avocado, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Grater, Strainer, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Tostadas are simply toasted tortillas. It makes them deliciously crispy! We've given you more tortilla's here than you need for the recipe. Why not make your own tortilla chips with what's left? Just cut them into triangles, drizzle with oil and season with salt, black pepper and any other spices you fancy before baking in the oven until crunchy. Enjoy!

Full Name: Coconutty Veggie Curry with Yellow Rice and Peanuts
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Chestnut Mushrooms, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Baby Corn, Tomato Puree 30g, Goan Xacuti Spice, Tamarind Sauce, Ground Turmeric, Coconut Milk, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Basmati Rice, Salted Peanuts
Utensils: Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: May's Spice Of The Month is Goan Xacuti Curry Powder. It's pronounced za-coo-tea and is a blend of fiery dried chilli, sweet cinnamon and coriander (amongst other deliciously fragrant things). It's traditional in Goa to balance the heat of spices with creamy, soothing coconut milk as André has done here. He's also filled it full of lovely veggies  and topped the whole thing off with peanuts for a bit of extra crunch. Enjoy!

Full Name: Tandoori Chicken with Spiced Quinoa and Kachumber Salad
Ingredients: Chicken Thighs, Tandoori Masala Spice, Natural Yoghurt, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Quinoa, Cardamom Pod, Lemon, Cucumber, Red Chilli
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Large Pan, Sieve, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: No, we haven’t just spelled cucumber wrong! Kachumber is an Indian salad of chopped cucumber, usually with onions or tomatoes. It makes a refreshing side dish to this spicy tandoori chicken. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia with New Potatoes and Tarragon Sauce
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Strainer, Plate
Description: Tender tilapia and tasty tarragon! Try saying that ten times in a row! It may be a bit of a tongue twister but we're sure it'll be a taste bud pleaser too. Enjoy!

Full Name: Moroccan Beef Burgers with Potato Wedges and Onion Relish
Ingredients: Minced Beef, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Ras-el-Hanout, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pan with Lid, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This recipe was inspired by Head Chef Patrick's trip to Morocco. After spending some toime in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes he returned to Marrakech and treated himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel. Their spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression so we've re-created it here for you. Enjoy!

Full Name: Rocket Pesto Orzo with Charred Courgettes and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vine Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Rocket, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Lemon, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Large Pan
Description: Today's recipe is a cross between a risotto and a pasta dish. It's made with a tiny, rice-shaped pasta called 'orzo' cooked in a similar way to risotto. You could think of it as an 'orzotto'! We've put a twist on the accompanying pesto too. Instead of basil we're using rocket which provides a delicious, peppery contrast to the creamy pasta and fresh tomatoes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Mexican Beanie Tostadas with Cheat's Guacamole and Cheese
Ingredients: Corn Tortilla, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Yellow Pepper, Courgette, Mixed Beans, Mexican Spice, Tinned Plum Tomates, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Avocado, Coriander, Lime
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Sieve, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Today we'll be whipping up a delicious Mexican feast, piled high on crispy, crunchy tostadas. A tostada is just a tortilla that has been toasted but the flavour marries perfectly with Mimi's spicy beans and some creamy avocado. Say 'Ole!' for guacamole!

Full Name: Sweet Potato Coconut Dhal with Pumpkin Seed Salsa and Garlicky Flat Bread
Ingredients: Onion, Ginger, Garlic, Small Sweet Potato, Red Chilli, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Tomato Puree 30g, Coconut Milk, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Red Lentils, Vine Tomatoes, Coriander, Lime, Pumpkin Seeds, Flatbread, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Pan with Lid, Bowl, Baking Tray
Description: This week Head Chef Patrick's Sri Lankan adventure took him all the way to the 'Coconut Triangle' where he was determined to climb a coconut tree and retrieve his own ingredients. The reality was a lot harder than the locals made it look! To see his efforts and watch him cooking this recipe in the middle of the plantation go to blog.hellofresh.co.uk/sri-lanka

Full Name: Springtime Chicken with Roasted Veggies, Tomato Salad and Minty Salsa
Ingredients: Chicken Thigh, Dried Italian Herbs, New Potatoes, Carrot, Leek, Courgette, Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Vine Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Delicious roast veggies, crispy-skinned chicken and a refreshing minty salsa. There's a lot to like here. But maybe our favourite element of today's meal is the tomato salad. There's something so elegantly rustic about mixing tomatoes of two different sizes. Hope you think so too!

Full Name: Gnocchi Bolognese with Cheesy Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Broccoli, Carrot, Cheddar Cheese, Beef Mince, Provencale Herbs, Cherry Tomatoes, Tomato Passata, Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Water, Gnocchi, Basil 20g
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We've reinvented the classic bolognese by teaming it with crispy gnocchi. These delicious, pillowy little dumplings become extra tasty when fried 'til golden brown. It's a dish that looks indulgent but, hidden under the melted cheese, has four of your five-a-day!!

Full Name: Tuscan Sausage Wraps with Rocket and Basil
Ingredients: Tuscan Pork Sausage, Echalion Shallot, Red Pepper, Tomato Passata, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Wholemeal Tortilla, Baby Spinach, Hard Italian Cheese, Balsamic Vinegar, Olive Oil, Rocket
Utensils: Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish, Plate
Description:
At the Fresh Farm we love to take a traditional recipe and give it a fresh twist. Here we've morphed the sausage roll into a far
healthier and (we think) tastier version. These baked sausage wraps are packed full of flavour and goodness. We think they
may become a new family favourite!

Full Name: Mild & Creamy Fish Curry with Toasted Coconut and Rice
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Coriander, Desiccated Coconut, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cardamom Pod, Basmati Rice, Jalfrezi Spice, Plum Tomatoes, Crème Fraîche, Smoked Fish Mix
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Pan with Lid, Lid, Bowl
Description: This curry doesn't bite! Its jalfrezi spice is tempered by a creamy sauce which goes perfectly with tender fish and flavoursome veggies. Golden toasted coconut emphasises the sweet notes and it's all served with fragrant basmati rice. Nothing to be afraid of!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Spicy Lentils
Ingredients: Carrot, Celery Stick, Leek, Red Chilli, Thyme, Sage, Chicken Breast, Green Lentils, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan
Description: We're so used to seeing lentils dried or in tins that it only occurred to us the other day to wonder what a lentil plant looks like. Not dissimilar to a pea plant it turns out, but bushier. Here we've put these lovely legumes in a spicy, creamy sauce which pairs perfectly with pan-fried chicken. Beautiful!

Full Name: Chorizo Rigatoni with Cherry Tomatoes and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Yellow Pepper, Red Pepper, Onion, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Rigatoni Pasta, Chorizo, Black Olives, Mozzarella
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan
Description: The key to this dish is gently roasting the cherry tomatoes and peppers to bring out their natural sweetness and then balancing this against salty olives and mild, creamy mozzarella cheese. We’ve made it super quick and easy, to leave more time for putting your feet up!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Fish Curry with Yellow Rice
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Lime, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Curry Leaves, Vine Tomatoes, Ground Coriander, Olive Oil, Tilapia Fillet, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Our Spice of the Month is Sri Lankan Curry Powder and to celebrate, our Head Chef Patrick is currently on a Sri Lankan adventure. This week he made it to the southern coast where he met the local stilt fishermen. As he cooked this curry on the beach the tide came in and threated to wash his makeshift kitchen away! To see more go to hellofresh.co.uk/sri-lanka

Full Name: Brazilian 'Veijoada' Bake
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Onion, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Black Beans, Ground Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Cheddar Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Echalion Shallot, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: This is a veggie version of feijoada, the national dish of Brazil which is a rich stew of pork and black beans. Its name comes from the Portuguese word for bean, 'feijão' so we've given it a HelloFresh twist by letting the beans take centre stage and leaving out the meat altogether. We call it 'veijoada'! Enjoy!

Full Name: Freekeh Risotto with Asparagus & Courgette
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Asparagus, Courgette, Freekeh, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Salted, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Walnuts
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Baking Tray, Bowl
Description: We've given this risotto a summery twist by making it with freekeh instead of the usual rice. Freekeh is young wheat, picked green then toasted and cracked. It's deliciously nutty and, what's more, doesn't require any of the stirring required by a traditional risotto. Enjoy!

Full Name: Smoky Ratatouille with Goat's Cheese and Garlic Bread
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Aubergine, Chopped Tomatoes, Smoked Paprika, Ciabatta, Basil 20g, Goat's Cheese, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan
Description: Smoked paprika is most definitely one of our favourite spices. Regular paprika is made by drying peppers in the sun then grinding them to a powder. For the smoked variety, the peppers are dried in smoke sheds using wood such as oak to impart a distinctive flavour. It’s a great store cupboard essential and adds a whole new dimension to your cooking. For this recipe, we balanced it against fresh, mild goat’s cheese. Enjoy!

Full Name: Turkey Stir-Fry with Carrot Rice
Ingredients: Carrot, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Turkey Steak, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Honey, Ketjap Manis, Lime, Sugar Snap Peas, Coconut Powder, Water
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Many people forget about Turkey except at Christmas. Which is a shame as it's lean and flavourful and great in all sorts of dishes. Today we're making a colourful Asian stir-fry with a surprising secret ingredient: ketchup! It brings a delicious sweet and sour note and is actually used by lots of Chinese restaurant chefs!

Full Name: Honey-Mustard Gammon with Mashed Potato, Roasted Veggies and Creamy Sauce
Ingredients: Carrot, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Potato, Honey, English Mustard, Gammon Steak, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Frying Pan
Description: Pineapple rings and other culinary crimes have done much to tarnish gammon's reputation. But treated simply and shown some respect it can be a classic. Here we've given it a honey mustard glaze. It's sweet but with a bit of a kick and pairs beautifully with the savoury, salty meat. Add some mash, roasted veggies and a creamy parsley sauce and you've got yourself a feast. Enjoy!

Full Name: Tomato-Garlic Ragu with Spaghetti and Parmesan
Ingredients: Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Thyme, Onion, Minced Beef, Soy Sauce, Dried Italian Herbs, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic Clove
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan
Description: Traditionally, us Brits love the addition of a bit of Worcestershire sauce in our hotpots, pasta sauces and so on. Here at the Fresh Farm we’re very taken with the idea of using soy sauce in a similar way. The savoury saltiness is a subtle but genius addition to this quick ragu. Can anyone guess your secret ingredient?

Full Name: Chicken Milanese with Roasted New Potatoes and Chives
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Chicken Breast, Sour Cream, Garlic Salt, Lemon, Panko Breadcrumbs, Chives, Steve’s Leaves: Peashoots & Spinach, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Clingfilm, Large Pan, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Milan's signature dish of golden breaded chicken dates back at least as far as the 12th century! In Italy it's often served alongside spaghetti in tomato sauce but today we're having it with roasted new potatoes and a peashoot salad. Finely snipped chives add an allium note that finishes everything off nicely. Enjoy!

Full Name: Cajun Cod with Sweet Potato, Heritage Tomatoes and Avocado Crema
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Lime, Coriander, Avocado, Sour Cream, Plain Flour, Cajun Spice, Cod Fillet, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan
Description: Way back in the 18th century, French, Spanish and African settlers all congregated in America's Deep South. They pooled their culinary heritage and Cajun food was born! Inspired by this history of cultural combination, we created a dish that combines hot-and-sweet Cajun spiced cod with a cooling avocado crema and some beautiful speciality tomatoes from our friends at the Tomato Stall on the Isle of Wight. Enjoy!

Full Name: Crispy Skin Chicken with a Black Garlic, Chorizo & Basil Salsa on a Bed of Spaghetti
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Basil 20g, Parmesan Cheese, Black Garlic, Chicken Breast, Chorizo, Spaghetti, Finely Chopped Tomatoes with Onion and Garlic, Punchy Balsamic Mustard, Olive Oil, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Large Pan, Plate
Description: We love introducing our customers to new and exciting ingredients and today we're very excited to present black garlic. It's made by heating whole bulbs very, very gently over a period of several weeks! This caramelises the garlic's natural sugars and gives it deep, mellow flavour. We're combining it with piquant chorizo and fragrant basil in a salsa which is the perfect match for a perfectly roasted chicken breast. Enjoy!

Full Name: Veggie-Packed Moussaka with Cheat's Garlic Bread
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Oregano, Tomato Puree 30g, Cinnamon Stick, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Description: This moussaka lives up to its name - it really is absolutely packed with veggies! It's got lentils too, for protein, all under a creamy, cheesy topping. Delicious!

Full Name: Oven-Baked Sausages with Broccoli & Potato Gratin and Glazed Carrots
Ingredients: Potato, Broccoli, Thyme, Carrot, Red Onion, Cheddar Cheese, Pancetta, Double Cream, Dijon Mustard, Panko Breadcrumbs, Toulouse Sausage, Honey, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: This meal is like a meeting of the Tasty Things Association. Potato is rubbing shoulders with pancetta, cheese and broccoli in a gorgeous gratin. Carrots are getting on like a house on fire with honey and thyme. And is that sausage and onion having a little dance? You won't know what to eat first. May we suggest a bit of everything?

Full Name: Apple-Glazed Pork Steaks with Roasted Butternut
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Broccoli, Boiling Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Pancetta, Pork Steak, Tracklements Apple and sage Jelly
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What goes better with pork than more pork? Pairing these juicy pork steaks with crisp, salty pancetta takes them to the next level! Add some sweet roasted butternut squash, crispy broccoli and an appley sauce and we're sure you'll love tonight's dinner.

Full Name: Veggie-Packed Moussaka with Cheat's Garlic Bread
Ingredients: Aubergine, Onion, Courgette, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Oregano, Tomato Puree 30g, Cinnamon Stick, Red Split Lentils, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Vegetable Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Ciabatta, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Oven dish, Plate
Description: This moussaka lives up to its name - it really is absolutely packed with veggies! It's got lentils too, for protein, all under a creamy, cheesy topping. Delicious!

Full Name: Sirloin Steak with Salsa Verde and a Spicy Sweet Potato & Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Sirloin Steak, Small Sweet Potato, Chermoula Spice, Mint, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Flat Leaf Parsley, Capers, Olive Oil, Lemon, Cherry Tomatoes, Balsamic Vinegar, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A perfectly cooked steak is one of life's greatest pleasures. Whether you like yours rare, medium or well-done, there are two tricks you should know about for the perfect charred crust and juicy interior. First, allow the steak comes to room temperature. And second, get the pan really, really hot before you start cooking. A spicy salad makes is a fabulous accompaniment for sirloin and lifts steak night to the next level!

Full Name: Creamy Pesto Gnocchi with Courgette and Cherry Tomato
Ingredients: Cherry Tomatoes, Courgette, Garlic Clove, Pine Nuts, Basil 20g, Crème Fraîche, Hard Italian Cheese, Gnocchi, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Juicy cherry tomatoes combine beautifully with plump little gnocchi, fried until their golden. Add a creamy pesto sauce and it becomes a symphony of summery flavour. Enjoy!

Full Name: Spiced Chicken with Couscous, Toasted Sweetcorn Salsa and Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Pepper, Cucumber, Lime, Sweetcorn, Chives, Chicken Breast, Curry Powder, Couscous, Sour Cream, Water, Chicken Stock Pot
Utensils: Sieve, Bowl, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Pan with Lid, Plate
Description:
Toasting sweetcorn brings out a delicious nuttiness in the kernels. Along with cooling cumber it
makes a great contrast to lightly spiced chicken. Add some red pepper and this is a dish that not only
tastes summery but looks the part too. Enjoy!

Full Name: Asian Sea Bass with Tomato Concasse and Crispy Potatoes
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Ginger, Onion, New Potatoes, Coriander, Vine Tomatoes, Sea Bass Fillets, Lime, Fish Sauce
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Concassse is quite a cheffy word, isn’t it? Nothing to be scared of though. It just means 'dice'! Popping your tomatoes in boiling water to loosen the skins is a good trick to learn. It helps them come off in super speedy fashion. We've added some Asian flavours for a zingy twist on a French classic.

Full Name: Moroccan Steak with Lemon Couscous
Ingredients: Rump Steak, Ras-el-Hanout, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Spring Onion, Carrot, Red Pepper, Couscous, Flat Leaf Parsley, Baby Spinach, Lemon
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Close your eyes, open up the ras-el-hanout and inhale deeply. Let the scent of the spices take you on a magic carpet ride to the bustling markets of Marrakech! Don't forget to come back again or dinner will never be ready! Our tip for this recipe is to take the meat out of the fridge at least half an hour before you start. This will allow it to cook more evenly.

Full Name: Sri Lankan Chicken with Coconut & Courgette Pilaf and Coconut Yoghurt
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic, Courgette, Red Chilli, Fennel, Ground Coriander, Ground Cumin, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Cinnamon Stick, Olive Oil, Chicken Thigh, Desiccated Coconut, Natural Yoghurt, Coriander
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Head Chef Patrick is currently on a Sri Lankan adventure. This week he took a boat to Cinnamon Island to meet the family who produce this beautiful spice. You can watch Patrick cooking this recipe under the shade of a cinnamon tree and meet the great great grandfather who shows him a surprising way of preparing the spice by going to blog.hellofresh.co.uk/sri-lanka/

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Roasted Aubergine and Mushrooms
Ingredients: Water, Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Coconut Milk, Massaman Curry Paste, Crunchy Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The secret ingredient in tonight's dinner is peanut butter! Along with the coconut milk it brings a richness and creaminess to temper the chilli fire. You don't see massaman dishes on Thai menus as often as the standard red or green curries so it's worth knowing how to knock one up yourself. Enjoy!

Full Name: Stuffed Courgettes with Balsamic Spinach & Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Courgette, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Button Mushrooms, Cherry Tomatoes, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Panko Breadcrumbs, Hard Italian Cheese, Balsamic Vinegar, Baby Spinach, Munchy Seeds: Sesame Sprinkle
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: The writer Shirley Conran famously opined that "Life's too short to stuff a mushroom." But what about stuffing a mushroom into a courgette? It really doesn’t take long to make these cute courgette 'boats'. They're filled with a creamy mushroom stuffing and go great with a flavourful balsamic-dressed salad of spinach and roast cherry tomatoes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Warm Lentil Salad with Roast Butternut and Minted Feta
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Ground Coriander, Red Pepper, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Lemon, Lentils, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Feta Cheese, Red Pepper & Chilli Jelly
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Sieve, Pan with Lid, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Nutty lentils and bulgur wheat combine in thie delicious salad. Roasted butternut squash brings some sweetness as well as a pop of colour and we've added some minted feta to top everything off. It's hearty enough to fill you up but also zingy with herbs and super summery. Enjoy!

Full Name: King Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Red Chilli, King Prawns, Red Wine Vinegar, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Simple fresh flavours are combined in this dish to create something really special. Juicy prawns and tangy sun-dried tomatoes will transport you to the Mediterranean sunshine in the time it takes to cook spaghetti. Buon appetito!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted Potatoes, Broccoli and Peppers
Ingredients: Rump Bistro Steak, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: If we had a penny for every time we'd seen a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. Or at least rich enough to afford a bit of top class rump! Follow these three tips and a great result is assured: 1) Allow the steak to come to room temperature before you cook it. 2) Get your frying pan super hot before the steak goes in. 3) Rest the steak on a warm plate for a few minutes before you eat it. Now you’re ready!

Full Name: Creamy Chicken Korma with Almonds and Green Beans
Ingredients: Onion, Ginger, Garlic Clove, Chicken Breast, Green Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Korma Spice Mix, Water for Rice, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Star Anise, Water for Curry, Ground Almond, Raisins, Honey, Double Cream, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Pan with Lid, Bowl
Description: If ever a curry can be described as soothing, it's the korma. Ground almonds help make the sauce even more velvety and honey adds a touch of sweetness. Yes, there's a bit of spice but nothing to be afraid of!

Full Name: Easy Beef Enchiladas with Baby Gem Salad and Zesty Sour Cream
Ingredients: Minced Beef, Onion, Red Kidney Beans, Mexican Spice, Tomato Passata, Baby Gem Lettuce, Vine Tomatoes, Wholemeal Tortilla, Cheddar Cheese, Sour Cream, Lime
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Grater, Bowl, Plate
Description: Mexico's first ever cookbook was published way back in 1831 and included a recipe for enchiladas! This is our version of the traditional favourite. Mashing up the beans gives a creamy consistency that we think you'll love. Arriba!

Full Name: Oven Baked Salmon with Black Garlic Butter Sauce, Steam-Fried Veggies and Roasted New Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Echalion Shallot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Black Garlic, Salmon fillet, Balsamic Vinegar, Honey, Water, Mustard Seeds, Sugar Snap Peas, Tenderstem Broccoli, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Small pot, Frying Pan, Lid, Plate
Description: This delicious black garlic is a wondrous thing. Our supplier ‘The Garlic Farm’ makes (in our opinion) the best black garlic around and this is down to their secret month-long ageing process. This ensures the end product tastes deliciously sweet and syrupy – not what you’d expect from garlic! We’ve used it here in a delicious sauce but it can also be used in many weird and wonderful ways – ice cream, beer or just on its own (our buyer Ollie has been known to eat a whole tub!).

Full Name: Creamy Salmon Spaghetti with Tomato and Basil
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Basil 20g, Tomato Passata, Chopped Tomatoes, Salmon fillet, Lemon, Spaghetti, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Baby Spinach, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Bowl, Strainer
Description: Everyone loves pesto! Basil leaves just smell and taste so perfectly of summer. But did you know how easy it is to make your own? We're teaing it here with a vibrantly flavoured tomato sauce and some delcious, flaky salmon. Enjoy!

Full Name: Samphire Paella with Veggies and Olives
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Chervil, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Arborio Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cherry Tomatoes, Samphire, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Samphire is a fabulous vegetable. It grows by the sea and is one of the great tastes of British summertime. But veggies need a change of scene, just like the rest of us. So today we're sending it on holiday to Spain as part of this delicious paella! The trick to a great paella is not to stir too much, so it develops a crispy crust at the bottom of the pan. The Spanish call this the 'socarrat'. It's considered the best bit!

Full Name: Samphire Paella with Veggies and Olives
Ingredients: Onion, Yellow Pepper, Garlic Clove, Black Olives, Chervil, Smoked Paprika, Ground Turmeric, Arborio Rice, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cherry Tomatoes, Samphire, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Samphire is a fabulous vegetable. It grows by the sea and is one of the great tastes of British summertime. But veggies need a change of scene, just like the rest of us. So today we're sending it on holiday to Spain as part of this delicious paella! The trick to a great paella is not to stir too much, so it develops a crispy crust at the bottom of the pan. The Spanish call this the 'socarrat'. It's considered the best bit!

Full Name: Turkey Saltimbocca with Creamy Mushroom Tagliatelle
Ingredients: Chestnut Mushrooms, Turkey Steak, Serrano Ham, Sage, White Wine Vinegar, Chicken Stock Pot, Water, Tagliatelle, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl, Strainer
Description: The Italian word saltimbocca loosely translates as ‘jump in the mouth’. This dish is traditionally made with veal, ham and sage. We have mixed it up a little in this recipe, using turkey in place of veal. Paired with creamy mushroom tagliatelle, we think it truly lives up to its name and will make your taste buds dance!

Full Name: Sirloin Steak with Garlic and Chervil Sauce, Crushed Roasted Potatoes and Asparagus
Ingredients: Sirloin Steak, New Potatoes, Asparagus, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chervil, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate, Whisk
Description: Did anyone ever tell you that fat and water separate? Today we’re performing a little alchemy by defying the laws of chemistry. To make a delicious sauce to accompany your sirloin steak, we’re going to suspend the two liquids within each other by vigorously whisking them together. This is emulsification! Stock + Butter + a little love and whisking = saucy buttery heaven.

Full Name: Courgette Parmigiana with Insalata Caprese and Foccacia
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Tomato Passata, Oregano, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Bowl, Plate
Description: Parmigiana is a Norther Italian classic. It's traditionally made with fried aubergine but we're using courgettes here for a lighter taste. It takes a little while to assemble but we're sure you'll think it's time well spent when you taste the results!

Full Name: Courgette Parmigiana with Insalata Caprese and Foccacia
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Cherry Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Tomato Passata, Oregano, Basil 20g, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Panko Breadcrumbs, Foccacia
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Bowl, Plate
Description: Parmigiana is a Norther Italian classic. It's traditionally made with fried aubergine but we're using courgettes here for a lighter taste. It takes a little while to assemble but we're sure you'll think it's time well spent when you taste the results!

Full Name: Creamy Pancetta Penne with Peas and Mint
Ingredients: Mint, Garlic Clove, Penne Pasta, Pine Nuts, Pancetta, Water, Peas, Crème Fraîche, Vegetable Stock Pot, Parmesan Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: There are certain culinary marriages that endure the slings and arrows of outrageous foodie fortune. This dish is a testament to one such union: salty, savoury pancetta and sweet, green peas are a classic combination. The addition of mint turns the whole things into a beautifully summery ensemble. Enjoy!

Full Name: Paprika Chicken Dippers with Cheesy Wedges and Zingy Salad
Ingredients: Potato, Cheddar Cheese, Dried Thyme, Cucumber, Lime, Honey, Olive Oil, Chicken Breast, Plain Flour, Mild Paprika, Baby Leaves, Ketchup
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Bowl, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Everyone loves crispy chicken but breading and deep frying are a bit of a faff. This version uses a flour coating and a frying pan, to get a result that's just as tasty with a fraction of the fuss. It's healthier too! The secret is to let the pan get really hot before you cook the chicken. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sirloin Steaks with Salsa Verde and a Spicy Sweet Potato & Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Sirloin Steak, Small Sweet Potato, Chermoula Spice, Mint, Cider & Horseradish Wholegrain Mustard, Flat Leaf Parsley, Capers, Olive Oil, Lemon, Cherry Tomatoes, Balsamic Vinegar, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: A perfectly cooked steak is one of life's greatest pleasures. Whether you like yours rare, medium or well-done, there are two tricks you should know about for the perfect charred crust and juicy interior. First, allow the steak comes to room temperature. And second, get the pan really, really hot before you start cooking. A spicy salad makes is a fabulous accompaniment for sirloin and lifts steak night to the next level!

Full Name: Summer Salmon Spaghetti with Crispy Broccoli
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Chives, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Hot Smoked Salmon, Spaghetti, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: We're thinking pink today. Salmon pink to be exact. Not only is this fish delicious, it's packed to the gills with omega 3 fatty acids which can have benefits for both brain function and blood pressure. So dinner can be good for the head and the heart - and the taste buds of course. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pork Burgers with Rustic Wedges and Peanutty Carrot Slaw
Ingredients: Potato, Smoked Paprika, Pork Sausage, Panko Breadcrumbs, Carrot, Coriander, Red Wine Vinegar, Salted Peanuts, Brioche Bun, Cheddar Cheese, Baby Gem Lettuce, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Plate
Description: Sausages are a lazy cook's best friend. Take off their skins and you have ready-seasoned meat that's good for all sorts of things. Break it up into mince and use as the basis of a pasta sauce or roll it into meatballs (cheatballs!). In this recipe it makes a banger of a burger. Popping a lid on the pan while you cook them (see the tip in Step 6) keeps everything super juicy and gives you perfectly melted cheese.

Full Name: Simply Seared Steak with Green Bean, Cherry Tomato & Roast Potato Salad
Ingredients: Rump Bistro Steak, Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Green Beans, Oregano, Green Olives, Garlic Clove, Balsamic Vinegar
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Steak is always a treat, isn’t it? Any day with a steak feels a bit special. The question is always what to have with it. Salad or potatoes? May we suggest you go for both in the form of this colourful, warm summer salad? We've added olives and the Mediterranean mountain twang of oregano to really raise the steaks!

Full Name: Sicilian Caponata with Herbed Pork and Garlicky Ciabatta
Ingredients: Aubergine, Celery Stick, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Green Olives, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, White Wine Vinegar, Ciabatta, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Patrick learned how to make this dish whilst filming in the beautiful coastal town of Catania and (in a fairly risky move), he has decided to recreate it with a few of his own flavours. Italians are fiercely protective of their recipes so, for his sake, let's keep this one under our hats!

Full Name: Chinese 5 Spice Chicken with Charred Bok Choy and Rice
Ingredients: Water for Rice, Ginger, Soy Sauce, Honey, Rice Vinegar, Chinese 5 Spice, Chicken Thighs, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Baby Bok Choy, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Rice Water for Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Lid
Description: It's Spice of the Month time! June's blend is Chinese 5 Spice. How many things do you think it contains? Full points if you said five! They are: star anise, Sichuan pepper, fennel, cassia and clove which combine to form a distinctive peppery, aniseedy flavour that's showcased beautifully in this chicken dish. Using the starch in rice cooking water to thicken a sauce is a also a neat trick. Enjoy!

Full Name: Dukkah Crusted Duck with Roasted Butternut, Sumac and Feta
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Onion, Duck Breast, Honey, Feta Cheese, Cider Vinegar, Olive Oil, Sumac, Rocket, Super Dukkah Mix
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Tonight's dinner is a veritable explosion of colour and flavour. Sweet roasted butternut squash, peppery rocket, tangy sumac and salty feta made a bed for deliciously crispy-skined duck. It's finished with dukkah, that gorgeous Middle Eastern mixture of roasted nuts and spices. Duck and dukkah, such a good combination it surely can't be a coincidence that their names are so similar?

Full Name: Quickdraw Quesadillas with Tomato Salsa and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Corn on the Cob, Cheddar Cheese, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Black Beans, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime, Sour Cream, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Our chef Victoria loves a quesadilla. Partly because they remind her of the  months she spent exploring Mexico with not much more than a few Pesos in her pocket. Good times! But mainly because they are absurdly delicious. Whilst on her travels she would happily eat quesadillas twice a day and never tire of them. We're hoping you enjoy these beauties as much as she did. Buen provecho!

Full Name: Spiced Bulgur Salad with Chimichurri, Goat's Cheese and Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Basil 20g, Oregano, Courgette, Sweetcorn, Mexican Spice, Bulgur Wheat, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Baby Spinach, Lemon, Olive Oil, Goat's Cheese
Utensils: Sieve, Large Pan, Lid, Bowl, Frying Pan
