Description: Some foods are almost as much fun to say as they are to eat. Chimichurri is one of them. It's an Argentinian herb sauce but the name comes from a Basque word that means something like 'a bunch of things in no particular order'. You can use whatever herbs you like but Mimi's version today includes basil and oregano. It's gorgeous with nutty bulgur and charred courgettes and a great contrast to creamy goat's cheese. Enjoy!

Full Name: Saffron Risotto with Courgette and Caramelised Fennel
Ingredients: Fennel, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Water, Saffron, Vegetable Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Salted, Arborio Rice, Hard Italian Cheese, Lemon, Steve's Leaves Peashoots
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Risotto is a luxurious dish anyway but golden saffron really brings some glamour to this version. Don't be so blinded by its bling that you underestimate the fennel though! Caramelising sweetens its aniseed flavours and using the fronds brings a hint of freshness. Combined with some charred courgettes it makes this dish pretty special!

Full Name: Sweet & Sour Pork with Cracked Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Loin Fillet, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Grater, Plate, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, bulgur wheat is a great source of nutrition and, most importantly, it tastes great. It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might normally expect to find with rice. Try it - we think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Chicken Piccata with Buttery Sauce and Roasted Veggies
Ingredients: Carrot, Potato, Thyme, Broccoli, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Chicken Breast, Flour, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Bowl, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: For today's dish, you'll be making a lovely buttery emulsion for roast veggies! It's the technique behind many great sauces like hollandaise, mayonnaise and aioli so sounds fancy but is actually really easy. Chemically speaking, water and fat don't mix, so we beat the butter into tiny particles so it remains suspended in the liquid. If you have one, a whisk will definitely come in handy!

Full Name: Tuscan Pork Linguine with Courgettes and Lemon
Ingredients: Tuscan Pork Sausage, Courgette, Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Chilli Flakes, Chopped Tomatoes, Linguine, Pecorino Cheese, Lemon
Utensils: Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan
Description: This is a beautifully rustic number and should bring to mind the sunshine-soaked rolling hills of Tuscany. What's more, it'll be ready in the time it takes a bottle of Chianti to breathe. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Tilapia
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Green Beans, Tarragon, Tilapia Fillet, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Tender tilapia and tasty tarragon! Try saying that ten times in a row! It may be a bit of a tongue twister but we're sure it'll be a taste bud pleaser too. Enjoy!

Full Name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Dukkah Roasted Sweet Potato and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Sweet Potato, Super Dukkah Mix, Chicken Breast, Lime, Sugar Snap Peas, Sour Cream
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Clingfilm, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Have you come across dukkah before? It's a traditional Egyptian mixture of roasted nuts, sesame seeds, thyme and spices. It's fabulous mixed with olive oil as a dip for bread or as a seasoning, sprinkled over salads, meat or vegetables. Here it goes beautifully with sweet potatoes ,turning them into the perfect accompaniment for pan-fried chicken.

Full Name: Pork Ragu with Pappardelle and Parmesan
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Parmesan Cheese, Tuscan Pork Sausage, Fennel Seeds, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Pappardelle
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Sausage meat is a lazy cook's best friend. It's already packed full of flavour so you can have a tasty dinner on the table in no time. Here it's incorporated into a tomatoey ragu that goes fabulously with wide ribbons of parpadelle pasta.

Full Name: King Prawn Risotto With Tender Asparagus Spears and Dukkah Spice
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Asparagus, Basil 20g, King Prawns, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Super Dukkah Mix, Hard Italian Cheese, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Beautifully balanced between creaminess and 'al dente' bite, even the simplest risotto is luxurious. But we've really gone to town with this one! It's bursting with plump king prawns and tender asparagus spears. Fragrant, nutty dukkah provides the finishing touch. Don't neglect what the Italians call 'tostatura': cooking the rice in oil before adding stock. It takes only a minute but makes all the difference. Enjoy!

Full Name: Moroccan Beef Burgers with Potato Wedges and Onion Relish
Ingredients: Minced Beef, Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Ras-el-Hanout, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Pan with Lid, Bowl, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: This recipe was inspired by Head Chef Patrick's trip to Morocco. After spending some toime in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes he returned to Marrakech and treated himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel. Their spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression so we've re-created it here for you. Enjoy!

Full Name: Rocket Pesto Orzo with Charred Courgettes and Tomato Salad
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Courgette, Vine Tomatoes, Basil 20g, Rocket, Pine Nuts, Hard Italian Cheese, Olive Oil, Lemon, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Large Pan
Description: Today's recipe is a cross between a risotto and a pasta dish. It's made with a tiny, rice-shaped pasta called 'orzo' cooked in a similar way to risotto. You could think of it as an 'orzotto'! We've put a twist on the accompanying pesto too. Instead of basil we're using rocket which provides a delicious, peppery contrast to the creamy pasta and fresh tomatoes. Enjoy!

Full Name: Springtime Chicken with Roasted Veggies, Tomato Salad and Minty Salsa
Ingredients: Chicken Thigh, Dried Italian Herbs, New Potatoes, Carrot, Leek, Courgette, Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Vine Tomatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Mint, Honey, Wholegrain Mustard, Red Wine Vinegar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Plate
Description: Delicious roast veggies, crispy-skinned chicken and a refreshing minty salsa. There's a lot to like here. But maybe our favourite element of today's meal is the tomato salad. There's something so elegantly rustic about mixing tomatoes of two different sizes. Hope you think so too!

Full Name: Fragrant Lamb Pilaf with Spinach, Apricots and Minted Yoghurt
Ingredients: Lamb Mince, Red Onion, Ras-el-Hanout, Ground Turmeric, Basmati Rice, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Garlic Clove, Dried Apricots, Mint, Lentils, Baby Spinach, Natural Yoghurt, Lemon
Utensils: Frying Pan, Grater, Bowl
Description: Our chef André has created this tasty lamb pilaf and given it a hearty boost with the addition of lentils. The type of fibre found in these lovely little legumes has fantastic benefits for heart and digestive health, as well as keeping blood sugar levels stable. And of course it's delicious as well as good for you, fragrant with spices and a subtle sweetness from the dried apricot. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sweet & Sour Pork with Cracked Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Loin Fillet, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Bowl
Description: Bulgur wheat is high in fibre and a good source of protein. Most importantly, it tastes great. It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might normally expect to find with rice. Try it - we think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Oven Baked Salmon with Black Garlic Butter Sauce, Steam-Fried Veggies and Roasted New Potatoes
Ingredients: New Potatoes, Echalion Shallot, Flat Leaf Parsley, Black Garlic, Salmon fillet, Balsamic Vinegar, Honey, Water, Mustard Seeds, Sugar Snap Peas, Tenderstem Broccoli, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Small pot, Frying Pan, Lid, Plate
Description:
This delicious black garlic is a wondrous thing. Our supplier ‘The Garlic Farm’ makes (in our opinion) the best black garlic
around and this is down to their secret month-long ageing process. This ensures the end product tastes deliciously sweet
and syrupy – not what you’d expect from garlic! We’ve used it here in a delicious sauce but it can also be used in many weird
and wonderful ways – ice cream, beer or just on it’s own (our buyer Ollie has been known to eat a whole tub!).

Full Name: Creamy Linguine with Prawns and Serrano Ham
Ingredients: Garlic Clove, Green Bullet Chilli, Chives, Serrano Ham, King Prawns, Linguine, Vegetable Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Pasta Water, Lemon
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Pork and prawns are a classic combination. They team up here in a creamy sauce that goes beautifully with linguine. As the Italians say: Buon appetito!

Full Name: Paprika Roast Chicken with Veggies and Chips
Ingredients: Smoked Paprika, Honey, Olive Oil, Chicken Thigh, Potato, Dried Thyme, Yellow Pepper, Red Onion, Flat Leaf Parsley, Garlic Mayonnaise
Utensils: Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Which came first, the chicken or the egg? We're not sure but we do know that both are good with chips! It's chicken tonight - juicy thighs, subtley flavoured with smoked paprika and honey and roasted on a bed of veggies. Delicious!

Full Name: Sweet Potato Cottage Pie with Roasted Broccoli
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Broccoli, Sweet Potato, Beef Mince, Netherend Butter Salted, Tomato Puree 30g, Chopped Tomatoes, Vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Stock Pot, Cheddar Cheese, Potato
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Potato Masher, Baking Dish, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: Mimi thinks her mum makes the absolute best cottage pie in the whole world. So it was with trepidation that she presented this recipe for motherly approval. The twist is using sweet potato in the mash which adds more fibre and vitamins as well as flavour. Mrs Morley gave her seal of approval so we're sharing the recipe with you today. Enjoy!

Full Name: Oven-Baked Risotto with Bacon and Mushroom
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Chestnut Mushrooms, Tarragon, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Honey, Olive Oil, Lambs Lettuce and Bulls Blood Mix, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Hard Italian Cheese
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Pan with Lid, Bowl
Description: Risotto is so delicious, but the prospect of all that stirring can be a bit daunting. Chef André to the rescue! He's simplified the process and created this recipe that lets you just shove your risotto in the oven. All the creamy, luxurious texture with none of the elbow work!

Full Name: Turkey Stir-Fry with Carrot Rice
Ingredients: Carrot, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Garlic Clove, Turkey Steak, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Ketchup, Soy Sauce, Honey, Ketjap Manis, Lime, Sugar Snap Peas, Coconut Powder, Water
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: Many people forget about Turkey except at Christmas. Which is a shame as it's lean and flavourful and great in all sorts of dishes. Today we're making a colourful Asian stir-fry with a surprising secret ingredient: ketchup! It brings a delicious sweet and sour note and is actually used by lots of Chinese restaurant chefs!

Full Name: Brazilian 'Veijoada' Bake
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Onion, Yellow Pepper, Coriander, Garlic Clove, Green Chilli, Black Beans, Ground Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Vegetable Stock Pot, Water, Cheddar Cheese, Vine Tomatoes, Echalion Shallot, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Baking Dish
Description: The national dish of Brazil, feijoada is a rich stew of pork and black beans. Its name comes from the Portuguese word for bean, 'feijão' so we've given it a HelloFresh twist by letting the beans take centre stage and leaving out the meat altogether. We call it 'veijoada'! Enjoy!

Full Name: Sweet & Sour Pork with Cracked Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Loin Fillet, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Kitchen Paper, Bowl
Description: Bulgur wheat is high in fibre and a good source of protein. Most importantly, it tastes great! It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might normally expect to find with rice. Try it - we think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Cajun Cod with Sweet Potato, Heritage Tomatoes and Avocado Crema
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Cherry Tomatoes, Lime, Coriander, Avocado, Sour Cream, Plain Flour, Cajun Spice, Cod Fillet, Rocket
Utensils: Baking Tray, Bowl, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: Way back in the 18th century, French, Spanish and African settlers all congregated in America's Deep South. They pooled their culinary heritage and Cajun food was born! Inspired by this history of cultural combination, we created a dish that combines hot-and-sweet Cajun spiced cod with a cooling avocado crema and some beautiful speciality tomatoes from our friends at the Tomato Stall on the Isle of Wight. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sirloin Steak with Garlic and Chervil Sauce, Crushed Roasted Potatoes and Asparagus
Ingredients: Sirloin Steak, New Potatoes, Asparagus, Echalion Shallot, Garlic Clove, Chervil, White Wine Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Netherend Butter Unsalted
Utensils: Baking Tray, Large Pan, Grater, Frying Pan, Plate, Whisk
Description: Did anyone ever tell you that fat and water separate? Today we’re performing a little alchemy by defying the laws of chemistry. To make a delicious sauce to accompany your sirloin steak, we’re going to suspend the two liquids within each other by vigorously whisking them together. This is emulsification! Stock + Butter + a little love and whisking = saucy buttery heaven.

Full Name: Soy & Orange Pork with Mediterranean Vegetables and Couscous
Ingredients: Orange, Soy Sauce, Sugar, Pork Medallion, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Green Pepper, Courgette, Flat Leaf Parsley, Balsamic Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Couscous
Utensils: Mixing Bowl, Zester, Baking Tray, Knife, Saucepan, Spoon, Aluminum Foil, Cutting board, Frying Pan, Bowl, Fork
Description: Soy sauce is a crucial ingredient for almost any Chinese cooking but today we're bringing a little bit of its oriental, umami magic to a more Mediterranean dish. Orange adds a taste of sunshine and the veggies keep things fresh. Enjoy!

Full Name: Steak Tagliata with Rosemary Roasted New Potatoes, Broccoli and Peppercorn Sauce
Ingredients: Rump Bistro Steak, New Potatoes, Black Peppercorns, Rosemary, Echalion Shallot, Broccoli, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Knife, Plastic Bag, Rolling Pin, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Spoon, Plate
Description: If we had a penny for every time we'd seen a badly cooked steak we’d probably be millionaires. Or at least rich enough to treat ourselves to dinner at a top steakhouse! Yet follow these three tips and a great result is assured at home: i) Allow the steak to come to room temperature before you cook it ii) Get your frying pan super hot iii) Rest the steak for a few minutes before you eat it. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sri Lankan Fish Curry with Green Beans and Cardomom Rice
Ingredients: Lime, Tilapia Fillet, Water for Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Cardamom Pod, Basmati Rice, Onion, Garlic Clove, Green Beans, Mustard Seeds, Sri Lankan Curry Powder, Coconut Milk, Water for Curry
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Zester, Saucepan, Spoon, Grater, Frying Pan, Bowl, Fork, Lid
Description: This curry is inspired by the time Mimi spent in Asia. It's delicate and fresh; spicy but not heavy at all. We're hoping it will transport your taste buds to the Sri Lankan coast!

Full Name: Chicken Caesar Salad with Ciabatta Croutons
Ingredients: Chicken Breast, Ciabatta, Garlic Salt, Baby Gem Lettuce, Red and Yellow Cherry Tomatoes, Parmesan Cheese, Mayonnaise, Spiced Honey Mustard, Lemon, Olive Oil
Utensils: Baking Tray, Knife, Grater, Salad Bowl, Bowl, Spoon, Whisk, Cutting board, Fork
Description: Did you know that the Caesar salad was invented in Mexico? Food industry legend has it that in 1924, slap-bang in the middle of the Prohibition era, Italian-American restaurateur Caesar Cardini was running a place in Tijuana. He got swamped by thirsty Americans coming over the border to enjoy a drink on the 4th July. Having run out of almost everything in the kitchen, he improvised this salad and history was made!

Full Name: Cumin Roast Chicken with Patatas Bravas and Charred Courgettes
Ingredients: Flat Leaf Parsley, Olive Oil, Ground Cumin, Lemon, Chicken Thighs, Potato, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Clove, Red Chilli, Tomato Passata, Courgette
Utensils: Knife, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Cutting board, Grater, Saucepan, Frying Pan, Plate, Spoon
Description: We're in holiday mood! Are you going away? Even if you're not, today's recipe will transport you to Spain. Although it was actually inspired by Mimi's visit to a tapas restaurant in Dundee! Patatas bravas is the quintessential tapas dish, available all over Spain. Not everyone loves the casual, sharing business of tapas so we've given you plenty for a portion each alongside some delicious cumin roast chicken!

Full Name: Thai Spiced Stargazer with Black Rice, Baby Bok Choy and Coconut
Ingredients: Black Rice, Ginger, Baby Bok Choy, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Lime, Desiccated Coconut, Stargazer Fillet, Thai Spice Blend, Soy Sauce, Sugar, Olive Oil
Utensils: Cutting board, Knife, Saucepan, Sieve, Bowl, Frying Pan, Grater, Spoon, Mixing Bowl, Baking Tray, Plate
Description: We love the firm, meaty texture of monkfish. It can hold its own against some strong spicing so is perfect in this Thai-influenced dish. The fragrant fish is served with black rice, baby bok choy and a zingy coriander dressing. All finished with coconut, this exotic feast is as dramatic to look at as it is to eat!

Full Name: Veggie Calzone with Red Pepper and Leek
Ingredients: Red Onion, Red Pepper, Leek, Cherry Tomatoes, Flour, Northern Dough Co. Pizza Dough, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Dried Italian Herbs
Utensils: Baking Tray, Cutting board, Knife, Rolling Pin, Spoon
Description: We get pretty excited about pizza at the Fresh Farm. We're partial to a pie, too. But a pizza-pie hybrid? Wow! The deliciousness is almost overwhelming! As a folded pizza, the calzone combines the best of both worlds. Its name comes from the Italian word for 'trouser-leg' or 'stocking', so called because it's stuffed full of good things. Cook it as your first meal this week so you get the dough at its freshest. Enjoy!

Full Name: Indonesian Curry with Courgette, Green Beans and Star Anise Rice
Ingredients: Water, Basmati Rice, Vegetable Stock Pot, Star Anise, Onion, Ginger, Red Pepper, Courgette, Green Beans, Coriander, Yellow Curry Paste, Coconut Milk, Cashew Nuts, Soy Sauce, Lime
Utensils: Lid, Pot, Spoon, Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Frying Pan, Fork, Bowl
Description: They grow a lot of coconuts in Indonesia and love to cook with them. The country's food is often spicy but the heat is offset with sweetness from the coconuts and often a sour note too. We're attempting this balancing act in today's curry. The sauce bathing the veggies should be hot, sharp and sweet. Top it all off with golden toasted cashews and the herbal note of coriander and enjoy!

Full Name: Creamy Feta Pie with Leek and Mushroom
Ingredients: Potato, Leek, Celery Stick, Closed Cup Mushrooms, Thyme, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Double Cream, Kale and Rainbow Chard Mix, Panko Breadcrumbs, Feta Cheese, Potato
Utensils: Knife, Peeler, Saucepan, Strainer, Frying Pan, Spoon, Bowl, Oven dish
Description: Today's recipe owes something to the delicious Greek spinach-and-feta pies known as 'spanakopita' but we've given it a British twist. Instead of spinach we're using leek, chard and kale and a hotpot-style potato topping has replaced the filo pastry. It's an Anglo-Hellenic hybrid! We hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Full Name: Orzo Risotto with Mozzarella, Chorizo and Roast Cherry Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic Clove, Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme, Tomato Puree 30g, Chorizo, Orzo, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Mozzarella, Parmesan Cheese, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Baking Tray, Kettle, Large Pan, Spoon, Lid, Bowl
Description:
Orzo is one of the tiniest pasta shapes out there - at first glance you might mistake one piece for a grain of rice. It makes a
great addition to soups and stews but today we're letting it absorb some flavourful stock, a little like in a risotto. An orzotto if
you will! Enriched with chorizo and not one but two types of cheese, it's a real treat.

Full Name: Moroccan Beef Burgers with Potato Wedges and Red Onion Relish
Ingredients: Red Onion, Potato, Balsamic Vinegar, Minced Beef, Ras-el-Hanout, Brioche Bun, Greek Yoghurt, Baby Spinach
Utensils: Baking Tray, Cutting board, Knife, Lid, Saucepan, Mixing Bowl, Non-Stick Pan, Plate, Spoon
Description: This recipe was inspired by Head Chef Patrick's trip to Morocco. After spending some time in the mountains with the nomadic Berber tribes, he returned to Marrakech and treated himself to lunch at the beautiful Ksar Char-Bagh hotel. Their spin on a beef burger left a lasting impression so we've re-created it here for you. Enjoy!

Full Name: Sausage & Butterbean Stew with Garlic Ciabatta Croutons
Ingredients: Onion, Carrot, Chestnut Mushrooms, Sweetheart Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Flat Leaf Parsley, Butterbeans, Netherend Butter Unsalted, Honey Mustard Sausages, White Wine Vinegar, Plain Flour, Water, Beef Stock Pot, Ciabatta
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Strainer, Saucepan, Spoon, Baking Tray, Bowl, Serrated Knife
Description: Down at the Fresh Farm, we love a bit of constructive criticism. We want to make sure everything is the best it can be before it goes in your box! When Mimi came up with this delicious stew, André liked it but felt it needed a little 'something extra'. He suggested making some garlic croutons to sit on top and soak up the sauce. We're sure you'll agree it provides the perfect finishing touch!

Full Name: Warm Coronation Chicken with Savoy Cabbage and Potatoes
Ingredients: Onion, New Potatoes, Flat Leaf Parsley, Savoy Cabbage, Garlic Clove, Lemon, Chicken Thighs, Curry Powder, Mango Chutney 40g, Raisins, Water, Crème Fraîche
Utensils: Cutting board, Grater, Knife, Saucepan, Zester, Lid, Mixing Bowl, Spoon, Strainer, Frying Pan, Plate, Fork
Description: Coronation Chicken is a dish with a chequered history. Invented in 1953 for the coronation of our dear old Queen, it was considered elegant dinner party fare for a couple of decades before falling into disrepute as a soggy sandwich filling. We think the combination of mango chutney and curry powder is a happy and glorious one so have reinvented this retro classic as a warm dish with some potato and cabbage on the side. Enjoy!

Full Name: Confit Duck Leg with Creamy Bacon Lentils and Honey-Roasted Baby Roots
Ingredients: Baby Turnip, Red Onion, Streaky Bacon Rasher, Lentils, Chantenay Carrot 250g, Ground Cumin, Honey, Confit Duck Leg, Balsamic Vinegar, Water, Chicken Stock Pot, Crème Fraîche, Flat Leaf Parsley
Utensils: Sieve, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: What a treat for dinner tonight. French-style confit duck sits on a bed of pancetta-enriched lentils and baby veg. Classic and elegant!

Full Name: Mexican Cottage Pie with Sweet Potato and Mozzarella
Ingredients: Small Sweet Potato, Green Pepper, Carrot, Onion, Red Chilli, Minced Beef, Mexican Spice, Beef Stock Pot, Chopped Tomatoes, Tomato Puree 30g, Mozzarella, Sour Cream
Utensils: Frying Pan, Baking Dish, Plate
Description: What makes a pie a pie? We know some people who insist it must have a 'pastry hat and coat' to qualify. But what about a cottage pie? Surely that counts too, even though it's topped with potato. And what about this cottage pie? We've given it a HelloFresh twist with Mexican spices and a sweet potato crown. Whether it still qualified for official pie status, there's no denying it's tasty!

Full Name: Thai Massaman Rice with Roasted Aubergine and Mushrooms
Ingredients: Water, Chestnut Mushrooms, Coriander, Aubergine, Green Beans, Basmati Rice, Cashew Nuts, Coconut Milk, Massaman Curry Paste, Crunchy Peanut Butter, Lime
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Plate
Description: The secret ingredient in tonight's dinner is peanut butter! Along with the coconut milk it brings a richness and creaminess to temper the chilli fire. You don't see massaman dishes on Thai menus as often as the standard red or green curries so it's worth knowing how to knock one up yourself. Enjoy!

Full Name: King Prawn Spaghetti with Chilli and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
Ingredients: Onion, Garlic, Flat Leaf Parsley, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Red Chilli, King Prawns, Red Wine Vinegar, Chopped Tomatoes, Spaghetti
Utensils: Grater, Frying Pan, Large Pan, Bowl
Description: Simple fresh flavours are combined in this dish to create something really special. Juicy prawns and tangy sun-dried tomatoes will transport you to the Mediterranean sunshine in the time it takes to cook spaghetti. Buon appetito!

Full Name: King Prawn Risotto With Tender Asparagus Spears and Dukkah Spice
Ingredients: Echalion Shallot, Leek, Garlic Clove, Asparagus, Basil 20g, King Prawns, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Arborio Rice, White Wine Vinegar, Lemon, Super Dukkah Mix, Hard Italian Cheese, Netherend Butter Salted
Utensils: Grater, Large Pan, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: Beautifully balanced between creaminess and 'al dente' bite, even the simplest risotto is luxurious. But we've really gone to town with this one! It's bursting with plump king prawns and tender asparagus spears. Fragrant, nutty dukkah provides the finishing touch. Don't neglect what the Italians call 'tostatura': cooking the rice in oil before adding stock. It takes only a minute but makes all the difference. Enjoy!

Full Name: Chinese 5 Spice Chicken with Charred Bok Choy and Rice
Ingredients: Water for Rice, Ginger, Soy Sauce, Honey, Rice Vinegar, Chinese 5 Spice, Chicken Thighs, Red Pepper, Spring Onion, Baby Bok Choy, Chicken Stock Pot, Basmati Rice, Rice Water for Sauce
Utensils: Bowl, Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Lid
Description: It's Spice of the Month time! June's blend is Chinese 5 Spice. How many things do you think it contains? Full points if you said five! They are: star anise, Sichuan pepper, fennel, cassia and clove which combine to form a distinctive peppery, aniseedy flavour that's showcased beautifully in this chicken dish. Using the starch in rice cooking water to thicken a sauce is a also a neat trick. Enjoy!

Full Name: Quickdraw Quesadillas with Tomato Salsa and Citrus Sour Cream
Ingredients: Red Onion, Garlic Clove, Coriander, Corn on the Cob, Cheddar Cheese, Mexican Spice, Smoked Paprika, Black Beans, Corn Tortilla, Vine Tomatoes, Baby Gem Lettuce, Lime, Sour Cream, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Bowl, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Plate
Description: Our chef Victoria loves a quesadilla. Partly because they remind her of the  months she spent exploring Mexico with not much more than a few Pesos in her pocket. Good times! But mainly because they are absurdly delicious. Whilst on her travels she would happily eat quesadillas twice a day and never tire of them. We're hoping you enjoy these beauties as much as she did. Buen provecho!

Full Name: Sweet & Sour Pork with Cracked Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Loin Fillet, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Grater, Plate, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, bulgur wheat is a great source of nutrition and, most importantly, it tastes great. It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might normally expect to find with rice. Try it - we think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Dukkah Crusted Duck with Roasted Butternut, Sumac and Feta
Ingredients: Butternut Squash, Red Onion, Duck Breast, Honey, Feta Cheese, Cider Vinegar, Olive Oil, Sumac, Rocket, Super Dukkah Mix
Utensils: Baking Tray, Frying Pan, Bowl, Plate
Description: Tonight's dinner is a veritable explosion of colour and flavour. Sweet roasted butternut squash, peppery rocket, tangy sumac and salty feta made a bed for deliciously crispy-skined duck. It's finished with dukkah, that gorgeous Middle Eastern mixture of roasted nuts and spices. Duck and dukkah, such a good combination it surely can't be a coincidence that their names are so similar?

Full Name: Sweet & Sour Pork with Cracked Bulgur Wheat
Ingredients: Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Bulgur Wheat, Garlic Clove, Red Pepper, Yellow Pepper, Spring Onion, Pork Loin Fillet, Cornflour, Chinese Rice Vinegar, Ketjap Manis
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Grater, Plate, Frying Pan, Bowl
Description: High in fibre and protein and low on the glycaemic index, bulgur wheat is a great source of nutrition and, most importantly, it tastes great. It's eaten a lot in the Middle East and South Asia but for tonight's dinner we've teamed it with sweet and sour pork which you might normally expect to find with rice. Try it - we think you'll love the change!

Full Name: Chorizo Enchiladas with Black Beans and a Cheesy Topping
Ingredients: Onion, Green Pepper, Chorizo Stick, Black Beans, Flat Leaf Parsley, Lime, Tomato Puree 30g, Mexican Spice, Water, Wholemeal Tortilla, Crème Fraîche, Crème Fraîche, Cheddar Cheese, Honey, Cucumber, Baby Leaves, Olive Oil
Utensils: Grater, Sieve, Frying Pan, Potato Masher, Baking Dish, Bowl, Plate
Description: Mexican food is recognised by UNESCO as an 'Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity'. We're not entirely sure what that means but we're in favour of anything that gives props to things that are delicious. And Mexican food is undenably delicious. Like this enchilada recipe which is bursting with black beans and chorizo. Buen provecho!

Full Name: Caramelised Halloumi with Mango Chutney, Minted Freekeh Pilaf and Roasted Red Pepper
Ingredients: Onion, Red Pepper, Mint, Chermoula Spice, Freekeh, Water, Vegetable Stock Pot, Balsamic Vinegar, Pistachios, Halloumi, Mango Chutney 40g, Lemon
Utensils: Pan with Lid, Baking Tray, Bowl, Frying Pan
Description: You can't really go wrong with halloumi, can you? Some 'squeaky cheese' always goes down a treat at the Fresh Farm. It's delicious just simply grilled or fried but Mimi has really upped the game here by adding mango chutney. The sugar caramelises in the pan, bringing a hit of sweetness to the sharp, salty cheese. We hope you enjoy!
